text: Their breakfast sandwiches have guided me through many a hangover. Cali club, breakfast club, smoothies, all good stuff. Price is on the higher end for sandwiches and such, but good ingredients and quality  taste are there.

Spoiler:  Go! But not the through the drive through.   What a great find after last night's culinary fiasco. Food is fresh, fast and delicious. Even their salsa was great tasting! Coffee was smooth and delicious as well. The crew was super busy, but all very friendly and helpful.   We sat outside and ate and were surprised that we didn't witness any car accidents. The drive through traffic is insanely busy and until you can get in the lot your car will be hanging out straddling the bike and right lane. The staff seems to do a super job of taking orders and delivering orders car side however.

1 word: Delicious! Seriously...healthy and cute. I'll be honest...I've only tried the breakfast buzz (most delicious protein shake ever). I promise you that if i'm ever in south Scottsdale for lunch or dinner d'lish will be my first preference. I've looked over the menu and everything looks wonderful. I live in east Mesa and work in north Scottsdale...I go out of my way to get a buzz and will continue to do so. Highly recommended!

Consistently great service, and fresh, healthy food.   Everything I've tried has been above expectations.  For wraps, salads, smoothies, I've tried most of the local spots and this is my new go-to place for quality and reasonable price.  Very clean.
This place is awesome! The food is amazing, I love the California Club breakfast sandwich and the orange smoothie. I highly recommend D lite!
Quality, strong coffees. Hot day?, try an iced toddy!

I ate here for the first time the other day. I was a bit nervous that it'd be busy because it was a Sunday morning but there were still spots in their baby parking lot. Their drive thru is poorly placed for other drivers trying to park but their ordering system makes the line go pretty quickly. My friend and I ate on the patio. They was plenty of seating outside but little seating inside. The food and drinks were great! I had a breakfast croissant sandwich and an orange glorious smoothie.   All in all the restaurant is appropriately named. The food and drinks are indeed d'lish.

The Turkey sandwhich was one of the best i've ever had! D'lish is a hidden gem in Scottsdale! Very small, but cozy inside. I tried the turkey sandwhich, and had some ice tea to accompany it! By far one of the best lunches i've had! The service was excellent, I know I will be going back when I visit Arizona again.

This place is everything and more. The staff is always extremely friendly and wear smiles constantly. The food is to die for. I've been here a plethora of times and have had a pleasant experience each one. So yummy. And the atmosphere is cozy and warm. I love this place.

The only way I would eat at this place again is if my front door was less than 60 feet away from their entrance.... and I was a quadriplegic confined to a wheel chair for the rest of my life. Seeing that there are no residences that close and I can walk, I can confidently say I will never give this place a nickel again.  I walk in to blaring reggae music, which is fine, whatever...but of course I have some douchebag in front of me with his girlfriend slowly dancing to the reggae music for a full 90 seconds while they are deciding what to order, if you want to groove to the music for 5...maybe 10 seconds, fine...but I'm hungover as fuck dude, quit dancing and order your gay salad with raspberry vinagarette and granola all over it. if I had any wish in the world at that very second I would have not wished for a million dollars or world peace, I would have wished for a hammer to instantly appear in my hand so I could hit him in the side of the knee as hard as possible so he would stop dancing and scream so loud that I wouldn't have to listen to the loud reggae music anymore either.  I order an egg and cheese sandwich with bacon and an orange juice.  Orange juice arrives at my table first. It was basically sunny delight orange juice. This establishment has the hippy tree hugger organic feel to it and you idiots can't make fresh squeezed orange juice? The sandwich comes a full 8-10 minutes after I order it. It was small had a small egg not that much bacon at all, whatever on the cheese, and sourdough bread. This all cost me 10 bucks. Place is a fucking rip-off. If you had brought me my simple order in less than 24 seconds (not 10 minutes) and had fresh squeezed orange juice (not 3 bucks for sunny delight). Then ok charge me 10 bucks and I'll be moderately happy, and would maybe return to eat there if I was 2 mins away from dying of starvation and happened to be driving by.  Then some guy walks in who I guess was the assistant coach of the ASU basketball team or something and one of the tree hugging hippy waaay too exuberant employees starts yelling "clap everyone its so and so from wherever...." and then made some joke like "go UofA" or something to mock him sarcastically. Shut up you dumb shit, I'm trying to consume your shitty 10 dollar egg sandwich in peace. Go smoke a bong in the back of the restaurant like you probably usually do anyway, or go stand in front of your restaurant with a sign saying you want it legalized so I can run you over on my way out. Then I leave and I'm walking to my car and reggae dancing douchebag from earlier is feeding his girlfriend from his fork on the outside patio. Ugh. Everything about this place made my head want to explode.  And all you people who give this place 5 stars should be immediately transferred to the island of molokai like they did with all the people who had leprosy decades ago. Except the new colony will be for morons.

Love this place its healthy, fast, close to home! No matter what I order it's always good and I leave satisfied.  Breakfast favorites are California club and oatmeal our way, coffee is pretty good and they have almond milk.  For lunch... Man salad,  chicken breast panini and southwest bowl!!!  Cons Pricey Small location They close at 4

"BE"yond impressed with the quality of food and service! The food is clean, the atmosphere is inviting and the prices are ideal! If you thought fast-food had to be unhealthy, processed, greasy, etc... think again! D'lish makes eating clean on-the-go feasible and affordable! My personal faves are the soups and the portabello burger :) wait.... the Humanitarian is great too....  Enjoy! It is D'lish!

MY DREAM PLACE - healthy fast food!  I tried the Scottsdale location on Saturday for the first time - had the Protein Burger, Early Bird style, and it was so delicious.  Also had the dirty chai (has a shot of espresso) - so good.  Today I had the Signature Tuna Sandwich from the Tempe location, and thought it was excellent.  Everything tastes so fresh and has such distinct yummy flavors.  I saw the Tempe location didn't have many reviews and a lower rating so I wanted to try it out for myself.  I thought the food was just as good, and as I live in Tempe, I will be frequenting that location.   The drive-thrus seem kind of slow and ridiculous, but eh, that's ok -- worth it!
Breakfast Buzz is the best espresso drink I've ever had, not like a lot of the shakes with protein where you can taste the whey

Love this place, I got the breakfast club, and my wife got the turkey club and butternut squash soup. Everything was so fresh and tasty. We will come here again when in the area! Also the coffee was fantastic, no need for cream or sugar.
Very clean, quick and friendly service. I got the veggie supreme humanitarian wrap-- really good! I will definitely grab lunch here again!

I cannot say enough good things about D'lish! My fiance and I have never had a bad meal here and we've tried nearly everything on the menu! The services is friendly and fun. The atmosphere is laid back and relaxing. And, the food out of this world!!! My favorite is the Man Salad and California Club - hits the spot every time. For a guaranteed good meal, check out D'lish!

The California Club was pretty good. Their iced coffee is really bad. But what I'm most hung up on is their service. I went with my coworker to pick up a couple orders for the rest of the office; I forewarned the woman taking the order that it was going to be a couple different orders - on different cards- she reassured me that it wasn't a problem. Obviously, it became a problem. Another woman came to the window and snipped that if we wanted to make several orders we should have came in. They were not nice about it, and became obviously flustered. I felt badly, I know what a pain in the butt it can be. However, they were not nice - very rude and I felt my business was not valued. Needless to say I will not be going back; not because the food was bad but the service was very off-putting.(1/28/16) Went back today because those idiotic women charged my card twice. The manager there, however, was as nice as can be and gave me a gift card and was extremely apologetic. Looks like I will be coming back. (1/29/16)

Have eaten from the drive thru a few times, great healthy-ish, fresh tasting sandwiches. I had the club and the chicken sandwich and both are good. The menu is really simple, wish they had one or two more choices on it, but overall, I will keep going back.

Just enjoyed my first cup at D'lish.  After reading the other reviews from the Yelpers, I decided to go with a Dirty Chai with Almond Milk.  Great choice.  I am not a huge chai fan and I will definitely be getting another in the near future.  Very good.  Very pleasant atomosphere and the customer service was very welcoming.  I decided to sit and work a little and enjoyed my chai so much that I ordered a latte to go.  Excited to try this one, but wanted to update my Yelp before I hit the road.

Food is super tasty. Always. So tasty.  Coffee is slightly above par, with lots of options.  Service is molasses slow. For a drive thru, don't bother unless you have at least ten or fifteen minutes to spare.

Need a fast, yummy, CHEAP, breakfast burrito in the morning?  This is your place.  And trust me, I am a bit of a bfast burro connoisseur.  I've been perfecting them since my freshman year in college.  This place almost has me beat.  I've tried all three varieties; chicken sausage, bacon, and just eggs/cheese/awesome potatoes.  they were all d'llsh.  Additionally, the drive thru was quick, easy and enjoyable - staff is extremely friendly.   Great stop for a quick, yummy bite pre-work, during-hangover, or post-bank over-drafting (it really is cheap!).

Best place ever! I am very happy to know that there is a drive thru that is healthy and fresh. I just drove up with my dog in the back seat, and everyone wanted to give her a treat. Very kind and friendly people; I am seriously going to come here all the time!      Eye candy tehehhehheheheee

Dlish is adorable! I have driven by many times and wanted to stop, but they are always closed because I am driving by at like 330 or 4 pm. This morning I woke up and needed some strong coffee, so I went to Dlish. I got the Veggie Burrito... AWESOME! Completely cured my hang over, soaked up all the alcohol! And The red eye completely woke me up! I am going to go back there for breakfast as much as possible. I am little disappointed in their lunch menu. It is lacking in vegetarian options( I am not a fan of egg salad sandwhichs and I am sick of the hummus craze!). I just noticed on there website they will be doing dinner soon- SO excited.   I wish there were more little precious places like this in Scottsdale!
Breakfast for the active.... Yummmm. Very quaint and even a drive thru if you are in a hurry but definitely not fast food type quality.
Had a co-worker do a breakfast run this morning for a bunch of us and I had the Cali Club for the 3rd time & it was D'lish as usual! Can't go wrong here..
Today was my second time there. Tried the California Club and the Turkey Club. Both were excellent! Iced green tea is so refreshing.

This was my first time at D'lish, and while I normally don't eat at organic, healthy diners, this was a pleasant experience! I didn't have to wait to place my order, and the cashier answered all of my friend's questions quickly and courteously. He was also very patient in waiting for us to decide what drinks we wanted since we hadn't planned on getting any until he asked.  The dining area inside is very small, but we were able to get a table even with the area pretty busy. There were plenty of spots to sit at outside, as well. While waiting I noticed that the music was a little too loud. It made talking with my friend difficult at some points. The atmosphere of the place is very chill, though, and it lends to casual dining.  Our smoothies arrived in a few minutes and our food was there shortly after. I ordered the berry smoothie, and it was very tasty. My friend ordered the strawberry-banana smoothie, and it was just as good. For food, I ordered the California Club. It has egg, bacon, turkey, pepper jack, cream cheese, avocado, tomato, and pesto on Artisan bread, if I remember correctly. It was fabulous! Like I said, I don't tend to eat healthy food (I'm a meat and potatoes kind of girl), but this definitely hit the spot. Everything tasted fresh, and I really enjoyed the cream cheese addition. I didn't notice much avocado on the sandwich, though, but I also wasn't inspecting it very closely. My friend ordered the Chicken Breast Panini, and he says it was "delish."  The employees noticed we were sitting around talking, so they came by and picked up our plates and trash to free up some space on our table for us. They were very polite and asked us how the food was. When my friend mentioned I was a Yelper, the employee seemed delighted to hear that. I mentioned that there were good reviews for the place, and he said that he reads them often. It's always nice to hear that businesses pay attention to what is being said by customers!  Overall, I had a great experience at D'lish, and I'll be sure to go back!

My boss picks up Burritos and Fruit smoothies from this place quite often. The food is always good but not mind blowing. I see this as being a great quick stop breakfast. Worth the stop in if you don't have time to make breakfast. I will be returning on my own accord for burritos for hiking and such in the future.

Having only eaten here once, I'll give it 4 stars.   The good: had a tuna fish sandwich on toasted sourdough. Yum. Food tasted clean. Also scooped up a Breakfast Buzz (vegan) smoothie. Peanut butter & banana. Daumnnn so so good. I make amazing smoothies everyday in my Vitamix and this murdered my recipe. It has me jonesing for more less than 24hrs later.   The bad: this isn't their fault, but entering southbound from Scottsdale Rd at 1130am on a weekday is a nightmare. Parking is minimal. Restaurant is small.   Big complaints: blender running constantly, and due to the small size of the establishment, it makes conversation super difficult and annoying. I hope they read this review and consider moving it to the back.. (hint hint). Sandwich portion size was somewhat small, and my friend got a wrap that looked small as well. We both ended up buying the Breakfast Buzz smoothie after eating our lunch because we were both hungry.   Overall, the food is bomb. Super clean, healthy, unique recipes. Don't plan on coming here for a quiet date or a meeting. The drive-thru is the way to go, it seems, and ordering ahead would be my advice as well. I'm definitely going back. Sooon.

Great food, great prices for food that's a bit healthier. The drive thru is very convenient so that's a plus. Will defiantly be back, my only complaint is I wish they had more of a variety for the kids menu.

Love that theres the option for in-house dining or drive-thru, and everything is made-to-order right in front of you. Have had a few smoothies here-- my fav is the coffee/mocha one, and their bfast sandwich and bfast burrito are delect.

This place is SO GOOD. The salads and sandwiches are fresh and everything seems fairly priced considering the quality of food.   Though the drive thru is often packed and can be tight with the small parking lot around it, I love the concept of getting fresh quality food in a fast drive thru and it's totally worth the wait. I wish there were more D'lish restaurants in the valley, but not if becoming a chain would sacrifice their quality of food :)
I would say, it's' a good place for lunch. My Southwest rice bowl was okay. Not bad but also not fantastic. Not many tables inside, but they have a patio with umbrellas.
I had the frittata and the espresso shake. They were both delicious. The service was great, the prices very reasonable, and you can either drive thru or eat in. Great customer service.

Food and prices were good; however, I walked out of here with a receipt for $15.13 that ended up on my credit card as $35.13. The service wasn't bad but definitely not worthy of a $20 nonconsensual tip.

WOW!! This place is awesome. I love local coffee establishments. The place had a really homey feel to it. The art design on the wall gave the place a unique feel. They're hand drawn and painted, which separates itself from the Starbucks mass-produced art work.   I loved the fact they used Pandora as their music source. Lots of great collection from indie musicians.   I ordered the 12oz Mocha which was very delightful to the palette. It was smooth and refreshing, it didn't have that burn taste. It was just great! Their menu is VERY healthy.  The owners are very welcoming and great to talk to. I like how they interact with the customers which give it that personal connection. I'm definitely going back to this place it's just a GREAT place to hang!!  This place has potential. They are expanding their menu so watch for goodies within the next couple of months. They buy a lot of their produce from local farms which help sustain the community - I'm a big fan of that!!

This place has a drive thru which makes for some fast service on the go. There is a great shake called the "breakfast buzz" which has some coffee in it too. They food is above average at best but does the trick.
I ordered an California club for to go and got burned bread and bacon!!!

Tried this place out today for lunch with a few co-workers, great food, great service and very friendly staff.  Two of us got the California club (signature sandwich) and it was delish!!! Seemed very lite going down but was filling.    My other co-worker had the salad and was very happy with it as well.  We also all decided to try the breakfast buzz- which has vitamins, peanut butter, bananas with chocolate and espresso shots...   we are awake and ready to go!!  I don't consider myself a real healthy eater, but I felt like I had some healthy food for a change, and didn't feel at all that the flavor or taste was lacking like some good for you food does.  Overall great experience and looking forward to seeing what else we can try next time. I will definitely be back and let others know what they missed out on :) and they have a drive thru and call in...

Good place to take your young out-of-town guests to show you're still hip. Not a good place for us senior citizens. The music is so loud as to be painful. The staff are disdainful of older folk. The food is strange hard core healthy. Might be good spot to cure a hangover.

Really good and would go back again.  Just can't justify 5 stars when the service was decent but nothing out of the ordinary.  The breakfast buzz was worth the flight from Michigan, but the food seemed a bit over priced--2 drinks, a California Club and a bowl of quinoa for 22.50, you decide.

Great concept with the drive thru healthy, alt food. Had the oatmeal - it was very tasty. Good coffee but went a little cream happy. Didn't try the shake but prob should have. Point deducted for no bathroom if you eat there, otherwise very solid little breakfast/lunch stopover.

Friendly and playful staff that work hard to deliver good service considering their small space and almost always busy  Everything from their dirty iced chai to their quinoa burger is AWESOME.   If I am on a time crunch and the line is busy I go somewhere else but other than that, their food is always worth the wait.   I am so glad they decided to put a D'lish near campus but a little badgered that they did it my senior year when I am about to graduate in a couple of months!  By any means, I love this place. One of my favorite lunch spots!

Thought I would try this place out today since I'm a huge fan of breakfast food! I had heard good things and the menu seemed promising.   I ordered the Croissant Sandwich. I wouldn't say the guy behind the counter was very friendly and it looked like he could have been the manager. He acted like he just wanted to take our order and get us out of the way. But he could have been having a bad day, who knows.  The sandwich was good. I wouldn't say it was outstanding or better than any other breakfast sandwich I've had. Plus it was $6 for a pretty small sandwich... Honestly, I probably could have eaten another one to fill me up. I ordered berry green tea and I'm pretty sure they gave me traditional black tea. Either that or their berry green was very tasteless/didn't taste like green tea at all.  So I'm giving this place three stars because they definitely have the right idea! Great menu options, drive-thru, nice outdoor seating area. Customer service could have been better, but I'm not going to say it was bad after only one experience. Portion size was not substantial for how much the meal cost, but I can't say that's surprising for a healthy food joint.  Not bad! But could have been better.

Hidden Gem! I found this place on Yelp and so glad I checked it out this morning. The food and coffee were great and the prices are so low. The staff was very friendly and made great suggestions for us. I am already planning on going back tomorrow to try something else!

This place is awesome! I live right by and I love that they have a really healthy menu. I have two friends that are picky eaters, one gluten free and the other vegeterian and this place is perfect for both. They have a menu that specifies which items are vegetarian and which items are gluten free (so we don't have to annoyingly ask a hundred questions like we do at other restaurants). I like D'lish because I'm on a 'mostly protein' diet and they have plenty of options for me- my favorite is their Man Salad and their Breakfast Buzz (which is an awesome espresso drink mix with protein powder). Great prices and nice staff..I will keep coming back:)

This place is delicious I go here at least once a week. The main reasons why I love this place is that the food is healthy and fresh, great prices and fast service! My favorites would be their breakfast burritos, quinoa oatmeal and frittatas so yummy! My boyfriends favorite is the club sandwich which is super good too.

This food stop has gotten it right!  The food, customer service, atmosphere-everything!  I had the California club with avacado and split a daily buzz protein shake with my date.  Absolutely fantastic!  The guys working there were really friendly as well.  My only complaint:  the parking.  There simply isn't any room.  Had the parking been a little better, a 5 star rating would've been given.

I've waited along time to check this place out. The green lemonade smoothie was the best I've had! The issue with this location is the poor customer service.  I may or may not go back again purely due to the service. Every employee I encountered was rude, didn't even thank the customer.  They all need a lesson in customer service. Hope the management monitoring YELP notes this review.
We've been for breakfast - breakfast sandwich was super yummy and just recently tried lunch.  Recommend the tuna and turkey club sandwiches.
This place is reasonably priced and has great fresh food.  Everyone is really nice.  Great for breakfast for lunch.  Veggie friendly which is a plus!  I wish there was a place like this where I live.

I have ate here everyday since Day1. Move over Pita Jungle....I have a new love. The food looks an tastes.fantastic!! Cactus blossum tea. get that everytime. The soups\ LOVE Love them. its all good.very crisp an clean inside an out an a much needed addition to this area..

Great food and EXCELLENT customer service. They often have long lines since they make your food to order, but they said they doubled their staff since spring training and have really improved on efficiency. You can also call in your order to pick up if you are really pressed for time. Parking is pretty terrible because they have such a small place that you have to wait for a clearance in the drive-thru line just to leave. However, they really try hard to get the drive-thru line orders in quickly and even send someone out to take your order before you get to the order window.
Great coffee, fresh food, friendly service.  Great little stop. Could use a good cleaning, but if you can overlook that, you'll love the place.

Purchased a soup and two sandwiches and it cost me over $30! Kind of ridiculous considering how bland and boring the food tasted... Also it was definitely not worth the 20 minute wait in a drive thru that is falling apart! If you charge people so much for the food I'm sure you would have enough money to spruce up your location and make it easier to drive through.

This is one of my favorite lunch spots! The food always comes up quick and everything I tried is amazing, especially the tuna salad sandwich. The smoothies can't be beat and everyone is super nice that has helped me. Will keep going back and back..
How did I not know about this place before!?! I had the breakfast club and it was AMAZING! Great customer service, quick and healthy eats.. what more do you need?
I tried this place to try to eat healthy. Nothing to rave about. I guess my expectations are higher cuz the name pretty much says a lot but wasn't impressed with the sandwich and juice...it's ok.

Extremely disappointed. Woke up on New Years with a craving for a breakfast burrito. I only have 4 cheat days from paleo a year, and New Years is my last one. I ordered the AZ Burro. First, they forgot the turkey. Everything was mixed together, there was way too much feta, and I couldn't tell if I was eating rice or potatoes and couldn't take the eggs at all. It was all extremely bland, even the salsa! Also, super long wait and the burrito was lukewarm.
My favorite is the low carb breakfast!!   I have to eat here at least once when I visit my daughter.  It's D'Lite-fully d'licious!

After seeing the size of the parking lot, I was pleasantly surprised with this little gem! We were immediately greeted by a friendly and knowledgeable staff. The "man" salad was wonderful! The ingredients were all fresh and the tuna was delicious! The prices are great for the quality of ingredients and the portion size. The sandwiches looked awesome! I will definitely return!
Don't bother reading my review, just go to D'lish and enjoy yourself some awesomeness in and around your face.

Was expecting much better of the nuts and berries salad.  Turned out to be very mediocre.    The place is very popular though.  Every time I pass at lunch hour the drive through is jammed back to Scottsdale Rd.  It's very likely you will have to drive a few blocks up the street to park.  I can't imagine how much business they lose on a daily basis due to the inconvenience of the parking lot/drive-through.    Anyway, friendly enough staff but it took a while to get my food, they nickle and dimed me in charging for adding a few raisins to my salad, and the salad was very average.

Great food for the people who want to eat a healthy diet without the guilt. I go there everyday to get my breakfast buzz without the espresso! Definitely makes my life easier and I have so much energy the rest of the day. Highly recommend this for anyone looking for a quick healthy fix.
Killer drive-thru breakfast spot. Love the Breakfast Buzz, really kick-starts my morning with the heat of one thousand suns. 5 stars.
Hard enough to find organic restaurant, these guys have a drive-thru. It can get over-whelmed during breakfast time they need to expand.

The food at D'lish is super fresh and real tasty!  Recommend the breakfast club and a coffee (drink menu is on point).  For lunch, the tuna sandwich or turkey club are awesome!  If you don't want to wait in line (drive-thru line can grow fast, parking lot has about 10 spots), then call your order in, highly recommended.

We had the turkey club without tomato, very good. We also had a large house smoothy. Which is strawberry banana. I was very impressed with both. The smoothy was five dollars and the club was tiny bit over 7 after tax. That's the reason it didn't land a five . I feel like the food should have been 5 and the drink 3.50. Very small place and little bit dirty .

Last Sunday, the man and I headed out to get breakfast, enjoy some coffee and have a lazy read of the day's paper.  He wanted to take to me to the place he stops at many mornings on his way to work, but alas, it wasn't open until 11am.  (Side note: A coffee shop that doesn't open til 11am?  On a Sunday?  Really?)  We looked at each with blank faces.  Where to go now?  We needed breakfast, coffee, wireless internet and a place where we could relax without feeling like we were preventing a server from turning the table.    So I said, "What about that little shack place further south on Scottsdale Rd.? You know the one that says coffee, breakfast, lunch on the sign outside."  He said something along the lines of, "You're a f*$@ing genius."  His colleague had apparently been recommending this place for weeks and he hadn't tried it yet.  D'lish as it turned out to be called, was exactly what we were looking for.   As we walked up to the front door, we passed a lovely but small patio.  I was instantly charmed.  All along the patio are planters with homegrown tomatoes, herbs and other yummy garden delights.    When we walked in we checked out the menu and waited our turn.  Not sure who helped us but I'm assuming the two guys who we spoke with during our visit are Chad and Kyle.  The bf and I ordered the same thing: two breakfast croissants and two lattes.  The latte was great and satisfied the Sunday morning coffee craving.   The breakfast croissant?  Just delicious.  A fried egg, bacon and tomato with a light layer of pesto on the croissant.  Seriously delicious.  I don't know if I ever would have thought of pesto on an egg sandwich but I'm so glad that D'lish has broadened my culinary horizons.    The bf was equally satisfied with his meal, but did remark that he thought $6 was a bit expensive for a breakfast sandwich.  I think we paid a reasonable price for a quality product.  It is apparent to me that with a limited menu stocked with fresh ingredients, a garden on the patio and their status as a CSA drop off point, D'lish is trying to churn out food that is as fresh, natural, local and organic as possible.  Yay for them.    Chad and Kyle were nothing but friendly and welcoming.   A number of regulars came through while we were there and it was obvious they have quite a loyal following.  D'lish is small, no more than 20 or 30 could fit in the place.  However, they also have a drive thru to serve customers on the run.  We'll be back and hope to be regulars soon!

I recently just went there for breakfast and spent $18 on a breakfast buzz a turkey wrap and some sort of soup The breakfast but it was melted the tomatoes in the turkey wrap were old and they tasted horrible and the soup was cold never going back there again waste of money

I am a foodie from the San Francisco Bay Area, and I encourage D'Lish to open a cafe there. The food truly is fresh, flavorful, prepared and presented with care. The only thing that detracts is the extremely loud noise that overwhelms the eight table inside dining area, every time a smoothie is made. I worry for the hearing health of the employees who must tolerate this throughout the day. So 5 stars for delicious and healthy  food, and 5 Bells for uncharacteristically rude noise.

This place just isn't for me. All my friends love their breakfast sandwiches (as do most) but I don't like their eggs and I feel it's a little pricey for what you get. Everything comes with avocado and they have absolutely no room for cars during busy hours. If you're in south Scottsdale it's worth a try as you'll probably like it. 6/10 on the hipster scale

D'lish in Scottsdale has been on my list to try for a long time, so you can imagine my excitement when they moved in two blocks from my house. They provide a good option for coffe and food on the way to school, but I can say I am rarely comfortable in this establishment. They don't have shade on the east side of the building so in the morning the majority of their inside seating is out of the question. It is always either too hot or too cold inside and the music is consistently just a little too loud. This place is small! You don't need three spakers. That being said, their food is pretty good. I really love anything with their hashbrowns inside. AND you can get bfast any time of day. I certainly won't be going too often....the prices would break this grad student's bank. Also, I often get the same drink order, and I feel like I am always paying a different price. Obviously they are still working some things out, but I just have never had so many small complains about a place. Also, I haven't checked recently, but for a while their sign read "free trade" coffee instead of "fair trade" coffee....gotta get that fixed!

We'll certainly return when we're back in town! The only thing 'fast' about this fast food is that the service is quick & efficient! Great local concept!  Like: AZ burrito! Chicken breast panini Toddy - cold brewed coffee! Ambiance - informal & one can tell it's a local favorite!  Wish: We had one in Riverside CA!

I had heard a lot about this location and boy was my experience an anticlimax. The sandwich was one I could have made with little effort. It was pleasant and light, but by no means the best sandwich I've ever had. Would not recommend highly.

What a great find! Coffee is strong and tasty. Oatmeal is very good as are the breakfast sandwiches with very fresh and high quality ingredients. Efficient, prompt and very friendly service. We'll be back!
Simply amazing! Menu is small but sooo good! I find myself going there on a more regular basis just to keep trying different things on the menu.
Had the frittata this morning - AWESOME!!!!  Not the same 'ol breakfast for sure!
Great local sourced food, with creative twists.  Plenty of healthy and vegan options, and don't forget to try the Breakfast Buzz

Love the Breakfast Buzz, just wish the taste was consistent from server to server. My only rub against this place is the parking. I prefer to walk in and go to the counter. More often then I'm in and out before most cars have even placed an order.  Update on my initial complaint   Can't fathom how they can't get their signature drink consistent each time. It's like the employees just guess. Really disappointed that the Buzz I was looking forward to this morning was over powered by the amount of espresso poured into my drink. It can't be that hard to post the recipe by size right in front of the blender fir the employees to follow.

I just picked up lunch for my coworkers and they cant stop raving about how good the food was!  Everyone is already talking about going back.  I had the "man" salad and it was amazing.  Packed with good protein and gluten free, not to mention so fresh and tasty!  I'll have plenty of energy for a good workout after work and no stomachache from lactose or gluten.  Plus, the employees were friendly and upbeat in spite of the lunch rush.  Yes, the drive thru line was a little long, but completely worth it.  Great job, D'lish!  I'm so happy to find a fast, healthy local restaurant.

I don't like to trash a place based on one bad employee, but I don't think I'll go back here.  I went here with a friend. We place our order and sit down. A few minutes later, our waiter takes our drinks to a table across the room. This table realizes they have the wrong drinks and returns them to the counter. This is no big deal, I won't freak out over this. The waiter then brings the drinks (with the same straws used by the previous table) to my friend and me. I ask for new straws. The waiter then tells me "I just made these and I took the paper off of the straws." Why did he lie about this? I try not to make a scene, but he continues lying to me and refusing to just get two straws for a full five minutes before I reveal that I have watched where the drinks have been, I know that he did not "just make" them, and he was not the one handling the straws. He makes a scene and lays into me with a very sarcastic tone. I didn't eat too much of my meal. When your waiter lies about sanitary issues and mocks you in front of a crowd, your appetite goes away.  This was probably my fifth or sixth visit to D'lish. In the past, the service has been okay and food is pretty good. But I have no problem with never eating here again.
5star breakfast! It is my second time coming to D'Lish and i just more in love with the food and service. The popularity of the restaurant is amazing! #healthy #organic #cantnevergowrong
Love love love this place. It is a unique spot in a not so likely area, just one the things That keeps me coming back. Not mention they also offer great food and friendly service.

Food here is  mediocre! Some healthy options & close to campus. I like that they have vegetarian options. I feel that the Employee's at the Tempe location need to be trained on ingredients and allergy information! They seem to be pretty clueless! Also went to the drive thru at 3:30 (they close at 4) and the guy at the drive thru said to me "you are lucky that you didn't come any later or I would be pissed" RUDE!?? As far as I am concerned you are open until 4pm. So you work until 4pm.

Yes, there is a party in my mouth...a breakfast party!  Definitely one of the best breakfasts I ever had.  I enjoyed the arugula salad with hash browns, eggs, and bacon (all in the salad, not separate).  It might sound weird but was fantastic!  The only thing keeping this place from 5 stars is the abysmal parking/drive-thru situation.  Words that best describe the situation I cannot use on Yelp....so I'll just say I had to make a 500 point turn to get out of the lot, and those in the drive-thru line were none too helpful in letting me depart.  I will definitely keep this in mind on my next trip--or buy a smart car.  Patio is dog-friendly, food is fresh and fantastic.  Just don't park in the back--and enjoy D'lish!
Even though the drive through line is always long (sometimes all the way out to Scottsdale road) is worth waiting for that delicious Cali club sandwich.
I honestly have only had the morning buzz with almond milk and it's my all time favorite!! The man salad is great too!! Healthy on the go!

I really like their breakfast buzz shake. Chocolate, peanut butter, banana, coffee, protein, ice. So delicious! And can be a quick meal replacement. This shake is one of the few foods I dream about. If I'm in Scottsdale, I try to think of a reason to stop by.  I also like the quinoa oatmeal. Very light tasting but filling. Quinoa gives you protein, chewiness, and a slightly nutty taste.   Downsides: not too much seating. Parking lot is small. Drive through line can be long. None of these keep me away.

Stopped by on the recommendations posted for breakfast-didn't disappoint! Fresh, hot food with reasonable price AND healthy! From out of the area but wish there was one in Seattle-I would definitely come back.  This will be on my list for future trips!

This place fills a gap that is definitely needed in the area. Fast, delicious, and relatively cheap breakfast food and coffee. Yesterday I had the low carb breakfast in a tomato basil wrap - warm eggs, fresh greens, potato, and pesto sauce. It was fantastic! The iced coffee was smooth, almost-carmely (not sweet), and delicious. I highly recommend this place any day. Oh, and they're open early!   Beyond the food, the place looks great and has a beautiful patio. It stands out amongst some of the eyesore plazas of Apache. The only down side - they close at 4pm.

I love, love, love this place!!! There are no healthy drive thru places so right away that's major points. Everything on the menu is delicious, literally. I've never ordered anything I didn't like from the AZ burro to the Top Notch protein burger (made with black beans and quinoa) to all their tasty teas and drinks. It doesn't matter what you get you're sure to be satisfied! I hope this place stays open for years to come!!
OMG this place is off the chain.  EVERYTHING is so fresh it's insane.  High-quality local ingredients and all super knowledgeable staff definitely make this place a must-visit if you're in this area.
Loved the breakfast croissants here. Friendly and fast service, and a small business feel. The iced drinks are also a plus!

I have driven by Dlish about a thousand times and about two weeks ago stopped in. AMAZING I have since been back close to a dozen times. The food is awesome breakfast, lunch if it's on their menu it's sure to please. Organic, local and awesome friendly staff makes this one of my new faves

Great vegetarian options. Love the low carb breakfast, and the drive thru staff recommended their amazing seasonal smoothie. This place does a great job getting healthy meals out as quickly as possible without skimping on quality. I'd rather wait in a line of cars here than at in-n-out (no offense, just feel better about the options here).

Place is awesome.  Was in town on business for two days a couple months back and looked for a breakfast spot for the first day. Found D'lish on Yelp and ended up going there both days because the Breakfast Buzz drink was out of this world good.  It's a combination of peanut butter, bananas, espresso, chocolate, milk, proteins and vitamins, blended cold. Got it with soymilk and it was still great.  Sandwiches are solid, four-star worthy. But the Breakfast Buzz is six-star caliber. And the service was great. Fun, relaxing place to get some work done and they also have an unusual drive-thru, which could be convenient.

This place is seriously delicious! I am addicted to their Pomegranate Green Tea and Kombucha. I went three days in a row last week, but have one complaint... They were out of large drinking cups all three days. They also have great sandwiches. Popular tiny little place. It's better to go through the Drive-Thru because of parking issues.

EVERYTHING is delicious.  I have tried half the things on the menu and I would order everything again..  My favorites are the AZ breakfast burro, the Veggie burrito and the Humanitarian wrap.  You can make anything vegetarian.  Their iced coffee is my favorite in town!    As a heads up, they have peak times that are super busy and there is little to no parking to speak of.  Their drive-through is fairly efficient.    Definitely my favorite quick, healthy restaurant in Scottsdale.

Awesome concept, love the idea of a health-conscious fast food joint, but as far as "fast" goes I think they could speed up their game for their drive-thru just a bit.  Last few times I ordered food through the drive-thru it took about 10-15 mins for a drink and breakfast sandwich.  Plus, when I got the sandwich it was just a little bit sogalicious. However, today I thought I'd give them another try and sit inside.  Was a little more impressed with their service and food this go-around.  The guys working were cracking me up, very witty and sarcastic--kinda like the personable attitude of a West Coast coffee house; super laid back like hanging in a friend's kitchen.  I ordered their traditional breakfast burrito and it was very D'lish, not soggy but very hearty and filling, eggs were perfectly seasoned and loved the flavor of the salsa.  Definitely willing to try this place again, but from now on I'll probably sit inside or put in a pre-order.  Really wish their hours went a lot later through the evening instead of closing at 4pm. I think they could probably triple their business if opened at night given the location.  Update 08/25:  Just gave this place an additional star...I've been more and more impressed w/ DLish because they've definitely sped up their drive-thru game!  I look forward to continuing my dining business with them again and again!  Would rather support local cafés over any mega-tron monopolies (*cough* Starbucks).  Also, just recently tried their blackbean and quinoa burger...ummm yeah, very DEEElicious, super ++ !

I like this place for there drinks and sandwiches, but there burritos just have way too much egg in them. I guess if you are a huge egg fan you'll love their breakfast burritos, but I like to keep it at a minimum. I usually order the turkey BLT or tuna sandwich which are both great. They are quick and keep it casual and friendly. They even have a drive thru which I've never used, but if you are too lazy too get out of your car and don't mind wasting money on gas it's perfect for you!

Long wait unless you call your order ahead, but so worth it!  Delish food, tastes great, very healthy, portions which leave some for the next meal.  This is food that makes you like it not just when you eat it, but after as well!

Not quite sure why they have a drive through when they can't operate it properly. I waited 15 minutes after ordering for a breakfast buzz.  I was the first car followed by a long line of people who also ordered beverages only. They all managed to leave before I did. There was no reasoning as to why I had to wait so long for the same beverage numerous vehicles had ordered after me.

Just flew into Phoenix.  This was the perfect treasure for breakfast.  Be sure to park down at the bar.  Worth the walk! Would have take photo but we scarfed our food down so fast. This is a must if in this area!
Friendly staff and food is stellar.  Second time in and had the nuts and berries salad with chicken.  To die for!

First and foremost the food here is great. Love everything about it.   The problem appears to be the workers. About a week ago I stopped in to get a coffee after dropping my wife at work. I was told it would be $1 and some change. I signed my receipt that said $1 and change and went home. Later in the day i'm paying bills and see the charge from D'lish as $6.56 on my bank history. All i got was a coffee. So the cashier at the drive through clearly screwed up. Everyone makes mistakes so I'm not to bothered by this.   However, A week later i go back for some burritos and breakfast buzz. Everything seems hunky dory. Fast forward to the next day and I'm at work when i receive a call from someone who says they were in line behind me the day before at D'lish and they have my debit card. I look in my wallet and lo and behold I was given someone elses debit card when at delish the previous day.  Now i can forgive an overcharge. It's easy to fat finger a cash register but to give away my debit card to someone else is completely unacceptable. Part of the blame could certainly be on me for not checking but if you're operating a business I'm trusting you do things right. The fact that you messed up twice within 2 weeks is almost unforgivable. Still not sure i'll ever go back. If I do I'll definitely be bringing cash

I've only been here once, as I just moved to Scottsdale, but the low carb breakfast was delicious. I'll definitely be back to try more. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I haven't tried most of their food. Definitely casual.
So freaking delicious. Bit my tounge trying to eat too fast but good food and great shakes. Really enjoyed breakfast this morning. Dont hesitate to try its bomb!

Healthiest drive through option ever. They actually cook! I am at the Scottsdale location at least once a week. As a creature of habit, I generally only order the same thing....the seasonal turkey sandwich called "the gobbler" with this amazing cranberry goat cheese spread. Not sure what I will do when they change the menu.   They have assorted iced teas as well: green, black, and cactus pear or cactus blossom. These are excellent when mixed with black tea. The last time I went thru, I noticed they had a "doggie bag" option, which is chicken and wild rice. That's an awesome option for anyone who takes their pet anywhere.  Additionally, this place is small.... But if the drive through is backed up, the guy that works the first window will come out with spare menus and take your order on the spot. I don't think I have ever waited more than 5 min for food.

This is my favorite spot to go after the gym, excellent menu and cool contemporary interior. Breakfast buzz smoothie, the Chicken Breast Panini,  and the Turkey club are all great choices if it's your first time in, but you really can't go wrong for fresh healthy nutrition. Staff are friendly and know the menu. Highly recommend!

I've spotted this place while driving down Scottsdale and saw it had great reviews on here and had to try it.  They have drinks, snacks, bfast/lunch items that are creative and tasty.  Healthier and more nutritious than others nearby.  Fast and friendly as well.

A buddy and I stopped by for pick-up on our lunch break a few days ago. I had their southwest rice bowl. It was alright...a little on the soupy side, with too much of the enchilada sauce and not enough chicken. It came with blue corn tortilla chips, which sounded good...the bag contained maybe 10 chips? Really? Again, it was alright...I could probably make this at home. It was also a little on the spendy side for what I got. I'll give something else on their menu a try next time.
Good food. Quick service. Went there for breakfast and was very pleased with our oatmeal and breakfast burrito. Yum.

Sat at the drive thru window for 10 minutes today without being acknowledge (after reading other reviews this seems to happen often). There were three employees at the counter inside, all of which looked at me but no one came to help. Eventually, after the cars behind me left, I left as well. Only to show up to work late and hungry. I know how delicious their food is but my experience today has changed my views about the place. So disappointed..

I LOVE this place! I am obsessed. The best items on the menu are by far the Breakfast Buzz (protein shake with coffee, peanut butter, and banana) and the California Club.   I usually dread going to work on Mondays, but a quick drive through at D'lish gets me ready for the week! It's so convenient for my schedule that they are open at 6am.   Lots of locals are catching on to how awesome this place is, so the line hangs out into the road often times during lunch hours. Also very busy on the weekends!

Had postmates deliver to me this weekend and my egg sandwich was inedible. It was completely burnt and I added chicken sausage to the sandwich, which I had thought they forgot to add because I only got 3 pieces total on the sandwich!  My breakfast buzz was great as usual but I'm pretty disappointed that I couldn't eat my sandwich. Posted a picture just so they could see this inedible sandwich.

Everything I've had from here is so delicious and fresh tasting, and the drive thru is a big plus. The bialys are amazing, especially in the breakfast club. Turkey club is also 10/10. All the staff is super friendly. I had my dog in the car and they were all so excited to see her and give her a treat. Great experience overall and would highly recommend. The parking lot can be a little cramped and annoying, but that's not really their fault.

The food is healthy and fresh, even if a little pricey. My favorite thing to get is the lunch combo: Humanitarian w/chicken and portabello mushroom soup. The California Club and Turkey Clubs are also pretty good. I tried the Oatmeal and there was too much milk for my taste; I like the quinoa oatmeal I make at home better. I also wasn't a fan of the Nuts n' Berries or the Kitchen Sink salads Good teas and coffees. And OMG that Breakfast Buzz!

Can't go wrong with anything on the menu! The Oatmeal our way is magical, toddy's (super charged coffee & espresso) are better than any Starbucks concoction, and the breakfast buzz will hands down change your life!! They say dynamite comes in small packages and this little place is no exception!
Breakfast burrito w/ chicken sausage and kombucha or breakfast buzz.  Order it.  You're welcome.

I generally crave the breakfast buzz shake at least once a week! As far as the breakfast sandwiches, you can't go wrong. I alternate between the California Club and croissant sandwich. Great little breakfast/brunch spot!
Eating here now this place is great super health love it the man salad is the way to go they are not open late but a great lunch and breakfast place

Went there on a Sunday morning.  Its a drive thru spot but I parked and walked in.  There was no line as almost everyone does the drive thru.  Got the California Club which was super good.  The prices are reasonable and the staff was nice and quick.

I'm in love with this place. I've passed it so many times and didn't realize it was actually a heathy place to eat especially since it's next to a Mexican fast food stand. My friend got the "man salad" and I got the "California club". It was nice to be able to get breakfast and lunch at 9:45am. I got the their chocolate, espresso, protein iced drink and it was great! I loved the reggae music. FYI It's a small place and doesn't have public bathrooms and neither does the Mexican place next store so don't go to crazy I the fluids.

After 2 years of living in old town I just went to D'lish last week and I am so sad I didn't find this place sooner! I have now been 3 times in the past 9 days!! The food is amazing. I have only done the drive thru and considering the quality of the food, it was really fast! The iced coffee is amazing on staff recommendations I have had the California Club and the Humanitarian Wrap, & I was very happy with both! Today I had the Tuna Sandwich and can honestly say I've never had a better one!! I am quickly becoming a regular, can't wait to try the rest of the menu!!!
This place mixes fast drive thru service with quality food. If you want to chill they have a small outdoor patio. Their menu is awesome offering vegetarian and vegan options.
Ordered 8 California Clubs for coworkers. All were missing avocado and three were missing egg. Did not look at all like picrure. Little to no flavor.
Great place!! If you are a gym rat this is the place to eat!! Had the AZ Burro and Oatmeal our way. Delicious and awesome !!

Cute place, minuscule parking lot.  Had a turkey wrap, which was on the small side compared to most wraps I've had, but it was plenty filling enough for me (a little skimpy on the avocado though).  Also tried the breakfast buzz shake, which had pretty good flavor, but was more icy and less creamy than I would have liked.
The staff are extremely friendly and chipper and the food never fails to blow me away. I highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch.

Love this place! The kombucha is so good!! Staff was friendly food was yummy.   I'll be back!! I'm vegan so it's hard to find healthy fast food items.   I'm so excited to have a place like this close to my home. I will be a regular for sure.   The only thing I would like to see is more vegan options :)  Or ways to make something vegan below the item on the board.
Kitchen sink salad like I would make myself-mixed greens, carrots, celery, feta, cukes, cous cous, raisins. Love it!

I was looking for a "sit down" restaurant for breakfast. While they were friendly, the food comes wrapped in plastic as it is obviously geared to the massive beasts idling next to the patio. With it being 115 degrees,  it's too much for a quiet and peaceful breakfast. To drink hot coffee from a paper lined in plastic cup with car exhaust idling next to your face in the "too lazy to get out of my car" drive through window que.

Food was great. The place is very small and anytime, they were turning the blender on, it was a lot of noise inside the restaurant making the atmosphere uncomfortable to sit and have a chat with friends. I figured next, I will only go through drive through.

This small perfectly nestled little place is right up my alley so I loved it before I even ate anything. I like that there is no machine I talk to yet they still have a drive-thru. I like that I actually have to wait for my food to cook and it's not pre wrapped sitting under a heat lamp waiting for me. I like the happy, carefree (in a good way) personality of the staff. I love the food! The mushroom soup is something I crave! The veggie burrito is always piping hot and their salsa that comes with it is perfect! Salads, love! Chicken breast panini, love! I just wish it were across the street from my place instead of my boyfriends. Fresh, trendy, and consistent! Consistency is key and they have nailed it! Thank you D'lish!! Cheers :)

Easily worthy of 5 stars based on the food alone. However, accessibility & efficiency are not D'Lish's strong points based on a building they've clearly outgrown. Congratulations to creating a successful business, but everybody's favorite neighborhood secret has literally outgrown its charm.   I find it annoying to wait 15 minutes for a blended drink (Breakfast Buzz) which I can easily replicate at home. I could go on and on about the cramped seating, rough chairs & the worst parking lot in S. Scottsdale, but I won't. I want to see D'Lish succeed on a bigger scale. It's quite simple. Rent or build a bigger building. Build your brand; because waiting 25 minutes for breakfast food isn't good business.
Dirty Chai (w/ almond milk) AMAZING. I went out of my way to get this drink!

Food is good and comes fairly quick, but a little on the pricey side.   Popular place for take out and drive-thru. Eat-in dining area is too small and a little noisy.  Parking can be a nightmare.  Please stay in our neighborhood, but please expand.  Maybe buyout the place next door : )

First time I came here, I was visiting. After I moved here to AZ, I am still going here! Their quinoa burgers are fantastic. I always get the "naked burger" (served on a bed of greens) so I can skip out on those extra carbs.   It is nice they have a drive thru...went through it once and the gentleman at the window was very friendly. Also addressed me by name (gave him my credit card to pay), which always makes someone feel special! Great service and food!

We just went to D'lish with a friend on a lazy Sunday morning.  I had an egg, cheese, and chicken sausage bialy sandwich.  It had great flavor, and the eggs were cooked perfectly!  I never drink coffee, but I tried my fiancee's coffee and was very impressed.  The service was great and friendly, and everything came out quick.

So i've been here now 2x and It is for lack of better words Delish!  One of my colleagues told me about this place after bringing back a couple Man Salads for lunch a few times.  I am always looking to try new places and lunch of course is a constant challenge that we are faced with every day...especially whilst working Full-time.  Being in Downtown Scottsdale, you can't not try a new place a minimum  of once a week.  ANYWAYS, I'm a breakfast guy and after a morning work out I felt like trying out their Breakfast Buzz and AZ Burrito.  BOTH were just delightful.  The drive thru has been packed the 2x i've been there and now I know why.  The Breakfast Buzz is just a great protein shake w/ espresso that really gives you the jolt for the day that you need in the office.  The AZ Burrito also was just on point w/ that smoked turkey and egg white.  Neither were overly filling and I was just set for the day.  Usually I get the office some Starbucks to start the Friday off right, but this week there were requests for breakfast buzzes instead.    Quick, D'lish and healthy.  Can't really beat that.  Definitely one of my go-to's for breakfast/lunch.    Cheers

The AZ Burro was fantastic, as was the Breakfast Club. The coffee was one of the best tasting and the hot tea was great. The music was a bit loud, even outside on the patio but the staff was very friendly and the food tasted "d'lish"! Worth the prices.

My husband and I needed a quick place to stop for lunch on our way out of Scottsdale. Stopped here based on Yelp reviews, and it was so wonderful. The food was fresh, delicious and prepared quickly. It also wasn't the kind of place we felt awkward having a baby with us. Very casual and friendly.  We also got iced chai lattes for the drive home to Tucson, and they were great! I haven't been anywhere that offers almond milk as a dairy milk substitute, so that was a very pleasant surprise!
They have cheap small plastic cups for water. I requested a bigger cup for water and the response was that we have to charge you. That is okay for fast food but not okay for my $9 lunch.

Great menu and atmosphere. Service wasn't the best, but the manager handled the situation very well and professionally. Unfortunately I found a dead fly tucked into the paper on my wrap. We may have had a fluke bad experience, but I won't be rushing back anytime soon.

Went here to check out what all the "buzz" was about, and ordered the breakfast buzz.  Wow what a great shake.  The service was super friendly and there croissant sandwich was phenomenal.  Will definitely be visiting again.
Phenomenal service.  The breakfast buzz was amazing.  Super healthy and the place looks fantastic.  Would definitely go back and recommend this place!

Great little spot to grab a quick breakfast. Ingredients are fresh, menu is unique, prices are reasonable, the guy behind the counter was friendly, and the Breakfast Buzz is AMAZING. I can't wait to go back for lunch to try the 'Man' Salad.

I go to D'lite quite often since I work near there. They are always very friendly and quick with their orders. The food is tasty and consistent. The reason for a four star and not a five is because I would love for more vegan options. Other than that... I love it :)

Great place that takes quick service and gives it a nice healthy twist. It can be very difficult to find a healthy meal and quick service. This place has a great menu especially if you consider yourself somewhat health conscious. My only complaint is that I wish they had more locations!

Lord have mercy, their black bean & quinoa burger (made early bird style) is my JAM. I appreciate the drive-thru for a small restaurant like this (even though it usually takes about 10-15 minutes to get through during lunch). I don't know how many calories might be in this thing because it's got plenty of spicy mayo and cheese but... I JUST DON'T CARE. So good!

This is my absolute favorite lunch spot. I have two kids and if my youngest is asleep and we are out and about I'll go through the drive-thru , grab my food & kombucha and be on my way. The staff is always super friendly! To the people complaining about the line : yes , it's long and can be annoying when people "cut in front of you" but truly there isn't anything more the staff can do. Don't get your panties in a twist. Relax!   I highly suggest the Humanitarian + veg supreme (pesto and avocado) ... As a vegetarian I love the flavor of the wrap and never find myself wanting more.
Wow had their California breakfast sandwich..so yummy. Went thru the drive thru and they had friendly service. :)

This speakeasy was kickass. The staff is super down to earth and the menu is great. The drive thru is an awesome touch. I got the Turkey Club and it was reallllllly good. We received 2 randomly free samples of a shake and smoothie and had some good conversation with the guys behind the counter. It gets a little noisy if they're makin shakes in there, and the seating is pretty limited. I wish they were open later but so far I'm loving it!

A cute, friendly little place on a busy road but well worth finding! We stopped by for brunch on our first visit to Scottsdale. Had the frittata...so good it hit the spot. Our kids ate the California club and couldn't finish them so I'll order 1 dish to share the next time. As previously mentioned some may find it a bit pricy but did not disappoint! We will be back!

This D'lish location just recently opened close to my place.  Absolutely love the atmosphere, workers, and food. Large four berry smoothie = awesome hangover recovery Chicken breast panini is my go-to sandwich.  BOMB.  This place is so green that I feel guilty driving my car there..So I walk and get to feel extra good about the environment.  Only downside is the fact that they close at 4PM...  (Maybe it would be wise to readjust the hours when ASU is in session.  50,000 students are nearby looking for healthy options for food at all hours.) ;)

Just found D'lish through a friend's recommendation.  Portabello soup and turkey club are amazing, coffee (their own) is smooth, and the service is friendly and fast.  It really doesn't get any better than this!!!  I will be back often!
Seriously great food and wonderful staff!  My favorites are the Veggie bowl and Chicken panini.  Breakfasts are great too.  Drive-through is fast.

LOVE THIS PLACE. Been eating here for 4 years now and I crave it regularly. I always order the same thing now because I know what I love: The humanitarian wrap with a portobello soup and the orange glorious. Their hummus plate is fantastic though! Really satisfying for a light lunch or snack.
Great food, drive through, iced coffee was delicious and the staff was super friendly. Loved this place and would come back if ever in the area.
Quick stop sandwich spot. The California club was perfect for brunch

I give their Dirty Chai with Almond Milk 5 Stars.  Their protein burger, however gets 2 Stars. It wasn't dry like some veggie burgers can be but it was tasteless. I got the Early Bird (open faced, no bun) and the Chipotle Aioli was so overwhelming that you couldn't really taste anything else. The egg on top of the burger was also very bland.  The service was OK, a little slow  I'll have to come back to try a different meal.  .

I love the food here! The restaurant is all about being organic and earth friendly, however they do not use cage-free eggs. ( So, not so earth friendly) Cage free does not mean the hens are treated well, but it is better! So my only suggestion would be to use cage-free eggs!
Awesome food! They are under staffed though... so when it's busy the drive thru gets backed up and can take up to 30 mins to get food. One of my favorite my favorite places.

Love, love, love this spot! Great food options but my favorite item is the Breakfast Buzz! It's a blended iced drink with espresso, protein powder, peanut butter, banana and several other ingredients. It's basically like a meal replacement shake and tastes amazing. I'm addicted now! Great coffee shop/lunch atmosphere and very very friendly service. There's a drink thru window available as well.

As far as the food goes, five stars. It is all really tasty, especially the breakfast sandwiches!  I'm subtracting stars because I'm confused about their mission statement and overall concept. Their website states "we offer organic and all natural fresh ingredients, including locally grown produce when available." I noticed on my most recent trip through D'lish's drive thru a notorious and easily recognizable jar of peanut butter with a blue/turquoise lid aka Skippy brand peanut butter. Of all the peanut butters on the market, this is one of the least health conscious products out there! Not only does it contain genetically modified/engineered oils but they are hydrogenated. In layman's terms, it contains TRANS FATS. This type of fat raises your bad cholesterol, lowers your good cholesterol, and puts you at a higher risk for having a stroke, type 2 diabetes and heart disease. Peanut butter without trans fats and genetically engineered ingredients is readily available and such a choice should be obvious for a restaurant that considers themselves "healthy".  I can't trust any of their other ingredients when they go the cheapo route on something so basic.

I was led here by yelp reviews. When I came here, there was no one and I thought I had made a mistake. I walked in and there was a tall guy at the register which was extremely friendly. My friend and I ordered and when our food came out, I understood why this place is so popular. The sandwich was so warm, perfect, soft, and just amazing overall. I ordered the cali club and my friend ordered the turkey sandwich. Both were great!   And then as we were leaving, there was about 9 cars lined up at the drive-thru. We'll definitely be back.

A great alternative to Starbucks to grab a coffee in the morning because they open at 6am and because the staff is friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable. The food is awesome. I had an egg, cheese, potato, and bacon burrito with the house blend coffee. Delicious! Really cool that they have a drive-through window, as well. You gotta go here!

Ordered the egg, potato, and cheese burrito at the new Arcadia location and would not order this again.  They put in fried hash browns in the burrito!  Not very healthy!  Sorry to say, "I won't be going back!

Food is great, I had the chicken breast Pannani and wife had the Southwestern bowl. The business is in a too small building however and if dining inside the blender noises are too loud for talking and if sitting outside there is no umbrellas from the sun. No bathrooms in premises, you have to walk to a nearby bar.   But if you are OK with that stuff, the prices are good and food fresh and tasty.

I was one of the many people who hopped on the delish bandwagon when they hit the south scottsdale scene. What a great concept. Healthy fast food. Not only has the quality of their food gone down but also their ability to hire individuals to provide any form of customer service. Today I called in an order and like many other times I get a girl who answers the phone like she would chatting with a friend, zero phone etiquette and the vocabulary of a child. In addition to the drop in service and the quality of food, the owners still have invested no money into the dump of a building this place is in. I'm surprised it passes the health code inspections. There is no bathroom for guests to use and it seems as if they are in no hurry at all to have these issues addressed.
so glad we visited this little shop - it was amazing to the extent we went there for breakfast and lunch and if they served dinner would have been there for dinner too!
This place made me believe in Arizona food again. It's easy to think of AZ as a bland cookie cutter city but places like D'lish are helping us gain a culinary identity. Go D'lish!

I went to the location on Shea (I was unable to find the location on yelp)  The service was fantastic, the employees (not just one but all) were helpful, informative and kind.  Any questions or menu modifications were gladly answered and accepted.      We had a sample of the "morning buzz" it was amazing and my husband ordered one for him self. I had the California club and beet salad both satisfying and delicious.   On my way out the door an employees noticed I was leaving with my iced tea half full they offered to refill my iced tea which I gladly accepted.    Give this place a try I'm sure you'll be glad you did.

The person who took my order at the drive thru was not friendly at all. My kitchen sink salad did not have several of the ingredients that were listed and it was very small. The chicken was not good and there were very few pieces. Also the bagel "chips" were just slices of bagel, nothing chippy about them at all. Not sure I'll ever go back after my first experience being not so good. I'll stick with Protein House right around the corner. I've never had a bad meal there thus far.

Great lunch spot!  Fast, delicious, fresh food!  We were in town last week from Chicago and based on the yelp reviews checked this place out.  I had a yummy hummos plate and my husband the turkey sandwich.  Returned 2 days later for more.  Good prices, friendly service, and great food!!

All I have to say is, it's been a nightmare being vegan and ordering from this place. Never have I been through the drive-thru and have received a correct order. Yes, I understand ordering vegan is a bit more complicated but at a place like this, one would think that the *entire* staff should be competent enough to be able to handle such a feat.  After speaking with a manager regarding my last order and telling them I did not want a free meal, that I just wanted my money back and it was the principle and the concept of when a food establishment gets an order wrong, it creates waste. I was surprised to hear their reply: that they don't care what I do with the food. Be that as it may, they should care because that means they're losing money. So, after I stated I just wanted my money back, the manager seemed to have become short and frustrated. This last visit just further solidified my validation in that this place is NOT for vegans.
I love this place not because the food is great, fresh, and healthy. Not because its got a great neighborhood feel to it, but because its full of deadly handsome bearded men that work there.

Food was healthy and tasty but a bit overpriced and akward to wait if you order to-go.  They have absolutely no waiting area or chairs so I was standing in the middle of two rows of tightly packed tables trying not to be in the way.  And they told me 10 min wait over the phone but I'm pretty sure I waited at least 30 mins.  :(

I have gone to this location at least 3 times and the Scottsdale location at least 5 times. This location is much safer to pull into and out of. In my experience of the other location a trip to get a healthy breakfast sandwich can feel like a suicide mission.. This  location has a lot more parking.  It is an extra bonus that the employees seem to enjoy their job! Since this location feels much safer and over all a more enjoyable experience I have started to drive out of my way to go to this location. The food is amazing at both location!
I always love dlish, I know I can't go wrong - anything on the menu is fantastic and fresh. I typically get a breakfast buzz and a sand which depending on how hungry I am. Great food!

Best thing about this little hole in the wall place is the food.  Those of you driving on Scottsdale Road would most likely miss the location of this restaurant if you're not looking carefully.  So keep an eye out!  My favs are the frittatas and salads.  Yummy and definitely tastes healthy for you.  Plus, the staff are very friendly.  The bonus:  free doggie treats for your canine companion.  Only thing....it's loud in the restaurant area because of all the blenders and barista sounds.  It's kind of challenging to carry on a conversation.  I recommend the outdoor patio seating when the weather's cool.    And...the drive through is not really a typical drive through experience.  Expect to wait approximately 10 minutes for your order while you're waiting in your vehicle (because of course, they are making your meal from scratch).  It may be faster to just park and order take out inside the restaurant.

I freaking love this place. The food is always awesome, love the buzz, the staff is always hilarious. They can blare all kinds of reggae music, hell even country ( and I hate country quite a bit) and I'd still be there pretty much everyday. I do wish that they would be open later  so after work I could get dinner lol.
Just had a meeting here and it was great. Nice big cup of tea and a great environment. Too early for food but I'll definitely be back to try it out!

I came in for a quick snack not during peak hours (10am). I ordered the Oatmeal to go. The place wasn't that busy at all. But it took 20 minutes for just the oatmeal to come out. When it finally did, the milk was cold and the fruits in it was not fresh at all. This was my third time coming here, each time the experience gets worse. Not a fan.

My girlfriend and I had spent the previous four days hiking around Arizona and we were looking for something fast, healthy, and relatively inexpensive.  We found all three in D'Lite!  She loved her California Club and I devoured my black bean and quinoa burger.  My girlfriend wishes we had a place like this back in Cleveland as she would certainly be a regular.  We also thoroughly enjoyed the decor inside the restaurant!

NOM. NOMNOM. Let me eat this delicious fuhd forever and always!  Specifically, let me eat the quinoa burger all day err day. There's something about the cool cucumber sauce or the tangy pesto or the gooey melty sticky cheese and thick juicy tomato and can you see me drooling through your computer screen yet?   I am a vegetarian. Yes. So, the options at this lovely little restaurant fit my moral standards and they did so deliciously. On top of that, the staff is so friendly. They hand out free smoothie samples regularly, all of which are quite scrumptious. I will never turn down a free smoothie sample. Ever.   The only bummer was that at around one in the afternoon one lunch date awhile ago they had ran out of kombucha to pair with my quinoa burger. That was probably the only time that unfortunate drought had happened to me, though. It was quickly forgotten after a free smoothie sample was placed in my palm. Thirst: quenched. Stomach: filled. Wallet: thick. Stars: five.   Eat at D'lish, just don't drink all of my kombucha.

Loved this place! Cool little place with very cool vibe and food. Wish they had one on the north west side of town. Will be back as I pass this way from time to time. Oh, and the iced tea was amazing as well.

d'lish is for sure the perfect name for this little place. When you walk in, the atmosphere is great, what with the snazzy furniture, friendly staff, and the plenty of customers in line, eager for the fresh food they serve up. Their menu is expansive and you might feel overwhelmed by all the breakfasts, soups, salads, wraps, sandwiches, are you feeling overwhelmed as I talk about all the choices that will overwhelm you?! Last time I went there, I ordered the nuts n' berries salad, the perfect toss of greens, blueberries, goat cheese, candied walnuts, and a raspberry walnut vinaigrette. It's perfect! I've also had their butternut squash soup, YUM! I try to try something different all the places I eat, and at D'lish, it'll be a while till I run out of new options. Go here!!

Grabbing a breakfast buzz and a sandwich before work! Fantastic pick me up and a great way to start the day! Best healthy food in the valley by far and one of my all time favorite spots in the valley!

First time to D'lish and I must say I am impressed.  The drive-thru may have a line, but they do their best to get people through as fast as possible.  I had the Veggie Burrito.  It's probably the best I have ever had...delicious Portabella mushrooms and perfect egg whites and potatoes.  The salsa is great, the people are friendly....I will definitely eat there again (and again).

California club : bomb. Turkey club : good. Regular side salad : okay. Protein burger early bird style : eh...too spicy but probably to hide the fact that the quinoa black bean party is extremely bland and dry. Green tea and breakfast buzz were delicious too.
