Quaint spot, very small, has a drive through but you should dine in or you'll be in line forever. People are saying it's one dollar sign but I think it's on the expensive side...maybe for the type of food it might be one dollar...or considering it's Scottsdale it's pretty cheap lol.
D'lish is my favorite morning breakfast spot! The California and breakfast club are awesome. They also have a really good protein shake to make the morning count!

I frequent this location very regularly as i love the healthy option on the go. Food is great, smoothies are awesome, people are nice enough, but the drive thru is 1 star speed. Even for a small smoothie and being the lone car in the drive thru, on average, takes 10-15 minutes. Longest wait has been up to 20 minutes with only a couple cars in line. I don't know if it's a lack or urgency with the employees or a lack of staffing, but it hasn't gotten better in about a year and possibly getting worse it feels lately.

I love coming to D'lite, I know the food is always freshly made. I highly recommend trying the 'man' salad if you have never ordered their food it's one of my favorites as well as the turkey club **but as a wrap instead of sandwich! It's a little disappointing they close at 4 pm. Oh, and just a heads up, the parking lot and drive through can be a little overwhelming because it is a very tiny location but the food is delicious.

Stopped by before a baseball game--- very busy parking lot and drive thru. Decided to park and try our luck inside...and we got our sandwiches pretty fast. Tried the tomato turkey wrap and the chicken panini. Both were very delicious... Full of fresh ingredients and tastiness. Perfect for a healthy lunch. Also, the service was friendly even though it was crazy busy.

Clean, healthy, vegan, vegetarian with high quality meat and dairy selections. Breakfast croissant was out of this world. All the items I have purchased, so far, have intense and delicious flavor, and are amazingly tasty for being so healthy. WOW. Love this place.
The coffee was similar in quality to Starbucks and a better value.

Stumbled upon D'lish whilst looking for a different breakfast alternative and was very happy with the discovery.  Food is top notch, creative, and right in the range of what you should expect for good quality breakfast food.  Thumbs up on the service.  Biggest knocks against the place is the ambiance.  Overly loud, somewhat unpleasant club music not conducive to a sunday morning breakfast that did nothing to conceal the very loud shake/ice grinding machine.    Definitely check the place out but after ordering find a table outside.

I am here every week, sometimes multiple times, and a Breakfast Buzz is where it's at! That is my go-to order, and the chocolate-espresso-banana-peanut butter-protein shake is a little taste of heaven. They have punch cards for drinks, and the staff is AMAZING. They know me by name and always take a minute to ask how I am. I love this place so much I'm going to make them Christmas cookies.
Got the breakfast shake and egg white sandwich. Healthy, fast and delicious. Will definitely be back!

They now have a baby buzz (16 oz) and a thug buzz (24 oz) It's great they have more options!     The oatmeal our way with almond milk is a perfect nourishing breakfast.  You can get their breakfast burrito enchilada style. It's a large burrito so you could definitely split between two.  The California Club is always fresh and a must try if you like avocado.

Stumbled upon this place while getting some gas and I  have to tell you that I couldn't have been happier. This place has top notch everything. Super tasty sandwiches! Will definitely be coming back. Great quality and a really cute set up. I got the California breakfast sandwich and it was to die for.
The signature tuna sandwich served hot is the best tuna I've ever had. The atmosphere is very relaxed, and the prices are very reasonable for such delicious food.
I travel 30+ weeks a year; hands down the best breakfast sandwich I've had in years! Coffee pretty darn good too. Try 'me out fer sure

What can I say...the best healthy fast food in the world. A few of my favorites are the veggie burrito, green lemonade, & the vegan breakfast buzz. I'm addicted & my experiences have been seamlessly amazing! I miss decly though!
Fabulous place for quality, whole/healthy breakfast and lunch.  Love their healthy, all-natural protein shakes and fruit/veggie smoothies, too.

This was my first time at a D'Lite and I thought my breakfast was delicious. I ordered the Low Carb Breakfast and a large iced coffee with almond milk. My meal came out quick. I think I waited at the most 10 minutes. I like a lot of almond milk in my coffee so after taking a few sips to make room I asked for a top off of almond milk and the lady kindly obliged. Another employee came over to clean off the dirty napkins and straw wrappers on our table. I'll be back!!
Awesome friendly staff and great healthy d'elicious food. Was looking for a breakfast spot perfect for brunch on the weekend

Love this place.  No seriously, LOVE!  California club breakfast sandwich = the best thing I've put in my mouth first thing in the morning in a long time.  The house style frittata is unbelievably amazing as well.  Package it all in a cute, small, quaint, local establishment with a drive thru as well and it's a score.

Love this place! Love the california club and breakfast wrap!! The staff is very friendly and helpful. Best ice tea & iced coffee! If you've never been to D'lish you have got to try it or your really missing out!

This place is incredible! I love the food, and it's always super fast and convenient. Rating it a 4/5 because the choices of condiments is super slim pickings (no ketchup) , and the menu isn't always customizable.  Also, they don't split checks through the drive trough. I find this odd

3 Star! Friendly staff, fast service, we both got the California club. They were good but totally overpriced. $8+ taxes for each. It was good enough, but on the smaller side, never something I'd crave, or pay that much for a breakfast sandwich again. The pictures make it look extremely delicious, and it was just.. good? Not fantastic for the price though  I'm also not a huge fan of the process through the drive thru. They run your card and you sign for it, but like at a restaurant, they have a spot for a tip. I don't tip for Taco Bell, why is this different lol?  It's the exact same process as any other drive thru.. no special treatment. Taco Bell employees don't accept tips. The one who was handling check out (sweet young girl) was also hovering over us as he filled it out which makes us feel obligated to then tip on top of the overpriced breakfast sandwich.. meh. If I want to throw a couple dollars in cash, great! Don't like feeling obligated when speaking 3 words total to someone. It's a drive thru, not a full service restaurant.. sorry

I love this concept:  healthy breakfast/brunch/lunch on-the-go.  I tried D'lish this morning for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised.  I wasn't expecting much from a drive-through establishment but they delivered a hot, yummy breakfast, coupled with a chai latte that was probably the best I've had to date!  Don't go expecting the speed of fast food drive-through.  You will wait a bit but it's worth it because the food is that much better.  I tried the breakfast burrito with chicken sausage, wrapped in a warm whole wheat tortilla.  I enjoyed it.  What makes me happy is that there are several other breakfast and lunch items that look appealing to me so I know a repeat visit is in my future.

Amazing, tasty, healthy, filling food. My husband and I came here routinely for weekend brunch. His favorite was the California club, mine was the early bird protein burger (black bean and quinoa). Parking can be a pain, seating can be limited, and their tiny restroom is accessible outside on the backside of their kitchen... Kinda like a gas station. All that being said, totally worth it.
I read some reviews that complained about how long they waited for their food. I always call in my order. They're friendly servers have it ready when I get there. The Tuna sandwich is very good.

I will travel across town to get decent food which is almost impossible to find. This D'Lish opened up right near our home and I ignored it for months until my wife tried it and told me it was good. Well, one day I tried it and I have been eating there nearly every day since. I emailed all my friends about it and emailed the owner to tell them how great their food was and how lucky we were that it opened up right down the street from our house. I have had their tuna sandwich 4 days in a row. It is by far and hands won the best tuna sandwich in the universe! You have not had a tuna sandwich until you get one from D'Lish!  Everything that I have tried from the menu has been excellent.   One reviewer wrote "I probably eat here once a week. It is my dream to one day try everything on the menu. Unfortunately, I can't stop eating that damn tuna sandwich"  I did the exact same thing. When I first went in  I said that I would go right down the menu and try everything. But that tuna sandwich is heaven and I can't' resist it every time I go there.

So this is the 2nd time I've been here. It's fast-causal, a little more pricey than Chipotle, but overall worth it if you want a clean, light, and filling meal.   The first time I ordered, I got the hummus plate: raw vegetables, hummus, and a delicious pita bread. The hummus' flavor was toned down (bland if you're a Debbie downer lol) than other hummus I've had but it was still good. What throws me off is a broccoli+hummus combo. That's probably a thing, but you'd think they'd serve blanched broccoli and not raw. Maybe I'm wrong. Idunno.  The second time was better. Veggie bowl, mostly consisting of quinoa, with a little bit of tomatoes and mushrooms. Flip-Flopping delicious. I'd eat it over and over again. Yet, again, raw broccoli... As a dominant veggie. lolwat.   Now, I do like raw broccoli but I eat that plant by itself or with ranch/blue cheese dressing. Everything else, I'd eat it cooked. Tell me I'm picky, tell me that I'm raw broccoli hater, tell me I'm weird. Just don't tell me you'd have raw broccoli in your cooked quinoa because Ima tell you you're weird too.

Solid food. Friendly staff which is a plus. Most frequent visitors know that parking is a major struggle as well as the drive thru line. I live near by and often there is a line flowing out into Scottsdale Rd.

I first learned of this 'hole in the wall' fabulous gem when I was taken by the hand there by a former love last winter.  I hadn't been back until a few weeks ago and I am still in love with the YUMMY YUM YUM YUM food and smoothies they whip up.    While dining there they make me feel like a Goddess and will act as your 'date' if you go in solo or with another girlfriend.  It doesn't hurt to have amazing company and laughter while you dive into your California Club and inhale your Breakfast Buzz!  The oatmeal is something amazing and everything is simply tasty!  The price is nice and is someplace I would take the snobbiest "Scottsdalelight" for a pleasant surprise and an amazing meal.  The portions are sharable if you are watching your wallet or waistline!

My newest addiction here is the oatmeal. It is made with quinoa, which sounds a little odd. Don't knock it until you try it, you won't regret it! Have I mentioned how awesome the staff here is too?! This is my favorite places to go when I first wake up. A day that starts at D'lish is guaranteed to be a perfect one.
Excellent food. California club can be eaten for breakfast or lunch!  Drive thru line can be long, but there is about 8 small tables inside.

The only thing that isn't awesome about this place is the parking lot...when there are folks in the drive-thru, there usually no way to get around that line of cars to park, so you just wait.  Oh, and the interior seat cushions are a bit worn (being nitpicky now).  The food is delish (or d'lish, I suppose?), healthy, and somewhat creative.  Definitely NOT your typical drive-thru fair.  I've tried a few different things (wraps, cold sandwiches, hot sandwiches) and I always keep coming back to the California Club (no bacon please!) for breakfast and lunch.  It's impressive they are able to offer many organic and.or local ingredients for similar pricing to say, Subway.  Depending on who is at the checkout, the service isn't always with a smile, but at least it's pretty quick.  And for a sandwich this good, I'm totally fine with that!

This is a very unique place in my mind. Def hipster and casual dining. Great stop after a workout. It combines heathy eats with a "fast food" concept. I love that I can make healthy eating choices on the go by using their drive-thru! I will say that their drive through is typically slammed to the point where no one can pull in to wait in line or park to go inside. Parking is also very limited and poorly designated so much so that there have been many times I have parked to run in to get food and when I came back out I've had to wait 5-10minutes just to get out of the parking lot. Obviously, the food here is AMAZING and well priced otherwise I would never waste my time going here but I had to give it only 3 stars because it can be VERY time consuming depending on when you choose to go. They have very limited seating both inside and outside. They are known for their "Breakfast Buzz" which is a protein shake and happens to be what I order every time I visit. They also offer a "Vegan" option when making this shake that is also D'lish! They have a good selections of healthy food options, the service is quick once you have placed your order and the staff is SUPER friendly and deserve an A+!    If you are looking for a healthy menu and you are NOT in a rush then this is the place for you!
Food was ok, but nuked to crazy hot temps. Props for the non-disposable plates if you eat there. Minus for the parking lot that's impossible to get out of if there's a line in the drive-thru.
The breakfast club sandwich here was great and then to top it off their house shake with chocolate, peanut butter, and espresso was addictive!

I love this place, always good food, good service and did I mention the good food...  They recently raised their prices and were courteous enough to post a letter on the door. They are worth every penny
Amazing food and even better customer service. Line is always long and it's obvious why. You get quality food that's unique and service that is personable. Can't get enough
I love this place, we eat here at least twice a week and it's always great!  The service is always friendly and attentive, the food is always delicious and they have the best Iced green tea in town.

I love the new D'lish restaurant in Tempe.  I've been to the Scottsdale location before and was pleasantly surprised by the new location.  It is larger, more open and very well-designed.  I had an iced green tea and the 'man' salad, which was a tuna stuffed avocado on top of a salad already loaded with chicken, bacon, feta and a side of cucumber blue cheese dressing.  I must say, this salad is both amazing and very filling. There were some familiar faces from the Scottsdale location working and everyone was very upbeat and friendly.  If you're in the ASU area, I would definitely recommend checking it out for breakfast or lunch.

I've only had the breakfast buzz here but it's all I need. I seriously replaced my usual Starbucks or Dutch Bros run for this. Espresso doesn't do anything for me, but at least this isn't empty sugar and calories.
Great food! Great friendly service! I love fresh healthy choices... This establishment would do well in the good parts of LA and I for one, would like a piece of the action!

Absolutely Love this place, it gives you the local business vibe, along with healthy eating options. The drive thru is the biggest seller for me.  I love the breakfast buzz nothing starts my day of better than espresso in my protein shake.
Always love this place. Convenient and good ingredients. Not trashy fast food but guilt free healthy and prompt!

The Breakfast Buzz.....THE Breakfast buzz. Oh my goodness I think this place could get 5 stars just for this amazing morning "smoothie" drink. It tastes like heaven on earth, I'm not exaggerating. Also had one of their California breakfast clubs and it was d'lish as well! I plan on moving to the area soon and I already know this will be one of my go-to breakfast destinations! They also highlight their use of local and organic ingredients whenever possible AND they have a drive-through. We need more places like D'lish across the nation..or at least 10 more locations in the Phoenix metro area to start!

Believe the hype.  Just moved to this part of town recently and am now frequenting this place whenever I can (since they close at 4pm).  The fact that I can get amazing, fresh, natural, often organic and local food, in a drive thru is awesome.  This place is very small but it doesn't matter because it's all good and usually pretty quick (considering what you get).  I even ordered soup when it was 105 degrees just because i wanted to try everything!  And I don't mind paying extra cuz it's always fresh, delicious and they're friendly (and cute) so why not.  You probably drive by it all the time and don't even notice it, but you're missing out.  Can't wait to try their dinner entrees (even though they close at 4pm) they also have a lot of breakfast stuff and smoothies and coffees too.
Love this place! Dirty Chai and Kitchen Sink salad are both a must!

More expensive than I would like.   I have been here twice now, both times choosing their Breakfast Buzz protein shake with an extra scoop of protein powder. It's a good post-workout treat. It also is about $1.50 more than the sweet price-point where I'd show up multiple times a week to buy one.   Nice staff, they all seem positive and quick.

If I visit Tempe again and need to grab a quick and healthy bite to eat, I will def swing by D'lish again. This cute little local eatery reminds me of what I can find in Austin. I ordered the turkey club, and it was stuffed with healthy and fresh ingredients. The place is clean and the staff is friendly.
I've been going to their restaurants since they opened and were called delish excellent Food Service and employees are great.
I was visiting from San Diego and really enjoyed this place! I ordered the turkey club and it was superb

Love this place, fast but healthy. Not much catering towards keto/Whole 30... there's lots of grain offered. But they can be quite accommodating. Biggest drawback- patio sitting. You can listen to Shea or obnoxious hiphop at McFates next door. And...it smells like gas oven farts inside.  But the food, the service; A++!!
Pretty quick and good.  Tried D'lish for breakfast and was impressed.  Nice service and good menu.
I recommend the California Breakfast Club and d'buzz shake!  took my mom and sister here who are both picky and they both loved it as well! Quick, clean, and delicious food.
Great service, great food, great environment. Very excited about having a healthy and reasonably priced "fast food" restaurant on this side of town
YUM! This place is a little gem I stumbled upon not too long ago. Their name says it all. I could say more, but there's no need. If you're near by, check it out. If not, it's worth the drive.
Are you serious? !! First time here visiting from Cali and they don't have ketchup?? -___- disappointed
Get this delicious food to go u less you enjoy eating a deliciously delicate breakfast sandwich amidst a cacophony of whirls, beats and operational mechanics.
Nice little place for lunch or breakfast. But no restrooms? Really?  How are you supposed to wash your hands?

My first thought when I came here was, I hope the food is worth the wait. And It was.  My fellow yelpers never do me wrong, so I had to go with the California Club and Breakfast Buzz.  Both lived up to the numerous good reviews.  I just loved the Breakfast Buzz's hint of peanut butter flavor. I am pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food considering they have a drive through.  This place is most definitely not your typical fast food restaurant.  If you have not come here yet, give it a try you won't be disappointed.

I usually never write reviews but I had to because the food was so yummy. Last minute decision to try this new place and it's my go to place for breakfast now. I love that it's a drive thru especially when you have a toddler. The food was fresh and delicious! I ordered the California signature breakfast sandwich  and it was amazing! I will be back soon!!

This place was busy on a Monday morning. The dine-in experience was clean and prompt. Only complaint is the noise of the coffee grinders made conversation hard.  The food and drink was very good. Fresh and hip. Good options for alternative diets. I have both a vegan and a paleo eater in the family who would be happy with the options.  Drive thru looked very slow, but inside was great!

The vegan buzz is so good, breakfast and coffee all in one. It is a bit too sweet to have often and expensive, but it's great in a pinch. Everyone is friendly and while the wait is long they seem to be working hard.

Everytime I pull up to D'Lish I seriously have cartoon hearts popping out of my chest.  I have loved every single thing I've eaten here. Breakfast go to is a Frittata - perfectly done. Split a hummus if you're grabbing lunch with friends. My new favorite dish is the Southwest Bowl - Basmati Rice and Enchilada Sauce together as one? Yes, Please! The staff here is phenomenal..always feel welcome! I prefer to call ahead and you're in and out in a flash.
This place is extremely convient and comfortable. I love that they have vegan options that are extremely delishious.  A must try if you are in the area!
The California Club was bomb. We went through the drive through, and although there was a line several cars long we only waited 10 minutes. The four berry smoothie was also "d'lish."

Great breakfast place. When on Scottsdale road, be vigilant you could drive by without noticing it... Very friendly service. Healthy, tasty food. I ordered the low carb breakfast. It was excellent. At 9am the walk-in customers are in majority people who have just finished their morning sport. Lively music competes with the noise of the blenders. Judging by the length of the line of cars in the drive thru (that never decreased while I was eating), they are very popular. Good dynamic breakfast atmosphere.

Ordered the breakfast burrito and a hot coffee and both were quite tasty.. Decent prices and they are pretty fast.   The inside is small, but they do have outdoor seating.  If I am ever passing by again, I will definitely stop there again.

Yummy!  And great service.  Had lunch with my parents who had to sit and wait for us. But the staff took great care of them. And when we showed up they took great care of us too. We all has the California Club.  It's obvious why it's the most ordered item. It's terrific. They made mine gluten free by putting it in a bowl on top of a potato cake. D'Lish!!  That's your first tip. - if you're GF, try it that way.    Your second tip has two parts: it's a drive thru so drive through!  They're really fast and organized. You won't wait long. But if you feel like sitting down keep in mind there's not a lot of seating so don't hit them at the prime time. Go 15 minutes before or after noon, for example.   But go. You won't be disappointed.

I love Dlish, it is one of my favorite healthy spots to eat. So grateful to have healthy and delicious restaurants like this, with also super amazing and friendly staff. Thanks Dlish, and keep up the amazing work!!!

The drive through was super busy, yet they got in my order quick and the food came out great. I had the breakfast buzz and the Cali club always fantastic. My date ordered the nuts and berries salad after she got in her low brow jokes about nuts and berries she looked at me smiling and said this is all she ever wanted.

Love this place! The breakfast buzz drinks are the most amazing coffee/protein drink. Even have the buzz drink for vegans(no dairy). Food is a little pricey but sooooo worth it! Wish they had one in Ahwatukee

The oatmeal was unique and very good. I also thought the Breakfast Buzz was great.  It is a cool experience that is well worth the trip.  I get so tired of the same old food choices and this is just different.  I like different and am glad I stumbled across D'lish.

This was our first time at this location and the service was stellar!!! They had plenty of staff and each and every employee was extremely accommodating. They came by our table several times to check on us. Great place to go for good food if you want to feel like your patronage is appreciated! Be prepared to feel great from the moment you walk through the door to the time you leave. :)))

D'lish would be a perfect start to any type of day, whether it's action-filled days of snowboarding, inaction-filled days of laying by a pool and reading... or even, for the approx 90% of working-aged Americans who are sauntering, driving, running, biking, whatnot off to work.   My New Year's Eve day was perfectly (obsessively) planned, and I wanted to make the most of it. So it was with slight trepidation that I decided on D'lish to start out my day. And... it was perfect!  Perfectly hot/warm burritos filled with perfectly fluffy eggs and potatoes and savory meat to fill me perfectly full, at a price point that did not mar the perfection.  5 yums up!
I am all about healthy food and this place is so convenient for a guilt free bite! The pesto chicken wrap is my favorite.. I have yet to try the breakfast but the menu looks delish.

D'lish is a GREAT breakfast and lunch spot in Tempe. Thus far I have had the Turkey Club and Kitchen Sink salad. All ingredients are fresh, healthy, and made to order, and I've been very happy with my meals! And what would a coffee shop be without great coffee? NOM. Very delicious coffee. I like that there is inside seating, a patio, and a drive thru. My classes are at the law school in Tempe and I can zip over there in between classes to grab a bite. Not to mention that the staff is SUPER and super nice. Very happy that D'lish opened a tempe location!
Great find for healthy fast food. Tried the croissant sandwich and a good cup of joe.

Love this place for fast and delicious healthy food. My favorite is the early bird burger. The tuna is really good and so is d'veggie bowl. Any breakfast option is solid. Staff is always super friendly :)

D'lish's California Club is the best breakfast sandwich I've ever eaten PERIOD! They usually put it on focaccia bread, but I think it's much better on sourdough (grilled, of course!). It's just the most exquisite combination of lightly fried eggs, smoked bacon, fresh avocado, tomato, sweet cream and pesto that will send you to heaven! WORTH the wait! Their coffee is very satisfying and the staff couldn't be friendlier. Truly one of Arizona's food gems.

Stopped by D'Lite the other day, as I heard they had a drive thru and I wanted a post-workout smoothie. I pulled up to the drive thru menu and saw just a handful of smoothie options. I open for the berry one, and asked if I could have it made with protein. I asked her which one she recommended for my berry smoothie, and went with her choice. I ended up paying about $6 for a small smoothie that was not blended well. The protein powder was overwhelming, and had I realized it wasn't going to blend well it would have been nice if either it was properly blended or the woman working there had made a better suggestion. I drank 2 sips and ended up throwing it away. Bummer!
cali club and a buzz = pure bliss any time of day. just wish they were open 24hrs!

You wouldn't think much of D'lish from its unassuming exterior.  It almost looks like a fast food or burger joint from the outside.  Upon closer inspection, however, it is a brightly lit, quaint restaurant both inside and out.  And although D'lish isn't a full service restaurant, the staff is helpful and adds to the cheery feel of the establishment.  The food, simply put, is d'lish.  It is simple and healthy.  I just had the Traditional Breakfast Burrito.  Even though there is nothing complex about the ingredients, it is great.  The eggs are nice and fluffy, and the potatoes are just slightly crispy, just the way I like them.  The only thing is that it can get just a little dry since so much egg is packed into there, so some salsa definitely helps.  I also had the Breakfast Buzz Shake, which was quite good as well.  It's infused with so much stuff that it's hard to describe.  "Rich" would be one word to call it.  It is a bit pricey, but with all the vitamins, protein, and other stuff they put in it, I suppose it is worth it, making a good start to a hot day.  Overall, I am quite happy with my experience at D'lish.  I love the idea of fast but healthy.  It's a great place to pick up breakfast before heading off to, oh I don't know, the Grand Canyon maybe.
Yeah I was addictd to the breakfast buzz for a month straight , actually still getting 2-3 a week. The California club is good, the man salad with tuna is a favorite.    5 star !

I love D'lish- my favorite things are the breakfast buzz and the breakfast quinoa. My only complaint is the drive thru at this location. It's enough to make me need to call in an emergency bottle of Xanax. It's super narrow and people are always trying to squeeze through. Maybe I'm a hyper freak but it was terrifying. This is also the reason that I've never dined in at this location- wasn't sure if I could risk my life even though the breakfast buzz is so unbelievably good.
I had the California Club breakfast sandwich!  It was amazing!  Although it was small venue the food was great. Just wished they had more seating and glad I rode my bike there - limited parking.

I REALLY wanted to love this place...but it did not go well.  I never noticed this restaurant although it is right next door to my favorite burrito spot (Super Burrito).  When I arrived they were plenty of people pulling into the drive thru.  Since I couldn't figure out what to order, I went inside.  The staff was cordial.  I decided to keep it simple and ordered a traditional burrito.  I was so excited!  I got home and bit into it and "crunch"!  I tried again..more crunch!  Broken egg shells in my burrito!   Needless to say I lost my appetite.  I called to let them know I was bringing the burrito back and no I didn't want anything else (they offered).  Although they were very apologetic, I'm just not sure I can bring myself back to trying something else.  D'lish was a D'isappointment :(  Maybe I'll give the new Tempe location a try *sigh*.

4 stars for the food and the extra star is for the customer service. Pulled in this morning when it was still dark. Mind you this is a drive-thru health food/coffee spot. Roughly 6:15, 6:30 AM. A guy was in there already with a smile on. Hard to find at that hour. I ordered a quad espresso with cream and the low carb breakfast. After he punched in the order I pulled kind of a d*ck move and asked for an extra egg. Told him he could charge me. He said no problem and told the cook to add the egg. Didn't charge any extra at all. Bonus! He had me test the espresso to make sure it was to my liking. It was fresh and strong. Cream was perfect.   Now the food. 3 perfectly cooked tender eggs on a bed of mixed greens with a pesto dressing. 3 tomato slices and 4 avocado slices. Also a thin hash patty. Everything was cooked perfectly and you could tell everything was very fresh. No weird tomatoes, no brown avocado. Everything was just right, even such an ungodly hour. The only recommendation I can make it put the hash patty on the side or on top so that some of the crispness would maintain. Other than that you can't get better service and quality and that early in the morning to boot. Highly recommend. I will be back for a lunch sometime.  PS I tipped him a few extra bucks before I pulled away. Well worth it.

I love this place! D'lish is conveniently on my way to work and I love the staff there. I tried this place for the first time about a week ago and there was a pretty solid line through the drive thru. I was extremely impressed with the friendliness and efficiency of the people who work there.   They have an extensive menu and I am sure many people (like myself) order food as well as a beverage when they go through the drive thru. For their location this can cause a bit of a squeeze as the line starts to get longer and longer and as does the wait time. But fear not!! A lovely D'lish employee walks outside, takes your order and payment, and BAM. Next thing you know, you have your delicious coffee and you are on your way! Don't fear the line. Seriously, you'll be taken care of.  As far as food goes, I've only tried the egg and cheese sandwich and it was a delicious breakfast indeed. Next adventure? the oatmeal. Enjoy my friends, and get your D'lish ON.

The BREAKFAST BUZZ!!!!!! OMG!!!!!!!!!  I wish that I could have one of these everyday!  It is a patent-pending protein drink with espresso, chocolate, protein powder, banana, peanut butter, milk, vitamins and I think that is it! My friend introduced this to me and I do not even like coffee, but this drink is F'in Fantastic!  I love the vibe here...everything is fresh here!  I also tried their hummus plate with chicken and it was like the best hummus I had ever had!  It has some fresh veggies with it and a flat bread.  The Berries and Nuts salad is awesome too!!  The inside is cute! They have a drive thru if you are in a huge hurry!

This really deserves a 5 for the food and exterior of this building.  However the 3 rating is for the poor service I have received the last 3 times.  So, I called in a phone order and arrived to pick it up in the drive thru and waited 10 min.  Not sure what was holding up the joint, but made me late for work !!!!  no one came out to take orders and the line was wrapped around the building.     Then I get to the window.... and a snotty little girl standing there taking money and giving orders.   No smile and showed a horrible attitude.   I will not be back for awhile.  Your tempe location workers are worse.

I've never had something from D'lish that I didn't like. The chicken panini and breakfast club are two of my favorites. Dirty chai vanilla latte rocks my socks. The only bad thing I could say about this place is sometimes the wait kind of sucks, but for the delicious food and drinks it's worth it!

Really good breakfast sandwhiches, coffee drinks, and customer service. My only hope is that they come out with flavored cream cheeses down the road. Love that their food is healthier than your typical fast food as well.

Interesting little place.  Seems more suited to the drive thru crowd but they do have a small dining area inside and a little patio too.  We were staying down the street at the Four Points Sheraton and needed some breakfast so we took a quick walk down here.  We weren't really sure what to expect and were pleasantly surprised.  I ordered the egg and cheese sandwich with chicken sausage and it was tasty and filling!  I also tried the cactus fruit iced tea and it was great.  My friend had the croissant sandwich with pesto and it looked good too.  Wish there were more of these places around.

This little place is great (emphasis on LITTLE). This place is always packed for good reason but the wait to park or get through the drive thru takes a bit away from the appeal of a quick and healthy meal. That being said the speed is only slowed by the traffic. The food and drink are always ready promptly. The food is awesome and they are friendly to those with special diets. My top picks are the Breakfast Buzz, butternut squash soup, and California club. They have a soup and salad combo that hits the spot! Those are my top three but everything I've tried is very good and they have a patio that is doggy friendly.   The only other thing I might add is that this isn't the cheapest place but it's definitely worth it.

I just had my first -- and certainly not last -- meal from D'lish!  My food was packed with flavor and delicous fresh ingredients.  The service was super friendly and fast, too.  I can't wait to try more from their yummy-looking menu!
Was eating my AZ burro that I love so much and a black hair started to pull out of it  I'm so sad right now not even mad. Put ya damn hair in a net or something next time.
the breakfast buzz is life!!!!! Price is good service is quick food is yummy. I hope they open more locations.

Went here recently since I was craving a nice breakfast sammie. I went through the drive-thru and the service was fast and easy. In terms of the actual breakfast, I ordered the breakfast club which was ok. The egg and bacon were kind of lukewarm and could've been a little warmer but overall it was a nice breakfast drive thru and definitely felt healthier than the fast-food chains all around town!

One of my regular breakfast spots  This place rules except for the amount of space they have to serve the people coming in. Aside from that the food is good and is consistently quality for the amount of people that come in.. It's hard to find a healthy option and a not healthy option without sacrificing taste. So I get my happy unhealthy option and my girlfriend can have her weird tasting quinoa oatmeal.

Came to Phoenix for vacation, and we got D'lish both of the days we were in the area. Do yourself a favor and order ahead so you don't have to wait in the drive thru, then just pick it up in the store.  I got the California Club both days... absolutely phenomenal! It was so amazing I'm going to try to replicate this recipe at home... it's going to be difficult, but this was best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. My friends got other breakfast items and they raved about it as well, very good joint.

A friend introduced me to this place as a healthy lunch alternative and I was pleasantly surprised. This is a cute little place in a strip mall off Shea with a nice lunch seating area. Since we didn't have a lot of time we decided to just order wraps. I ordered a Humanitarian with chicken and a breakfast buzz (to go). Sometimes wraps end up too dry or too moist depending if there's any kind of additional sauce. While nicely prepared and full of healthy veggies and hummus, I'm not sure if there was enough chicken in it to justify the up charge. As far as the breakfast buzz, be prepared, it's sweet, thick and could be considered a meal in itself. I had a few sips, got a good taste of it and then took the rest home. If you're in the mood for a quick meal, this place fits the bill.

All the salads from here (we tried the nuts and berries and the man salad) were really good. The Veggie bowl is more of a soup and pretty good (we had it to go). I had the veggie wrap and it was the perfect portion for one person. The protein shakes here are HUGEEEEE. I felt like all the good was tasty, well prices, good quality and made you feel good about what you were eating. I would definitely come back again. Great place to eat at before or after a hike. :)
Where have you been all my life? Places like this come by almost... um never. The manager is the funniest person I have ever met. The breakfast buzz is probably not legal. I am in love!

To the very nice lady who was working this morning taking orders on April 26, 2017, after sitting in line and forgetting my wallet last minute, she asked what I wanted (Breakfast Buzz), she said to not worry about it and she put it on the house. So thank you very much for that kind gesture early in the morning, I didn't catch her name!
Awesome little college breakfast nook. Close to campus with unique and delicious options including fresh juices!

Disaster! I guess I don't get the allure of this place, and my biggest complaint...one that tops very average food will probably be scoffed at.  That being said, here we go.  Never, I repeat never, order the breakfast sandwich with no cheese. Apparently, that was the secret ingredient meant to hold the entire average sandwich together.   Imagine my shock opening this puppy to have it explode all over my car when pulling out of their drive thru. Thousands of pieces of sandwich over the car...not my belly, where an $8 breakfast sandwich belongs.  Cheese. It's what the Knights Templar smuggled to America to mend average sandwiches together.
Loved that I could get "breakfast" for lunch.  Great healthy food.  The staff was super friendly.  Got to sit outside ons sunny day.  And, it was not expensive and quick.  I will be back!

I have been to Dlish quite a few times but always waited in the drive thru which is this place's only downfall, my wife and I actually parked and ate out on the patio today. %100 better, the food was on point! Had the az burro enchilada style. Golf clap for the food, thumbs down for the size of the place. They lose a lot of buisness over people driving up and seeing the line out to scottsdale rd.

I love stopping here for a quick bite to eat during lunch or breakfast. The traditional burrito is really good. Has the perfect egg to potatoes ratio. Last time I had lunch here I had the chicken pannini with pesto and sour dough bread. Arnold Palmers are the best here too!
After our last visit being disappointing, the owner contacted me and offered to make things right. Another example of why I feel this place is so great! (Besides their delish food!!)
Glad this exists. It is kinda expensive actually. I spent 15 bucks for a bowl and a drink. It was decently tasty. Wonder if it was really that healthy. Give me Native Foods over this any day.

Let me start with the fact that this place really does have excellent food. Two two meals that my friend and I ordered were delicious. It was served quickly and the food was prepared just then and still super hot. The customer service was great too. Unfortunately, the place is very, very small and there is no way to escape the door or the noisy blender. I was looking to sit down and have a nice conversation with my girlfriend but we were constantly interrupted by the loud blender and we were freezing so we had to leave. I'd recommend this place if you're looking at picking up food and leave.
We were waiting for the poke place to open up and stumbled across this little place. I got the cactus blossom tea which was good. I liked how it was unsweetened.
What can I say? Wow!! Obsessed with the buzz and the California Club sandwich!! No wonder the lines are always out the door.

This little gem has the best breakfast croissant I have ever eaten!!! Superb! The chai tea latte and orange glorious are also great!    There's limited seating inside and some outdoor seating, but when in a pinch, there's always drive-thru!

OMG! The house farmhouse frittata is D'lish for sure!!! My taste buds fell in lust at first taste. Food Porn in FULL EFFECT! ...plus to really indulge in naughtiness I ordered my Dirty Chai EXTRA EXTRA DIRTY! y u u u m

You want healthy drive thru food that is not grease & packed with a 1,000 calories. Then this is the place! It is a diamond in the rough. I LOVE the Breakfast Buzz! Their wraps are awesome! Everything is great!!
yummy !  nom noms :-))  every time I've been here, it's been delicious ;p   and any out-of-town family & friends have liked it, too

D'lish.. it is absolutely Delish!  The food is fresh and tasty!  The location is in a good spot, right before you hit the main part of Scottsdale.  It has a DRIVE THRU!!  Brilliant idea!  The seating inside is tiny, which makes it difficult to sit down and have lunch with a friend.  There are no heaters outside, so if it's a cold Arizona day and there are no spots inside, you're out of luck.    The morning buzz with almond milk was absolutely delicious!  My friend had the California club and it was warm, fresh and absolutely delicious!  I will definitely come here again for breakfast or lunch and use the drive thru!

This is definitely a great place to go! I usually stop by when I want light, healthier food but they do have more filling options forsure! The food selection is definitely vegetarian friendly which is amazing! They have a broad selection of food as well as beverages from protein shakes to coffees and teas! I feel like the wait is never too long especially for the quality of food I'm getting! The staff is always kind and gets my order right every time! I love that they're expanding and making new locations too!

Great spot! Was leaving town in the a.m. by car, passing through from Los Angeles. Googled a healthy spot in Scottsdale. D'Lite popped up and was perfect. Under $10 for a burrito. Healthy. Fast. Fresh.   Love the drive-thru! Thank you for caring about human's health in this fast paced life.

My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try out this place for a while and finally got a chance to stop by. The food was mediocre but overpriced and the portions were small, pre-made eggs and such. There was trash overflowing, on tables, and all over the floor. Dead plants and open peanut butter containers sitting out for the MANY flies to get to. The service was bad. The man working was on his cell phone yelling about having money stolen from him and spent the rest of the time looking at motorcycles online.   I used the bathroom, which has no air conditioning and no working faucet. I got a glimpse of the kitchen and, again, it was worthy of  a cringe.   I was almost unable to eat my sandwich when it came. I was a little worried I'd get food poisoning.   Stay away from this location: bad service, expensive food, and extremely unsanitary.

My first breakfast at D'lish was so good I had to come back a couple days later.  This is one of the best drive-through restaurants ever.  They use flavorful, quality, natural ingredients yet still manage to crank out tasty food very quickly.  Hopefully you don't need to eat in your car, but if you do D'lish is the ticket.  -- Traditional breakfast burrito, $4.75/$6.25 w/ meat: Score!  I have had a lot of breakfast burritos and this ranks up there as one of the best, if not the best, ever.  The chicken sausage was a total winner and the cheese was out of this world.  You might think $6.25 is a little pricey for a breakfast burrito but the ingredients are sooo good that it is totally worth it.  -- House blend smoothie, $4-5: This smoothie ranks up there with anyone else's.  A must get if you want to kick start your day with some blended fruit rather than caffeine.

Really good breakfast sandwiches and burritos very delicious and filling. The coffee is so good good with so many options to customize it to your taste. I loveeeeee that its a drive thru . its time that there was a better breakfast option that's fast and tasty.

Super fun friendly and good.spot for breakfast.  Its hard finding a good quality drive thru. We are always on the go and can't find good places to stop for breakfast and this is perfect. The people here are so positive and the menu is good and fresh and healthy.  The burros and sandwiches are full of flavor they are filling and I'm addicted to the veggie burro. The prices are good and the drinks seem good, I've yet to try them but will. Great spot definitely a fun and delicious spot to grab a quick but real good bite.

Everything here is amazing.  The menu is healthy and extremely creative at the same time.  Faves right now are green lemonade smoothie and traditional breakfast burrito with chicken sausage and chipotle aioli.
Southwest bowl is the bomb! Fresh food. Nice service.  Truly Delish! However, they need more indoor seating space and extended hours.

This was only our first visit but it was so good that I had to give them a five star rating.    We each had the traditional burrito, which they kindly substituted egg whites for the eggs.  The burrito had a thick layer of eggs, along with melted cheese and a layer of potatoes and the tortilla wrap was fresh and warm.  It was so good.  They served salsa along with it and it was such a great addition.  We both ate almost the whole thing and that's saying something because the portion is decent.  I always try to leave a little of whatever but it was hard not to finish each and every little bite of that wrap!  We also each had a decaf Americano and those were fantastic.  Decaf is often so bitter but this was one smooth cup of coffee.    We're returning tomorrow to try something else.  That's the plan now but it's going to be hard not to repeat today's selection.  We'll see.  *Returned the next day and I had the same thing but my husband had the az burro that was similar to the traditional burrito but had smoked turkey, avocado, egg whites, hash patty, tomato & feta, wrapped in a sundried tomato tortilla and he said it was very good.  Mine was as good as the first time I had it.  But next time I think I'll try the oatmeal.  It's made with organic quinoa, vanilla macaroon granola, maple syrup, fruit and steamed milk.  That definitely sounds good!
Sooo GOOD! Looking for a healthy find?? This is your place! Super cute, healthy, and delicious!!

Wanted to love it. I'm always searching for a quick healthy bite. Saw D'lite on my daily commute, Was thrilled to see they have a drive through. As I turned around to give it a go, I began to daydream about an easy morning commute with healthy, quick food. I ordered the "baked" veggie frittata. The only thing baked is the person who swears this is baked. It was nuked. So obviously microwaved!! Spongey and tough. I'd love to know where the veggies were. Was absolutely HORRIBLE and inedible. Took so freaking long to get it too, and I was the only car in the drive through, the inside didn't appear busy. Would have made me late to ask for a refund. So I'll just Yelp my review instead, hoping to save some other poor schmuck their time and money.  Too bad, I would have stopped daily.  The search continues.  ***update from 1 star to 2 because I was contacted after my review posted. Offered a free frittata to make up for my experience. Very impressed. Will update review after I take the manager up on his offer.

Healthy food but I was still a little hungry. Its good that it doesn't weigh you down. Maybe eat one or two of the AZ Burros before a marathon race. Parking can get hairy as the drive thru line goes out to the street blocking thru traffic.

I've been visiting this location a few years and enjoy the food, however have found much of the staff to be snobby. I stopped by over a week ago & tried to do two orders in the drive thru, to which I was explained they can't do. Over a year ago they could so I'm not sure what changed. Understanding however, my friend and I went inside, where the same person was running both the register. To describe her, hispanic dark haired with some sort of octopus tattoo on her arms. When I asked for my food to go she snarked "it already is to-go because we close in 30minutes" then was unable to make me a latte for the same reason... they won't make any fresh espresso 30 minutes before close. Apparently couldn't make a dirty chai either, by the lack of chai mix in whatever-they-served-my-friend. The cashier made it clear she didn't want to have to take any time past the 2:30pm summer closing hour to clean the establishment by her remarks. I will probably come back for a healthy bite on the go, but y'all certainly need to step up your customer service.

D'Lish has been a personal favorite for over a year now. I live at the halfway point between two locations, so I trade off which one I visit pretty frequently. Fortunately, both locations feature the same level of quality service and delicious food.  The California Club sandwich remains at the top of my breakfast cravings list and the Breakfast Buzz is just way too good to *ever* pass up!  I've driven here, ridden my bike here, eaten in, taken out and the experience has always been positive. The ambiance is organic and trendy and casual with a strong hint of hipster mixed in as an added bonus.  Everything on the menu has been really well thought-out to provide healthy, truly mouth-watering options for the discerning foodie. Really can't recommend this place highly enough. If you haven't been, GO. You'll be glad you did.

The one on Apache Blvd fixes the only thing wrong with the Scottsdale location.  Parking.  Plenty of it.  Otherwise, same great D'Lish.  I hate lunch the other day for the first time, having to get something off my beaten path of either the AZ Burro or the Breakfast Buzz.  I went with the Southwest Rice Bowl.  Also amazing.  Everything at D'Lish is top notch.    I go to a D'Lish EVERY DAY I'm in Arizona.

I visit Arizona every two months for work, and make it a point to always come here for breakfast.    I doubt anywhere else compares, and I wouldn't even risk finding out, because that means I'll miss out on either an AZ Burro or a Breakfast Buzz.  Healthy Drive-Thru?  Impossible!  D'Lish made it happen, and they are quick.  Even if there's a line, there will be someone taking orders so that the visit is as quick as possible.  I've never had to wait longer than 15 minutes.  There's a large menu, and I'm sure it's all wonderful, but the AZ Burro and Breakfast Buzz are FANTASTIC.  It starts the day off right.  Do not order both in one sitting...    Parking is tough if you want to go inside.  That may be the one caveat if I were to think of one.

I've been coming to the Tempe location for years but today was likely my Last trip.   My one year old has a very severe sesame seed/hummus allergy. I let the guy at the drive thru know so that they could make sure there was no cross contamination. He totally blew it off "uhh okay see you at the window". I didn't feel like he heard me so when I got to the window I asked the gal if he noted the sesame allergy - as there have been mistakes at other restaurants before and she has had severe allergy attacks. The girl looked at me and said "I don't know, your food will be ready shortly" and closed the window. THEY LITERALLY DID NOT CARE AT ALL. My food was fine but they totally blew me off which made me uneasy- it's not fun for me to have to be extra cautious but my child could literally die from cross contamination. It seems like they are in educated about the severity of food allergies.  Oh and I ordered her the oatmeal but it was just a cup filled with milk and quinoa. They forgot the oats and it was totally inedible so I had to throw it away. It was like quinoa soup. I'm really irritated. See attached picture

New to Scottsdale and wanted a quick breakfast on the weekend. So I stopped by d'lish .  I got the California club which was amazing. It has turkey, bacon, cheese, egg and avocado. It's an awesome breakfast sandwich .  Everyone was nice and my sandwich wasn't to long of a wait . They also have a drive thru which is awesome for a nicer breakfast place than mcdonalds .  I will definitely be returning .
Very convenient drive-through but it closes way too early and the prices are outrageous for their mediocre food. The employees are pleasant!

One of my favorite breakfast places in town. A true "local" choice. The almond buzz shake is my go to but the veggie burrito is my addition if I need a more hearty meal. Be prepared to wait a little bit on weekends and during peak hours. It's a small place and very popular.

Woohoo! Fast AND healthy food? That's almost unheard of. I wish they were open later than four pm so I could come in for dinner too. They also have vegetarian and vegan options. The person who helped us was extremely helpful and patient.  Had the humanitarian wrap without feta and it was the perfect summer time meal. Paired great with the pomegranate green. ..and I also drank half my husband's four berry smoothie because it was so delicious. I'll be back to try the black bean and quinoa burger for sure. Highly recommend!

This place is an amazing breakfast spot, I usually go here once every weekend. The staff is super friendly and down to earth, and they have a lot of vegetarian options on the menu. I usually get the veggie burrito, which I highly recommend. The drive-thru is fast, which I thought was amazing for a health food spot. Make sure to get their fairly early on the weekends though because sometimes the line can get pretty long, but it moves fairly quickly.   I have yet to try any lunch items here yet, but I'm planning on it since their breakfast items are so good!  They also do a punch card, where you can get a free drink if you fill one up, coffee and smoothies included.

Not your typical oatmeal here, steamed milk with some granola on the side and fruit with some sweetness from maple syrup.  Quinoa all at the bottom as you scoop each time. The breakfast buzz, there is some coffee, the chocolate syrup can be overpowering though.  Overall very good still.

Food and drinks here are a lil overrated. Staff is friendly enough, but the low rating is strictly for the guy who I think is the owner or manager. I kept trying to give this place a chance, but each time I would witness this guy be so rude to guests and then myself. First example, 2 girls sitting at the coffee bar talking about the night before, not being loud or obnoxious just being girls... This guy yells at them bc he hears them say a bad word and says "where do you guys think you are?! This isn't a bar! You need to leave if you're gonna keep talking like that." Next example... A group of us went in there for breakfast one Saturday morning and my friend Kevin was kicked out bc this guy heard him swear... My third and last visit there... My friend and I were waiting for our drinks (this place is tiny and not much standing room) I'm telling her about my other 2 visits here and point out the guy to her... Sure enough he yells at us and says "you girls need to get out of my way!" I'm like "there is no where else to stand" he rolled his eyes and just walked off in a hurry. I get that cursing is inappropriate, but both of these times people were talking amongst their friends, not being loud or obnoxious. And to be honest, in both cases I never even heard the cuss word used, all I heard was this dude scolding people. The only person that's loud and obnoxious there is him. Like, I just wanna get a cup of coffee, not be scolded for saying "dammit" or for trying to find standing room in this shoebox

All I have to say is get the California Club. I live in the East Coast and I still crave for the sandwich. I wish I had the chance to try other things on the menu. The drive-thru concept is pretty neat, but there was a bit of a wait. Guess you can't rush perfection.

The original location on Scottsdale Road was definitely a staple back in my Old Town party days. Nothing cures a hangover quite like that breakfast buzz. My only complaint about the Scottsdale location was that it's ALWAYS super busy, and there's not nearly enough parking/drive thru space to accommodate all their customers. This location is much bigger, with ample parking and a huge dog friendly patio. My sister and I came around 830 on a Sunday morning and there was no wait at all. We split the California Club and the Croissant Sandwich. The Cali Club is my absolute favorite - super soft fresh bread, egg, turkey, avocado, tomato, cream cheese, pepper jack, and pesto. On second thought, I actually don't know how healthy this ends up being, but it's probably miles better than the chorizo breakfast burrito I could've scarfed down instead. They also offer doggie bags for $1.50 - leftover rice and turkey that my monster pup absolutely loved. For lunch, their man salad topped with a tuna stuffed avocado is AMAZING. You can't really go wrong with anything - it's all delish!

Jut got some breakfast here with one of my girlfriends. My friend ordered the breakfast club and she said it was good but not as good as the California club. I ordered the veggie burrito and it is delicious I also asked for a gluten free option and they had a gluten free wrap which was amazing. I also got a vegan buzz. Last time I got it they make it very sweet to the point where you can not drink it, but this time I asked for only half of the peanut butter and it was perfect!

Shoutout to my boy Chris B. for telling me about this spot. He was right - this place is terrific.   I've only been once so far, but am already conniving a plan to return! I went with a friend and shared food so I got to try 2 things. Traditional Burrito + bacon, and Breakfast Club on wheat. I truly enjoyed both. Hit the spot without over-doing it and making me feel groggy.   To wash it down I had a dirty iced chai - one of the best I've ever had. I recommend it. Next time I'll listen to Chris and get the "Buzz" which is "patent pending" and per C.B. "one of the best inventions of the 21st century"... I know what you're thinking, and I was afraid too. Hence why I went with the chai. Next time - I'm buzzin'!!
Breakfast buzz is a must!! California club is my fav bfast sandy. It's absurd how busy this place is.... I recommend going mid-day.
Absolutely amazing California Club and AZ burro (couldn't decide which was better!) We will definitely be back when we are in the area.
I love this place!! Vegan breakfast buzz! Bagel chips! The man salad!!! I'm here everyday!!
Food is great but the staff not so much. A lot of attitude from multiple servers. Tempe location is much more friendly and a better environment.

This is one of my usual breakfast places but they lose the 5th star because twice they've forgotten about my pickup order and left it sitting on the counter while I wait for them to call it out. The food is great and the service is otherwise pretty good. My girlfriend loves the Breakfast Buzz smoothie and I like any of their sandwiches that involve turkey.  A tip for diners, do not go through the drive-thru. You will get your food indoors so much faster. I can never understand why people wait in a line seven cars long instead of parking and walking inside directly to the counter. I definitely recommend this place!

Was excited when this location opened up since I had gone to the South Scottsdale store for years. This location does not make the D'lite products to their own standard.  I've watched several times now as the guy making the Buzz drinks kept refilling the pitcher with more ice and syrup, no other ingredients. I'm not paying $6.50 for syrup and ice. I complained to the management about this exact thing and nothing has been done, now I'm done. Never got a crap drink from South Scottsdale location. I've spent hundreds of dollars here in the last few months. Go to Protein House, Smoothie King or Onestop if you want a breakfast shake.
Not bad, but not the best I have ever eaten! Will I go back? Yes! However after being there 3 times the only food items I think really make the cut are the sandwiches and burritos!
Great breakfast and lunch food in Scottsdale.  Very cool that you can do drive-thru and come in for a quick, delicious meal.

This is easily one of the best breakfast spots in Scottsdale, and one of the quickest too!  I ordered the California Club Breakfast Sandwich and was blown away by the taste. So good.  The customer service is excellent, the food was ready in minutes, and it was way healthier than your average "fast food" for only a few dollars more.  They have a drive-thru if you're in a hurry, but if you're not, I suggest stopping in and relaxing with your meal on their lounge chairs!

I ordered a California Club and croissant. I recommend the California Club. It was so good, especially the green sauce in it. I bet it's their homemade sauce(maybe with basil, I am not sure but it tastes so good). I really wanna go back and have that everyday! Unfortunately, I am not living there lol Beside, they provide drive through but it's kinda slow. I wanted to drive through at first, but I changed my mind then parked the car and sat in the restaurant. It's much faster. Overall, I like the California Club so so much!

One of my favorite places to grab lunch, and do a little work that requires wifi.  I found this place one day just driving around and stopped for a cup of coffee, they had wifi, but I couldn't connect to my vpn.. but that has been fixed and they probably have one of the robust wifi locations around!  But first, let me talk about the food and the service.  It seems like EVERYONE that comes here is a regular, including me.. but no worries, you will be treated like a regular the minute you walk in.  The folks that run the place all seem like they LOVE what they do, love talking to customers and take pride in what they do, which is provide great food with some nice atmosphere.
I love the berry salad in a wrap. But I need my coffee first.  This place has a great vibe and it's healthy and Eco-conscious. What's not to love?

I had read so many wonderful reviews about this place so I had high expectations.  I also thought it was a cheap place, but I see that you don't get much for the price you pay.  I ordered the Cali Club and was not impressed by it.  There was too much cream cheese so it overtook the sandwich, rather than just make a mark on it.  We ordered my son a quesadilla and a green smoothie.  The smoothie was fine and the quesadilla was meh.  I would not come back, but it's just not my cup of tea.

Ok, I pretty much love this place! The dudes that work here and/or own it are very cool and friendly.  They aren't bad to look at either, I'm just saying. I just like to hang out here.  They are doing some remodeling and in general making this place even better. They are adding some sort of juice bar component soon, which is great.   One dude knew who I was by my Yelp review, which was cool & a little scary.  He had a great take on Yelp though, and has the right attitude that a lot of the feedback can be constructive.  One guy working there wasn't a Yelp fan, which was fine with me, he gave perfect service and made me feel totally welcome.  I respect his point of view. We all don't have to like the same things...right.  They know my stance on pillows there, and I would love it if they would stay open longer on weekends. I will bring my own Baileys....Please!!!!!  Seriously great place.

D'lite is one of those businesses that you always go to and shake your head saying "you're too big for your britches." LA Milk Depot is the same way - cars line up down the road waiting in line to get to the window. It is a good problem to have, I suppose.  I've had their smoothies, teas, and breakfast sandwhiches. All delicious. There isn't much to wonder why people clog up Scottsdale Road waiting to get in line for this place.  I also like that the people taking the orders walk down the line and take orders. I'd hate to see the line and how long it took if they didn't.
great taste. dishes are a little smaller than what I am used to.
Great spot to pull through once and a while for a blended coffee drink and breakfast sandwich / burrito

Always always always great food and GREAT service!  Small space and almost always crowded (but hey, that's D'lish), they do a great job of serving you fast.  Managers make an effort to know you and take extra good care of regulars, service in general is always great... the kind of place whereupon, given a problem or delay with you order, you just really don't mind all that much.  Biggest issue: stupid customers who seem unwilling to get out of their cars and mindlessly join the drive-thru lemmings even though they're blocking traffic on Scottsdale Rd.   No, there isn't a great deal of parking, but there's enough... and going inside is usually faster.  Like everyone else... I'm partial to the Low-Cal Breakfast (holy-shmoly its yummy!), the Nut-and-Berries Salad (also yummy), hummus plate (just right), various sandwiches, and seem unable to avoid a Breakfast Buzz (ever).
California Club is THE BOMB DOT COM!!! No substitutions needed!!

Whenever I come back into town, my first stop is D'Lite (formally Dlish which I still call it that lol) and I pick up my breakfast California Club with no tomato. I can never finish in one sitting but I try. It is so damn good, I look forward to my trips back to PHX just so I can get my D'Lite fix. Highly recommend!!

Just went through drive thru at 9:55am and the girl with shorter hair working the food window was very unhappy and rude. She didn't know my order and was just surprised at the unpleasant experience, it's not like D'Lite.

Came here because of the 4 stars Yelp review. I am very disappointed I their low carb breakfast and traditional burrito. I thought it would be tasty but taste like what Denny's. Nothing special. I expected more flavor but the sauce that they used for the low carb breakfast does not live up to my expectation.

So yeah, no time for a decent breakfast but want something good than the average McDonald's? Something perhaps healthier? Well, you have found your place here at D'Lish.    Granted it was my 1st time, so will have to go back for more.  Had the California Club, it was really good.  Did drive through and they had a guy walking out there taking and expediting orders, which was really great, and he was cracking jokes which made waiting just a bit a little more pleasurable.

My coworker suggested this place and I had my doubts, but it ended up loving it and going back a couple days later!! Their Southwest rice bowl is mouthwatering and the black bean chips are amazing! I will definitely come back here again and again!
I love the turkey sandwich and the man salad its d'lish  the only down side is the hours

Love this place.  Been going there a couple years.  The food is great,  the green tea is some of the best!   Staff is attentive and gets to know the regulars!   The only Complaint is the parking, or lack there of.   Great having a place like this in the neighborhood! !

I got the man salad which had BACON, chicken, tuna, tortilla chips, avocado, tomatoes and mixed green with a blue cheese dressing. I have been eating a bunch of fried food so I craved a salad and even though this salad isn't the healthiest of salad it definitely was satsifying. It was a pretty big salad for under $10 and I loved the wooden bowl they served it to me in. I like the concept of fast healthy food since they had a drive thru but I opted for the dining in option. I went up to the counter ordered and they gave me a number and deliver the meal to my when it was ready.  It reminded me of a small hole in the wall coffee shop with plenty of great food options. I would love to come back here and try some of the sandwiches and other types of salads.

I'm not usually a fan of "breakfast for lunch," but I had one of their egg sandwiches for lunch the other day, and daaaaaaamn it was good!  Also, since they don't serve soda, I had one of their black teas.  It was excellent, too.  If you haven't been here yet, don't be fooled by the small size, check it out ASAP!

Oh, AZ Burro breakfast burrito, how I adore thee. Then again, everything I've had for breakfast or lunch has been excellent. Love the breakfast bowls and salads... My one and only (incredibly minor and unimportant) gripe is that they are super liberal with the coffee creamer. SO. MUCH. CREAMER. EVERY. TIME. But, that doesn't really matter when you can stuff a delicious turkey, bacon and egg breakfast burrito in your face.

So awesome to see a healthy, fresh quick option in Tempe!  Do yourself a favor and get the Breakfast Buzz shake. Soooooo good! Chocolatey and sweet and amazing! :D I'm hooked.  The pesto croissant sandwich is a great breakfast option as well! I love the fast service and awesome food quality every time. The raw kombucha is killer too. :)  I'd love to see more vegan options!

The ratings are not a fluke. These guys and gals are good. Had their signature california club and was not disappointed. Fresh, great flavor. Bread was awesome. Coffee was excellent too. Gotta go back. The menu had a lot of items I want to try. The flow of customers was constant. Great sign of quality over time.

So so happy this place is finally open!  What a great convenient place.  The decor is adorable and the breakfast and salads are great!!  Staff is friendly and it's a nice place to sit w my laptop and relax and enjoy a healthy snack!
Damn! Double Damn!  This thing called breakfast buzz just buzzed me. I am addicted to this drink. It is a must try. The bagel egg sandwich was yum!  My new healthy place to frequent.
Sweet place.  Fresh food great coffee.   Fast & great service.  Great Concept for a restaurant.

Today is the 50% off everything menu!! Until 6pm. This is the time to try multiple items without regrets! And yes I did try several items.   Kitchen Sink Salad: Quinoa, beets, spring greens, carrots, jicama, cucumber, feta, golden raisins, balsamic vinaigrette and roasted bagel chips to tie it all together. Impeccably fresh and healthy! $8.25. Add chicken for $2  Protein burger House Style: house made quinoa and black bean burger with sliced portobello, creamy cucumber sauce, tomatoes and feta and pesto sauce to mesh the flavors together in between the toasted artisan bread. Optional to go Naked (no bread) on a bed of spring mix and balsamic dressing.  $9  Signature Tuna Sandwich: served hot or cold. Albacore Tuna mixed with their signature sauce, white melted cheddar, onions, celery, tomato, cucumber, dull on a multi- grain bread. Mmmmm for a cold windy day! $7.75  Croissant sandwich: a warm breakfast sandwich with egg, bacon tomato and pesto drizzle $6  Dirty Chai: comes in a choice of 12oz, 16oz or 20oz for $3.50/$4/$4.50 respectively. And of course went for the 20oz. I added soy milk.   Breakfast Buzz Shake: the best 32oz shake and their signature shake. Whey protein, espresso shots, peanut butter, nonfat milk, banana chocolate syrup, and other vitamins. $6. We ordered 5 of these. A couple to drink and the rest to give to friends! Yummmmm. They have the punch  card to get a free one after all 10 purchases are complete.   Their drive thru was just as long as a busy Starbucks line. Definitely worth  the wait. Until next time!

Wow. I've long believed that the only way for me to stay in shape was to eat food I didn't like. I obviously hadn't met the guys at this restaurant. Not only is the staff friendly and helpful, but the menu and the food is amazing.  At the owner's recommendation I tried the hot tuna sandwich and was blown away. Fresh Dill really made the sandwich pop And made it a totally different take on good old tuna. I can't wait for my next one. Good job guys!  I wish I would've taken a picture but the sandwich got destroyed way too fast for that. :-)

Three words on D'lish: Simple, tasty and healthy menu.  My fiance and I ventured over to D'lish after hearing they recently started serving dinner. It's a small, but comfortable coffee house that has indoor and outdoor seating along with a convenient drive-thru for those on-the-go.   We ordered the new "Man" salad, margherita pizza and tomato basil soup. The man salad is quite a combination of flavors. It has a huge lump of tuna salad, avocado, bacon, blue cheese crumbles, tomatoes with creamy cucumber blue cheese dressing. The margherita pizza was small, but tasty. It's perfect for smaller appetites. Not a massive fan of the tomato basil soup. It was a little too salty, but not bad.   All in all, we had a great experience there and will definitely be back to try a few other menu items and the coffee.

D'lite reached out to me after my last review and invited me to come back and try them again. This time I tried the veggie frittata. It was definitely much better than the sandwich I had last time. The dish consisted of buttered toast and sliced tomatoes topped with a baked egg layered with brocolli then sprinkled with some feta and a pesto drizzle. They were much more generous with the pesto this time and everything tasted fresh. Yummy pesto! I wish the egg had a slightly lighter texture... it was a little spongey. I also think this dish could be improved in flavor and consistency with some different veggies... maybe mushrooms or red peppers. The broccoli was just kinda too much. If they're going to keep the broccoli it needs to be smaller. I just don't think large broccoli florets work that well in a small breakfast dish.  They also mentioned the tables in their message to me. They said they are ordering new ones,  but as of today the old tables are still there. There's also some confusion about the name. Some signs say d'lish and some say d'lite. Overall, this place has potential, and I will try it again. It just needs some tlc ie: fresh coat of paint, correct signage and menu tweaks. I received great service again so they have that part down.

Rolled in before my class at SCC, and had the place to myself. Snacked on the hummus and veggie platter (cilantro and jalapeno hummus was tasty and tangy!).  Sipped a lemonade, then got an iced coffee to go.  Wish this place was closer to my home, especially with the drive thru, but will definitely be back when I'm in the Scottsdale area.
Friendly, fast, delicious! Club sandwich is great! The pomegranate green tea awesome! We will be back!
Quick and helpful service! Large portions and everything was honestly delicious :) only visiting town for a couple days but plan to come back for sure

Amazingly delicious iced coffee and turkey club sandwich for a post-ride lunch.  We were in town for Collegiate National Triathlon Champs and looking for a tasty but healthy place to nosh after exploring AZ on our bikes.  The waitress even gave us all free refills on our iced coffee!  Everyone's food was delicious.
Get the AZ Burro and the Breakfast Buzz. Not a cheap breakfast at $12 + tax, but it's so good and it'll leave you full for hours. Love the hash brown patty inside the burrito!

I absolutely love this place. The food is fantastic and the staff is very kind. Everything is fresh and prepared to order. The only minus is the music is too loud and the speakers are so sharp, which is not a good combination (my rating would be 5 stars if the environment was more enjoyable But don't let that stop you from enjoying some excellent food.

This is the only food that is to-go healthy. There menu is really awesome, they have great smoothies. My hands down favorite is the AZ burrito. Only problem are the prices. A little over priced for most items , but being a healthy convenient options it's hard not to pay a pretty penny. Lastly, the Nitro coffee is the best coffee around. Definitely worth your dollar.
Great place to go before heading to the zoo. Not a lot of seating if you're with a big party

This is a small, decent place to grab some food if there's nothing better. The people who work here are certainly nice enough.   The thing of it is, though, is that its overpriced for what you get, and the food isn't all that special. Its ok, not bad, but not great. Its also a bit strange to me that they close so early. Clearly they have no desire to serve extra late lunchers or any sort of dinner folk.
Well finished, delicious food! However, if you're going through the drive, call in your order! I recommend: everything
Staff is rude; food is full of salt; portions not as advertised.  Don't waste your time or money.

Yummy! 1st time visiting. Ordered the chicken panini and the man salad.  Both were fresh and totally delicious.  Freash, fast and wholesome. Prices were reasonable.  Service was fast and courteous.  Would recommend,  and will visit again.
