First time visiting today and I am impressed. Best tuna sandwich of my life and the iced tea I had was incredible too. Tiny inside, but very cute. Staff members were super friendly, helpful, and quick. Will definitely return.

Coffee is great, soy breakfast buzz is my favorite, tuna is awesome, veggie delite with turkey is awesome, hummus plate is awesome. all of the breakfast sandwiches and burrito are the best. basically everything I've had from D'Lish is really good. People are nice. I can't say enough about D'Lish
Very convenient location. Tons of healthy options, great assortment of beverages. Reasonable prices. Do yourself a favor and check it out!!!
This place is so good!! The staff there are always friendly and are so helpful at helping picking out anything your craving :) menu is not only healthy but delicious!

I love all of the other locations but this one seems to lack each visit. I had the California club last time and the egg tasted like it had been sitting out for hours and then heated in the microwave! The staff is way less friendly at this location which is my biggest issue. The last three times I've been I said thank you as I would drive away and get no response. They make it an uncomfortable experience for me each time.

I haven't had the food there, but I love their iced mocha and their breakfast smoothie.  Very yummy and not ridiculously overpriced.  The atmosphere is very friendly.  This would be a great place to meet up with a group.

Incredible long waiting time for a drive-through! Strong discrimination! I ordered a frittatas, a California club and a salad, which made me wait on the driver through way for half an hour! Several cars behind me had their orders delivered before me and finally they asked me again what I ordered! If I could offer negative star, I will definitely do so!

Pretty good food but customer service could be better. They have a walkup window where I attempted to order a drink, but was told to come inside (leaving my food outside on the balcony to wait in a long line for a cup of water). Pretty inconvenient, considering there is a window for ordering, outside.

So the Breakfast Buzz shake... Best shake ever made! As for the food items, I've never been dissatisfied!! All breakfast items are out of this world, and the Southwest Chicken Rice Bowl is simply to die for! Such a better/healthier alternative to ANY fast food restaurant! Hope this organization expands everywhere!!
Quick, easy, healthy and enjoyable! Loved the healthy options and tea. Would highly suggest

The Southwest rice bowl is so good! I hope it's good for you, because I felt like I was cheating on my diet. The one thing I didn't like is the parking lot at this location. It's a tiny parking lot with no way out if the drive-thru is full. Also if you're in the drive-thru and get your order before the car in front of you you're kinda stuck until they move forward. I drove by today and the traffic going into this business was a mess! So make sure you have time when you go.
Amazing food. Great Orange Julius! Don't have a restroom though. When they put one in, they will go to 5 stars.

This place is cute, the food's yummy and the cute bearded men behind the counter made our first encounter even more fun. The hummus plate was delicious and robust...and only $5!  And they have a drive thru.  Can't wait to try it again.

Wish I can give this place 10 stars. The Vegan Buzz is the best thing I have ever had in my life! And it has espresso!?! This location has easy access and is very comfortable. I will be back to try many of the recommendations like the California club and the wraps! Apparently they have more locations across the valley. I will be trying them all! Hope they live up to the hype of this one!

Wanted to try the famous Breakfast Buzz drink. I did not like the fact that it was already prepared ahead of time. That might have caused some stomach issues. I paid and one second later there it was. I don't care if your busy, make my drink fresh or don't make it it all. Plus at about 6 bucks, I think they are taking advantage of consumers cause of the popularity of the beverage.

The breakfast here is so good! I've only had the breakfast sandwiches and the breakfast buzz so i can't talk for their lunch menus but I would definitely come here for anything. The food is always fresh and made to order and the breakfast buzz signature drink is so good! There's a drive they which is convenient unless it's too long it's impossible to get in line. the parking lot is also extremely tight and hard to park in. inside is a little small but it's a perfect little place to grab something fast and fresh to eat.
This is the perfect lunch fix. The strawberry salad is light and filling at the same time. The menu is local and it has a different small town feel than the other packed restaurant chains around.

The gal on the drive thru speaker was super chipper. I got an iced coffee and the southwestern bowl. The SW bowel was basically a soup, but it was still good. My girlfriend wasn't thrilled with her dirty chai but really liked her breakfast sandwich.

This place is so delicious! I'm addicted to their Caramel Lattes. I go here entirely too much. The staff is always the same and friendly (that's always nice to see the same faces there). They're very hospitable which is rare these days at many establishments and I never mind being in here since they'll chat with you while you wait. I have tried many items (fresh bagels and bialys, yummy traditional burrito, California Club, and my absolute favorite, the Low Carb Breakfast). This is just delicious!! Highly recommend and it's great they have a reward system with the Thanx app! I've earned a few free items since they told me about it.

Sooooooo good! I get the Southwest rice bowl every time and am never disappointed. I always walk in for service because the drive-thru is usually 5 or 6 cars deep, so that sometimes slows down service. However, the food is great, employees are friendly, and I do not feel guilty after eating this "fast food". Definitely recommend!

The best Tuna Sandwich  I have ever had. I wanted more and I had a whole one. Everything  tasted fresh, great flavor combo with all the non-traditional ingredients. My new favorite spot by work! Eating healthy with a drive thru is possible

I absolutely love this place and its concept. I hope they open one in north Phoenix soon!!! So worth the drive to Tempe tho. Healthy breakfast and lunch, can't go wrong with a reasonable healthy option!! Thankyou Dlish for blowing drive thru healthy food out of the water!!!!

D'Lish is DELISH!  I finally visited this darling establishment after reading my fellow Yelper's reviews, and I'm glad I did. The guys that work here are super friendly and super cute ( that is soooo inappropriate for me to say at this age)  and they can make a very nice latte and wonderful food! When you read that this is "fast food", don't be scared off that you are going to a chain-type establishment: this IS fast food that is freshly prepared and absolutely D'LISH!

The California Club was excellent! I also tasted the low carb breakfast which was also very good. The staff was very friendly and the service was very fast! I will for sure get the California Club again!

Love the healthy and delicious options. The quinoa version of oatmeal was amazing. Tuna sandwich was really good. The burrito bowl was yummy. Only complaint is the service. Multiple staff members haven't tried the food and can't answer seemingly simple questions like "Does the breakfast burger have a meat patty?" or "How is this menu item?". One of our orders had to be remade as we had requested the sauce on the side - if they had tried the dish they would know that doing that is a difficult task. Coffee was just ok.

My fiance and I needed a quick place to stop for lunch on our way between Sedona and Los Angeles.  We were driving through Phoenix, and we settled on D'lish because it was a well-reviewed drive-thru with plenty of options.  It was a good choice, quick, affordable, and tasty.  There was a short line for the drive-thru, but we were helped relatively quickly.  I was expecting a McDonald's-style drive-thru speaker system, but an employee came out and took our order while we waited in our cars.  The same employee then took our money at the pay window and maybe even gave us our food at the food window?  Is that too Looney Tunes?  Maybe there was another employee or just the one window.  Either way, he was a nice guy.  I ordered the combo lunch with a sandwich, a side, and a small drink.  I chose the turkey club, which was a pretty decent sandwich with smoked turkey, bacon, cheese, avocado, tomato, and lite honey mustard spread, served on toasted whole wheat.  It was a decently sized sandwich, not heavy but filling.  It was maybe a little dry despite having good turkey - less bread, maybe, or more mayonnaise would have done the trick.  I picked a soup for my side, a red pepper bisque that came with bagel chips.  This was excellent.  The soup was soothing and thick with tomato and red pepper, and the crispy bagel chips were perfect for dipping.  I'd definitely recommend a soup if you're coming through D'lish.  For my drink, I subbed in the Breakfast Buzz for a little bit extra.  I wasn't quite sold when I read the description on the menu, but as I often do, I let the voice of Yelp dictate my order.  This drink was a shake made with vitamins, protein, espresso, nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, and chocolate, blended with ice.  Pro tip, guys - don't lead with vitamins and proteins.  It makes your drink sound less delicious.  I'm glad I got the Breakfast Buzz against my fat-craving inner skeptic - it was fantastic, creamy and refreshing with plenty of banana, peanut butter, and chocolate to silence the healthier components.  We ate our lunch in the car and drove off in less than fifteen minutes.  It was a nice, efficient stop, and the food was well worth stopping for.  I'd recommend to D'lish to Phoenicians and weary travelers alike.

This is supposed to be a healthy eating establishment.  I am usually on a very restricted diet no sugar no starch as well as the use of HCG and most diets now a days seem to be jumping on the same bandwagon.  Its all about eating clean.  Hormone free meats, fruits and veggies thats it so when I took a look at the low carb menu that came with hash browns for every low carb entree I was a little confused and disappointed but rather than try and decipher their menu I just told the lady taking my order that I needed something with virtually no calories like an egg beater omelet she said we can make you an egg white omelet which isnt really my preference but I figured my choices were pretty limited so I said o.k. then I sat down pretty much prepared to hate whatever they brought me.  These people know how to make boring egg whites taste good.  It came on a bed of greens with tomatoes and onions as I requested along with a few slices of avocado and a very tasty pesto sauce just enough to give it flavor.  I loved it and felt extremely satisfied even though it must have been under 250 calories.  I would definitely go here again and order the same.  Make sure you get there early for breakfast because seating is very limited inside and out.  There is also a drive through.
I'm a very picky eater but everything here looked amazing. I ordered the California Club and it was great! Once I was done I wanted to immediately go back. Thank god for self control :)
great food, cool concept.  a little pricey and the location in scottsdale has a horrible parking lot.

Reg at the Scottsdale one.  1st time here rude service!! Wanna be hipsters that play to cool for school work here and food isn't as good as Scottsdale location.  Never will go back always pass it up on that side of town

Consistently one of my favorite go to breakfast lunch brunch places. The food is clean and yummy. Buzz shakes will get you going, be careful they are addicting. Cali club, az burro, veggie dlite are all amazing!

I love this place.  They are what they say they are.  Healthy fast food with a drive thru!  I love the morning buzz and so does everyone else that has tried it.  The burritos are so big they feed two people and the croissant wt/egg cheese and pesto sauce is really good.  They are a bit pricey and they dont provide nutrition info is why they dont get all 5 stars.
Delicious breakfast stop! I had the low carb breakfast and it was absolutely delicious and I didn't have to feel guilty for eating it either!

The staff is friendly, the service is fast and the food is magnificent.  As soon as I get in im asked about my day, typical but important. I have been to dlish many times but usually to the one in Scottsdale.  This one feels cleaner and gives off a better vibe. The staff all get along and joke around with each other. I love that. Food made with love. I usually order the early bird style burger, the one with the egg on it. I don't eat dairy so without the cheese I was disappointed. The burger is rather dry, but what can you expect when the "meat of it" *giggles, is made of a composition of quinoa and black beans? This past visit I ordered the house style burger. Good choice. It was delicious and I felt good after I ate it. Usually when I order its either one or the other. I will be a student at ASU next year and living in Tempe. I like everything about this place so much that I think I will even put in an appplication for a job here. no joke! To students who are health conscious, environmentally aware, and most commonly, on a budget, THIS is the place for you.  See you there!

It really is delish! You can't go wrong with any option! Highly recommend! I love that breakfast is served all day. The line and the parking lot can be a bit frustrating at times, but that's just an indicator of a busy time and a great place to dine.

First time customer, and while the food was pretty good, it was rather pricey and customer service was mediocre. I don't think I will be back any time soon.  I ordered the chicken panini with soup and green iced tea. I asked for a splash of lemonade and was handed an Arnold Palmer. I was confused about the pricing of the combo, and when I asked the cashier for clarification, I got an attitude, and immediate "do you want to cancel your order?" which I felt was not necessary. While I won't be back anytime soon, D'lish is great alternative to Mc'D's.
People are awesome so nice and the food is great! I love the breakfast buzz and the California club!!

Service was bad. They charge me for a for an extra meal because the lady did not listen. She wanted to get her own opinion across that I did not order correctly. I asked for two menus and  sat down. I asked her if she would take our order at the table. A simple yes or no would of been nice. But I was told.. like a child in front of my guest that not how they do it and next time I would need to go to the counter. There was no one in there.  Well I asked about one meal than order another she charge me for both and when I mention it she did not take back the meal I asked about and she did not give my money back. Another employee apologize for her treatment.  The oatmeal was water down grain of some sort and the meal that I did not order and paid for  I did not want.  End of the day if the service was better I might of given this place a second chance.

I hate to be a downer....  My dear friend and I came in after our mid morning trip to the gym hoping to get some coffee and a light bite.  I settled on the Organic yogurt and granola and a protein shake after asking a few questions about the granola (I don't like oily granola) and inquiring about the brand of protein powder used. I didn't feel like my questions were answered very well but I was hungry and it was crunch time. My friend got a vanilla latte and a tuna sandwich....we sat down....  I watch the guy begin to make my protein shake....The container for the Protein read Smart Gainer http://www.nextag.com/ids-smart-gainer/search-html 600 calories and counting.  read it for yourself...make since for a weight lifter or a very skinny person trying to gain weight....but I just came from the gym and worked really hard to run off those damn calories. I do not want my protein shake to be a weight gainer....I want in to be what it say it is...simple protein shake.....anyway I watched them make my granola as well...not Organic like they said. I think its important to use what you say you are using...they were using yoplait. Not organic. Humph.  On the other hand the tuna sand was pretty good....props on the sandwich but I'm not coming back anytime soon.
SO good and SO fast! I came with a group of 6 girls and everything we ordered was so delicious. The coffee was yummy too.

Love the food here, but the drive through sucks. No efficiency, even when there is one person in line it's never less than 5-10 minutes for a breakfast buzz. Rather than utilize the first window for quick items, such as a buzz, they make you wait.

This place is an awesome hidden gem! Never would have thought from the outside the greatness that lies within. The Breakfast Buzz was beyond amazing! The perfect breakfast protein shake of chocolate, PB and espresso. Went back 3 times in our week stay. Had the southwest rice bowl for lunch- very yummy and Fresh!

D'Lish is an incredibly clean, gluten free, healthy eating type of establishment. I wish so much that they would open a location in North Dallas!!! My favorite is the Breakfast Buzz with each a protein shake, pretty much a tasty, drinkable breakfast. I got that after a recent 5k at one of their relatively newer locations in Tempe close to ASU. Great outdoor seating, or get it to go.

We are obsessed with D'Lite and frequent all of their locations when in town. The Breakfast Buzz is an absolute MUST! We get ours with almond milk. I love the croissant-which with pesto- it's so freaking good!

I am a true fan! great for the vegetarian on the go :) DO NOT judge the D'Veggie bowl by its looks because it is fan-flippin-tastic! I wish they would come up with some other creative bowls though, they only have 2 to choose from and only one is for a veg. This place is true to the name, d'effing'lish :)
My favorite drive-thru! I wish they would expand and open one in North Scottsdale. Only downside is they aren't open past 4.

I have been to D'lite before with my cousin, I would say some time last year. Now I'm a vegan, and I asked particularly about their burgers at the time and they said every single burger option out of the 3 that they make are vegan. Excited as can be I order the Top Notch Style option with "bacon", "cheese", and grilled onions. I felt quite sick after a couple of bites but I figured it would be from how heavy it was. Today I thought it would be fun to take my husband to the same place to split the burger, so he could try it, just to find out it is actual bacon and cheese they put on it. Someone told me it was all vegan, made me ill and they were pretty rude today when I said how upset I was that someone lied last time. As if it was a joke!?! I will never EVER recommend this place, as they don't take diet, or allergy's seriously. My body can not digest animal protein and causes internal bleeding.

Food was very good and seemed relatively healthy. Inside was very small and loud but the staff was friendly. I got the southwest rice bowl and loved it. The price wasn't bad for what you get. They do a very good drive-thru so the parking lot is kind of busy.

Cute Place, Good Music and atmosphere. Friendly Staff. The fact that theres a drive-thru with such a menu is awesome. However there are only a handful of parking spaces & places to sit. They also do not have a bathroom. Ordered a Breakfast Buzz & Iced coffee to drink. The Breakfast Buzz is AMAZING i highly recomend it. It is a blended beverage with expresso, vitamins, protien, & has a peanut butter/banana flavor.

Their "low carb" breakfast option said it had a hash patty and maybe it was a bad assumption on my part to think it was corn beef hash, not potato. I'm curious though as to why they would put hash browns in the "low carb" breakfast as that's the exact opposite of low carb. Anyhow it was basically a bowl of lettuce, raw tomatoes, over cooked microwaved eggs & hash brown potatoes. They are really nice at the counter though and have some good items on the menu that are not low carbs so I gave them 3 stars :/

D'lish is just that D'lish, I can see why they named it that!!!  I have become a regular not only for the best Green Tea in the area but also the Men that always great you with a smile and a sparkling attitude whether they are swamped or you are the only person in the place!!!  Everything I have eaten there is D'lish but my personal favorite is the Turkey Club...  If you haven't been here it is a must try!!!

I loved my California club for 7.95! Eggs, bacon, turkey, tomato, avocado and pepper jack cheese on toasted artisan bread. The perfect warmth of the bread and flavorful taste of the pesto puts other club sandwiches to shame. Definitely enjoyed every bite of this sandwich  My fiancé got the breakfast club ($6.00). Nothing special about this sandwich...it tasted rather bland or maybe the sundried tomato bread overpowered the items inside the sandwich (turkey, tomato, eggs, bacon, etc).   Also got a caramel iced coffee. Very very good. Not too sweet, not too strong   Obvious that this is a very popular spot. The drive-thru line was sticking out into the street. While we dined inside (very small), many patrons came in to pick up their orders. Guess that's the norm there... I'd come back and repeat my order if ever I'm back in Scottsdale (California Club and Caramel Iced Coffee)
The California club is amazing!! Definitely will be eating here often and can't wait to try more of the menu options! Friendly staff and I love the atmosphere inside too.

This is one of my favorite Scottsdale stops for breakfast. The drive thru makes it super convenient and the food is always good. My personal favorites are the croissant sandwich and the az burro. Their coffees are also delish!

Tried their "Burger" for the first time.....OMG horrible.  Tastes nothing close to a burger. It even looked scary.  Sorry but not for me.  Some of my co-workers wanted to give it a try and they spit out the first bite too.
Great food. A bit expensive for breakfast joint. Quick kind staff. Happy I found this place when I first moved here. A must try!

Not McDonald's fast but still faster then In-N-Out yet amazingly good. Don't have a very good side selection at all. The woman who took our order was... eccentric and would be oblivious of who Emily Post is but was still charming and efficient.

We visited in hopes of a quick light lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  My assumption about this place was that they would be serving a light, fresh, and flexibly healthy menu. Although most of what they have seems to be fresh and healthy, ALL of their soups are dairy-based, and there's a lot of wheat, eggs and dairy products on their menu.   Prices seemed reasonable, and the staff were friendly and tried to be as helpful as they could. The Chef even came out and discussed my needs, but it seemed a bit of a stretch for them to adjust to accommodate my admittedly difficult dietary restrictions.  The only thing they could offer was a salad, and had to omit certain items.    While their menu boasts gluten-free and other individual allergen-friendly tags on some items, I was disappointed to find that they weren't readily able to produce more variety suitable to my needs.  I'd hoped for a more embracing healthy/allergen-friendly standard from this place, given their "Health Conscious" advertising.  Come on, guys - ALL dairy-based soups!?  Not really very healthy.  I guess I'd recommend you try this place because they were nice, tried their best, and are obviously a local business trying to make a go of it.  If you have food allergies, and want something other than Rabbit food, don't be fooled by their "healthy" offering.

I love their food. However, this location if horrendous for parking. I always call in my order for pick up and the line of cars is literally backed up onto Scottsdale Rd because of the drive-thru. But back to the food! Their Broccoli Side is amazing. Their Veggie d'Lite is amazing. I recommend getting it on wheat bread instead of the flat bread. The flat bread can get soggy. The food is well priced, fresh and always top notch. I know they can't do much about the parking issue, and I will continue to suffer through it because they are my go to lunch spot. As much as I want to shout my love for them from the rooftop, I'm hesitant to because I don't want any more cars blocking my lunch time getaway. If they had a larger parking lot, it would get 5 stars all the way!!
Local joint that excels at providing healthy but appetizing food quickly. Food was fresh and the long line at the drive through went super quick.

Friendly staff but sandwiches are kind of small. I ordered the breakfast club. It looked and tasted like I'd expect any bacon, turkey, tomato, etc sandwich to taste.  Nothing special to write home about. Is it sacrilegious or anti-foodie to say I might actually prefer McD's breakfast sandwiches?

I love this place! The breakfast are delicious and the lunches are amazing. I love their black bean burgers for lunch and their breakfast sandwiches for the morning. I love that they have a drive thru. It's convenient and they don't sacrifice taste with it.

Let's talk about this, breakfast buzz. It's seriously my new obsession. It tastes so dang good. I actually love most of the food here. Their veggie burgers, on point. You can actually customize whatever you want here. I've done and they're really awesome about accommodating my pickiness. One thing I would like to see this place do, post the nutritional facts of their food. Maybe one day they will. I'd love it if they did. Holla.
Good food and service.  Extensive menu, check it out........

A reasonably priced, healthy option, with very good service.  The restaurant is clean, employees were very helpful with explaining the menu options - I've tried most of the healthy restaurant options for salads, sandwiches, wraps, and smoothies in the area and this location has the them all beat, especially on price with quality and quick service.  Coffee / espresso is excellent.

Excellent idea! Delicious, healthy food on the go. Their salads are to die for- none of that "tons of lettuce, a little bit of toppings" nonsense... the salads are PACKED with ingredients and have a wonderful balance of flavor.  Just be sure to remember when you're going through the drive-through: everything is made-to-order and perfection takes time.
I enjoyed two tasty meals here while I was in town. Even the coconut milk Latte was amazing. Breakfast burritos had me hooked.
There needs to be more fast food places that are super healthy and have awesome staff. I love their food, their shakes, their service and their concept! Get the breakfast buzz and you wont regret it!

I started going through the drive through back when it was Daily Rush and got to know the owners at that time.  I loved giving the local guy business.  When the new guys took over I was bummed to have to build a relationship all over again.  But I have to tell you they are kicking butt!!    The remodel is fabulous, the extension of the menu is great and they know what I want when I pull up.  Always nice to have someone know your drink :-)  I can't wait to try the dirty Chai!  Thanks so much for giving us this great drive thru in South Scottsdale!!

This is my coffee joint!  When I wake up in the mornings I either have a thrift mentality where I drink my god-awful office coffee, or a "I don't care that I'm completely going broke" mentality where I head to D'lish.  I would say that I fall into the latter category most days of the week.  Everyone on the staff totally rocks.  I usually hate my entire life and everything in it at 7:00 when I roll through there, but I always drive away with excellent coffee in hand and as much of a smile as possible on my face.  The prices are totally reasonable, and although I'd be irritated about the fact that they have UoP propaganda all over their cups, I find myself wanting to support them and have whoever started this wonderful business to make millions and millions of dollars.  Like some fellow reviewers I would definitely recommend the Chicken Pesto Sandwich.  I generally stick with regular coffee in the morning, but every espresso drink I've had has been phenomenal as well.  Thank you D'lish for making M-F tolerable!
Perfect place for a college budget that at the same time offers good food. There food is all natural and is reasonable prices. There lemonade is perfect addition to add to your meal.

Had lunch today at D'lish with my boyfriend. We ordered the tuna sandwich and the early bird burger (which is not a burger, but a patty made with quinoa) and went halfsies on them, which is easy to do because they come cut in half already. To drink I got the kombucha, which I believe is GTs Original, and my boyfriend got the lemonade. Overall, our experience was excellent. The tuna sandwich was fresh and well flavored. The early bird was also good, but for me it was a little bit too spicy (and I love spicy), though my boyfriend who loves-loves spicy thought it was excellent. The ingredients tasted fresh and the food was reasonably priced for the quality and portions. The service was excellent and the staff very helpful. Our food came out quickly and so we were able to enjoy a healthy, delicious lunch in less than 30 minutes.

Found this place on Yelp! Always go by Yelp!! This place is amazing. Got the hummus wrap, green lemonade smoothie and the pomegranate tea.  Place was so clean  Bathrooms are clean  Great seating  Drive through as well!!!  Must try this place!!!  Great customer service!
My favorites are the angry bird black bean burger, he chicken pesto panini, and a large kombucha! So many yummy healthy options.

When I read that D'lish was an "alternative to fast food drive thrus", I knew immediately that we should go here before a day trip on our vacation in AZ.  I'm glad to see that business seems to be good for this little restaurant with organic food. Hippies! We did drive through and though we did have to wait a few minutes longer than we would if we went to McDonald's, it was definitely worth the wait.  Here's what we ordered: Veggie breakfast burrito - this was definitely filling. I couldn't finish a whole burrito. Eggs, portobello mushroom, etc with salsa = delicious. Tuna sandwich - pretty tasty! Carb-free breakfast - the person liked it! The only complaint... there were too many greens at the bottom. It's great that they gave so much, but it was a little wilted from the heat of the breakfast items by the time we got to it. Veggie d'lite - yummy! Lots of greens.

I've been coming to this establishment for over two years now. Not only is there food very healthy as well as their breakfast buzz very delicious,If you bring your furry friend they have dog treats for them as well when you arrive through the drive-thru.  My favorite menu item is the breakfast buzz, it is a mixture of espresso milk bananas protein and more! I would also recommend the California club if you are a chicken lover who also loves a good pesto sauce all in one sandwich. I recommend to come here during off hours from 1:51 PM as it can get very busy. Overall I highly recommend this Place for a quick healthy meal, five out of five!

This used to be my favorite spot for lunch. Their sandwiches, especially the Cali club, are delicious and the patio was a nice place to sit outside once the weather cools down.    However now the patio looks like something from the apocalypse. Crows everywhere, garbage, bird poop, and worst of all syringes. That, together with occasional shady characters hanging out around the back parking lot is a dealbreaker for me.

One of my favorite breakfast spots. The staff is always friendly, there's never a long wait, and the food is awesome. I usually get the Cali club and a breakfast buzz. Definitely try these two items your first time in.

Most of the staff here is amazing, and the management know how to run a business well and treat customers right. The california breakfast sandwich is a favorite, and their kombucha is top notch.  Lots of healthy options. Portions are solid. Flavors and ingredients are great. Keep it up.

The breakfast buzz is a great option to start your day, but it is the only thing I have ever ordered so I don't know how accurate my rating would be for the overall menu. The other stuff looks delicious though but parking is a pain in the butt.

Let me start with the positives!   I love that this place is small and is very intimate with the customer. I also love the food selection when it comes to lunch. I got the California club and it was pretty dank, I can't even lie.   The negatives:  I think I came when it was under construction and the place was getting moved around. Also, I don't know if it is an espresso machine or what but it is EXTREMELY loud. To the point where my girlfriend and I stopped talking and ate our food so that we could leave and talk later.   If the noise problem was fixed, this place would be 5 stars easy.

Two words: AZ BURRO. That is what you must get at D'lish! It is absolutely amazing and I honestly crave it on the regular. It is packed with smoked turkey, avocado, egg whites, potato, tomato, and feta in a sundried tomato wrap. It is huge, super filling and only $7! I promise that you will not be disappointed! It is great for any time of the day, not just breakfast! Another one of my favorite things about D'lish is that they have "doggie bags" for $1.50 which includes leftover natural turkey and basmati rice...the pooches LOVE it!!!!! And for $1.50, it is a lot of food! The line is sometimes very long, but don't get discouraged, it is worth the wait! You're welcome!! ;)

I can't believe I almost drove on by!  The drive thru line spilled out on the main road, and I was hungry.  At the last moment, I made an illegal U-turn and found some parking a block away.  When I got to Dlish, the long line was gone.    The friendly guy behind the counter took my order and gave me a number.  We sat at a table outside with our puppy.  Patrons were dog friendly and we didn't get any dirty looks.  When friendly guy showed up with my drink, he asked if our dog would like a treat and promptly brought him one.    California Club is as good as everyone says.  The Breakfast Buzz was even better than I expected.  The ice teas were also good.  Drinks come in big sizes.  That's the way uh-huh uh-huh I like it!

Great choice of healthy menu options, excellent coffee and amazing customer service. Been waiting a long time for a health conscious concept that is fast and convenient in the Scottsdale/Shea area. The fact that you can call ahead for drive thru pick up is incredible and I will definitely be here often.

I love this place. If I could I would swing by every morning, but when I DO have time and want something SUPER yum-O, I get my tosh over here.   The drive thru is awesome (its so nice to have an alternative to Sbux!) The staff has always been super friendly, the food is YUM! And you have tons of options (which I love!)  I have only been inside once and the place is pretty cute. The blender is a little loud, so its not the ideal place to be if you need to work etc.. but still its adorable.  I usually get the breakfast club, no bacon on a sesame seed bagel and a large coffee, its so good....in fact, Im heading over there right now to get my fix :)   See you there my darlings !
Great small place. Friendly staff. Nice menu. Perfect for breakfast/brunch.

I'm not as crazy about this place as everyone else seems to be. For one, it's cramped and crowded, not an enjoyable or relaxing brunch place. It's really built more to serve the drive-thru clientele.  Secondly, the food is overpriced. We spent the same here that we would have spent at a fancy sit-down brunch, but for less quality food and a less enjoyable atmosphere. Thirdly, I did not like the food all that much, my breakfast sandwich was just OK and it was on store-bought bread, not freshly baked. It tasted like warmed up leftovers. And my husband did not like his coffee or his sandwich. The ONLY redeeming thing about this experience was the Breakfast Buzz smoothie! Lindsay J. (another yelper) was right, it is delicious! It tastes like chocolate milk, and you can definitely taste the espresso, bananas and peanut butter. I might come back for that smoothie, but otherwise I probably won't be back.

Their menu had a variety of healthy vegan and vegetarian options as well options for your non-veggie friend. I ended up with the veggie d'lite. It had tomatoes, avocado, cucumber, cucumber sauce, and lettuce in a sort-of-pita-sort-of-focaccia wrap. The lettuce was not dressed and was the bulk of the sandwich. It would have been a lot tastier had the ingredients been mixed together prior to entering the wrap. I didn't expect it to be cheap, but $7 for this seemed a little on the pricey side considering it was just a wrap with no drink or side. Overall, it was a refreshing alternative to your typical drive-thru meal. I can't wait to go back and try something else!
The lemonade is amazing as is the tuna sandwich (make sure to get it hot). One of my fav places to get a quick delicious lunch!

TWO THINGS: AZ BURRO & BREAKFAST BUZZ. That is all you need to be happy in life. Okay, well maybe that was a stretch but seriously, they're pretty darn amazing!!   The breakfast burro has been my go-to for years - it is in a tasty sundried tomato tortilla with egg whites, turkey, avocado, potatoes, feta cheese, and served with a side of salsa. I seriously dream about this burro on the regular.   As for the breakfast buzz - think rich, chocolatey shake but with espresso! It also has banana and other vitamins and goodies. It is the perfect start to any morning!  I'm so happy about this new location in our neighborhood. I used to have to drive to south Scottsdale to get my fix! The best part, they have a drive thru! Yep, fast, healthy food and you don't even have to get out of your car. My kinda place. See you again soon, D'lite!

I love this place! Breakfast buzz is my jam! It is delicious, not sure how healthy it is, but I don't care... I crave it! And the turkey club or California breakfast club...sooo good! Always fast, and if they're too busy (line of cars in drive thru) they come out and take your order and bring it to you..which is 5 stars in my book, have an infant who has a love/hate relationship with car rides and you never know what you're gonna get. Always worth the trip!

I just LOVE this place! Its like the Cheer's Bar for college and adults who like to be healthy or even just want an awesome place to go to.  But the best thing that you can do for yourself is to get the Breakfast Buzz!  Its the perfect mixture of chocolate, espresso, banana and milk. I can't get enough of this!  The food is pretty awesome and so is the teas but seriously get the Breakfast Buzz anytime that they're open!

Love. Love. Love.   For starters, I can get a green iced tea the size of my head. They have a drive-thru AND it's a healthy drive-thru. Not to mention they have the best tuna sandwich I've ever had.   I probably eat here once a week. It is my dream to one day try everything on the menu. Unfortunately, I can't stop eating that damn tuna sandwich.
Food is excellent, great service, highly recommend the California club breakfast sandwich.

The food is great! I came 2 days in a row for the low carb breakfast. Fresh ingredients that taste great and are at a pretty low price, that's hard to beat. I wish there was one of these back home!! (Washington DC, hint hint) And it has a drive-through!

If you're looking for a great place to get healthy food on the go, then this is it. Every time I come here, the staff has been friendly and helpful. They also do a great job at getting your food to you in a timely manner.  The menu has a good variety of items, some even being vegetarian. I love ordering the California Club, which has great flavor and is very filling. Sometimes I am able to save the second half of the sandwich and get two meals out of it. I also recently started getting the Breakfast Buzz which is great to have after a workout. It has a peanut buttery flavor and is packed with vitamins, protein, and even espresso shots. I hope to try more items out because I don't think I'd be disappointed with anything they have to offer.  If you haven't already, I suggest coming to D'Lite. It's great quality food for a good price.

Great food & price. Organic and responsibly owned. Because I'm a fat girl at heart, my only gripe was the size of the food. Otherwise everything was perfect. I gave this place 4 stars  because of their parking situation. Totally inconvenient with their parking spots and at times lack thereof.  TIP: frittata is amazing. Definitely must have. Coffee is great too.  Try to bike there or don't bring a car. Even the drive thru is a nuisance with the traffic their parking lot creates.

Mayonaise makes me gag. I don't care how you prepare it, mix it, twist it, shout it...it grosses me out so bad. people who like/love/don't mind mayo always say things to me like 'try this potato salad, you can't even taste the mayo' and you know what? they are always lying.   anyway, i ordered the turkey club and asked them to hold the honey mustard spread. thankfully there wasn't any mayo so i didn't have to ask them to hold that either. this sandwich has a ton of my faves: tomato, turkey, bacon, cheese, avocado. scrumptious ingredients.   as soon as it's in my car, i can smell mayonaise. i think to myself 'oh, you're crazy, it's your immagination- the description said nothing about mayo'   well i am crazy, but my nose was right. mayo. on. my. sandwich.   usually i wouldn't flip out but my large sexy dirty chai and sandwich cost me $15. the drink alone was worth the $4 something dollars for several reasons, but the sandwich was gross and totally over priced. the bacon was pretty bad, and i ended up taking off most of the ingredients bc it wasn't very good. i was able to wipe off most of the mayo from the turkey and avocado so i ate that.  i was just so, so sad.   the customer service is great, the sexy dirty chai is great but the food i will not eat again.

I am in love with the Breakfast Buzz..more like addicted and I get with Almond Milk so an Almond Buzz!! This location (Tempe) seems to be way faster and has a much easier parking lot to navigate! Only negative is that is a little pricey but expected for healthy food options!

Had the Green Lemonade and California Club and the lady friend had some oatmeal and coffee.  The lady friend loved the oatmeal and liked that she got to choose her milk. The California Club was amazing and if you don't try the green lemonade there is something wrong with you.   Service was awesome and quick.  Real nice soothing atmosphere as we sat by the black leather chairs by the tv.  Will be back 100 times more

D'Liteful (*ducks tomato*)!  The small but mighty breakfast and lunch drive thru (formally known as D'Lish) has been a faint curiosity for me since I first drove past what looked like a line of about 10 cars eager to get their fix at this place.  I can't say with any credibility whether that is a normal crowd.  But having seen similar lines for drive thru's like In & Out Burger and Dutch Bros Coffee, I figured there'd had to be something behind the long lines.  So around 7:30am on a Sunday it was off to D'Lite's flagship location in South Scottsdale for breakfast.  Surprisingly upon my arrival there were only a pair of cars in front of me.  Additionally I saw that there was the option to park and dine in rather than go the drive thru route.  So dine in I did.  The space is fairly small with seating for maybe 20 inside and another 10 outside.  Parking is also limited with space for maybe 6-8 cars so depending on your arrival time dining in may simply not be practical, but the drive thru line was moving at a pretty decent clip regardless.  For dining in just order at the register, pick a seat inside or out and the good stuff is brought right out to you.  As this was my first go around here, I had done a little bit of research in advance and saw two particular items that were helpfully highlighted as "signature" items on the menu.  Seems like a good place to start.  So for my drink, I went with their Breakfast Buzz shake.  A 24 oz mix of nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, chocolate syrup, espresso, whey protein, and other vitamins all blended together with ice.  To be clear, I'm not a coffee drinker so the espresso aspect gave me a little trepidation, but honestly I didn't pick up any real coffee texture with this drink.  The two most dominant flavors were the chocolate and peanut butter.  The shake basically tasted like a Reese's Peanut Butter cup in liquid form (which is just fine by me).  For my breakfast dish, I also went "signature" and chose their California Club sandwich.  Egg, bacon, turkey, tomato, avocado, pepper jack cheese, cream cheese & pesto on toasted artisan bread.  Pretty decent sandwich and a just right portion, though I'll admit the tomato flavor might've been a little too dominant here.  Would've preferred a little more emphasis on the turkey and bacon and I didn't pick up hardly any of the pesto or cream cheese flavoring.  That said I liked the portion of avocado and the egg was also emphasized just the right amount.  Total cost for the shake and the sandwich including tax came to $15.  Both items came out within 2 minutes and it seemed like the D'Lite staff paid just as much attention to their dine in customers as their drive thru ones so both dining options are equally viable.  In addition to their flagship spot in South Scottsdale, they also have a location in North Scottsdale and in Tempe.  Overall I was pretty satisfied with my first breakfast outing here.  It wasn't perfect, but it was enjoyable, affordable, and efficient.  I would certainly come back for breakfast and will likely try their lunch menu at some point (rumor has it their house style protein burgers are popular).  D'Lite yourself in d'licious d'lectable goodness.  Sorry, I'll see myself out now.

A sad experience overall. I love their other locations, but this one seems neglected and frankly pretty dirty. All three locations are overpriced, but I feel like that's to be expected with trendy health food.  The California club was burnt but still tasty.   I brought my boyfriend and he ordered the "burger".  While I should have expected it; we were a little surprised to find out it was a black bean burger rather than meat.  We felt a little deceived especially considering the $9 price.    Looking more closely at the menu it does say what it's made of in the fine print at the top, but if you're just looking at the topping options it is easy to miss.  I do love their breakfast buzz and usually the California club is on point so I'll still go to their other locations, but this location is sad in comparison.

Very tasty. Everywhere we went was closed today (Monday) even though they showed it on Yelp. So instead if driving to the next closed location we decided to give this place a try. I highly recommend the cold brew expresso. Possibly the best cold brew that I have had. The are full menu all day. I enjoyed the Southwest Rice Bowl and my wife cleaned her plate, the Low Carb Breakfast.

My office is in Old Town Scottsdale so I have a lot of options for lunch. This little place is by far my favorite! My "usual order" is the "Man Salad" which is just amazing- lots of protein and good fats to keep you full all afternoon!  They are always so friendly EVEN when they're busy. The thing I like most, however, is simply how consistent they are. The salad is the same every time, their service is excellent every time, and they are as fast as possible every time. You see them hustling to get orders done as quickly as they can. The place is really just wonderful- keep doing what you're doing guys!

It's Saturday morning at 9am... I have been a fan of D*lish since they opened doors and the owner operated it. Well, it's been a while since I have visited because I have a three year old, so drive-thru's are always the better option for me to grab a drink and a bite to eat. We are always baffled that people will sit in the drive thru line which sometimes starts on Scottsdale road.  Today, I had time to wait as I needed to put my makeup on anyways. I look at the time so I could anticipate s possible future trip and what do you know, i had my breakfast sandwich and large green tea in hand in 6 minutes. I love it and am so proud that the local place can beat McDonald's across the street in a timed busy drive-thru race. The Cali breakfast sandwich was better than I remembered. I will never be afraid of their long drive-thru line again.

I love this place so I brought some girlfriends here the other day and they loved it too! We ordered the hummus plate (with no feta) to start which was a great idea of course! For myself I ordered the humanitarian with the broccoli side (no feta) and it was delicious! My friend and the cashier recommended it to me and I was not let down! The cashier was also super nice and awesome! I didn't get her name but props to her for dealing with us without complaints! 10/10

My mom and I were looking for a good place to eat yesterday and we thought we'd try this cute little spot that seemed to be full of people as we drove down Scottsdale Rd.  And yes, when we arrived inside the cafe, it was booming with young, fitness going clientele. Nice. No limping people here.  My mom ordered the low carb breakfast which she seemed to love that included an egg with cheese covered in a pesto sauce over a bed of greens. It also included a hash brown patty.   I ordered the humanitarian wrap, which consisted of a tomato wrapper with an assortment of veggies including zucchini, yellow peppers, broccoli, tomato, quinoa and hummus. So good. Right up our alley.   We loved the food there but I think what we loved most was the staff member who pulled a table for us because he saw that we were eating our food without one. The place was really small and there were tables outside but it was hot as shit so my mom decided she wanted to sit inside even if we didn't have a table.   There was a large group of people next to us still chatting away after they had finished their food, so the staff member just kindly grabbed one of their tables for us, letting them know that we needed it to eat. That was awesome. Those people were totally oblivious to the two ladies sitting right next to them eating food on their laps, like that's something we would have chosen to do even if there were available tables.  Anyway, lovely place. Wide variety of great healthy food. Young crowd mostly. Tiny location. Great service. Can't wait to return.

My favorite place for lunch ever. The staff are always so sweet and everytime i go, my food comes out so fast and is always correct. It is very clean inside as well. The manager always stops by the table and makes sure everything is tasting well. I have also gone through the drive through three times, and each time it has not been more than five minutes for my food which is really impressive. Definitely my go to place for something quick, cheap, and healthy.

On a business trip to Scottsdale, I discovered this place and ordered the California Club based on other Yelp reviews. To this day, I still crave the sandwich and have even tried to re-create this deliciousness at home (... just not the same)!
Really great food. Customer Service, Timing, and pricing could be improved. Don't go if your in a hurry.

How do I drive past this place every day and never stop?  Now that I've tried it... I won't make that mistake again!  D'lic has a great menu of fresh breakfast items including several vegetarian and gluten free selections.  Good bye starbucks, I found my new favorite coffee,  I'm so hooked!  Just beware the drive-thru is not super fast because all the food and drinks are made to order, but if you plan for a 10-15 minute wait you'll be fine.  The food is not cheap, but reasonable for fresh ingredients cooked to order.  Definitely give this place a try, great hang over cure after a nice out in OT!

Ok..sooo I've fallen in love with this really amazing place called D'lite! I had the best breakfast sandwich called California Club.. It's got eggs, bacon, basil pesto, avacado, tomatoes, pepper jack cheese and cream cheese on a bialy bagel.   Great service too! I will definitely be coming back!!

You can come for the food and drinks, or, you can come to people watch.  Seriously. Wake up in a Saturday/Sunday morning with nothing to do? Stop by D-lish, get a drink and enjoy the view. Soon enough, you'll see a stead flow of hipsters, Scottsdale party-goers in their walk-of-shame outfits and sorority girls in their Sunday best. Its absolutely stunning to see so many accidentally-overdressed people coming to a very very casual breakfast spot. And hey, most of them are pretty attractive- so its not like its a bad sight to see.  Customers aside, D'lish is an extremely popular spot for obvious reasons. Their breakfast items are a comforting deviation from your typical eggs Benedict, pancake stacks and omelettes, even tho they do have these components in one way or another.  For example, instead of your scramble eggs and bread, you can get the egg fritata on toast served with bacon and a pour of a smoky chipotle sauce. If you want something easier to eat or even "on the go", their club sandwich with egg is filling, hangover cure-tastic and pretty tasty. My one advice is to not get the veggie sandwich- its mostly green leaves and doesn't have the flavor and heartiness that we all need at 11am on a Saturday.  For drinks, I can't not order the orangina. It is extremely refreshing, not too sweet and gives me tons of energy (and Vitamin C). If you want to bulk up, their breakfast smoothie (with peanut butter, chocolate and other hearty items) is definitely a mouthful (dirty jokes aside!) but it is extremely popular for those peanut butter/chocolate smoothie lovers. Unfortunately, their iced chai is not worth ordering- it lacks flavor and its mostly just skim milk. :(  Pay at the counter and wait to get served at the table. Space is extremely limited, but luckily, many people chose the drive-through option so it is not too hard to get a table at prime time.  Hope to see your hungover asses there soon, if I haven't already....

This is my new favorite restaurant! The food is great, the service even better! Everyone is so friendly here. It is a great place to hang out as the dining room is one of the coolest I have seen. I will be back, probably way too often!

I want to thank the owners for a nice message and apology. I recently gave D'Lite another try (anonymously) and it was very much improved from my last visit. Everyone was friendly and they do what they can to keep the line of cars moving by taking your order before you get to the window.

Even tho this place has a drive thru I can see why this place is so popular. They have many items to choose from for breakfast or lunch!  They even have protein shakes and smoothies.  I ended up trying the croissant sandwich along with a soy caramel latte.  Both were perfectly created and made my Taste buds sing.  I know a breakfast sandwich doesn't seem like a complicated item to make but this was by far the best I've ever had.  Their egg was perfectly cooked where the yolk was not overly done and wasn't too runny either.  You can either go thru the drive thru or come inside and order and sit down and have the food come to you!  It's not very spacious inside...
You can't go wrong, really. AZ burro and an iced green tea is my ultimate comfort meal. Everyone who works here is so friendly, perfect way to start my day!

This place really delivers on their promise...Good food fast - but not "fast food!" I had the house style frittata and it was d'lish.   The staff was friendly, the place was clean and the ambiance was irie! I lived in Scottsdale for a few years and wish this place was around when I lived here. Enjoy a good meal and know that your pocket, your body (and the earth - they recycle and buy local) will be glad you did!

I got off my flight and came straight to D lite  on a recommendation from a friend. I got the black bean burger and pomegranate tea. It definitely hit the spot . So good I didn't have time to take a photo lOl.... It's healthy, clean and the service is efficient .I would def come back again and recommend it to anyone who is hungry and on the go.

I absolutely love this place! Yes the lines can be long at times, but the staff goes above and beyond to take your order. The staff have always been friendly and every one seems to really enjoy working there. My drink of choice is the "breakfast buzz" hits the spot every time. I am looking forward to going there tomorrow to get my buzz on!

I frequently eat at both the old town and Shea locations. The food is flavorful, well priced and mostly healthy. I always enjoy quick service. However, today, I had the worst experience there. The server could not get my order right at the drive through window. Ok, no big deal. Then it gets handed to me without my drink. Ok, no big deal. Then I get handed the incorrect drink. I politely mention this and the man helping me rudely tells me "nope, that is what you ordered and what you are going to get. I heard you on my headset". Ridiculous. I am really upset to be treated in such a manner. Really disappointing.

Always satisfied. Healthy food on the go is the best to me. This was one of my goto places in college. Now being done with college for some years now , I work back in the area and I'm so happy literally just because I can go here for breakfast and now lunch again !!   I've tried bagels- I get them toasted and I love the fact that they add the cream cheese on for me!! That's such a sweet touch!  The California club breakfast sandwich is very very good, although I could probably eat two because I'm hunger again soon after it's very tasting and I like the make up of the sandwhich.  And the Breakfast buzz shake is great. I was hesitant at first because of the pb - but they allow substitutions and have the vegan buzz too! This one is a must try!     They are opening up  a new location near my place in Phoenix and I couldn't be more excited!!!

For anyone who wants a quick and healthy meal to go, d'lish is the place to go. The california club is one of my favorites along with many more items on the menu. The service is always positive and quick. WIth its small interior, it makes for quick and easy service. The most popular item on the menu is the Breakfast Buzz which is a shake with bananas, vitamin, coffee, peanut butter and milk. If you want something healthy and fast to eat, the buzz is the way to go.
Went here for the first time. Ordered the early bird burger, bagel, orange juice and kombucha tea. I must say we were impressed by the burger and ingredients. Good place to have veggie food.

They have HANDS DOWN the best tuna salad sandwich I've had in The Valley. And also, because they understand that tuna sandwiches are delicious both cold and hot, I am now giving a hard pass on any tuna sandwich unless it's from D'lite. I eat fish, but can't stomach much else in the meat department and their southwestern bowl (without chicken) is a solid choice as well. I'm truly "living my best life" when I'm eating their tuna salad (good for those who are also a big dill like myself ) Thank you D'lite, what a great start to my culinary adventures this year
The California Club is amazing!!!! Staff is always upbeat and super friendly, this is a great place to eat healthy.

I needed some coffee today... so I rolled through the drive through and ordered my usual triple shot cappuccino with honey.   They do a great job here and I will definitely be back.  The coffee here rivals my usual spot copper star coffee.  The drive through is awesome... I love not having to get out of my car:).

Great emloyees and the blended BUZZ is the BOMB love it and the breakfast croissant is delicious  The only thing i would ask to change is to make the hours go longer i don't get out of work till 6:00 so i can only get me a Buzz on the weekends but still  Gve it a try this place is wonderful

This establishment was ok at best. The food selection wasn't inventive, and the time it took to receive a simple bagel sandwich was just under 10 minutes. The waiter was too busy flirting with my friend to carry out his job.

What a great alternative to McDonalds!  Great service, pleasing ambiance, and especially......the tasty & well prepared fresh food!  Our favorite: California Club!   Silver Palette Ladies Lunching Club

Crowded space but you can def get something healthy to go.  Tried their signature hummus wrap and California breakfast sandwich.  Very tasty.  The portions aren't huge but healthy.    Glad to have healthier joints in the East Valley.

I don't know why I haven't reviewed this place yet.  This is one of the best places in the Scottsdale/Tempe area to go for a filling, delicious, healthy meal.  I love, love, love their soups.  Their sandwiches and "burgers" are pretty tasty too.  The only thing I could ask for is that they start offering at least one gluten free bread option, like Chompies's gluten free rolls (so far the best gluten free bread option I have had), so that individuals with gluten sensitivity can enjoy their sandwiches and burgers.

A group of us came here for breakfast and really enjoyed D'lish.  We ordered their drip coffee and some bagels and found everything tasty.  The coffee was strong and HOT! If water boils at 212°F, then D'lish serves it at 210°F LOL  What was great about it?  It wasn't over roasted and burnt like the Green Mermaid.  Actually the three of us enjoyed our conversation waiting for it to cool.  The bagels were another surprise.  Given the small space of D'lish's building, I would love to find out where the get them.  My suspicion would be NY Bagel on Scottsdale Road, up near Shea Blvd.  But no matter, they were very good and hit the spot.  We'll be back for lunch.
The 'Man' Salad!! Yum!! Greens, small scoop of tuna salad, chicken breast, feta, bacon, tomato, avocado. Oh, did I mention bacon?! All super fresh and delicious!

I have only had their breakfast buzzes but just that alone makes me wish I still lived in Tempe so I could go more often. The lines can be a bit long but health orientated restaurants that also offer a drive thru are pretty hard to find.

Favorite breakfast place to eat in Scottsdale.  You can't go wrong with the AZ burro or California Club. Both are so good, I haven't even thought about trying anything new, although I soon will.  The green lemonade is the perfect (healthy)  drink to keep you feeling cool, and relaxed on a warm summer day.
I'm not a vegetarian but I really like their veggie burrito. It's a great mix of ingredients and the salsa adds good flavor. I've recently become quite the fan of their lattes as well.

Yum, yum, yum!!! This is such a good place to get a breakfast sandwich in the morning. I always get the California club, the best thing on the menu. It's on soft ciabatta bread, with perfectly cooked eggs, bacon, turkey, cream cheese, tomato, avocado, and the best part......PESTO! I would highly recommend this place. My friends enjoy their style of oatmeal as well as the black bean burger. It's great quality and the never let me down. The one thing that kind if sucks is their location. It's very small and the drive thru sometimes goes into the street. Not good! And parking is a bitch too. There's hardly any and it is just a very tight squeeze to get in. But the food makes it worth it!

Disappointing- I see a lot of cars here regularly so I dropped by to get lunch today. I ordered the southwest bowl, which consisted of a piece of broccoli and 4 pieces of chicken over rice. The sauce or soup in the bowl seemed to be thickened with something, I'm not sure how healthy it might have actually been. For about $10 I would have expected higher quality.
Very cool little spot. Love the concept of healthy fast food and reducing the impact on the environment. Awesome coffee. Californian club sandwich is a great way to start the day.

I've eaten here for breakfast three times while visiting family. My favorite is the oatmeal - which is actually quinoa. It's not too sweet. has yummy fresh fruits and stemmed milk. Their bialy sandwiches and breakfast burritos are also very good. Fresh ingredients makes the difference. The portion sizes are generous too.

Mickey, the GM there, is awesome.  I witnessed him go around to people at the restaurant, building rapport with them, getting to know them, caring about the people.   The food here is awesome, I've been alot to the other locations and it's just as good (which is the key for a franchise).   Breakfast buzz is the best iced drink in town, bar none.  I will spend way too much money at this establishment over the next few years, but I'm totally good with that.
This is the best kept secret. I ordered a breakfast club which was phenomenal and a breakfast buzz. I would highly recommend both. Their breakfast buzz is out of this world.
Refreshing and delicious!!  Hummus platter is my go to dish and this place did not disappoint.  Club sandwich split with a friend was the perfect size to hold us over after a long hike    Will return

Saw the great reviews and finally I have the same experience as others. To be fair, I've only had the signature Breakfast Buzz smoothie and a breakfast burrito. The smoothie is flippin amazing. So good I've gone back several days in a row to get it and this place is a bit out of the way for me. The burrito was just ok. A bit expensive (to me) for the size and fillings, plus it seemed a bit gummy to me. Not sure if that was the tortilla or the cheese, but to be honest I've had much better breakfast burritos.  The interior is super cute and very well done, they even have a drive thru. How convenient! The staff have also been very friendly and helpful. One day I will venture out and try out some of the other food they have and report back. So for now it is just one star shy of a full 5 because of the gummy burrito, but really above par on all other areas!
great low key breakfast, friendly staff. yummy quinoa granola and breakie burrito ($4.75).

I relocated from Phoenix to Tempe almost two years ago and D'Lish/D'Lite quickly became my coffee spot away from home. Consistently the most friendly staff who remembered my name and some of the best coffee I've had in the Valley. Usually I would just drink cold coffee black but sometimes I would go with the Breakfast Buzz for a change and absolutely loved it! The food is also 'd'lish'. My favorite is the toast with sausage, egg and hashbrowns with chipotle aioli.   Thank you especially to Shelby and Leonard for always being so cool and willing to chat when they're not incredibly busy.  Note, they are a popular spot and can get busy on Saturday mornings. There is additional parking down the side street. Great place to work during the week and people watch on the weekends. Ideal for coffee, food and conversation.

So thankful my girlfriend wanted to try this place out! I had no idea it was even here!!!! I had the California Club and it was AMAZE-balls!!!! Oh and a cappuccino. They were so fast and really everything was delicious. I will definitely back again!
veggie breakfast burrito and croissant sandwich were both excellent.  +1 service, +1 drive thru, +1 prices
Vegan Buzz. That is all. Wait. Also, try not to get killed when it's busy and fools in the drive through are backed up into the busy Scottsdale rd.

I'm going to give this place 5 stars as to me, it is a pioneer of the way fast food should be in this day and age. My wife and I ordered one item off the breakfast menu, a chicken sausage frittata, the kitchen sink salad and a veggie wrap. We finished up with a cafe mocha and chocolate, peanut, banana smoothie (yum!) The food was very good and came out pretty quickly. Everything was just fresh and they had a lot of healthy, vegetarian choices. The place is a little small inside but there is a nice size outdoor patio, they also have a drive through which is a convenient service. In a world dominated by Mcdonalds and other fast food establishments, finally, we have a healthy, convenient alternative!  I hope this trend continues and more of these type of places start popping up all over the place. Way to go D'lish, you really raised the bar on fast food for healthy minded people.
Food is amazing....fresh ingredients, healthy options, and best of all a drive-thru. Love the new location! Quick, easy, and tastes great, can't ask for more

I had always heard this place was amazing, but never checked it out until a little over a month ago.  We stopped in for lunch and brought our dog to eat out on the patio.  We enjoyed the baja chicken soup, a southwest chicken bowl, a raspberry italian soda, a lemonade and a dog bowl...everyone was happy and thoroughly enjoyed their lunch!

I stopped in last week on my day off before heading to yoga.  I enjoyed an everything bagel with cream cheese and an Orange Glorious - wow so tasty!  I have been craving the Orange Glorious ever since trying it...I will definitely be back!
I've been here for breakfast and the oatmeal is yum. Today I'm doing lunch. Man salad, sure to be satisfied as usual.
Amazing! My wife and I were blown away at the incredible taste of the food. We stopped in for breakfast. This is healthy food done right. I recommend this place to anyone who loves good food.

Everything I have eaten there is awesome! The humanitarian wrap is my favorite! We call in take out at least once a week at work and the food always consistent and prepared quick! The drive thru is very convenient also.  Highly recommended!
I usually love it here but today they barely put any cream cheese on my bagels. I didn't spend 9$ on 3 bagels with no cream cheese.

Taken in the context of the drive thru/fast casual there wasn't much to say about the decor of the South Scottsdale location.  However, the drive thru line was out to the street if that tells you anything.  I chose the Humanitarian Chix Supreme and the attendant put it in immediately.  Wasn't waiting too long before I got my wrap and headed to the house.  Although I'm not foreign to broccoli in a wrap/burrito I was a bit surprised.  The coupling of cold flavors was pretty tasty.  As far as healthy on the go, D'lite could be the spot.  The location looked small so I don't see myself doing walk-up service at this location.

Yes, please! The California Club is fantastic! This sandwich will fill you up and has a fantastic flavor. To be honest, I haven't tried anything else on the menu because the California Club is so good. Enjoy!

Locally grown and damn tasty. Walking distance from airport hotels and craft coffee and teas. Do it!!! They have this thing called a "man salad".. Im a man and dont eat salad unless its chicken or tuna, I ate this....still a man!  Do it!!!!!

had the kitchen sink salad - was expecting some serious ingredients piled on top of each other....thats not what I got. It was measly ingredients, fake chicken that looked pressed together and had no flavor. And it was small...for the price - this place is NOT worth going to. I have had better salads for less other places. Not impressed at all - a shame - the menu looks so good and I wanted to try other things - but if you can't get a salad right and use awesome ingredients - no thanks I wont return.

This place is so delish! The breakfast buzz is a genius idea to get you up in the morning.   Protein, almond milk, vitamins, banana, chocolate, peanut butter, and an espresso shot.  This place offers fast service, amazing quality and service! Thank you !

My wife and I came across D'lish on Yelp and with all the great reviews went for breakfast.  WOW!  First of all, small place and not one you would necessarily notice driving by.  It's in a small building, like an old fast food restaurant, complete with a drive thru.  We knew we would be OK when the drive thru line was backed up 5 cars deep into the street.  That kind of traffic means that somethings going way right here.  My wife had the the club sandwich and I had the low carb breakfast.  Both of us were blown away with how good everything was.  The menu has a lot of interesting items.  Ones we are going to try now and replicate at home.  If you are looking for an overpriced and fancy place, this is not the place for you.  If you want honest, excellent food and attention to the quality and makeup of the food, then don't miss D'lish.

I think this place is really overrated, while I found very cool to have a healthy choice on the go without leave the car, the space for the drive thru is shared with the parking lot, so it's crowded, I felt anxiety just to see the cars behind me and at my side parking or coming out from their spot, besides that the service is very slow not like as a fast food drive thru... I easily spent like 15 minutes on the cars line and waiting...an eternity for me considering this is a drive thru... Now the other costumers were also anxious they started to honk their claxon and well that's not nice neither... The prices are high for the quality and amount of food that you get. And the food is not really healthy at all! I will not come back and I will not recommend to anyone I care, so much trouble just for the wait to open my bag at home and find it's not at i was expecting from a healthy salad spot, no thanks!  By the way there's another salad drive thru a couple of blocks going to south I haven't tried but I will give them a visit to try them.

I really liked our stop at D'lish. It was first place we visited when we stepped off the plane for Spring Training, and just the breakfast I had been wanting since 3:30 AM. Thanks to all the great Yelpers in Scottsdale, we decided quickly on D'lish, and found it to be up to all the hype. The food is delicious, healthy, and fast, and we were not at all disappointed. The inside is small, but we had a great spot on the outside. As someone who loves to eat on the healthy side, this was the perfect stop to get us geared up for a weekend of baseball.

First time at this location...Staff was super friendly and overall service was excellent in the drive thru. I got the Southwest Rice Bowl and It was meh, little more soupy than I imagined. I've had a sandwich here before and remember it being really tasty. So wraps/sandwiches may be the way to go! Also, they gave my dog Charlee a treat, so she's a fan!. Always nice to have healthier options in the neighborhood! We'll be back to try some other stuff on the menu.

My wife and I read all the great reviews and decided to give this place a try. The workers were very nice, however the place is a dive. Lots of flies, dingy, very loud rock music playing inside(probably to drown out all the heavy traffic noise outside) We got a breakfast club and a lunch club sandwich. The egg sandwich had lots of mayo on it, which we thought odd. We had to leave before we were finished due to the bugs. About an hour after we got home, we both had upset stomachs. If you're a fan of loud dingy places with lots of flies served up on the side, this is for you.

First time trying this place out today. I heard so much about it on the radio. Especially about the breakfast buzz drink so I had to stop by and see what the buzz was about. See what I did there? :) I got the California club breakfast sandwich and the breakfast buzz drink and OMG that drink was AMAZING! The food was freakin' delicious too. I was not disappointed. The place lived up to the radio hype. Nice to have a healthy alternative to fast food. Just wish one was closer to my side of town.

The thing I love about this place is that its simple. Sandwiches, salads, soups. Breakfast and Lunch. There menu is specific.... what comes on the meal and what health benefits (if any). They do not serve soda. Tea, lemonade and coffee. Staff was knowledgeable and quick. No complaints.

California club, all the way, I love their breakfast sandwiches. They're so tasty, the breakfast buzz is also worth mentioning, I don't really dig on the quinoa oatmeal, so pass on that and stick with the sandwiches. They also have kombucha sometimes, which I dig in the morning, because I'm a masochist with vinegar tasting beverages, per my boyfriend at least. Is a little spendy though.

Best tuna sandwiches on the planet.  And truly top-notch menu, full of vegetarian choices, (and many that include include meat if you are into that).  Drive through takes a while sometimes, but it is well worth it. We need more healthy fast food places like this. Everything I have ever had at D'lish is amazing, and it is fresh and healthy!  One of my favorite places for sure, but I wish they didn't close quite as early, I could eat there any time of day. D'lish needs to be nation wide.  Also, they a few menu options for dogs, which obviously just makes me love them even more.  Heidi, my german shepherd rescue and official canine foodie, says she would prefer that the doggie options had a little more meat to go along with all the rice, but at the end of the day she doesn't mind eating around the rice that she considers bland on its own.  "There is no whining when I'm wine-ing, if my dog is with me dining."  -Dog Mom Dining

Stopped by on my way to work and ordered a protein breakfast smoothie, two ice teas, and their oatmeal. The ice tea is always great, and I enjoyed my smoothie - but the oatmeal... terrible! It appeared to be warm milk with some grains, apples and bananas. I thought they forgot the oatmeal! My co worker (whom I bought it for) and I were very confused. I glanced at the menu before I wrote the review and realized that no, they didn't forget it, there is no actual oatmeal in the oatmeal. They call it "oatmeal our way" and list the ingredients as quinoa, maple drizzle, fruit, granola and steamed milk. OK maybe my fault for not realizing it didn't list oatmeal as an ingredient but seriously.. Don't call it OATMEAL. For $6.00 I was very disappointed. I don't know anyone that would enjoy it. It was a 20oz cup filled with 80% milk and some fruit and the quinoa. I gave 3 stars because usually their food is good, overpriced, but good. But seriously, think about offering a disclaimer or something.

So delicious, I would go there every morning if it was closer to me.  My Favs: Breakfast Buzz, Chai Tea Latte, Breakfast burro, my gosh I don't think it is possible to go wrong here. Everyone I have shared D'lish with ends up addicted.
Nice menu but drive through and parking are pain. Good price though. Patio seating and WiFi are plus!

This place is delicious! I had a breakfast burrito with black beans, mushrooms, eggs and cheese and fresh salsa on the side! I also had a prickly pear tea and a almond milk latte both were on point! The second time I dined in and had a big salad and a wrap that were also yummy! I love that they have a drive through. I wish they were open later in the day. For a quick healthy bite to eat I definitely recommend this place.
