My only negative would be one of the staff members she has been there both times I have been there, she mumbles and doesn't really smile.... if you don't like people, don't work in customer service! All the other staff was great! I can't fault them for one bad tomato!

Over rated. Way too expensive, location SUCKS, and the employees nickel and dime you for every thing extra dressing, salsa or sweetener everything is gonna cost you. A salad runs about $10 with tax and then add all the extras. Too many other great options in the area to be nickel and dimed over condiments.

Hello friends... I have been searching this earth for the perfect blend of black tea my entire life.  It has taken decades to come up with what I truly  believe is unparalleled....until now! Decades of life have been wasted, as you can now easily find a better Iced Tea at this amazing little gem of a restaurant.  Tea is one thing, but we were absolutely floored by the great customer service especially from our fabulous host named Patty.  She welcomed us to lunch, we had a great time, and we can't wait to come back.  Cars line up around the block for food at this place, but I'll have a hard time not coming in to see Patty now.. oh yeah.. the Tuna sandwich was dank!

I stop at D'lish almost every morning for a large coffee and a bagel.  The coffee is delicious and is great black.  To me the sign of a good coffee is one I can drink and enjoy without adding sugar or cream and this is it.  The D'veggie (sp?) bowl for lunch/dinner is so good I would eat it every day.  I did try their version of breakfast oatmeal the other week and it was phenomenally good.  I will definitely be having it again.  2010/10/06 - Went for lunch today with some coworkers and it was as good as always.  All of the inside tables were full, but it was cool enough to sit outside and the guys brought our food out to us.  One of my friends had the protein burger and said it was really good.  I once again had the D'Veggie bowl and really need to get something else, but it is SO GOOD!

I was looking for some breakfast while traveling in Phoenix. I was looking for a place that would be on the healthier side and I want disappointed! This was a smaller place so I don't recommend staying with a large group but they make the food pretty quickly and the food was amazing. I had their signature California breakfast Wrap and every bite was delicious. Pretty affordable of a healthy breakfast wrap and a cup of coffee.

The food here is amazing, the California club and AZ burro are popular and for good reason. I came on a weekday morning so it's not as busy as on the weekends. The building is very small and primarily a drive thru ordering system with about a dozen seats inside and another dozen outside. Not sure that I would wait in a line for 20 minutes for a burrito or sandwich but overall the food is excellent, healthy, and there's a good variety of hot and cold beverages.

Go here a few times a week for their healthy food and amazing Breakfast Buzz drink! The staff is always friendly and very quick with getting their customers served! If you have a chance to go to D'Lish, absolutely do it!!!
Great food and nice staff will return for sure when I get to town again

Had an amazing breakfast here this morning. I have long been a fan of the location on Scottsdale Road, but it is tiny and always kind of a cluster. This location has a much bigger, beautiful, modern, clean space. Had the California club egg sandwich. Soft ciabatta bread that held together well. Perfect balance of filling and bread. Very focused on local, fresh, organic ingredients. Very friendly staff. I will definitely be back for breakfast or lunch when I'm in this area.

Favorite bfast joint in Scottsdale hands down! Quick and healthy food. My favorite is the California Club. Their coffee is pretty good as well. Only negative is the location! There's always a line in the drive through out onto Scottsdale road and because of this you can never park in their lot.  But despite always being busy I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for my food. I'm sad I waited so long to try this place when I used to live just around the corner!
Being a visitor to Arizona, this was a great local spot for breakfast.  Great coffee and natural food choices and very friendly service.  Highly recommended.
I love this place! Everything Ive ordered has been amazing food! The Man Salad is probably a top fav! I wish it was open for dinner, LOL
Insane!!!! Please open a location in Cali!! We were in town for the weekend and went here two times! Amazing food super nice staff they help you a lot!! Keep jammin this place rocks!!

Not gonna lie, this place is pretty good.  I have only gotten the humanitarian chicken pesto wrap since I've been coming here and it's pretty filling-and super healthy! It is a bit pricey- came to about almost $10 for the wrap, $13 with a drink. And I just had to tip $2 for the great service. But it is pretty tasty and healthy. This is my go to spot when I'm in the area for lunch.
Great little drive thru breakfast.  AZ burrito was excellent.

Baby breakfast buzz. That's pretty much my usual order at this point. You will recognize it is a lot of regulars at this point that know the menu and will wait in the line. It is worth it because the food is healthier and catered towards people on the go that don't want fast food..and the menu is also very vegetarian/vegan friendly. I enjoy Dlish and mostly everybody in Scottsdale knows about this place by now and if you don't then you're missing out. Five stars for friendly service and tasty meals.

All I can say is "OMG"!!!  The first thing I had here after a friend brought me for a quick breakfast was the California club.  It really was like a party in my mouth!  I'm not kidding.  Everything on the menu looks so good I can't wait to try it all.  I'm a little embarrassed to admit it but I have circled all the items that I really want to try on the menu and I'm going through them one by one (I'm a total list crosser-offer).  The last thing I tried there was "oatmeal our way". Which is actually not oatmeal at all, but SO incredible!

D'Lite has a super healthy menu that really lends toward active lifestyles I love their breakfast buzz, can't get enough of them.  I usually order the vegan buzz with plant based protein.  They do an incredible job at putting a healthy spin on typical breakfast items like breakfast burritos and the oatmeal their way.  I've had several of their sandwiches and salads for lunch, all are filling and leave you feeling great.  Staff is very friendly and drive thru moves quik! Highly recommend.

I moved from Scottsdale one year ago, and I can tell you that this is the place I miss the most.  Their food is fresh, healthy and served drive-thru - nothing better.  Literally the perfect start to a Saturday / Sunday morning.  My favorites are the breakfast buzz and California Club. Never disappoints.

Their AZ burrito was great. The flavor journey ended way too soon though. The portion size was disappointing, very small. The salsa included was not very authentic, not good. Service was mediocre, lacking professionalism, what do you expect near ASU though? I would probably not go back again as it was also expensive! :/

Always consistently great for me... I love the low carb salad... I see a lot of ppl are upset with the long time for the drive through.  The secret is to park at super burrito and order or dine inside..  or even better call in your order ahead of time!

I'm so disappointed! I was looking forward to trying D'lite and ended up having order envy of literally every person around me. When my d'veggie bowl came out I was honestly shocked at how small and unsubstantial it was. I think I finished it in 6 bites and they forgot the bagel chips which really would have helped the situation. At $10 I wouldn't recommend this dish to anyone who is actually hungry. Also, they kids' meal options are anemic. My daughter's $5 grilled cheese was very lonely. At that price point kids' options usually come with a vegetable or fruit on the side and a beverage. Not here - just a sandwich all by itself on a plate. The smoothies, burritos and salads around me looked worth returning for at some point but I won't be hurrying back to try them.

So I discovered D'lish today during my Friday lunch excursion and i have to say I'm quite delighted to have stumbled upon the place. I work close by and have always struggled with my local occupational coffee situation. Ya see... I love to put my money in locally owned and operated businesses, but the cafe at my work location serves horrible coffee so I have been wearing a disguise and hitting the Starbucks drive through to make it through some work days. until today.... D'lish has marvelous fair trade locally roasted espresso that is prepared to the coffee connoisseurs delight.   For lunch I had the hummus plate with chicken and the creamy tomato basil soup. The hummus plate was just OK (reason why the 5th star wasn't added to this review). The hummus was a little bland and the chicken was soggy as if it had been precooked and thawed. However, I really like how they serve veggies with their hummus plate and not just pita. The creamy tomato basil soup, on the other hand, was superb or shall i say D'lish.   The atmosphere is relaxing, cozy and unique with a bit of urban flair. I'll have to bring my laptop next time and relish the ambiance while I get some work done.  I'm so excited that I found good quality locally roasted coffee... I will definitely be back and I'm looking forward to giving a try to the rest of the menu.

I've only ordered one thing on the menu...and that's the House Style frittata. It's amazing. That's why I kept ordering it. I've also had the Breakfast Buzz shake minus the peanut butter and that was also great.   One thing that's weird about the drive thru is that they walk up to you and ask what you want. Like, before you've seen a menu. Idk what i want yet dude ! If you ask, they give you a menu, but I just think that that's weird. There's probably a small percentage of people who know what they want before looking at a menu. So give me one first, then ask later...anyway not a big deal.

Been here several times with the drive thru and eating inside.  Service is good but the food Quality has gone downhill.  So disappointing that the Frittata was not fresh... Nuked eggs were not good.  Reheated frittata was overdone.

Liked it. Better than expected. The food is super fresh, varied, and healthy. Not inexpensive, but not outrageous. Good choice for a fast, quality meal. P.S. It's not just takeout. The inside is relatively inviting..couches and everything.
Love this place, always satisfied. They're breakfast buzz smoothie is seriously addicting and they probably think I'm crazy because I'm there at least 4 times a week.

Awesome food and fast service! I had the California club, which was a jam-packed sandwich with lots of flavor - bacon, pesto, avocado, tomato, eggs - all with the freshest ingredients. My mom enjoyed the nuts and berries salad which she says was delightful and crisp. I can't say enough about 'The Buzz' either... a creative morning drink with peanut butter, espresso, banana and chocolate. I could have that every day and I wouldn't get sick of it. I wish I lived closer, this would easily become a favorite weekend restaurant, especially with the drive thru option! These people know what they're doing.
Favorite place!! everything is awesome! There green tea and breakfast buzz are the best.

My dad and I searched up and down for a good breakfast place and stumbled upon this gem. It was EXACTLY what we were looking for. Cool vibe, friendly staff, vegan options, free wifi, good food... Just excellent!

Average food. Noisy inside. Not a lot of parking, actually horrible parking. I got caught in the drive thru trying to leave. It's like healthier fast food. I had the breakfast burro and my wife had the Cali club. Both were average to me.

Awesome lunch spot! Every time I go here I leave satisfied... I used to go here all the time when I worked at Skysong but now have moved up to DC Ranch area.   Not going to lie, I have driven all the way down to Old Town on several occasions just to get lunch here... Granted I am obsessive and like the place alot, but either way, great little spot that you might miss driving by it!  Here are why I don't give it 5-stars: --They need more hours, open later... I mean their location is out of the Old Town foot traffic, I get it, but still! --Need to get the Drive Through situation worked out a little better...

I have dreamed of a place like this since I can remember.. "Why isnt there a convenient drive-thru place with delicious food? The kind of place that caters to scenarios such as being hungover in your outfit from night before and desiring something so much more than your regular egg mcmuffin and hash brown.  I highly recommend the breakfast burrito/turkey sausage accompanied with green tea. . refreshing and sinfully D'lishous :)

I really like their sandwiches (my favorite is the california club).  Can be quite busy in the morning and the drive-thru gets really crowded (we can't even access to the parking behind sometimes), but i guess that's a good sign, right?  Other than that, I would definitely recommend for those who like a healthy sandwich in the morning.

I am not sure about this place. I like it but my god was it dirty as hell! I am mean so freakin dirty I am not sure what the hell was going on. Trash cans over flowing with trash, trash all over the floor and under stuff, all the way into the Kitchen. It was terrible. I had the veggie wrap. It was OK. nothing special. My kids had turkey and chicken sandwiches which were ok. My wife had quinoa thingy which is just veggies and quinoa in a soup. It was good but clearly a pre made soup most. I am not sure I would go to this location again due to it being FILTHY! I don't care if they were slammed for lunch and in the weeds they should have cleaned up. They were all standing around not cleaning a damn thing. Not sure if I would give them a second chance...Coffee was mediocre at best

I love this place... I have been here for breakfast and lunch and have not been disappointed. I just moved here from San Diego and it's nice to finally find a place in Scottsdale with Healthy options, good prices and fast, friendly service!!

What a wonderful place to get a fast and healthy drive through breakfast or lunch!   The eggwhites veg burrito is outstanding.   The service is smart , quick and friendly.   This is my new go to place near work!

EAT AT D'LISH!  Food is great. You can have a healthy breakfast/lunch or cure your hangover with fritatas and breakfast burritos. The coffee is the upper echelon as well.  The atmosphere is great - friendly, hip, personal - the likes of which i haven't seen since I left Manhattan (with the exception of a couple vacations to San Francisco and Amsterdam).  BIG PLUS: d'lish is staffed by pretty good looking people and the clientele is as friendly as they are.   STOP DRIVING UP AND DOWN SCOTTSDALE RD. WONDERING "how that place d'lish is." I finally stopped in and have been back every Sat & Sun since.

I won a gift card and was excited to try this new place. On food alone, this place is a 5. We ordered the AZ burro and the California Club. Both were delicious, but the CC was the stand out! This place lost points on atmosphere. The parking lot was super tiny and with the drive thru, it made it difficult to get in and out. The inside was tiny and super loud so we ate outside. However the street traffic was almost as noisy since it's on busy Scottsdale Road. I will be back, but next time I'll just go through the drive thru.

I went to this small restaurant after my camel back hike.  The food is light, tasty, and cheap!  Easy go to spot for a smoothie, healthy wrap or salad.  I highly recommend this place if you want something that taste good and is healthy.  The drive through is a bit ridiculous, while I was sitting down I saw a few fights break out because of the long line that extends out to the street.  But it's not the restaurant's fault.
Love this place! Cali club is the best also the breakfast buzz! Customer service is always great! A little pricey but definitely worth the price

Love their healthy menu options and hefty portions. I would recommend the California Club for breakfast or the Tuna Sandwich for lunch! They do a nice twist on all the entrees like adding pesto or honey sauce. Be sure you have plenty of time because they are always packed. If attempting the drive thru make sure you come at it from the South so you can get in line from the street. Customer service is great and will come out to your car to order to make the line move faster.

The California club is so yummy!! Thick cut bread, over medium eggs, avocado, pesto, bacon, tomato. So good...only thing they could do better is use better quality bacon. A couple of times, the bacon was super fatty, not crunchy. The dirty chai is amazing.

The California club and breakfast buzz are amazing! I wish they would have another location more north, although the drive and wait are worth it for this place!!  Has a drive-thru if you're grabbing something on the way to work!

This place is phenomenal! The food is so fresh and tasty the guys that work there are truly very nice which is harder and harder to find these days.   I would definitely recommend this place to every.

Yum yum yummmm!!!! So hard to find quick n easy choices as a vegetarian. love their traditional burrito. my boyfriend loves their veggie burgers (not a vegetarian) so thats always a plus! i love this little place to start my day

At first I was confused by D'lish, how can drive-thru be healthy? I walked in to meet a friend and fell in love with the small menu (Side note: I dislike big menus - they overwhelm my indecisive self)! How often can you go somewhere and get a dish made with quinoa, being that I am recovering vegetarian, I was super excited! Then he brought out this "pasta" dish and as the name states it was D'lish! The great thing about D'lish is that each dish is freshly made with locally grown produce. I've been there several times and everything I've had has been refreshingly healthy, balanced, and tastes great.   The owner keeps telling me that I need to come in and try breakfast but since I live in Gilbert I have yet been able to make it over. Maybe one of these Sundays, I'll stumble in my dancing heels from the night before to try their breakfast sandwich and the infamous "Breakfast Buzz" shake, which according to the owner is THE cure for a hangover.   P.S. The hype surrounding the Dirty Chai is well deserved because it is as fabulous as my new dancing heels!

Tried this place for the first time and it was fantastic.  Nice inside, the front counter girl was more a brand ambassador than an employee.  Give that girl a raise or maybe I'll hire her.  Food was satisfying, filling yet light and delicious.  Girlfriend remarked that the coffee was awesome.  See you guys again soon!

Everything is delicious and fresh. Can't go wrong with the breakfast buzz and Cali club!!! Wish they had a D'Lish up in the north Scottsdale area but for now I don't mind driving to south Scottsdale or Tempe!! Highly recommend this!
I'm in love with their Breakfast Buzz, hummus with chicken plate, broccoli salad and their veggie delight (I add turkey). So happy there is a drive thru that offers healthy food!!
Breakfast buzz shake. The best guilt free shake that I know of it's just about all protein. A great meal replacement. I'm sold love it. I've also gotten the veggie breakfast burrito. So good aswell.

The California Club was good but this is a drive through joint with a need for some customer service training. I couldn't even get in to park without being part of the drive through line. So instead of going on, I went though the drive through.  They took orders from the line "portillos" style which is fine, but when I got to the window a woman handed me the bag and walked away. She didn't give me utensils so I sat there waiting for her to return for several minutes. After about 3-5 minutes, I beeped my horn to request utensils..and still waited a few more minutes.

It was the afternoon so I said why not try a non breakfast sandwich, so i took a chance on the "chicken panini" (added avocado because as you know which you all should avocado is a gift from the gods) AND IT BLEW MY BRAINS!  I ate it so quick I couldn't take a picture or I would upload its deliciousness to it can stimulate your eyes as it did my stomach.  This place never disappoint's, EVER!
First timer. It was okay, i ordered the breakfast club. I didn't have much time to look at the menu. Next time trying something else. Then ill decide if i like the place lol

My wife and I had lunch there today and loved it. I had the turkey club and she had the tuna sandwich. She had an ice tea and I had the kombucha tea. Sandwiches were good but what I'm more excited about is the kombucha tea. It's like a sour Belgian beer but it's a cold tea. Craziest beverage I've ever had, in a good way!  Service was great as well.

The breakfast buzz shake just may be the best shake I've ever had. The food is definitely a healthy alternative to other fast food joints and is still delicious at the same time. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to grab a quick meal and not suffer the feeling of fast food regret 15 mins after you have eaten.

I was happy to see another "non-hookah" related establishment go up in my neighborhood. I tried a crossaint breakfast sandwich and a GIANT green tea. Came out to $11. The tea was great. The $6 sandwich was smaller than my fist. I realize this is a "health" food place and that "we use fresh produce whenever available" but I left hungry. I hope they realize how tough the summer will be.

Kitchen sink salad is amazing! It comes with chewy, soft bagel "chips" on the side and the salad itself is a pretty decent portion of yummy quinoa, lettuce (arugula?), and lots of other goodies. You won't get bored with this salad, that's for sure. This salad has bagel chips in it, which I was skeptical of at first, but they came in a separate bag and were soft and chewy, just like a bagel should be!  I've tried a few bites of other items like the breakfast burrito and the club, both of which were tasty. I've been wanting to try the burgers since they sound so delicious, but they're always out of them, even before noon!   As for drinks, I've tried the soy chai, almond chai, and dirty soy chai. I've gotta say, don't mess with perfection-the soy chai is where it's at! Also, their lemonade is BOMB, and I hate lemonade usually. The girl behind the counter said it's not homemade but it's "really expensive" lemonade they get delivered, and I totally believe her.  Only complaints are the hours (they close so early!) and the parking situation, which totally sucks. Parking requires Austin-Powers style maneuvers going from reverse to drive back and forth, but its totally worth it. Part of this is because they have a DRIVE-THRU, which is awesome, but the line is sooooooo long (all the time!), so it's worth it to just park and go inside or order if you don't call ahead. Also, you can call ahead and go through the drive-thru to pick up your order if there's no line!  Overall, cheap and delicious but lame hours and parking situation!

OMG YOU GUYS. The California club is incredible. The flavors work perfectly together and every bite is pure bliss. I just had it for the first time about ten minutes ago and will likely be back tomorrow for another. This sandwich is a mix of egg, avocado, tomato, cream cheese, some sort of sauce, all on a warm and tasty bun. On another note, prior to this afternoon I would always get the top notch burger, which is a black bean and quinoa patty, no meat (bacon) and add avocado. It is positively delectable as well- A great BBQ sauce accompanies the ingredients. The staff is great, even offering dog treats when my furbaby is in the car with me. Additionally, the staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and quick with service. This place is excellent in every way!

Seriously thebomb.com. I get the chicken panini with the side of broccoli, and each time it come out super delicious! The staff is friendly and bring out your food in a timely manner. The drive through option is super convenient!! Love this place

Ever want an abundance of healthy food that'll make you feel like you just walked out of an all-you-can buffet on a lazy Sunday afternoon? Then D'lite is the place for you!  The combo meal (Any which/wrap AND any side AND a drink) is too much for a lunch meal. Nonetheless the Tuna sandwhich is the best secret sauce/dill/cheese/spring mix/onion/cucumber/tomato/feta concoction. Portobello soup was satisfying fulfilling. We thought the Hummus plate was going to come in half size... well we thought all the items were going to be half size tbh.  We walked away with full teas and leftovers for snacks... for two days from now because that's when we'll feel hungry again!
Hard to find healthy food that tastes so good! I always stop by this place when i go to arizona. Definitely a favorite
The best! California breakfast club is so good. Its easy, quick and I know it will be good!

I love this local spot. Everyone that works here is friendly, laid back and willing to help you figure out what you're craving.  My breakfast go to is their breakfast buzz with almond milk. It's a quick, nutritious and equally delicious jolt of caffeine with protein. It's filling and it keeps me full until lunch.   For lunch, my go to is there tuna salad wrap. It's not your typical tuna salad, because they refrain from using mayonnaise (thank heavens ), I also sub out the wrap for a sundried tomato one. So good!

OH I so wanted to love this place.  Coffee: TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!! Oatmeal: OMG- watery quinoa, cold with mushed banana and berries Kitchen Sink Salad: Looked AMAZING....zero taste, no dressing and small.  All were to go...    Staff were very nice, super cute place....but a huge disappointment. Heard the juices are good but certainly won't be eating there again. :(
Breakfast sandwiches and croissants are just sooo good and healthy. Try their vanilla iced coffee as well!
It won't be long until this locations is as busy as their original. Great service and cool Modern look inside. Nice and quiet on a Saturday at 9:30 to enjoy a breakfast buzz!

I gave D'lish a second chance and the service was much better this time! The guys who work here are funny, friendly, and make you feel welcome. I like that they use all natural ingredients in everything they make here and I think that's why the food tastes so great.

Wow.. I love love D'lish. Food is so good and so well priced. I ended up getting the quinoa oatmeal for breakfast and with no regrets either. My friend got the breakfast bagel with eggs and bacon.. it was so filling that she ended up only eating half. I loved my oatmeal as well, the portions were perfect and it was D'lish! Would definitely love to come here for breakfast again
This place is awesome!  Great concept, and a breakfast buzz with extra espresso is gonna be wayyyyy better for you than anything blended from Dutch Brothers!!!

I have to say this place has delicious food!! Found this place off of yelp trying to find a breakfast place to meet all the needs of everyone in our group and this place did its job. I will say parking is a hassle especially when the drive thru is packed. Yes it is a small place but I must say this place is worth it!! I recommend the southwest rice bowl hands down! Can't wait until the next time I visit here just to eat here again.

Love this place! 4 stars instead of 5 only because the staff don't have much in the way of personality even though they do a good job...just a personal thing. Been here 3 times in 2 weeks. I love that they 1) serve breakfast the whole day, 2) have a varied menu with health benefits noted and 3) have suriracha sauce on every table. I've had the breakfast burrito and a breakfast sandwich, both withr availability of chicken and/or bacon. Can't remember what else I had but everything has been good so far. Oh yeah, the 3-berry smoothie was tasty!

Im obsessed. Every single day before work I have to pick up a thug buzz and a California Club sandwich to get me through my day. Its so delicious and filling! Someone recommended this place to me and I highly recommend to anyone!! I really wish there was one in north phoenix!!

This place is fabulous! Everyone who works there is very friendly and great at helping you find something you will love. I go there at least once a week and get my favorite drink... an iced chai latter with almond milk. It is the BEST coffee drink I have had! I definitely recommend trying it, as well as their food items. I have only ate there for breakfast but everything on the menu looks d'lish and healthy! Plus, all of the items are all labeled as either vegetarian, gluten-free, dairy-free, protein packed or balanced, which is helpful for those with food sensitivities.   All in all, I highly recommend this place for coffee, breakfast, lunch and even a mid-day snack.

I love this spot for a quick, healthy drive-thru lunch! They offer a great menu full of healthy dishes. My favorite is the Veggie D'Light wrap. the sauce is so tasty and I love all of the veggies. Great staff, too - they're always friendly and fun.  I haven't tried their breakfast, but want to. Great local spot!

i also order the california club like others here with coffee. but i made it veggie as i prefer not to eat meet. it was great, they put a veggie Patti which was great.   Its a good place for vegeterians
Food is delicious, smoothies and shakes are delicious, everything about this place is delicious!

I've been eager to try this place. The staff was really nice so that was good. I got a burger with bacon and grilled onion. They forgot to put on mushrooms like I asked for. The bun was a disappointment. And the quinoa black bean burger was dry and bland. It wasn't the veggie burger I was expecting. Sadly.

This is my first time there, I got a drink that was recommended by a friend and it was amazing! The line took a little bit but once I got to the window there was a very sweet blonde girl that helped me.
Love taking my girlfriend's daughter here! Vegan buzz is the way to go. Also had the Arizona Burro which is out of this world with their salsa on top.
Love this place! The location is clean, open, and welcoming. The food and drinks are as healthy as you would like. My family and I stop here a few times a week at least!

First let me start by saying the parking here is a nightmare. HOWEVER you can just go through the drive thru and continue on with your day without missing a beat.  I love having healthy food options available in a drive thru!!! Seriously- I can get a protein shake, rice bowl, hummus, or great salads all within minutes! Lately I've just been getting the breakfast buzz smoothie which is very filling. The prices are very comparable with other fast food options as well.

Probably time to update this review.. I've been here quite a few times since last rating and they have definately improved.  As always, the food at D'lish is wonderful. Great combination of salads, unique and healthy sandwiches, a bonus of tasty protein shakes. The atmosphere is still good as well-kind of trendy, but good mix of students and locals. The parking and drive thru are still cramped (nothing they can do there), but they've improved the drive thru speed by taking orders carside during busy times. Which leads me to the biggest update... happily, the real change and improvement comes from their service. I remember a time when service here was slow and painful. No more. The new crew is pleasant, helpful and competent. Hallelujah.

Have had breakfast here a couple of times when I come to Tempe no business trips.  Always quick, friendly, and good quality.   Made a misjudgment this latest visit and I ordered the wrong item (too early for the brain to work properly)....anyhow when he brought me what I ordered I thought perhaps they too my order wrong NOPE it was totally my bust.  He said no problem he would replace it with what I really wanted.  Even after I offered to pay for both....  That's really cool.

I enjoyed it and the flavors. I had the chicken panini and the bf had the breakfast bagel. It doesn't include any sides but we weren't too hungry anyway.   Service was fine... run by some older teens. Not that friendly but not bad service either. I think one kid was in training as I think I knew the menu better than he did, and it was my first time there! :-P I'm sure he'll do fine.

I love this place.  Been here just a few times, but everything has been great.  This morning I ordered the kombucha (always good) and the low-carb breakfast.  Looking at the ingredients of the breakfast (eggs, tomato, hash browns, mixed greens) I was a little nervous, but gave it a shot and was not disappointed.  The pesto "dressing" pulled it all together.  Well played D'lish, well played.

This place has wonderful, interesting food and a cute, small indie shop vibe with an outdoor patio - love it!!  Their protein burger, house style, is probably my favorite veggie burger in the valley. They call it hearty and healthy, and it is, but the taste is the best part: house style has portobello, feta, pesto, cucumber sauce and tomatoes - wow!!   Delicious breakfast, too, and they have a bustling drive-through window. Come early: they close at 4pm. And watch out: they have no public restrooms.

Had a very enjoyable breakfast here. The low carb breakfast was filling and tasty. Service was incredibly fast and efficient. We hung out on the patio for a good hour after we ate and no one encouraged us to leave. Yes, it was hot and patrons were mostly drive through but still, no one bugged us.   Customers kept coming out with this delicious coffee/shake beverage but I never got a chance to ask them what it was. I will definitely be back for breakfast and order that yummy looking concoction.

D'Lish is my go to spot for a healthy but very tasty breakfast. I have had  a bunch of things here, from the frittata to the AZ breakfast burro, the croissant breakfast sandwhich to the chicken/curry/vegetable/basmati rice thing...and it's all legit!  Reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is simple: it's a bit pricey ($8 for a breakfast burrito or $5 for a small croissant breakfast sandwich is a bit much) and the parking situation here is brutal. Drive-thru line up could literally leave you out on the street.  But again...it's VERY good food
Their hash browns aren't deep fried after all :D Wooohoooo !

Was visiting a pal in Scottsdale and he mentioned this place.  Everything on the menu sounded good.  A few selections for each options. I got a "burger" with bbq sauce and Swiss.  The burger was black beans and quinoa.  It had a decent texture, tasted great.  The bbq sauce was a good amount of spicy.    A plus is they are environmentally conscious.  They tell you what goes in what bin. They use actual dishes.  Definite pluses!  The staff was super friendly.  Made the visit very positive

This particular Monday I was in the mood for something healthy and affordable and with it's overwhelming positive reviews I figured it would be a place to check out.  After waiting in line in the drive through for what seemed like forever, I finally inched through the tiny drive-through/parking area and ordered my food.  The selection is limited and I think the price is misrepresented.  I would probably put it at least at $$.  For a simple tuna sandwich and a medium drink to put me back almost $11 without any sides.  For $6.50 I thought, this sandwich had better be amazing.  It was meh.  New flavors and combos with the tuna salad that I hadn't really thought of before, including diced carrots? Strange, but the flavors were interesting.  Sweeter than I would have liked.  I'm more of a savory lover.  All in all, I was not that impressed with the food and the price.  Especially since I could've gotten a bigger sandwich with a side of chips (or salad) and a cookie from Bread Basket Bakery for $.25 cheaper.  Thanks for the experience, but I do not think I will be back.

Stopped by after reading the reviews...well deserved.   Service was quick, polite, and very helpful.  Seems like a perfect grab and go spot for breakfast, especially after a long night of drunkeness.  Ordered the AZ Buro and it hit all kinds of spots. Light, but filling, exactly what I wanted this morning.  Will be back in a few hours for lunch.

I am obsessed with D'lite! Especially this location! The staff is always super friendly. They always remember me and my order, which is awesome! Makes my whole day! I will say I am addicted the the vegan buzz! Niqkole and Aleck hands down make the best ones! I adds shot of espresso to my buzz and it makes it the perfect blend of protein and coffee. Hummus is amazing and all the food always tastes fresh. Great vegan options and green iced tea is out of this world. If you need a great brunch spot, meeting or just hang out D'lite is my jam! Thank you for always making my mornings and occasional afternoon the best!!
2 Words: Breakfast Buzz.

Not cheap but I come pretty often because I love their food. Stopped by today to get breakfast, wow.. Worst customer service.I have never posted negative reviews before on yelp. Employee gave me attitude. So RUDE. That's NOT how you want to treat costumers. I don't know if she had a rude customer before me or what, but I will never go back to this location. Not worth ruining my day for the food. I agree with other comments that employees at Tempe location is more friendly and welcoming. Would give no star if I could.
Food was excellent. Slightly limited menu, but any place that is vegan friendly is hard to come by, so I was happy. Small place with a peaceful atmosphere.
Love this place! Delicious and nutritious selections. I love that they have a drive through and service is always with a smile!

I heard really good things about this place so after a hike up "A" mountain with my sister, we decided to try it out. Both of us were first timers and it took us awhile to decide what we wanted because everything on the menu sounded so good.   We both ordered the Traditional Burrito with chicken sausage and my sister added avocado to hers. We took our order to go. We unwrapped our burrito and couldn't wait to take a bite ...  Now for the 2 stars .... I took a bite into mines and there was a string of hair hanging out from it. Yup, I was really really disappointed. My sister however enjoyed hers.   Would I try this place again? Possibly, we'll see.

Wow is all I can explain on my lunch experience. My cup of soup felt empty when I took it out of the bag, it wasn't even half full. Additionally, they forgot my pita chips that come with the  soup. The guy looked too baked to be working and  I had to ask for my juice or I would  have  not gotten that either.  I tried to call in 8 times to rectify the situation and explain the overall experience and nobody answered.  I love the food quality and  premise behind the business, but outliers such as this tarnish the name. Each week it seems to get worse.  I usually come a few days a week when I don't  have time to prep my meal. I don't want them to lose my business, but this is too much for an easy order.

LOVE visiting this D'lite location! I am always greeted with a smile and my breakfast buzz (all toddy) is consistently delivered quick and tastes amazing! Tons of comfortable seating room if you decide to dine in but the biggest bonus for this busy, working mom.. is the drive-thru! Thanks D'lite you have a customer for life!

WILL TRAVEL FOR BREAKFAST BUZZ! I got turned on to the Breakfast Buzz from the radio host, JohnJay! It took months of him raving about it before I finally talked myself into driving over to Scottsdale to give it a try. Oh Em Gee, its D'Licious!!  The kick of the espresso, fullness of the protein and the mixture of all the ingredients makes for the perfect pick me up drink. I am a fan for life and will travel for D'lite Healthy On The Go! THANK YOU! A+ customer service A+ ambiance A+ food quality

One of the best tastin' and healthiest breakfast I ever had.  I had the California breakfast club and a caramel latte.  The latte was good too.  Service was very friendly.    Tempe food rocks.  Photo attached.

This place is crazy delicious, the food is fresh, and I feel like its reasonably priced. However if you're in any kind of hurry do not go inside, even if the drive-thru line is long. They obviously give priority to those customers no matter the order. Also it's hit or miss whether the person working the drive through is any good. They either can't understand, or get annoyed with small requests (like not having the straw in the cup). But again, the food is REALLY good. So I'll keep coming back and hope for a high turnover rate.

D'lish is so d'lovely, especially knowing that I can call ahead and order in the drive through on my way! Talk about efficiency. As if the drive-through wasn't fast enough, now by ordering ahead there's practically no wait time! On my way there now!

Ok WOW! Need a fast but NOT "fast" food meal. This is the place to be. Amazing healthy food that comes out quick. For all you men who think you're too manly for a salad come sink your teeth into The 'Man' Salad and wash it down with a "Breakfast Buzz" (protein, espresso, milk, bananas, chocolate, & peanut butter). Guaranteed to fill you up and still complement that gym workout. Bowls, Burgers. Whiches/Wraps, Salads, Shakes, & even some pretty dang good Breakfast. With locations in Scottsdale, Tempe, & just around the corner in Hawaii, make sure to pop in or hit the drive through for some D'Lish fast food that is anything but "fast food".

This place is GREAT! I have to resist coming here every time I am in the area, it is that good!  The California Club Breakfast sandwich is my GO-TO.  The artisan bread on it is so so good!  I quickly saw a trend of EVERYONE ordering the morning buzz, so I had to check it out.  Definitely glad that i did! Great drink to get you going in the morning!   The wait can be long, but worth it.

Passing by this place I decided to stop by and check it out. Happy to say I was not disappointed. Staff were pleasant and patient with me taking my time. I ordered a breakfast buzz which was absolutely amazing and a club sandwich. Sandwich was tasteful and never seen cream cheese on an egg before. Will for sure be stopping by this place again!

Have been to D'lish a few times now and really enjoy everything I've gotten. Today I wasn't toooo hungry so I got the 1/2 AB &J w/banana slices. It was a perfect size 1/2 sandwich and the almond butter was so fresh as well as the jelly and nanners. I will certainly get this again soon. I also had the Beet side Salad. While it is small it was the perfect size to go with the 1/2 sandwich. I also got the Dream Tea. Again, a great choice.  On my previous visit I had gotten the southwest rice bowl. The serving was HUGE but it was sooooo good I ate the entire thing! (I was wanting to save some for a snack later but couldn't stop eating it).  They are super friendly and great service. They will also give you great suggestions on menu items or if it is your first time.  Will be back again soon!

Delicious, healthy food I love having for breakfast or lunch! They're vegan buzz is the most amazing thing you'll drink. It's chocolatey with coffee protein and more. I love living right around the corner from them!
Excellent food, it will go above and beyond your expectations. Fast service, very friendly service. The smoothies are also amazing. Try this spot out!

This place has great customer service and awesome sandwiches and coffee is mm! I've gone a few times before work. Haven't been for lunch but many of the breakfast items I've tried are very good.  I always go inside because the drive thru line is insane always going onto the street. Usually 7 cars at a time. Only complaint is wish it had a larger parking lot. the place is so small and cozy inside. Only other issue is if you eat there. Be sure to have headphones. The smoothie / drink maker they're using 24/7 for the drive thru peeps is VeRY loud. Can't hear what the person across the table is saying.   Otherwise a great quick bite!

Wanting to avoid my hotel's 'free breakfast', I made a short trip to D'lish and am very glad I did. Enjoyed a vegie frittata and coffee. Service was very friendly and quick. I'd estimate seating for 20 indoor w/a patio out front.  The coffee was very good and a nice alternative to the chains.   I will definitely make it a regular stop when I'm back in Phoenix.

This place was incredible!  Scrumptious humanitarian (think vegan) wrap had the option to add chicken, feta and pesto to its quinoa, hummus and veggies base... absolutely delightful when wrapped up in a tomato tortilla.  Coupled that with the orange glorious smoothie - which basically tastes like a melted creamsicle, without the calories!  Awesome place and a lucky little find... thanks fellow Yelpers!

walked over today after the parada del sol for a bite to eat. we had the dog and they have a few patio chairs so we could enjoy our meal outside with the pooch.   i ordered the humanitarian wrap...filled with quinoa, veggies, and hummus in a sun-dried tomato tortilla. it was ok, but kind of like something i could just make at home. i had to drip siracha on it for every bite to get any real flavor. i only tasted hummus at the very last bite, down near the bottom of the wrap.   their other options look good, with plenty of choices for vegans, veggies, gluten free'ers, and meat eaters. what knocked the place down a star was that...we saw one of the cooks come outside with her food prep gloves on, buy a box of cookies from a troop of girl scouts standing on the sidewalk, and then walk back inside. i HOPE she took those gloves off and put new ones on. i really, really, really don't want to see the person preparing my food handling items other than my food with those gloves...

I love eating at d'lite! They are getting so popular it is sometimes hard to get in the drive through line! I'd recommend calling in your order and picking it up inside. But the food is so delicous and makes you feel really good! I like getting the humanitarian wrap and also the veggie burgers! The price is always fair for the delicous portion you'll receive :)
Eaten here before. Was good. But today I ordered the frittata with egg white and they said they couldn't do it they are pre done. what? Just left no more to say.

I have liked everything I've tried. Their Housestyle Protein burger is wonderful and filling. Their turkey club is everything it should be. They have great breakfast sandwiches. I usually drive-thru to get a drink, they make a wicked Dirty-Chai. I love that I can get any drink made with Almond or Rice milk. The Breakfast Buzz is perfect for anytime of the day. I regularly get the Oatmeal Our Way because it is gluten-free. They have a few gluten free options which is nice, but I think they could get more creative with it. Once you are a regular the staff is very nice. It's pricey, but I can't seem to stay away.

Found this gem based on Yelp reviews and it definitely doesn't disappoint!!!!  My personal favorite has been the AZ burro which has been so filling that I either skip lunch or eat a late lunch. I've also tried the veggie burrito and that is filling too. I really can't wait to try the other menu items including the green lemonade that other Yelpers have posted.
Last few times have been consistent! Love the salad. Cant help but keep going back. So D'lish!

I really love the menu selection here. There are a lot of healthy options that provide an awesome alternative to the many other fast food places around. The California club, their signature breakfast sandwich is delicious. They also have the breakfast buzz protein shake which may be one of the best shakes I've had. Unfortunately drive through wait times can be pretty long, even when there's not many cars ahead of you, but I guess that's the price you pay for quick and healthy food. I also think some of the items are a bit overpriced but other than that this is a great stop for anyone on the go.
Definitely a hidden gem for veg. And healthy people. I would come back here again great place to go to for early rising sun people. Beautiful people.

Yum Yum Yum!  OMG, so awesome!  Great concept.  Would love to see more GF/Vegan options but no complaints as what we ordered was delicious.  Breakfast wrap was altered to accomodate my food choices.    OJ was worth the $3!
super fast, super friendly, super healthy.   My favorite drink is the "buzzkill." It's not on the menu but it's a breakfast buzz without the espresso. I love that they have a drive thru!

This is the best thing to happen to my neighborhood! I used to frequent the locations in Tempe when they were called D'lish when I was in the neighborhood. I love the breakfast buzz, the frittatas, and burritos. The prices are *so* reasonable for what they give you. The food is very fresh, healthy, and delicious and they have all the alternative milks you could wish for.

By far my go to place for lunch and breakfast! When living in Arizona I would come here twice a day sometimes almost everyday! I love everything on the menu and the staff is always friendly. Haven't been here in over a year but I gotta say D'lish is by far my go to place in scottsdale and tempe!
I like what this business is doing ... trying to get people to eat healthier. But their food is pretty blan.

I was super happy to find this place on my way to work.  Coffee is good-service is always super friendly.  Had breakfast once and it was pretty good, though if you are getting it in the drive-through it seems to take a while....but it's fresh food made there-what can you expect....

This is the BOMBEST spot to get your morning fuel up. Breakfast Buzz.. Absolutely the best way to get started in the AM. I'll always get the oatmeal and a breakfast club. Filling, delicious, and doesn't make me food stoned! A unicorn breakfast, I know, but it exists here.   No wonder everyone here is so chipper! Smiling faces in the early hours makes anyone's day so much better. My boy Leonard always hooks it up with a smile and a laugh.   No better place in Scottsdale to get morning grub!

Had heard good things about this place. My boyfriend and I ordered two breakfast burritos (egg, cheese, and a small side of salsa). It was okay, nothing tasty, and my burrito came with a thick strand of human hair. Will not be coming back.

YES. So good. I'm not sure if they tell the employees to behave the way they do ( 1/2 stoner,  1/2 flirt) but it always entertains me and service is not sacrificed. Consistently amazzziiinngg food and that breakfast buzz is spot-on #worththe600calories  PRO TIP: order the Baby Buzz. it is the same as a breakfast buzz but smaller/cheaper.

What can I say, I absolutely adore this place. My usual order is large green tea and a California club. Their club is by far the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. It had smoked turkey, eggs, bacon, cream cheese and more.  On top if the great food, their employees are amazing. They are always super friendly, incredibly patient, and have never steered me wrong.

The food is very fresh and tasty. I love it so much that I always order the same thing! The California Club is amazing and you can actually taste all the ingredients... It's not just a mishmash of things that seem like it's not worth paying for.   The hummus plate is very good. I wish they gave more pita bread because we always have way more hummus in the end.   For two people it's about 20 dollars (excluding tip) if you get drinks too.

This is a great location. I alternate between this cafe and the one in Scottsdale. I didn't find a difference in the food.   The California Club and hummus plate is just as tasty. I really like the wide parking area. There are menus outside where you park so you can peruse the choices at your leisure!!  I wish it stayed open longer but that's the only gripe. Prices I can't argue with because I think it's worth it because it's so fresh but I can't afford to eat out here everyday, unfortunately! Heh.

so i've been here a couple times now and i'm only writing this because i am definitely a fan of this place. i've only gotten the chicken pesto panini but it's just so damn good, i can't bring myself to try anything else. this, however, ain't exactly healthy for you as it's loaded down with pesto and feta AND it's served up on some texas toast! damn! my friend has gotten a few different things including some kinda turkey wrap and a club sandwich. they were both very good too!  parking and seating can be tough during lunch-i've warned you!  bonus points for being locally owned.
The breakfast buzz is amazing!! Espresso  peanut butter protein smoothie. Everyone ive shared this item with has become addicted.
This place had he best black bean burger I have ever had! Totally opened up my world to vegetarian burgers! And the breakfast buzz keeps me going all day!

This place rocks!!!  First what I'm so impressed with is their menu and healthy options. I love the variety of choices you can get.  I got their Breakfast club because its one of their most popular items.   It was good not as great as the other reviews say. The reason why I say that is because I feel it has the making of a great sandwich but they layer it wrong. You have bread, pesto, cream cheese, tomato, smoked turkey and bacon. Because the only texture you get Is the bacon if they put that on top of the cream cheese it would enhance your chewing experience.   Still tasty just mushy.  Hubby-Breakfast burrito with sausage and bacon and he loved it!!!! He came back two days in a row for it.  Next time I want to try the coffee and salads.  Great place

Amazing spot. Great concept - fast food that is fresh & healthy. Breakfast Buzz with almond milk is amazing. I've had almost everything on the menu. All of their items are tasty. You can't go wrong at D'life :)

Was expecting so much better. No toasted bagel like I asked and the bacon was so crispy it was basically charred and had no flavour. The eggs taste old and a little odd. I guess you can't expect good food out of the drive thru

The food is just as great as the Scottsdale location, but the service here sucks! They are so slow it drives me insane waiting to get my food even when its not busy.  Even just ordering a coffee took 10 minutes. 10 minutes!! Would have been faster just to drive up to the Scottsdale location.

This place is awesome!  I eat here probably 3 times a week. It's pretty healthy.  They also cater to many people's dietary constraints ie vegan, veg etc.  It's delicious and the staff is very warm and welcoming.   I literally bring all my friends here.   Oh, and they're dog friendly!!
Order taker: cup or bowl? Bowl. And I get a cup.   California club on a croissant. Get regular bread.   Seriously dude? Why even take the orders if you're not going to listen?

This place is awesome!! For a place that's crazy popular and busy, the service is super fast! I was definitely impressed. They have gluten free wraps, which I believe are Udi's. It's very satisfying if you're craving a breakfast sandwich! I would recommend this place for sure.

I used to drive past this place every day on my was to ASU, but did not even know anything about it until I read about it online. Oh man, I am sure glad I did.  It is hard finding a good, healthy, vegetarian/vegan friendly fast food place, so having a place like this around is just awesome. Not to mention, the service is great, the staff is always entertaining. I had one guy working the drive through flip out with excitement because I had a gingerbread house kit in my passenger seat. He also kept referring to me  as 'homegirl' haha.   I have not been able to bring myself to try anything other than the veggie burgers, since I just love veggie burgers so much! I usually go for the Early Bird. The quinoa black bean patty itself seems a tad bland to me actually, but the toppings so make up for it. The fried egg and chipotle aioli are fabulous on that burger. The buns are delicious as well. Plus they are huge, fill you up fast!  D'lish is relatively inexpensive for the quality for the ingredients. I think the concept of this restaurant is awesome and I would love to see more places similar to this!

I've been to both of the other D'lite locations (practically lived at the Tempe one during senior year of college), but this one was the best by far! Unlike the other two, this one is spacious, plenty of parking and room to sit inside! Although for some reason it was a little hard for me and my sister to find when using google maps. There were not any customers when I came so we got great service haha. I ordered my favorite, the early bird. I feel like the black bean quinoa patty was a tad smaller than usual when comparing my current early bird pic with the old one. But still delicious and enough to fill me up. My sister got the croissant sandwich and loved it! Prices are fair too for such good quality food. We also both got the decaf desert blossom iced tea and loved it. I am so happy to not have to drive so far to get my d'lite fix anymore!
They have the best Dirty Chai I've ever tasted!  What's better is if you order a large without ice it can last you well into the afternoon.  Score!

D'lish stands by its name.  These little sandwiches are packed with so many ingredients that make them delicious.  I love the fact that they have a drive though and their lattes are better than Starbucks.   I've been to both locations and I always get super friendly service.  This place is perfect for a quick bite.

I've been comming here over 2 yrs now and will never come back. First the parking situation is ridiculous. Second there food is over priced and not even that good. The other day I waiting in the drive through for 20mins before they ordered my food which was at the window they are supposed to give you your order.  Once I ordered my food they lady  came out of the window waving her hands with my sandwich in her hands cuz I had my window up which take 2 seconds to roll down. She basically threw my sandwich at me and left. I couldn't even give them back thier clipboard that had my credit card slip on it.

I don't know of another drive-thru shop that offers everything you could want (and need) for breakfast. The low-carb breakfast always helps me start off my day right. And the shakes and smoothies are bomb. The staff have always been really cool and friendly too. Must be a fun place to work.

Coming from NYC where things are fast this place is really fast regardless how busy there drive threw is the food is always high quality and consistent  and healthy And the staff are super friendly good vibes good people if you want good fast organic healthy food this is the place to come and stay healthy

The food is amazing. The cali club and the breakfast buzz are delicious. I've been here countless times and they've never once messed up an order so the staff deserves credit. However, the prices are high, and the lot is tiny. They're supposed to be "healthy to-go" but the to-go process is super inconvenient. Most of the time, the line is backed up into the street so cars are honking at you. Parking is almost never an option unless you want to wait in the drive through line. I'm sure buying another lot next door isn't an option but if it is, it could seriously improve this place. Even with the inconvenience, I continue to come back for the food/service.

This place has the BEST breakfast sandwiches in town.  I come here all he time when i want a filling/healthy/delicious breakfast.  If you don;t want anything that heavy i am also a fan of their low carb breakfast...Their dinner pasta bowl is also really good-i'm not the biggest fan of their lunch though, not that it isn't good, it's just that i expected it to match how much i love their breakfast-but you might have a different taste.  The other reason this isn't a 5star rating is also because they can take a long time.  Most of the time it's fine because they are making it from scratch but sometimes it goes over average and when that happens you would think it would be better than the last time but they aren't the most consistent.  Please-go here for breakfast and try it, it's a great neighborhood coffee place.

So I've been to D'lish many of times before and I've been meaning to write a review for months but today....I just had to document my experience.  D'lish always has a pretty big wait and rightfully so. I ordered a banana strawberry smoothie that was killer and a AZ burrito BUT...I got this bad boy enchilada style. Best decision I've made her by far.  I've had the black bean burger, the bowls, the sandwiches but this burrito enchilada style is the best if I haven't made my point already! Service is always great and friendly and there isn't really much negativity I can bring to the table for this place.  Maybe one thing is to stay open later! There's not really a place like this and I'd come here a lot more if they were open later too. Keep it up D'lish!
Cute little spot! They offer a drive thru and sit down, inside or outside. If one of these existed where I live, I would be there every morning. Try the California club, it's AMAZING!
Thanks for being on happy cow app! Love finding new places for healthy eating :)
Would really like to try this place but waiting in the drive thru for 15 minutes is a joke.

Had the California Club(breakfast sandwich) and an Ice Americano for breakfast here. Both were amazing! The California club was delicious! In addition to great food and a cool little restaurant the staff was super cool! The two employees that were there were very nice and I chatted with them while I ate. great food, great people = win.

I recently moved just down the street from this new location, I am a big fan of the original one on Scottsdale road so I was pretty stoked!  Just like the Scottsdale location the food is great and the staff is very nice and friendly. I always get the California breakfast club and a large iced Americano. The Buzz is also a great drink but somewhat pricey. I think this location has a nicer outdoor seating area than the original but overall the service and quality are identical.

One word : Deeeeeelicious! I have tried every single place around here for lunch and I curse myself for not having tried the food here before. The place is small and does not ideally make the cut for a date but if you are seriously scourging for lip smacking food, D'lish will leave you content and smiling. I had the veggie d'lite wrap and for 6 bucks, it was gold! The drive-through can become a little busy during lunch time but the staff is prompt and gets the food out on time. I'll probably head there again soon for a bigger bite.

Very good breakfast here. I came here on Saturday morning after looking for a place that served green smoothie, this one came up on my Yelp search. I was on my way to fit company challenge and was in need of light and healthy breakfast.  Service was excellent, friendly and thoughtful, thank you for the extra maple syrup and agave for oatmeal.  I like that they have this recycling system, I am happy to participate. I liked that they installed a foot pedal thing to open the restroom door to avoid people using paper towels to open the door. Reducing paper napkins consumption helps with environment.  Green lemonade was pretty good. Didn't have that too much kale taste to it, easy to drink. I started juice punch card after 10 drinks or so, I get one free drink. Since they have convenient drive through available, I might stop by here on my way to work in the morning.  Breakfast was very good, really enjoyed my sandwich, gave me enough energy without feeling heavy to get through two hours of fit company challenge.  One negative might be is their metal chairs. They have comfy chair along the wall but all others are metal. Not so good if you come with short shorts like I did.   If you want healthy breakfast, this is a great place to try.

The food is always fresh and delicious. I recommend the California Club and the Az Buro. Fast service. The true mark of a great place is how they handle issues. This place surpasses the mark. This morning I received the wrong breakfast sandwich. The manager made it completely right and brought us a gift card for future use. He was friendly, apologetic, and I remain very impressed with this place.
They have great food but the service is so slow. If you go through the drive-through it's a guarantee of 20 to 25 minute wait.

have I truly never reviewed D'lish???  5 stars for the Orange Glorious. this was my fave thing to drink when I was pregnant. I would drive here, get an OG to go and then go get my nails done. love it.  Everything here is pretty amazing - the food has always been great. This last time I had one of the paninis and it really hit the spot. But again, I waaaas starving from tending to a crying baby... ;)  The only drawbacks are 1)the parking situation sucks 2) the drive thru CAN take a bit of time depending on when you go, but it's all made fresh so... eh. 3) getting into and out of their lot can also be a hassle. But otherwise, it's all good.

Stopped by this place solely based on the yelp reviews. Folks it will not disappoint.  The service and food were all on point. I went with their suggestions and got a CA Club and d'buzz. I will be coming back regularly. It is rare to find a place so well put together. I hope they open more locations across the valley!

I am absolutely obsessed with this place.  Every single thing about it is perfect.  The food.  The drinks.  The service.  The quaintness of the building.  I couldn't possibly explain in words how great I think this place is, but I will surely try.    The first time I ever went here was on New Year's Day and my friends and I still had on our Happy New Years dresses, heels, makeup, the whole 9-yards AND to top it off...we were sporting the hats that boasted HAPPY NEW YEAR all sparkly and obnoxious on it that we had somehow acquired the night before.  We were, needless to say, a bit hungover and ready for some delicious food after an incredible night.  The owners happened to be working that day and immediately jumped on board with us and joined us in shouting happy new year and then proceeded to explain the menu and take their time with us since we were clearly in no state to comprehend much of anything.  Needless to say, I fell in love with not only the owners but also the California Club (which we order on a croissant and add a hashbrown patty to).  This sandwich is like heaven, but better because it exists and is edible.  Seriously, if you're reading this, just stop and head over there for a California Club right now.  It'll be the best thing you have ever done with your life.  Ever since that day, I make special trips to this place (considering I live nearly an hour from it) and have never once been disappointed with the service or anything else.  This place can do no wrong and I just hope more people get the chance to try it because this is one place that should never go out of business.

D'lish is one of the best breakfast and lunch places in town. It's a small hole in the wall, but the people are friendly, the food is fresh, and healthy, and it's quick. I don't think I've been there when there hasn't been a line of people waiting for some awesome food. Even with a line you get fast friendly service. I highly recommend the AZ Burro or the California Club! Two of my favorites with an Almond Milk Latte.

This was my first trip to D'lish, my business partner talks about this place to no end so I've been excited to try it. It didn't disappoint. I went with the breakfast burrito with chicken sausage and it was really great. They also have almond milk, which I love, so I had a latte with almond milk as well. The food was amazing, very clean, and healthy. They have everything from Vegan, to Gluten Free, and are able to add chicken to anything for you meat eaters. I highly recommend this place. My only criticism is their parking situation is a little less than desirable. It's a very small and tight parking lot, we even saw that someone's car got hit while parked.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally stopped in for lunch the day before yesterday.  It wasn't too crowded and I was able to get my order in quickly.They also gave me two stamps on my punch card because it was my first visit!  I ordered the cold tuna sandwich on toasted wheat bread.  Oh man, that's a great sandwich!  The pomegranate green iced tea was delicious as well.  I really like D'lite and will definitely be back again soon.
Love their iced tea!  I also really enjoy their soups.  When I am not eating Paleo their sandwiches are also quite tasty.  Great place for a healthy, quick lunch.

This breakfast/brunch and coffee house is a diamond in the rough. I had the low carb breakfast. A hash brown pattie on a bed of fresh greens w a well seasoned vinaigrette  on top of that were slices of avocado and two overhard eggs and topped with pesto.  My friend had the quinoa oatmeal with fresh fruit and loved it. The only drawback is parking if the drive through is full you wait. At least someone will occasionally come out to get your order so it hopefully moves faster. If you do want to park it may be better to go in the out side.

We absolutely love this place. Their chicken panini is terrific. Their salads and soups are flavorful. Their smoothies and juices are really great too. I like that they are dog friendly where people bring their fur babies and sit outside. Customer service here is consistently great.

I was honestly pretty surprised at how huge the menu is at this place - and for a drive-thru, too! Lots of lighter, healthier options on the menu, although I thought my "signature" California Club was a bit heavy. I'll try something new next time. Expect to wait a bit in the drive-thru line, because they're running a full kitchen inside. I'll be back for more!
Great healthy menu and the atmosphere is cozy with modern decor.  Love going in for the breakfast buzz! Their salads and bowls are delicious as well.

I have a love-hate relationship with coffee. I love the smell, coffee ice cream is delicious but I don't necessarily enjoy drinking it. Many times, I just do it for the caffeine. And I refuse to get a hyper flavored concoction that have 3,758 calories. I like to eat my calories, not drink them thankyouverymuch.  Since it's hotter than the 6th circle of hell, I decided for iced coffee. I always pass d'lish on my way to work and decided to finally try it. The interior is tiny, it feels like a cool doll house to me. I had an iced coffee and wow!!!!!! It was amazingly good. I tried another day ( and another and another) to make sure it wasn't a fluke and I'm glad to say it wasn't. My iced coffee has been equally great every single time. I also had a bialy with cream cheese and it was very tasty. I'm looking forward to try their hot coffee once is not  115* out.
Food quality sucks despite what they advertise and the parking lot is pretty ridiculous. The customer service there is nothing to brag about either....

I must admit I was very skeptical before going.  it's just a sandwich/wrap shop I thought to myself.  I was surprised with the quality of the food.  We ordered the d'veggie bowl and it was amazing.  The vegetables were fresh and crisp.  They were out of quinoa, and rice was substituted, but it fit the bowl perfectly.  The sauce was tasty without being overpowering.  Friendly service.  Excellent place.  Hopefully, i'll get a chance to go back.

This place has the beeesssst protein shakes. The service is wonderful as well. Seriously nice people. The facility is really nice as well. We were just passing through otherwise I would have gone there for lunch too!!

Love this place! Great for a quick lunch without having to resort to fast food. They have a drive thru and fast service. I've tried to breakfast club, which is VERY good, the tuna sandwich, humanitarian wrap, and turkey club. Everything I've had thus far has been delicious. Very friendly and happy workers there too.

I've avoided D'lish like the plague because the menu was so basic... but fast forward 4 years of residing in Scottsdale and I can't stop chugging breakfast buzzes.  WTF is wrong with me?  I'm seriously addicted to them.  And the humanitarian wraps.  How the hell did these guys make broccoli taste good in a wrap?  Because it's so good!  I come here probably once a week - and it's not even out of convenience.  I'll find an excuse to go, because I've convinced myself that a sugary drink is a "healthy lunch".  Augh.  Anyway, I'm officially converted and I'm not mad about it.  Here's to getting that dukedom #yelpelitegoals.

Ive been going to the place since it was D'lish... & it holds true to it's name. I prefer the AZ burro, sans the turkey breast. Everyone around me loves the breakfast buzz... I just don't do coffee.  My husband got the lunch panini and said it was even better than the breakfast burros. Point is, you can't go wrong!

This is one of my favorite places to go for healthy delicious food! My two favorite things on the menu are definitely the Breakfast Buzz (w/ Almond milk) and the Southwest Rice Bowl! Although this place is a little pricer than ideal, it is definitely worth the money and the Buzz actually keeps me full for several hours so it's definitely not your average smoothie/shake. This particular location is pretty spacious and also eco-friendly which is always cool to see. Highly recommend trying if you have not already!

omg am i addicted?!? am i obsessed!?   i can not get over this place and my california club!!!  i have my entire office hooked on d'lish now. we now have a lot of"meetings" at d'lish. we can not get enough.

I am so happy we chose this place for January Yelp Office Hours today... we had a great turnout, but better than that, I found my new favorite Old Town area coffee shop!  I started out with a hot peppermint tea, and a few hours later, I chose a breakfast sandwich for lunch - let me tell you... it was d'lish!  Kyle and Chad - great name for your place, and thanks for the hospitality also.    I can't wait for my next visit as I hear the dirty chai (chai tea latte with espresso shots) and the breakfast buzz shake are winning combinations as well.  I love that there are so many healthy options on the menu to choose from.  Not to mention outdoor seating, good vibe/music inside, and a drive-thru - how cool is that?!

It's been 2 months since my first visit and I've been back through the "d'liteful" drive-thru a handful of times since... love that.  I'm also making good on my promise to report back on the wifi and inside since I checked that out also... five stars for the inside seating, wifi, and customer service as well!    Every employee I've interacted with at DHOTG is super friendly and genuine.  They custom my order without complaint and get it right every time.    Inside, there's plenty of comfortable seating and the place is clean!  Bathrooms are clean too.  I have no complaints about this place, hence another five star update.  I'll definitely be keeping you in the rotation, D'lite.  See you again soon!

I've been a fan of D'lite since my days at ASU. Upon coming home last week to visit the family for Thanksigiving, my sister in law (but really my sister) @gabi m, mentioned their new location.   After an early morning yoga class, I decided to stop in and wow was I surprised. This new location is spacious and beautiful. I tend to use their drive thru but didn't have patience to sit on the long line.   Thankfully when I went in, I was greeted with huge smiles by all the employees.   Here are my goto's at D'lite:   1. The Breakfast buzz but I substitute Totty for Milk  2. The Early Bird but protein style (aka on a bed of lettuce) with avocado and extra aioli sauce ;)  3. The Kitchen Sink Salad  4. The 'Man' Salad

very small quaint nice location.  A little bit of a hippie / granola feel there, that is not a negative thing by the way.  Food is amazingly fast for the quality and rather inexpensive too.  The real question... will I come back to get more food or drink there... yes, I think I will.  I'm may try their drive thru next time...  They even made a special drink for me and charge me the normal .    only pitfall, but it's a pretty big pitfall, is it seems that most of the employees are not paying attention to the customers, rather just going back and forth talking to each other.

This place is a delight. Best for breakfast. The low carb breakfast is light yet filling. The pesto they drizzle over it is amazing and also used in some of their sandwiches. I also frequently get the egg and cheese sandwich- add avocado! The bread they use is so soft and yummy. All the ingredients are fresh. It really is healthy on the go.... the food comes out so fast! Ok the one down side to this place is also the best part about it- when you sit inside the blenders are constantly going off and they are LOUD buttttt these blenders are making the breakfast buzz! A delightful mix of peanut butter, banana, espresso and chocolate protein. Quite possibly the best way to start your day, or afternoon! If you're coming later in the day try the hummus and don't be afraid to still get a breakfast buzz. Your taste buds will thank me.

I am watching my calories and this is my new favorite spot! I cannot stop coming here!!! Heard about this on Jon Jay and Rich...and I am so happy I stopped in. Everything has been yummy even though it is super healthy and the staff is very friendly! I would highly recommend this spot to anyone!

So I come here for the first time in a while and order a ham egg and cheese sandwich on a plain bagel. The person at the counter could not hear me do to the loudness of the blender for smoothies running and puts in the order for a egg cheese bagel sandwich. My order comes out and I tell the person that I ordered a ham egg and cheese sandwich. They bring it in the back without question to change it. They return with a turkey egg and cheese sandwich! So I ask once again with politeness and they scramble to figure out what the issue is and they finally tell me they don't have Ham! WTF! Why didn't they just tell me that in the beginning and I wouldn't have ordered anything at all. There was no apology just that's how it is. What happened to Buisness like this valuing there costumers!

Humanitarian wrap with extra veggies filled my tummy hole today and both my tummy and I were happy for that! Quinoa, hummas, veggies, pesto, feta on a sundried tomato wrap. Super good! I have been here a few times now and the only reason for the loss of star is that their parking spot has potential to be a nightmare during busy times.   I have had their hummus plate and kombucha on previous trips and both were wonderful! The hummus is much more flavorful than I have had at other places and the veggies on the wrap and the plate have always tasted fresh and crisp. My dude loves their chicken salad and swears by it AND was totally jealous I went for lunch without him.
