I am definitely enticed to frequent here more regularly knowing their effort toward sustainable practices seem legit, my lunch was given in a paper wrap without a plastic bag and I dig that! They say their produce is organic or locally sourced when available which is super stellar as far as I'm concerned.  I haven't yet tried their breakfast burritos or any of the bowls but it certainly gives me something to look forward to.

I have visited the location in South Scottsdale multiple times now and I love it! Same great menu here only, or is such a larger location! Very open and a bit fancier.   I decided to try something I haven't tried yet and I am very glad I did. I know, it's  after 5 pm but I went for the Oatmeal their way because, why not? When breakfast is always available to order, sometimes you want breakfast.  It was quinoa, honey, bananas, berries, coconut milk (option) and a sprinkle of oats. The kiddos grabbed the quesadilla option and both seemed to enjoy it.  The dish went well with my delicious vegan buzz shake. I just totally love this establishment and the concept and the staff. The staff are always super chill and friendly.  Oh and the tunes are always in line with a good vibe!
Wait took FOREVER, and parking is a bear. Bottom line, I won't be going back here on my lunch break....   which they made me late for.
They're breakfast sandwich is amazing. They also have really great tea.  I love this place!
I had the veggie frittata, it was great! Everything about it was perfect. Flavor of the pesto sauce was delicious, all toppings spot on. Prices are very reasonable here. I'll definitely be back!

Found this place thanks to other Yelpers who said that it was a good spot to eat. It's a very small place, but the food quality was AMAZING! I got a chicken panini, my wife got a turkey club (which we shared with one another) and the kids got a chicken quesadilla. Had I known that I'd have been hitting up a non-franchize coffee house I'd have skipped the morning coffee and gotten it there. If their coffee is as good as their food, Wow! Customer service was great and everybody there had a big smile on their face. The only thing that could be a problem is parking if they're busy. Few spaces and the inside was small as well. Well worth it though!

This is a very small location. Parking is a challenge. The drive thru is packed! The nuts n berries salad was perfect. It was very fresh and tasty. The goat cheese, walnuts, and berries were a perfect compliment to each other. The veggie delite wrap was very flavorful and filling. The inside is small and very noisy but they have a patio as well. Very healthy and quick spot for lunch

Free refills on iced coffee!!! Amazing breakfast sandwiches and it's good for you. Parking is super hard to find, you're better off parking down the street and walking. Service is really fast and staff is very friendly. Love this place!

I totally loved this place, I have burnt out the fruit/cheese/nut salad for myself cuz I keep ordering it, but i just had to again.  The berries were amazing and sweet, the nuts were sooo yummy, creamy goat cheese, it was great.  The hubby had a tuna sandwich, and I stole as many bites as I could it was soooooooooo good!! The price was GREAT! The customer service was totally nice.  I can't wait to go back and try the cali breakfast club, the man salad, maybe a bowl.

Ok not gonna lie!! I don't cook!! I know they are sick of seeing my face but I go here 6 days a week.  No joke!!! I can even get my dog doggie bags which they love!!! I get the tuna melt and mushroom soup! I haven't had one bad thing here!!! Seriously try it!!!

I blinked & I missed it - it's tiny but has a lot of food options to offer. I got a vegan chocolate protein shake & it was a wonderful way to start my day. Love that such yummy fresh food can come through a drive thru!
The drive through lady wasn't friendly after she looked at the receipt to find out how much I tipped her. 15% gives you a shitty attitude nowadays.

Healthy, fast, breakfast food. Not sure why this is such a novel idea.    So scrumptious- I crave it even when I'm not in a big hurry. Their breakfast burritos are great. So good that I don't think I've ever ordered anything else. I need to branch out.

We LOVE D'lish! The food is fantastic and the staff is awesome. We are trying to make our way through the entire menu but everything is so good we get stuck on one item for quite a while. We go several times a week and tell all our friends and clients to visit D'lish. A great gem that everyone should try. The burritos are insanely good!
This place had a great wrap but they have no chips for a side. Clean and very pretty atmosphere though. Definitely was fast and good to grab on the go.

This place is absolutely wonderful. Both locations feature good service and fast, clean food. I recommend the Breakfast Buzz, Cali Club, and Traditional Burrito for first-timers. They will also take one-off requests such as for a BLT or something along those lines. Again, very friendly people that really take care of you.

Absolutely my new favorite breakfast spot. I visit at least once a week. The breakfast buzz is phenomenal and their breakfast sandwiches are all filling and non-greasy so you never feel less than awesome after eating one.
Love this place!!  The California breakfast club is amazing!!  Love it had a drive thru!!

I was SO excited to try out D'lite as I pass by there almost every day. I ordered the signature California Club breakfast sandwich and was significantly underwhelmed. The flavors did not mesh well in my opinion. The Nitro Toddy had good flavor, but in my 32 ounce cup there was probably 5 ounces of actual coffee because it was over packed with ice. My husband got the same order so for $30 it was not worth it. We could spend $30 at any other breakfast spot and get a lot more food and coffee.

This place is very casual and has great staff! The food is amazing a must try! Everyone was so kind and happy to be there. I had a traditional burrito with avocado. If you haven't been to D'lite and like healthier alternatives to fast food this is the place to go. They have a drive through and walk ins.
This little place has some unique and delicious menu items.  I had az burrito and tried the house frittata. They were both very good. The orange glorious smoothie was just ok.

I just found this great little spot on Scottsdale Rd. called D'Lish, and that is just what it is - mmmmm. And the best part is, the food is healthy! I loved it so much I went back the very next day.  I talked to the pretty girl at the counter and I found out that they started as a coffee shop and have been adding more food items to the menu. It's owned by this really cool young couple and you instantly become a part of the family when you come inside. But if you're on the go, there is a drive-thru! Also, free WiFi internet!  I had the california club which has eggs, turkey, pesto, avocados and cream cheese (and maybe some other good stuff) on a low-carb bialy bagel. I also tried the kombucha, an interesting alternative to coffee that will really pop open those eyes for the day.  Whether you're on the go or you want a mellow atmosphere to read, talk, drink coffee, make friends, eat good food, D'Lish is your new hang out.

It's an ok sandwich. Rather bland. Could not taste any of the supposed pesto. Small. Most certainly not worth $7.25. Won't go back. I think the locals must be starved for half-decent food to attract the reviews it has. Very emu deserving. Should be a 3-star rating at best.

First timer here today. I ordered 2 different sandwiches and I have to mention they were really good and delish on my taste scale. I have to note though I had a headache after eating and don't know if its the ingredients they use or any MSG... I think they use weed in the ingredients hahaha...
Great place to go for a healthy breakfast.  So far everything I have tried has been good, especially the breakfast buzz.  I am hooked and would recommend everyone to try this place out.

I went with my wife and kids and we thoroughly enjoyed our food!!  Everything was fresh and I was pleasantly surprised with the portion sizes.  Service was spot on and they were very friendly.  It was the first day they were open so we did have to wait for our food a little longer than the norm (just a little), but it's their first day people, lol.  We will definitely be back.  Welcome to our neighborhood.
The best place on earth. A breakfast buzz everyday was needed when I stayed there. Please for the love of god open more.
Aptly named! We shared the veggie burrito and the az burro. Both were fresh and delicious.   And the other yelpers were correct: great coffee!

Came here for the first time today and the food was excellent! The workers were friendly and food was ready fast! Such a cute coffee shop and cafe to hang out at for a healthy breakfast or lunch! Would definitely come back!

1. No bathroom or better still, it is inside the dive bar 2 doors down ....  2. Ordered the Oatmeal m, which reads great on the menu, using quinoa instead of oats :) but is served as some sort of soupy substance slopped together w/ out much care Also, they nickel and dime you and then upsell you because they are out of the Rice milk for 50cents extra and have to give you coconut milk instead for .75cents. Just the principle if you are out of a product it's not the customers fault so dont pass on the charged to them, makes me question just how cheap your kitchen quality is....  Put out a sign that you have no bathrooms and uour out of a certain item etc place just wreaks of lazy, sloppy, cheap. Welcome to Scottsdale, AZ. NOTE! Owner reached out, apologized and explained the bathroom situation and felt that their heart is in the right place and all. That said, strongly feel their bathroom situation should be clear on some sign before ordering and update the menus to better reflect what's being served and for how much. Have no probs paying just don't like feeling I'm being duped by some conflicting policy/ menu...

There's simply nothing else out there like this place. Healthy fast food that tastes amazing and has friendly service to go along with it. If you try to eat clean and live a healthy life, you've found your food mecca here.

The food here is so good!  I love the breakfast sandwich california club!  I wish the restaurant was bigger, it's not really comfortable to have a meal with people there, so we usually just go drive thru.  Everyone is super friendly.  Great local place!
This place is super delicious. A bit pricey, but worth it. Plus, their coffee beverages are super strong, just the way I like them.

Yes, I will pile on.  Hipster inspired decor and attitude and delicious and unique breakfast.  We shared the "our way oatmeal) which is made with quinoa/fresh fruit and we opted for the almond milk.  My GF got the breakfast club and I tried the AZ burrito (which I pronounced the AS-burrito, or the A-Z burrito).  Both were fresh and had such interesting ingredient combinations that made things so tasty.  I'm not sure why anyone would go to some big chain place when the food is fairly priced and so delicious here.  Wished I had this place locally.

Such a cute coffee/breakfast/lunch spot. All the food on the menu is super delish! (Hence the name) I love their turkey sausage breakfast burrito and breakfast sandwiches are good also. It is always busy so keep in mind it will take awhile waiting at the drive-thru, but, that shows how good the food is! They are fast and efficient at getting your order in as timely as they can by having car hoppers take your order in advance at the drive thru.
Dear D'lish.  I love your food, but your BLENDER makes way too much NOISE!!!!!! I guess I will only do to go from now on.

I loved the original D'lite on Scottsdale Road but this one is BIGGER and BETTER!  I brought my coworkers here last week for a healthy lunch. We all loved it! I love how spacious this new location is and they have an expanded menu! The drive-thru option will make quick lunches or breakfast on the go a breeze! I have had many veggie burgers (some good, some bad) and I was super impressed with D'lite's. It was not mushy and had tons of flavor with the mushrooms, pesto, and cucumber sauce. I can't wait to try some of the other new menu items they have. This place is great for everyone wanting a lighter lunch-- vegans, vegetarians, and meat eaters!

I came here on a whim for a quick bite before my yoga class. I was able to get something very fast and filing and delicious. I literally asked for bread, avocado and tomato and they delivered! I will be back to actually try a full meal. The menu looks well thought out and I love how they use organic and local ingredients as much as possible. Definite bookmark for me!
This place is busy no doubt, and parking challenging but worth it. The morning buzz is awesome and I have thought of driving 8 hours just to get one again..its that good!
Truly enjoy this little spot...my daughter and I go after our morning workout...my only complaint is that they don't have any nutritional information...:-((...otherwise I would give it 5 stars...

I have finally had both breakfast and lunch here, and as every other review and all of their marketing dictates, it's a fast healthy option in a land of fast food and fried disgusting crap. The wrap was fresh and great size and even distribution of ingredients. The cactus iced tea is awesome! To everyone complaining about the price, go eat off the dollar menu and shut up because healthy fresh ingredients come at a cost in the country at no fault to this establishment. I have zero complaints and happy to pay their prices.

The Breakfast Buzz is an excellent example of good milkshake engineering.   First off, there's just one size. That means only one method of preparation. It's nice not to regret ordering a size too big or too small. The cup is transparent so you can gage your consumption and not find out you're running low when the straw starts making that horrible inconsistent slurping sound. You have a good view of what's in there, you're not left in the dark blindly, dredging the bottom trying to pick up any last remnants.  The straw is big and strong enough to handle the shake and doesn't bend flat in your mouth under pressure like it would at Sonic or McD's. The Shake has the right consistency so you don't drink it too fast. On the other hand, it isn't so dense that your face goes turquoise and your eyes vacuum back into your head.   There are no cumbersome doodads like choc chips, ice or cookie that could obstruct the entrance to the straw preventing the flow of shake.   Lastly, the menu says it has vitamins,  proteins and fruits so you feel like you're making a healthy choice. As long as I BELIEVE it's good for me, I'll be ok right guys...?  I can understand why D'lish is voted so high. California Club is a nice sandwich and service is pleasant, but the milkshake, oh yeah, the milkshake is really quite good.

THE WORST. The service here is bottom of the barrel.  Shame on me for not learning the first time. They are slow, unorganized and rude. I can make my own smoothie or salad without the unnecessary hassle. One time they only took exact change. Every other time WRONG order! I had the drive thru sliding glass door slammed in my face. If I could give negative stars I would.

If you're looking for a quick yet amazing breakfast, just come on over to D'lish! We were on vacation and wanted to have breakfast on our way out, SO GLAD we pick this place. I got the Cali club with a smoothly. The pesto on my sandwich seriously brought it to another level lol. So good... Wish we had a place like this in my neck of the woods.

BEST BLACK BEAN BURGER EVER!! The Early Bird Burger is honestly amazing. It's so huge, but I ate it all and still felt great! I can't wait to come back and try more off the menu!! We need more heathy fast food options like this place! I'm a fan for sure.
Have yet to try something that isn't "d'lish!" Protein shakes, breakfast buzz, every breakfast sandwhich, just all super yum

I had the "low carb" which consists of a slice of cheese, an egg, and a hash brown patty on top of a bed of greens and vinaigrette. Not sure of the nutritional content of such a mixture but I can tell you that it tastes damn good.   Unfortunately it's just a really, really small building that is ALWAYS busy. Not to mention that they have an industrial mocha-mixing machine that will give you tinnitus in 5-10 minutes.   The price is right, and all my friends say the smoothies are fantastic. If I want a late breakfast (because you'll be waiting any time before 11) that I can feel great about, D'lish is in the top 3 for sure.

LOVVEEEEEE the food here but I almost hate coming by just for the fact that they literally have the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my entire life. Such a shame, they have so much potential.
If I lived here I would definitely be coming here often. $6.25 for a veggie burrito. If you're from California this is a spot to stop at.

Got the california club breakfast sandwich and it was awesome!!! Would like to try some other stuff on the menu but were only out here for a little while. Wish they had one in east mesa!!!  Clean facility and friendly service.

Really disappointed in how healthy D'Lite claims to be. I asked for the four berry smoothie without the banana and I came to find out the the rest of the smoothie is just a juice purée with ice. ...how is that a smoothie? Or healthy? The purée content is full of sugar. It makes me question the rest of their drinks and how much of those are just purées as well.

Location is great and the size and parking lot are finally not cramped like the other locations. The staff was really friendly and helpful and explained what exactly goes in their vegan breakfast buzz. They are having a serious fly issue inside the restaurant. It was a nuisance as there were so many flies inside. I won't be back if that issue isn't addressed and fixed.

I got the croissant sandwich and the buzz (a chocolate/coffee/protein smoothie). Didn't take super long after ordering and tasted great...pesto is a nice touch. Parking was atrocious, you have to get creative. Many people seemed to be ordering the burritos (and they also look great), definitely trying them next time.

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!!  The food is great and the people are really friendly!  There are a few issues I must call to your attention.  1.  The place is very small.  2.  The drive through is so busy, at times the line goes out to the street.  (Scottsdale Rd)  3.  Because the inside is small, it can be very noisey when they are making smoothies.  4.  They do not have a location in Gilbert.  :o)   None of these are deal breakers, that is why I still give this place a 5 star review.  If you are looking for a place off the beaten path, with healthy choices, this is a must!

Drive thru deliciousness!!! Please put one in south Chandler so I can fix my lunch time cravings. Super cute decor, great service and perfect menu. I loved my egg pesto sandwich. The bacon was perfect. Fresh brewed green tea topped it off.

This place is awesome! It's so cute and leaps and bounds better than what it once was.. I love their soy dirty chai! So good. When they first opened they told me they'd have more vegan options soon.. boo, still lookin' to see when that will happen.  Love the drive-thru on a busy day.

Cutesy place with fresh ingredients.  We had the burritos and oatmeal which were very unique - a good thing.    Love the quaintness and outdoor seating.  Very difficult to park and the back has an interesting smell.  Avoid the bathrooms but go there for breakfast!

I've had this place bookmarked for a long time and finally was able to visit this morning since I was in the area. To my surprise, I walk in to a cute and modern coffee spot. I walk up to the counter and the cashier didn't give off a friendly vibe. I ordered the California Club and a small vanilla latte with almond milk. She gives me my order number and I guess I just have a seat. I just felt awkward and out of place the whole time I was there waiting for my food. Another employee gives me my food and my coffee and I leave.   When I get back to my office, I take a sip of my vanilla latte. It lacked flavor... and the California Club was okay. I'm not sure if I like the cream cheese in a California Club but I ate half of the sandwich. Food and coffee were okay, service was less than okay but overall, three stars.

The breakfast buzz is extremely good with protein and espresso in it. Perfect meal to start your day for a light eater, the California club is extremely good too. All of their dishes are top notch, expect a long line for they drive through until 12:00

This place is amazing. You can tell by the constant line of cars in the Drive-Thru. Considering the price and quality of food it's more than worth the wait. I get either the AZ burro or the California Club. It's honestly a travesty more restaurants don't serve breakfast food all day.
I ordered the SW Bowl.. It tasted pretty good... but smallest portion I've ever seen for something that costs $10 a plate.. It was 45 min before closing so I wonder if that was why.. ahh well..
I have been here a few times now and I have tried the breakfast buzz, dirty chai latte, and the AB&J. All are delicious and the staff is very nice, I will definitely be back!!!
Very good kombucha, good coffee, delicious food and fair prices. Local produce, organic food. Yeah, I like this place.
Very cool, delicious, organic/local options, original and fun... Plus service from a bunch of cute, down to earth guys= Awesome in my book. I'll definitely be back!
Great service! Great food! Love the AZ Burro! I love going places where the staff is so friendly and welcoming.

I hate that I'm writing this because the food and service are always stellar, but the staff was not kind to me on my last run. Rating 5 stars because 1 bad experience shouldn't ruin the chain of positive feedback. My last experience was disappointing in many ways, I wont be back.

I ate here for the first time this morning as an Arizona tourist.  I got the vegetarian burrito with avocado and put a little sriracha sauce on it.  It was fantastic!  I went in really wanting just some scrambled eggs or an omelet, which wasn't exactly what they offered, so i got this instead.  I am quite picky and not an easy mind changer, but I'd like to go back tomorrow to get the exact same thing.  I wish this existed closer to where I live (Colorado).  It was a little loud in the store itself, but its because it was a weekend morning during breakfast hours.  I'd recommend this place highly!  The also had free additions to coffee such as soy milk and flavors, which is a greatly appreciated touch.

We stumbled across this place one Saturday morning and now I'm obsessed! Amazing healthy menu with great smoothies and coffee too. Don't let the long lines derail you, they move fast and it is totally worth the wait!

Best breakfast drive through I have ever been to. This place is not your fast food junk. Healthy food that competes with a sit down restaurant, but you don't need to get out of your car. Service has always been super!
The AZ breakfast burrito with the side salsa is so scrumptious. This place is a must try for a delicious breakfast while visiting Scottsdale! 5 star rating!

Well, I ordered the hummus plate. And while it was good hummus, I got maybe 1/4 cup of it. And none of the cucumbers the menu promised. Other veggies and bread, but certainly way too much for the teeny amount of hummus. 2 stars for good hummus, but service was slow, although they seemed to have 10 people working there.

A little small inside, but the food was delicious. The california club is made fresh and is amazing. I recommend getting it on a croissant, but I'm a sucker for anything on a croissant. Definitely would recommend this to anyone looking for a cheap, fast breakfast.

Sometimes I like it Hot and Dirty, and no one gives it to me better than Kyle and Chad.   I'm talking Chai's people, get your mind outta the gutter! ;-)   Seriously you need to try a Dirty Chai Latte!  And if your not the type to want to hang around for meaningless small talk after you get it dirty, they have a drive thru for your convenience!

Having visited D'lish two separate times now it's safe to say I have built myself a more than fair opinion of place. It's also safe say D'lish is looking to be major hotspot of mine in the coming months! With the right mindset I know you will enjoy it here too.  I would imagine many passers by give D'lish an unapologetic look. The truly lackluster curb appeal reeks with the facade of a failed and dirty restaurant. Keep in mind the word facade though. D'lish makes up for its looks in what it cooks.  Health is the focus here. Minimal portion sizes and apparently organic/natural ingredients are meant to keep even the more hearty choices at a low health concern. The burgers (what I ordered on my first visit) are meatless. Instead a wonderfully blended patty of quinoa and black beans is served between artisan bread and a slew of great tasting condiments and toppings. The "Top Notch" burger is my personal favorite however many prefer the healthier option with pesto on it. Either way your taste buds will thank you!  Breakfast burritos seem to be a popular item on the menu. Hence my choice in ordering one during my second visit. It's a no-frills burrito with hardly a garnish in sight, but with such high quality ingredients being cooked with careful skill and precision nothing stands in it's way to becoming the perfect breakfast meal.   Try the coffee and tea too! Their dirty chai is one of the best I've ever had.   Take heed, D'lish is EXPENSIVE for what you're getting. A burger is $8.50. No fries. No salad. No drink. In fact, buying a medium dirty chai tea will run you a hefty $4.75. Health is the key at D'lish, but the almost $14 price tag just does not make it plausible for a college student such as I to make frequent visits, especially if the portions are so minuscule. An unfortunate setback in an otherwise fairly perfect experience.  Try it out for yourself though! Maybe the price won't bother you as much as it did me.
Shockingly good. Extreeeeeeemely loud inside when they make the shakes, which is often. Bring earplugs while eating their excellent food.

The breakfast buzz is a must.  It is what I need to start my day. Their food is great too for lunch would recommend the chicken breast naked panini. Would also recommend the green lemonade with the house style burger.

Normally long lines are frowned upon but in this case it doesn't bother me because the place is that good and it's worth the wait. Incredible food and amazing service-I always go thru the drive-thru with my dog and they always offer him a treat! And I love getting my puppers the homemade dog food, the basmati rice and roasted turkey breast, which is literally good enough for humans to eat. Favorite breakfast menu item is the California club. Favorite drink is the iced dirty chai tea latte with almond milk. Cheers!

I love this place! I always get the breakfast club but I wish it had avocado, it would be so bomb! I tried the breakfast buzz this time and it was delicious. I highly recommend eating here if you want a healthier alternative.

Always my favorite place for fast healthy food. The fact that I don't have to get out of my car means I can roll up looking like sh*t and still get my fix of healthy food   You can never go wrong with the almond buzz (no chocolate syrup). It honestly tastes the same without the chocolate syrup.   The Cali club (no meat) is my go-to for breakfast. Get a side of the chipotle aioli! The humanitarian veg supreme is my go-to lunch!

This place has pretty dry and bland food for the price (for two people you WILL spend at least $20). The food isn't bad... It's just that it's pretty uninteresting. But if you want to pay a premium for a health moniker this is your place. Not for me tho.

This place is the best... I have been saying for years I don't understand why there is not more healthy food readily available. I came here for the first time a few weeks ago and got the "breakfast buzz" protein shake. It is sooooo delicious. Everyone that I have bright to try the "breakfast buzz" is instantly hooked. Today I tried the turkey club which was also fantastic. I highly recommend this place. The staff is always so friends and helpful... The drive thru makes it very convenient.

I was here a few days ago to pick up some coffee and the Arizona Burro. I went through the drive-thru and there were tons of flies flying in and out of the open drive-thru window (and into my car as well) and landing in the open peanut butter container I could see. Having flies everywhere is not a good sign of cleanliness at all. This is awful.
The California Club and Breakfast Buzz are both amazing

Looking for something quick, yet healthy, and delicious?? This place has a drive through which is convenient for anyone on the go! Although it's not as much room as the tempe location when it comes to the drive through...customer service has been great & they are always attentive/ to what you want! Thumbs Up!
Delicious croissant sandwich and coffee! Tiny place but with a drive through, seems like a local favorite. Speedy and friendly service.

I was very surprised by the food and customer service here...I got the vegan quinoa burger with the mushrooms and cream sauce.  Super yummy, but what's better is that it was yummy drive thru food!  My kidlet was with me and I couldn't find anything kid-like on the menu.  When I got to the window, I asked if they could make him a PBJ and give us a side of broccoli.  "Of course!" was the reply and I was instantly in love!  Yea for yummy drive thru and healthy kid drive thru food too!

Drive through vegetarian? Drive through healthy kid options like a PB&J? Smoothies? My kid is asleep in the backseat and I'm hungry for something tasty, healthy and quick? YES please!  Before you get up to the window, there will be an actual person that comes to your car and gets your order...very nice when you have 20 questions about the menu.  And yes, they have meat options too!

Nothing better than a fast drive-through place that actually sells healthy food.  I can't wait to go back to try the entire menu.  My boyfriend and I both got breakfast burritos on a morning when we were feeling particularly hung over, but mustered up enough energy to get in an awesome workout and run up Camelback. After our run we stopped into this place. The burritos were perfect size, not loaded up with greasy cheese or meat, but filling in a way that didn't weigh you down.  After this outstanding breakfast we're definitely going to have an awesome day!

I have now been here twice and both times I found the food to be just OK and the service to be not so OK. Both times I went through the drive thru and both times the person waiting on me was less than helpful. When I got to the window this last time he just stood there talking to someone behind him for quite awhile, while I was holding my money out the window. Finally he turned around and grabbed the cash. I usually drop in a dollar or so when there is a tip jar out, but this time I decided not to. I took my change and he stood there looking at me and finally just shut the window. Another person later handed me my order. WTH?? I get better service from the 16 year old in the drive thru at my local Carls. And I feel much more appreciated as a customer!!

Absolutely love this place. The food is great, and its always what you expect every time...consistently. Thats why I love this place and thats it!  First timers should try a Breakfast Buzz and a California Club. You will not be disappointed.  Customer service is decent here at best. The massive hole in the driveway is pretty annoying. It could definitely damage your car if your low on coil overs.   Aside from that I'll probably still make the 25 minute drive here because its the closest one. Awaiting one to open in Chandler :)  Customer service 3/5 Food Price 2/5 Food Quality 5/5

I'm torn....it's probably more like a 3.5.   I do see a lot of fans with 5 star ratings and I appreciate the loyal following D'Lite obviously has.     The menu is focused on 'healthy' and although they serve breakfast and lunch all day, it's a pretty small menu.   Re the sandwiches we tried, the portions of protein were fine but there was very little produce included (the Club had one or two thin tomato slices and a smear of avocado; the chicken panini said it has tomatoes but I didn't notice any); the bread is also on the dry side.  The mushroom soup was good, albeit a tad salty.    If I went back, I'd try something other than what we ordered, maybe the California Club breakfast sandwich which sounds like a better balance of flavors.  The ambiance is just neutral.   It's clean and bright but it's not the type of place you want to stay long at....eat and go...unless you get one of the leather chairs up front.  The servers are very pleasant.    The price point is higher than I thought the experience provided; we were just under $30 for 2 sandwiches, 1 ice tea, and 1 small bowl of soup.

Had az burro and California club both really good!! We also got a cold frozen drink called the breakfast buzz that had mocha, peanut butter and banana (I did no bananas) that was really good!! Will definitely go back next time I'm in town.

Really cool local place, checked it out during Spring Training before heading to the Giants game. I read the great reviews so I got a little of everything to try it out: a soup, sandwich, and smoothie. The soup was excellent gourmet quality, on par with a top restaurant. The smoothie was excellent, very fresh and refreshing, more of the low-dairy, low-powder, high fruit type smoothie that is really cold and icey and has a sugary bite to it like you might make at home with a blender and some fresh fruit. On the sandwich I think I called a bad audible, as I read their cali club was great on my phone, then arrived to order and saw that included egg but I wanted lunch, so I switched to the turkey club. Although the turkey club had quality ingredients, I think the strong flavor of the whole wheat bread overwhelmed the subtle flavor of the turkey, which made the sandwich less flavorful overall. However, my friends said their sandwiches and coffee were great, and they made a good tuna sandwich. I think my friends and I will definitely return in future springs!

I love this place! The breakfast buzz is to die for. I would love to start my day with this breakfast shake everyday. I usually get the croissant breakfast sandwich. And I have tried the California club too which is awesome. The atmosphere reminds me of SoCal - reggae music playing and just a laid back atmosphere. This place is always a good idea for hangover cures and for breakfast to go. It's so good I might even get it today for breakfast or lunch!

Breakfast buzz.  There is a reason every review mentions it.  It's that damn good.  Go there and buy a breakfast buzz.  NOW!  The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the parking.  Yes, I understand there are some things you cant control.  At this point I think you are making enough money and you have a big enough brand that you can upgrade A) your location or B) buy out super burrito so you can use their parking lot.  It was understandable 3 years ago when you were just getting started, but it is now at the point where you guys need to do something about it.
Food's fresh and delicious, I always feel good after eating here lol. Will come back again and again. I only wish that they were open later.

Went for the first time today and ordered the hummus plate and early bird burger.   The hummus: Soooo yummy!!! The pita bread is sooo warm and soft!!! Together they are perfect :) I could just eat a whole plate of just hummus and pita. I wish I could of just ordered a plate of hummus and pita without the vegetables. (Maybe I can...will need to ask next time)  Early Bird Burger: Was surprised it wasn't made out of meat, and instead some other super good stuff. It was really good, and the bun was very soft. I thought it was a little too spicy for me, and the burger fell apart easily, so I ended up eating it with a fork.   For two people, this filled us up. I would go back again, and maybe this time I'll try the southwest bowl!
great place, way to expensive. i would recommend if you aren't eating on a budget. lower your prices and more people will come!

I made my first-ever journey to D'lish this morning because I was aching to try the concept. Fast, fresh, drive-through breakfast? I loved it. As an aspiring locavore, I also appreciated the touted ingredients.   I ordered an almond milk latte and the veggie frittata. One reason I already love this place is because it is one of the few places near me that actually HAS almond milk. While the latte wasn't terribly hot, my tastebuds appreciated the flavor regardless. The frittata was flavorful and a unique combination of flavors. There was just a little too much pesto, which made the underlying toast soggy. Service was excellent; everyone there seemed happy despite working on labor day. Portion was perfect. Overall, my meal satisfied and I would return.  A few words about this place, not necessarily overtly negative: first, this is NOT a cheap place. My latte and meal were over $11. No value menu here. Granted, I totally get it - you're getting real, unadulterated food, not lab-generated franken-fuel. Just a fair warning. Second, this is not the place to go if you're in a hurry. I think it took about 8 minutes to order and get my food. Not bad, but bear that in mind if you're scrambling to nosh before hitting that lovely morning commute.  Overall, great place and I will return, again and again.

D'lish doesn't need another review, but I love it so much that I couldn't resist.    If I can help you out with anything, the key is to drench their sandwiches/wraps/flat breads in their chipotle aioli - game changer.  Makes their super delicious food even better.    While it's 'fast food,' be prepared to wait as everything is made to order.  Totally worth it, and you will be occupied by reading the rest of the menu items, plotting your next order a week later.

Two words.  BREAKFAST BUZZ.  If you haven't had one, get it now.  I am addicted.  Espresso, peanut butter, chocolate & banana in one drink?  Count me in.    The rest of the menu is so great as well.  A bit pricey, but it is worth it.  Some more of my favorites:  sun dried tomato bialy, iced chai, frittatas, & the veggie d'lite.  I still have so much to try...& I will, it is just a little out of the way for my daily routine.  I wish they were open later...I crave one of their salads or a wrap after my evening workout, but i'll forgive them.  Another plus: they use a lot of organic & local ingredients & recycled products.   I'm a fan of the drive thru, even though you may as well park & go in instead of idling in your car while they make your food!  (just get out...it's better for everybody!)  The guys who work there are awesome too.  Basically, d'lish is the food I wish I could make for myself!  I might just go get something now....

I was on my way to the airport to go back home, so I stopped by this lovely place for breakfast. Before D'Lish, I had never thought to try make quinoa in the morning as I would oatmeal. It was so unique and delicious, as was the amazing egg sandwich and coffee. The guys were incredibly nice and friendly. I wish this was in Austin!

When in Scottsdale, I honestly could eat here for every meal.   The breakfast burritos deserve 5 stars by themselves! Each variety of the breakfast burrito is incredible. And, I would highly recommend accepting their recommendations on additional fillings. They have yet to steer me wrong!   The coffee is pretty good too. Being from New England (where we have perfected iced coffee), I am always a little skeptical trying the iced coffee. D'Lish has my favorite iced coffee in AZ. (Yes, I'm including the local Dunkin' Donuts franchise here).    Until the next time I'm in Scottsdale, I will pitifully attempt to re-create D'Lish's amazing breakfast burrito here in RI....
TASTY. Had a frittata, freakin' BOMB. And cheap! That's my stahl (style).  Had some crazy chocolate/coffee drink that was off the hook!

I order the same thing every time, the California Club. It's not only delicious but a seriously beautifully crafted sandwich. Brought it in to work one day and everyone that walked by kept asking where I got that sandwich from!  I've tried the orange glorious before it was good as well!  Service is always great no complaints on that part. I just wish they had a location in Chandler I can only come here when I'm in the area which isn't often.

I ordered the California breakfast club at the recommendation of the man taking my order, and it was SUCH a good call. It was fresh, flavorful, and completely satisfying.  The bread was tasty and not at all soggy-like I seem to keep getting with similar places around here.  The sandwich's fixings both appeared and tasted freshly made, which is a game changer with this type of faster-slow food genre.   The employees were really friendly and even gave my dog a bone while we waited on our order.  Although it took longer to get the food through the window than say McDonald's or Burger King, the wait time was quite minimal for the quality of food I received to-go.   I'll certainly be back. Thanks for a great start to my day & week!

My sister lives in Tempe, so when I asked where we should take our mom for lunch, she suggested this place.  We all had the green berry tea, which was delicious--even unsweetened.  Everything on the menu seems healthy and friendly to vegans and gluten-free types alike.  I am neither of those things, but I like to have my options.  I ended up getting the kitchen sink salad, which had carrots, golden raisins, feta cheese, organic greens, and a bunch of other vegetables.  It was inexpensive for the heaping portions!  My only complaint would be, I could use a little more dressing, but I'm sure if you just ask they'd be happy to give it to you.  My mom had the California club, which looked huge and meaty (in a good way).  She loved it.  My sister had the nuts and berry salad... which I think I will DEFINITELY order next time.  It had raspberries, goat cheese, walnuts... oh my.  I tried it and it was AMAZING.    The staff was super friendly and courteous, pointing out how adorable my niece is (she really is).  We were in and out pretty quickly, and the facility was clean and sunny.  I like that they have a drive-thru... if I lived in town, I know I would take advantage of that!  Will definitely come back next time I'm in town.

I've been looking for a healthy, fast restaurant and definitely found one. I ordered the chicken breast panini; it was delicious and the perfect size!  The drive thru was pretty quick (about 5-7 min) but I was unsure if I needed to tip since the restaurant is not really "fast food" - I still left $1 tip for a $7 sandwich just in case.  I'm looking forward to trying other menu items asap!

I was so excited to try this place. I see their tweets everyday, and last week I thought "Today is the day Im finally gonna go". Mistake.  I decided to go through the drive thru as their patio looked packed. I got to the speaker, ordered my sandwich (the club), and asked what sides they had since they were nowhere on the menu. The guy on the other end of the speaker sighed and said he'd be right out. Um ok... He came to my window and said "Yeah we dont have them listed but people usually know." I explained that this was my 1st time there and he replied well we have chips and fruit and a little salad. I asked what kind of chips they had and he sighed and said Sun Chips "What kind?" "All of them." "French Onion?" "*sigh* Nope." I asked for whatever he had. He then said well the combo (again, not listed on the drive thru menu) comes w/ lemonade or iced tea. I gave him my choice and he said I was all set and off he went. Now, they were very, very busy so I dont fault them for my wait time at all. However, a couple of the guys that were working the lunch shift this day were so unprofessional. When I was at the window, after I had signed my receipt one of them hung out the window to have a shouting conversation w/ one of his friends that was leaving. As for the guy who took my order, I never saw him again. I got my food and left.  Let me tell you what I paid almost $10 for: a small lemonade, a bag of Sun Chips, and a tiny sandwich. Are you kidding me? I mean, I know theyre categorized as a healthy place, but this sandwich was about as small as a McDonalds hamburger, and unfortunately, not very tasty.  I dont think Ill be going back.

Breakfast buzz! Pretty much all I should have to say lol. Nothing on the menu here is bad. Amazing breakfast sandwiches and great lunch salads. Haven't had one bad thing ever. Recommendations from me are obviously the buzz, (I get mine with almond milk which makes it a little more sweet), California club breakfast sandwich, croissant breakfast sandwich, man salad and Portobello soup, but like I mentioned before you can't really go wrong with anything you order.  If I had to give a tip, I'd say if you haven't been here before you should try to park and go in so you don't back up the already long drive through line. Unless you scope out the menu ahead of time so you're ready to order.

I normally love D'lish's food. Sometimes portions or quality can be somewhat inconsistent, which is to be expected from a local place. However, I have been disappointed by the service lately at the Tempe location. Also, today I noticed the restaurant serving Pace salsa rather than their regular salsa, making my normal breakfast choice - the traditional burrito - something I could have easily made at home for a quarter of the price. When I asked about the reason for the change, the response was vague and no offer or apology for the grocery-store quality. I hope they can work on their service and go back to more local/fresh ingredients!

Stopped there for breakfast. A cozy little place, with very friendly and smiling persons. Their house coffee is fine, but will have to go back for a dirty chai. I had also a bagel (just like any other). A nice drive through, and a good alternative to start the day!

I came here Saturday when they were having their grand opening 50% off all their menu items. It was packed and busy due to the special deal that day. Maybe they were understaffed or most of their people were in back trying to keep up with the food orders? but there was only one register open that day so it took awhile to get my order taken. There wasn't any open tables and they did have outdoor seating but it was a cold cloudy day so it was a little wait to get an open table. They were very quick to clean off any open tables which was great and made seating faster and easier. I ordered the southwest rice bowl and I thought the serving was a little small, but considering all the ingredients, it was probably a +500 calorie meal or so. (I sent an email to someone on their team and they said they are working on nutrition facts for their menu. This would be great for me since I do count my macros. They actually replied to my question pretty fast, which was pleasantly surprising. I don't think I will be coming back until they have their nutrition facts listed though so it's easier for me to watch what I'm eating). Anyways back to the dish, other than be a little on the small side, it was clean and fresh tasting with good flavoring. I do wish a little that I had tried a sandwich instead that day. My son had the kids quesadilla and he seemed to enjoy it.

I'm not sure how I would rate D'Lite and this is why. The sandwich was amazing, I loved every bite but it was hard to enjoy because the idiot that made it did not know that the bread goes AROUND the lettuce etc. It was the messiest sandwich I've ever eaten. I wanted to kill the person that made it!  However, I wouldn't hesitate to eat it again. Maybe the next person will make it right. Very delicious nonetheless.

You can't go wrong with D'lish.    Lines can be outrageously long but it is worth it every time.  The inside is a bit tight but very doable.    Everything on the menu will leave you satisfied.   There is nothing like a breakfast buzz after a solid work out!
Had some good coffee and heard the food was good. Maybe I'll try it next time. Service was great and price was right. Could use a good cleaning but they're pretty busy. I'll be back.

Low carb breakfast? Yes, they got me- it's out of this world!  This savory breakfast has it all:  eggs, hash, avocados,  tomatoes, and greens- topped with a bit of pesto sauce & it's good for me? WHAT?  Yes, believe it.  The pesto gives the egg a nice balance of acidity. This is truly a well balanced breakfast.   Can't wait to try their shakes next time!

Went here with family from out of town. They both had dietary needs that this place satisfied very well. I love that it has the drive thru option too. Only wish I lived closer so that I might eat there more frequently. Very cute and cozy atmosphere as well, but be warned the smoothie machine indoors can get loud.

My wife and I drove through this place today. I was skeptical on many levels. Healthy, quick, made from scratc with a drive thru don't normally go together but this place pulls it off. The parking lot is tiny so be prepared. The food is really good. I got the breakfast buzz drink and the California breakfast sandwich. Both were really good but it was too much to take on at one sitting. The drink was next level good. It is coffee, peanut butter, banana, milk, vitamins and ice. I could've gotten this one on its own and been perfectly content. The sandwich was really good as well. I'd get it minus cream cheese next time. The bread on the sandwich was phenomenal. Overall, I'll definitely go back. I'm pretty sure the Scottsdale location has been a few different places over the years but I'm pretty sure this place will stick. It was super crowded around 11:15 and for a healthy, quick, made from scratch drive thru it ticked all the boxes..

What do you do with an old McDonalds when it closes?  Well you open a D'lite Healthy On the Go place! I like it.   I would have given them 5 stars but all i had here so far is a bagel and coffee. My raisin bagel was perfect and the coffee is good. Service was fast and server attitude was like going to Dutch Bothers - friendly and enthusiastic. And it was well priced.  Lets talk about atmosphere. I do not go to Starbucks because it is pricey, pretentious and full of people who like that. D'lite has couches with short tables, power and wify and you can get a bagel and coffee without learning a new vocabulary. Yea I know, that might just say more about me than Starbucks but I really felt more at home at D'lite.  I do not know if they cater but that kitchen is set up to manage some very big orders. In fact, if you are a caterer that needs kitchen facilities at night you might talk to them about it.   So if your are on Indian School some morning and you just want to pick up a bagel and coffee, stop in and say hello  to the staff, they will welcome you.
Best healthy breakfast place to go in old town. There is always a line but that breakfast buzz is worth the wait! They are also dog friendly!

This place is really tasty ! My group of friends and I went to grab a quick bite to eat on the way to watch a game. The menu was simple, the service was quick, and everything was delicious. Their sandwiches are so good and its cheap. The whole group agreed that their sandwiches were awesome. I would definitely come back when i'm in the area and looking for a quick delicious and cheap breakfast!
By far my favorite place in Scottsdale. California club and morning buzz are amazing . Plus this dude that does the drive thru is great and makes me laugh.

The first time I came I ordered an ice coffee then sat down with my shitzu while I waited and got asked to sit outside when it was 115 degrees, second time I ordered a hot chai and when I got it, it was luke warm. So today I wanted an ice coffee only to wait in the drive through for 20 minutes... I almost drove off. Couldnt believe I paid $6 for a medium iced toddy

Can't say enough gold things about D'lish. I've been dozens of times and have yet to have an unpleasant interaction with a single employee; the service is as quick as it can be (considering the relatively small place gets packed with customers) and everyone is friendly. The food is also amazing; a breakfast buzz a day keeps the doctor away! Errr something...

D'Lite is hands down my favorite brekky joint!! Everyone that works there is so down to earth and   friendly. The price point is pretty average but the food is sooo fresh and delicious. I love all their sandwiches and their "breakfast buzz" shake is to die for. I will remain a loyal customer of this place :)

My second visit today was a good as my first! Yummy fast food & I don't feel bad eating it! Plus, it's great quality. Staff is friendly which is also a plus.  First time I went, I ordered a breakfast sandwich. Yummm. This time I ordered the Hummus Plate. It came with veggies and warm flat bread. Veggies were crispy, flat bread was soft, and hummus was smooth and creamy.  Only downside is that they're only open until 4 and their prices are a bit high.

Oh my gosh! I love this place!! Where is my frequent flier punch card because I need one! I like all he food that I have tried and I like that you can drive thru and get a healthy meal. Their coffee is actually one of my favorite coffees, so delicious. They also have treats for your best furry friends at the drive thru window. We need these all over the valley!
This place is fantastic! It is small and the line is always long but it moves pretty fast. Everyone is super friendly and the food is fantastic! Highly recommended for healthy eating.

Absolutely ridiculous. In the time of ordering, three different people exchanged registers which resulted in my order being incorrect (as in 2 items for completely missed!). Not to mention no sauce was on my wrap...  What's worse is my wrap is 4inches long (my index finger is longer than half of it) yes I measured it. I have ordered it before and it has never been this small and for $8.50 I honestly expect more!

I've been camped here working all day and I can say this place is awesome! Good wifi, great food and better service. Everyone is greeted with a smile and taken care of.  If you're tired of being stuck in a home office come work here.

Checked out D'Lish with Gabi and crew. Really cool space with super-efficient drive-thru and friendly staff.  I sampled the "Breakfast Buzz," which is a delicious smoothie made with espresso, Nestle good morning mix, banana, chocolate, and peanut butter. The owner claims the Breakfast Buzz has restorative properties for those suffering from hangovers.  The coffee was also excellent. I'm 99% sure D'lish sources its beans from Echo Espresso on the west side.   Bonus: you can buy 160 ounces of coffee (in a disposable insulated box) for 20 bucks. That might be enough to get your group through a PowerPoint presentation or two.
Very yummy food, friendly staff, quick service, good coffee...great spot for breakfast!

This is my third review ! I gave one more star because They have really done a good job on improving their customer service !! The staff is way more friendly . Keep up the good work !! The best Protein shake ever is here !!!

Win win!!! If you are a regular of the Scottsdale location you will absolutely love this place !!! Why? Because the parking is huge yes that means no idiots blocking the road like they do in Scottsdale. There's a great fast drive thru !!! Plus friendly staff , and of course delicious breakfast buzzes !! Soo happy this place opened !!
I've only got the vegan buzz here, but I love it! It's a small parking area, but the drive thru line goes pretty fast. I love having this healthy option as a quick drive through.

New favorite spot for quick and healthy food. The best eggwhite burrito and protein shake.  eat here 5 times a week, and I notice that the drive thru line is getting longer.  no longer a secret, the word is out about Dlish.    have not tried the dinner menu, but will soon.  Some great dishes.

I would really, really, really like to give this place a glowing review HOWEVER I have never in my life, in all the cities I've been to, eaten at a domestic restaurant that did not have a restroom for customers.     WTF!!!??!!!   Even in third world countries, you can slip someone $5 to use the restroom!   They'll even throw in some sheets of toilet paper...  I wish I had some of the juvenile attributes, I despise, in some of my more interesting friends.   I'd love to pull my pants down and pee on their patio.

I've been going to D'lish for years! It's a great local spot that serves on the go healthy food. It's best known for their Breakfast Buzz morning smoothie with espresso, peanut butter and chocolate. I usually get their traditional burrito or Oatmeal their way made with quinoa! All their items are listed gluten free or vegan for customers who have diet limitations!

Super disappointed that I drove all the way to D'Lite after checking their hours online only to find a closed for summer hours sign taped to the window. It's not hard to update your hours online. Note to everyone: they close at 2pm during the summer.

Does it get any friendlier than this?  (Must be the sunshine and glorious temps in the winter- everyone in Scottsdale seems happy- and this placed topped out the smile & hospitality meter.)  Love the Buzz.  How can you go wrong with peanut butter, espresso, chocolate, and banana whipped up into a breakfast smoothie?  Fair-trade locally-roasted beans?  Kudos.   Ate in one morning with friends- cozy little indoor & outdoor spaces.  Had the low-carb breakfast- a pesto-ed fried egg salad and it was excellent.  So good I had to go back the next morning before flying home.  Tried the drive thru and grabbed a breakfast burrito (add some sausage & avocado for a cali-flair).  Perfect.  This healthy fast food movement needs to make its way West..  Come to San Francisco, D'Lish!

D'Lite is the real deal when it comes to healthy, organic, nutritious foods. They've got soups, salads, sandwiches, and smoothies for every palate, with a fresh interior design that invites you to sit down, relax, and take some "me-time" after the days events. Friendly, competent staff and an attractive fitness minded customer base make this the natural choice for your post workout meal. Bring a friend! You'll be glad you did!

Hangin' out at D'lish this AM,working the Wi-fi, drinking the java and enjoying the chill dance track soundtrack. Had a good (not great) egg 'n' cheese, and the barrista is generous with coffee refills. Definitely worth a visit if you're in S. Scottsdale. Fresh bunch of folks in and around.

First time at D'Lish and I was quite D'ssapointed. I ordered (to-go) the quinoa bowl that comes with veggies and it came out soup style...which then exploded in my paper bag on the drive back to work. I ordered mine without cheese expecting the bowl to then be a vegan dish but it appeared to be full of cream! Ew! Why would I bother to ask them when ordering if their "quinoa veggie bowl" has cream in it? SO weird. I also ordered an iced green tea with some lemonade mixed in and it came out pink and tasting like sugar water. Ummmmm.... when does green tea look pink... This place is a nice concept but it's overpriced and lacks vegan options and I won't be going back for food. I do want to try their coffee so I'll be back to see how that goes. All in all, D'Lish left a lot to be D'sired in my opinion.
Every Sunday I travel 15 miles for the best coffee in AZ. I love D'Lish and I love to see a local restaurant do well. Thanks for opening your doors!

The white guy behind the counter was kind of unfriendly when we came in, we hadn't done anything but walk in the door, hadn't even opened our mouths to order yet and the guy seemed like we were really putting him out by being there, but the Hispanic guy cooking and serving was really nice to us, which is what kept my husband from walking out on the bad first impression.  I'm glad we didn't leave cause the food was great.  I got the low carb breakfast and also sampled my husband's quinoa "oatmeal" (delicious with just the right amount of sweet and fresh fruit) and egg sandwich (cheese to die for and some very good chicken sausage).  My husband's complaint (beside the sort of assclowny guy behind the counter) was that the menu did not make clear that the egg sandwich was a fried egg rather than scrambled and that the oatmeal would be quinoa rather than regular oatmeal.  As we were sitting eating the CSA arrived with the days vegetable delivery.  Buying local from the farm?  No wonder it tasted so good.

I have been going here for as long as I can remember... ok, maybe not that long.  Early 2006?  I am guess what you would call a 'drive through regular'.  The Mocha Breve. It's not too sweet (a la starbucks) It's not too expensive (a la coffee bean and tea leaf) It is my perfect drink.   I stop by on my way to work (granted there is enough time and the line is not atrocious). It is manditory I go Saturday and Sunday mornings. I like to bring my dog - and he is always given a treat.    Because of D'Lish, my dog always expects to get a treat no matter where I take him in the car.  I go to the atm and he expects the machine to cough up a dog biscuit, I swear.    The coffee shop used to be called Daily Rush.  Many of the same faces are still around.  Rarely do I have to tell them what I want.  It's always the same: Mocha Breve 16 oz.  A couple times - they've seen me waiting a car or two back in the drive-thru line - my coffee is ready before I even pull up to the first window.   Yup, they get me.  For lunch - I love their soups in the fall, winter, and breezy spring.   Their tomato soup is perfect coupled with the grilled cheese.  I do recommend drinks only -  if you are doing drive through. If you require food - their is usually ample parking.  It takes some time.  A true testament to this place: It is one of the drawbacks of going on vacation.  I can never find coffee I like in other cities.  Daily Rush.. I mean, D'Lish is as good as it gets, in my opinion.  Cringing at the thought of ever-present starbucks.. vacation mornings make me long for home.  If you are in south scottsdale - I recommend stopping by.
Love the place and food, plus the drinks are outstanding just wish the price were a bit more affordable.
This is my favorite place to go eat at when by ASU. Always good, consistent  and there is always good friendly service.   My favorites are the Breakfast Buzz, California club and the Man Salad.

Wow can't believe it took me this long to come here. There are two locations closer to my house but I met a friend here for a weekend brunch before work. I know this place is constantly busy with the amount of cars in the drive thru, so that's a sign of a good business. We dined on their patio which is dog-friendly, and we saw some dogs inside as well.  Love that their menu is simple with healthy options that encompass all dietary preferences. I chose their nuts n' berries salad which comes with strawberries, blueberries, walnuts, and goat cheese on a bed of mixed greens and raspberry vinaigrette. It was light and refreshing, just what I needed since I wasn't feeling so great. My friend ordered their low carb breakfast, which was my other choice and she enjoyed it. I'm looking forward to trying other menu items and may visit the drive thru if it's not terribly busy.

Super friendly staff.  Had a crossant-wich.  Very tasty, came to me hot off the press. Not luke warm, freshly made which is nice!   Can definitely tell this is not your regular "fast food" joint.   However had a americano, a bit weak for my taste, considering I'm a Seattleite and huge coffee drinker.  But I'm still willing to give it 5 stars!  Must visit if you're in the area.

D'lish is great, we all know this. However, I think it's about time they got a bigger/more accessible location. They are always so packed which is obviously good but sometimes the drive thru line is just ridiculous, especially when people are sitting with half of their car still in the road. Also....good luck parking anywhere in that parking lot when there is a line in the drive thru. You are trapped. But that's enough negativity... Turkey Club, Breakfast Buzz, D 'Veggie Bowl, Tuna Sandwich, Veggie Burgers, Low Carb Breakfast, Green Tea, the list goes on. They also make a mean Dirty Chai. I wish they were open after 4pm....I can't tell you how many times I've craved it and looked at the clock...right at like 3:55pm. I also like how they come out to the drive thru and get orders rather than waiting for you to pull up to the window that does speed things up a bit.....and the fact that I typically know 90% of the people waiting in line at the drive thru. Nom Nom Nom

D'lish is my go to breakfast spot.  All the choices are healthy and you don't feel like a tub of lard after eating it.  I wish the drive through was a bit more accessible, but I'll take what I can get.  This place is always worth the wait.

D'lish is the best quick spot to get lunch without a side of coronary artery disease. Who would have ever thought that people would like healthy food coming through their car window!  Favorite things: The Orange Glorious. this my friends is new school orange Julius on steroids. all natural ingredients include an entire banana. so D'lish!  The California Club..phenomenal. like a flavor explosion in my mouth!   the staff is super personable and always chatty and friendly. I suppose when you take away the trans-fats, processed meats and general corporate shittyness of your average drive through food, everyone is just happier and better off!   my one and only gripe: they close pretty early, (4pm)  ive driven by a couple times for my black bean burger or chicken panini fix only to find they were closed for the day.

Decided to try this place to see if it was truly a healthy option. I am impressed not only with the food but the service as well. Place is clean. Had the vegan burrito and it was very good. I also had the berry smoothie and decided it was too sweet for me. They made me a green drink that was perfect!  I will be back sorry no pics ate it all!

Crazy busy on Saturday morning, avoid the drive thru and parking lot and opt for dining in.    Great, cheappp $5 hummus plate with pesto, aggghhhh so good!   Soup was decent and drinks are popular and well made.   I will be back if Im in the Scottsdale area again soon!

First time here- so good! I had the "low carb bfast" and my friend had the "bfast club". Both were filling and exceeded expectations. Good job D'lite! We also tried the green lemonade- also really good. Hint of sweetness that overpowered the garlic and ginger for me (probably not the best choice if you don't have much of either.) I couldn't really taste it, even tho girl taking our order said some people don't like it bc they could. Perfect choice for a healthy sit down or on the go brunch- will definitely be back :)

I would give it five if they could figure out the damn parking.... sitting with the rear of your car on Scottsdale Rd is just plain scary!. Yet worth it. I have had several things here. I would say that the chicken Panini ranks up there. The food is fresh and local and all that, so driving by this place to stop at Mickey Ds or T-Bell is just plain crazy. You will spend the same and get high blood pressure. I also enjoy the veggie wraps on occasion. There is one with hummus that tastes unlike anything you have ever had from take out. If you eat your veggies, that is. They have meat eater food there, too. But when you go healthy, it seems better  to get some greens down the pipe!. Line of cars my only issue...dang.
The food is soo gooood and the employees are very friendly.

Good food, fast service. Downside is that their parking situation sucks a lot. For driveup window orders you are often times stuck waiting in the middle of the road. They are busy AT ALL times soo no matter what time you come, or what day of the week it is, you will be waiting on the street for the drive thru window. Butttt they get things rolling pretty fast so not that bad. TURKEY CLUB AND BREAKFAST CLUB are delicious here!
Best iced chai with coconut milk!!! I got the man salad and it was everything I could have asked for. Super quick and healthy!
Love, love this place! They have excellent service and food AND offer Lots of gluten, dairy free and organic options!!! They were super kid friendly.  Oh and awesome music too! Yay Scottsdale!

I love this place!  I have been calling ahead to order an egg and cheese bialy to go for weeks now.  Their bialys are soooo yummy and the eggs are usually cooked perfectly!  I also like their salads, other breakfast sandwiches, low carb breakfast bowl, and southwest bowl.  We order lunch sometimes for our office from here as well.  They always get our orders right!  The final thing I'll mention is that I love that they offer doggy bags (leftover turkey and rice) for only $1.50 each!  I'll usually get these as a meal replacement for our pups when I want to treat them.

Sometimes you need to feel good about your "fast" food...ie. the awesome protein burger w/pesto.  That made me revise my review and up a star...hadn't tried it before...what was I missing?!  This is a very nice deli and quick stop for a healthy munchie or tasty, cold ice tea on a warm Valley day.  Great outdoor space as well.  The vibe is casual hippie/hipster/health nut in a GOOD way.  My usual favorite for lunch is the cold tuna salad sandwich (NOT canned tuna) on wheat toast.  My breakfast fave changes, but with so many good options (burritos, sandwhiches, etc) I'm never disappointed.  Probably not the option for someone looking for pork, butter, grease-laden hangover breakfast.  But this place has cured an ill or two of mine...

Small parking lot with an entrance that flows right into the drive thru line depending on time of day.  Problem is if people in drive thru dont hug the curb you can't get around them to park.  Almost as soon as you enter the parking lot from the East you will arrive at the drive thru order board.  If you're not familiar with this place you will completely miss your option to order. Parking is very limited to less than twenty spots. Menu isn't too complicated and really not much out of he ordinary. They have symbols beside every item that denotes vegetarian, gluten free, dairy free, protein packed, and balanced. Both entrees we ordered fell into the protein category. My sandwich was pretty good and only wish i could have had my eggs cooked to order.  I had a bite of my sons frittata and that was nummy and i will probably order it next time. Patio has more seating than there is inside.  Music is eclectic with jazz, funk, and a rap blended in which provides a more hip, youthful feel to the place -not that you need any more youthful and hip in an area that is so close to the college.  *g* Overall a decent change of pace and will probably come back again so i can try the frittata.

D'Lish is that total local spot that you keep to yourself. You don't want it to blow because its too perfect the way it is. All of the food is amazing, the management is awesome and they have some of the best coffee around.
This place was delicious! They do not have public restrooms though and the dine-in is very cramped. Food and service was great, though! Definitely going back.

Well they got the name right with this place because it is DEEEELISH!  I've been here twice (it would probably be closer to 50 times, but I live in Tucson)... the first time I got the az burro,  the second time a croissant sandwich.  Both these things I feel like I've had a hundred times before... but somehow D'lish makes them taste 100x better!  Don't know what their secret is, but I'm lovin it!

D'lish can be hit and miss, but when it's a hit, it is soooo good. I love their breakfast sandwhiches, and they usually have really good coffee. It gets really busy on the weekends, so prepare to wait a while if you're there on a Saturday or Sunday morning. If you ever drive by on the weekend and don't see a line, you owe it to yourself to pull off and get something to eat.   I typically get their egg and cheese breakfast sandwich, and I'll add either bacon or chicken sausage. My wife loves the croissant sandwich, which has egg, cheese, tomato, bacon and pesto. We'll also typically get coffees or a blended protein drink or something.   It's a great place to come for breakfast and coffee, but at times, the wait is really long, and the food/service can suffer when it's really busy. I'll continue to go there pretty much every weekend. Highly recommend.
Excellent find here near my hotel. Lots food options and nice setting and seating for customers. Great service and all is just right. I'll be back

Breakfast buzz. Maybe you shouldn't try it because of your inevitable addiction that will begin. A breakfast smoothie (milkshake?) with coffee, protein powder, chocolate syrup, milk, banana, and peanut butter. Unfortunately I have a hard time believing it is healthy because it tastes like a milkshake. D Lite also doesn't list nutrition facts and it's probably got a lot of sugar. Would love to see a healthier version maybe that includes spinach!

Fresh and healthy "fast food!" Count me in! I came here for the first time with a couple friends upon their recommendation. I had the Man Salad because it was chock full of healthy protein (tuna, avocado, chicken) and oh man! It was an amazing FILLING salad for a great price! I also had an iced chai latte, my favorite "coffee" drink, and they nailed it! I'll certainly be coming here again

Such a great and healthy alternative to fast food! This place is literally down the street from my house and I never had the chance to to try it out since there is always a line. I was not disappointed. The California club sandwich was delicious!!!

2nd best Best breakfast place in the valley (only to butters) if you ask me...can't beat the price of this place though. The oatmeal is the grandest oatmeal you'll ever have, so simple yet so delicious. The "oatmeal" part is actually quinoa which provides a great amount of protein and will keep you full until lunch time, if not later. Extremely healthy oatmeal that can't be compared to other places. Overall, such a quaint environment...their name speaks for itself when it comes to the food. The "house style" frittata is also pretty d'lish; it's served atop hash browns and toast, and topped with a spicy sauce. Coffee drinks are above-par.

Perfect place for a healthy yet tasty breakfast and quick! The breakfast buzz smoothie is must, especially if you're in a rush or want a light breakfast. I always go for the breakfast club as well. The tomato bialy adds the perfect extra flavor.
I love this location and the patio is spacious (and dog friendly!) Try the Breakfast Buzz shake, AMAZING.

Until recently I was the duchess of d'lish and it's about time I updated my review to reflect how amazing of a place it truly is.. a diamond in the rough.   Once I first tried the food menu I was insanely hooked. I now have a goal of trying every single thing on it and I'm about half way complete. It's a great place to swing by for breakfast to not only jump start your day with some protein, but to jump start your day with fun. One time a robot took my order!!  Lunch is just as nice. The staff is great while you are there and really appreciate their customers (and they even tell you).  My favorite breakfast has to be the croissant sandwich (with no tomato) and for lunch I've ended up getting the chicken panini more than anything else.   If I'm craving a hot drink it's always a chai latte and for cold it's an arnold palmer with black tea.  If you haven't been here yet, you should go out of your way to swing by!

I love this place but today I've been disappointed at the face that I ordered 2 broccoli sides and they both did NOT HAVE FETA CHEESE  IN THEM :( this was way disappointed I spent 16 bucks on all my food today and the one ingredient that I look forward to having was missing :(

So I've been anxiously waiting for more healthy options to come to my part of town. When I saw this place was about to come in I got super hyped! Finally open for business and here I am eating lunch. As usual my reviews are largely based on how good customer service is so I will start there.   Customer Service: 5*!! That's right 5 stars alone for the service. Everyone here is amazing. Even though the cashier was on the phone taking a to go order when I walked in, he still acknowledged me.Once he was off phone I was asked if I'd been here before and when I said no, he started to suggest what I would like. (After asking if I felt for breakfast or lunch) he suggested the Humanitarian, and after reading what was in it I said ok. He then offered me a sample of their  special nitro coldbrew. The other employees have been just as nice and easy going. Having fun as they work. I've sat here watching them all work in the kitchen and even the owner had gloves on and showing other employees how to properly make a burrito. Impressive.  Food: Smoothie with garlic in it?? Don't let it scare you, I was given a sample and there is no taste of garlic in it! It's super smooth, tasty, and refreshing all at the same time. The Humanitarian burrito is also very light, crunchy . I feel that next time I should add avocado to add a creamier texture. But definitely a good and appreciated suggestion. Will order again for sure. And the cold brew is just amazing, smooth, light and no bitterness to it at all. All in all this has been an incredible experience that I look forward to enjoying again. The fact that they have WiFi is also a great bonus. The cleanliness and open atmosphere will have me coming back more often than I probably should.

I love the breakfast buzz at D'lite! The drive through does take forever in the morning to only get a shake. They are also pretty expensive and from what I can see through the drive-through window is they are all premade in a giant blender. It makes me wonder if I'm actually getting a good amount of espresso in my drink.   I've also had their turkey sandwich it is really good! The bread is fresh and the meat was sliced perfect!
I just absolutely love this place! First visit I had the California club and it was amazing!! I'm here again and diving into the Southwest bowl, it's so good!!!

So I'll admit that when I find something that makes my taste buds beyond happy, that I get a little obsessed with it.  D'Lite Healthy has that thing for me.  Ladies and gentleman; I give you....the Breakfast Buzz.  The Breakfast Buzz is the penultimate of all breakfast shakes in my book.  Here's why: Protein Powder - Check! Chocolate, Bananas and Peanut Butter - Check, check, check!!  And Espresso you say?!?  CHECK!!  This is seriously all things that I absolutely love combined into a tasty, delicious, creamy shake.
