I seriously get it at least once a week; like I said....I can get obsessed.  If you are like me and love a great breakfast shake, then you should hightail it to D'Lite stat!!  You don't even have to get out of your car if you don't want to; they'll serve you in their drive-through.  You're welcome :)

I go there about three times a month and every time it's a great experience... I typically get the az burro which is delicious, and really tasty enchilada style... The staff is where it's at though...always always extremely friendly. Love this place
Stopped by a few days ago and the helpful cashier suggested the cali club and breakfast buzz, which I went with.  Both were PHENOMENAL, will definitely be back here soon.

The strong points are the friendly, attentive service, and a nice lounge chair sitting area towards the front; loved the fact they had the bowl game on.  The store is clean and well lit and has Wi-Fi.  The menu itself is a bit limited, or as another reviewer said, 'modest.'    We ordered a Turkey Club Sandwich, a Chicken Breast Panini, with a side of the Portabello soup.   The food was good; portions were average size.   Re pricing, as an example, the Club was $8.50 with no sides or garnishes or drink, and it was a nice, but average sandwich; this is a $$ tab by the time you order a complete meal. That said, I'm sure I'll be back because I like the environment and it seems healthy.
Good, timely service. Sandwich was a bit small for the price but it was very good. Coffee is above average but wouldn't recommend ordering a large as it's 32 ounces and quite a challenge to finish.

Amazing food/ drinks but the service is SO SLOW. They have got to do something to speed things up at this place. No matter the time of day or what day it is you will be sitting in the drive thru for a good 15 mins.
California Club and Breakfast Buzz. Nuff said. I could grab either one of those for breakfast every day and still be happy. If you haven't been to D'lish you are missing out.. SO good!

I am a regular at this place and absolutely love it. It is so nice to have a healthy food drive thru that you can grab at any time of the day. The people that work here are awesome, and the service is great. The breakfast buzz and the California club breakfast sandwich are to die for. I would eat these every day if I could!!!!

Very good ... got the low carb breakfast bowl ... added chicken sausage ... yummy.   My only suggestion ... it would be great if the calories were posted like most places do these days. Other than that, I'll be back.

The reality is that I'm a big person that needs to be a smaller person. So in all fairness, I'm limited in what my choices are here and am criticizing the most difficult item on the menu. Despite the other incredible looking and highly recommend coffee drinks and croissant sandwiches.  The low carb breakfast was pretty tasty overall. The bacon was a little weird and tough and I was surprised to see a little brick of potato patty included as a low carb option. Like I said, it was tasty and I wasn't complaining because even if it wasn't exactly what I expected, since I've been dieting I'm always hungry and could eat a tire if I added salt.  Seriously though, the staff is very upbeat and knowledgeable, the place is clean and I definitely recommend it. :)

I love this place so much!  I love places that are exactly what you expect with great food.  It's not huge, not an amazing dining experience on the inside, etc.  It's great food, nice people, good prices, and EXACTLY what you want when you go there.  Healthy fresh selections. I have a hard time driving past it and not stopping in!!

Brilliant business model. Fast, delicious seriously healthy food. Great for Gluten-free, or vegetarians, or vegans, or anything that ends in -Ans.   Small place, order right up at front counter. A ton of crazy delicious items - bowls - smoothies -   Parking can be slightly tricky, especially with the lady in the drive through burrito place next door yelling at me for going the wrong way through her empty drive-thru. Oops.

Everybody working here needs to look alive.... smh. Worst customer service. Literally just hand out your drink with not a simple "hello, here's your drink for you " gets our order wrong 2/3 times we go .
First timer over here and the "EARLY BIRD BURGER" is absolutely delicious!!!! I highly recommend this spot!

Food is great.  Service, wait times, and parking Sucks!  I love the healthy and sustainable concept and the food was above average.  I have been to D'Lish three times, and have had horrible experiences with service, and having to wait 10-15 minutes for "fast food".  I understand that quality food takes time to make, but they need some serious help! I am beginning to think that the owners are stubborn and don't want to pay for more help.  I was also overcharged for my food on every occaison, and was so frustrated with the cashier, and the pressure of the long line of people waiting to order that I just said "screw it".  Based on food alone, I would give this place 4 stars.  But the bad service brings my rating down to 2 stars.  I hope that this place gets their act together because I would enjoy their food more with better service.  I also think they should be open later than 4pm.  Seriously, who eats a meal at 4pm?

The most incredible thing on the menu is the AZ burro. Egg whites and feta are the best combination. The iced coffee was "d'lish" and the food was promptly brought to our table. If I lived in Scottsdale,  I'd be eating here all the time!
I love their breakfast burritos!! I have tried a few different ones and they are all good. Worth the extra wait.

The food is great- I love the black bean portobello burger and I practically lived off of the California club in college!   I go about once a month now for a quick bite to-go and while the food and service is still 5 star, I am so bummed that the seasonal smoothie is STILL the apricot peach. It's tasty, don't get me wrong; however, don't call it a 'seasonal' smoothie if it is going to be the same smoothie for a year. It definitely makes me question how fresh your products are.

It's very obvious this is chain restaurant that probably used to be good when they had one or two stores but now is not. I think this used to be a McDonalds and it still feels like it inside but at like 10x the price. The last time I was there I added avocado to my order, paid for it, and they left it off. The previous time my burrito was undercooked and literally ice cold to the touch. It just feels like you're paying restaurant prices for (not great) fast food that's dressed up by their "healthy" tagline.

Cute place!  Nice drive-thru window.  Adorable, really.  Nice patio-dining/lounging.  Noise-level inside was a little loud, but there were eight people, six of w/c were talkative yelpers (ha!), plus Kyle and Chad, owners of D'lish (who were, btw, easy on the eyes... a great asset for any business!).  One special request- please offer Maya Chai!  While Oregon Chai tastes OK, I'm allergic (I suspect there are "natural flavors" involved), and organic Maya Chai is multiple-times better (and, most importantly, I don't recall feeling negative effects after)!  Great spot to unwind and rejuvenate.  Will come back soon to try the food!

Wasn't too happy with this one. Followed the 4.5 star review on yelp and figured we would give it a shot. Coffee was okay, nothing spectacular. The food was not worth going back for. We had breakfast, the frittata and the breakfast croissant sandwich. The eggs were over cooked to the point they were rubbery tasting. The staff was nice but other then that, not a place I would visit again.

Quite satisfied with our delicious low carb breakfast bowls- or as we dubbed them "breakfast salads". Organic greens with tomato, avocado, 2 eggs, cheese and a pesto and balsamic drizzle. I was a bit confused because it also came with a hash brown patty which is definitely NOT low carb. When I asked the cashier about it he just shrugged. I just ordered it with no hash browns and he offered an extra egg. Yes please! It was quick, delicious, healthy and cheap. After driving all night from Santa Cruz it was just what we needed!!

Have only been there once. I ate inside, versus on the patio. There is no bathroom for patrons.   When I asked if this was against the law, I was told, "No , that's only if we serve alcohol."   Really?   So, after I ate my veggie burger and left, i just pee'd outside on the grate -- the one right in front of where the drive-up customers drive up.  I waved to a few who had braked for me after I stood up , shook off and zipped up.

This is a tiny place that gets crazy during the rush and there is very little parking but with that said YOU MUST GO HERE AND TRY THE CALIFORNIA CLUB FOR BREAKFAST.  It is pretty much the best breakfast sandwich on the planet.  I usually use the drive through and it doesn't always go that fast but it is well worth the wait.  This place is popular for a reason...check it out.

I believe they changed their menu or something. I have been going here since they first opened the Tempe location. Have gone a few times to the Shea location. Went on Sunday and was completely disappointed in everything I got besides the breakfast buzz. My humanitarian did not have the extra avocado I was charged. The vegetables looked and tasted like they came from a fast food place like Burger King equivalent, maybe even worse. I also got the hummus which they only gave me about a tablespoon  and it had absolutely no flavor. The veggies that came with it were disgusting and very low quality. The pita was ok but I wish I would have been able to eat it with some hummus, but unfortunately it was gone in about three bites with the gross veggies. The service has also been very off lately. I'm sad because I used to love this place, and have been a loyal customer, but after that expensive meal that I could hardly eat (I also tipped very generously btw) I don't think I will he going back.

Love love love the california club breakfast sandwich.  I crave it whenever I am near one of these locations.  I ordered it without meat this time and it was just as awesome.  Something about the soft bread, great egg, and pesto with cheese that makes this sandwich heaven.  This location is much larger with more parking than the Thomas and Scottsdale road location and it is nice and new inside.  I usually hit this place up on a Tuesday morning for a once per month meeting that starts early so I get here between 7-7:30am and no one is ever there that early during the week so I have the place to myself.  Highly recommend trying this place if you haven't yet....its awesome.

bad day? wrong order? I was so excited to try this place and was rather disappointed. The veggie wrap my friend ordered was bland and very unexciting. And the bowl I ordered tasted like canned mushroom soup - is it a bowl or is it a soup? Neither of us finished our food... The service was trite... one minute I'm giving my order the next i'm being ignored... and then poof, i'm ordering and then sort of being helped... abrasively but with a smile... no thanks.... I totally enjoyed my chai latte... but probably not going back anytime soon...

Went to Dlish for the first time on Sunday for lunch.  It was a great place to go.  Ordered a turkey cranberry sandwich and had it switched to a style without bread.  They tried to make it as close to what I wanted and they well exceeded my expectations.  Great place to go for breakfast or lunch!!

Busy little place.  Stopped in at around 10:30 AM and found a table near the window.  Be prepared for a noisy atmosphere.  They play music while you dine, but it has to compete with kitchen noise and patron conversations.  I would recommend sitting outside.  Decided to order the egg and cheese sandwich, with their chicken sausage and a Glorious Orange smoothie.  Total price was almost $12.00.  The price for their smoothies is pretty standard: $5.00 for a large.  However, $6.00 for a sausage, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich is a little steep.  Not to mention the fact that I paid $1.50 for a few slices of sausage.  I'm not sure how they justify that cost.  The sausage added a nice flavor to an otherwise bland egg and cheese sandwich.  I also recommend spicing it up with some of their hot sauce.    They chose to use "bialy" bread for their breakfast sandwiches, which is an excellent decision.  The bread is soft and spongy, with a texture similar to a bagel.  All in all, the food wasn't too bad.  For me, the price is the main concern.  I don't want to fork out almost $7.00 for a simple breakfast sandwich.  With so many breakfast joints to choose from, I can't say that I will be back anytime soon.  Nice guys, though.  You should definitely visit at least once and say 'hello.'

3 Stars for the food, zero stars for the ambiance/noise/parking.  Maybe that's why they have the words 'drive'thru' in their name.  I got the Kitchen Sink salad, added Chicken.  It was fine, and a decent price.  But the noise level in the restaurant was so incredibly loud that my friend and I actually would just burst out laughing because we coudn't hear a word that either was saying.  Throw in a blender and then random music being turned up even louder just for good measure and it just became comical.  I would go back for the food and bring it back to my desk, but would never actually eat there again.
Great, reasonably healthy food, and priced like fast-food. The service can be curt at times, but I tend to give them a pass because they do run a very busy drive through.
Long lines but always worth it.  The breakfast buzz is my all time favorite pick me up.

Everything I have had here is great. Breakfast buzz and protein burgers are a weekly staple in my diet. Staff is friendly. It can get crowded and limited parking. Must try and you will keep coming back for more!
D'Breakfast Buzz is sooooo good you can't go wrong with that shake and it's filling.

Seriously in love with this location. Everyone here is super friendly. The food is fresh and delicious. The drive thru is convenient.  Their green tea is so refreshing. The Turkey Club is one of my all time favorites but their bowls are also worth tasting. I haven't tried their burgers but I will one day. The breakfast menu options are also worth trying. I opt for the frittatas or az burro. The oatmeal isn't all that bad but the other items are sooooo much better.
This place is fucking amazing--coming from a fatass who hates "healthy" food. Fucking delicious.

Omgosh. Thank goodness we didn't try this place while we were still living in Arizona or else we'd be broke from coming here all the time! We tried their drive thru, dined in, and had gotten take out. Everything is so good, fresh, and made so quickly! It's nice that they made drive-thru an option - a much healthier alternative to your typical fast food joints.  Food: 1) Turkey club 2) Veggie d'lite 3) Dirty chai (chai with a shot of espresso) - tried it hot & cold. Both were good but the iced was a little better 4) Protein shake 5) AZ Burro 7) Veggie Burrito 7) Breakfast buzz  All the drinks and food were so delicious and cheap considering how healthy it is! All the workers are polite and they work fast. My mouth is watering as I write the review! Oh how I miss D'lish...!
California Club is AMAZING plus an iced mocha. Highly recommend!

Tasty! Tasty! Tasty!  Did I mention that the food here is tasty?!  LOL  I love the fact that they are open at 6am, so hit up the drive-thru and grab breakfast before work.  I've had the Cali Club and the Veggie Burrito.  The cali club is by far my favorite!  The veggie burrito was good, but a little on the bland side (even with the salsa).  Added salt and pepper after the first few bites, and it was then prefect.    This place can get super packed for during the brunch/lunch hour, and the parking lot is really small. so ordering ahead is always advised.    Think I'll go get a Cali Club tomorrow for breakfast!  :D
The GREEN LEMONADE is AMAZING!!! It's the best combination of sweetness and greens.  The addition of ginger and cilantro makes it the best juice ever. I couldn't put it down!!

This is my default to-go for lunch. I have tried the AZ burrito , veggie burrito, frittata and a few other dishes. Never been disappointed with the taste and quantity. Definitely one of the healthier options out there. The service is excellent. I have dined in but generally use their drive thru to get my lunch. When there is a queue 1-2 staff come out and take your orders. Highly recommended for a quick, healthy and delicious breakfast/ lunch.   They have protein shakes also - excellent!!
One of the best place in the world to eat your breakfast, the employees are great and always nice !  The best things to eat there is the California one don't miss that ! Highly recommended!!!
I LOVE this restaurant! The food is delicious, healthy and fast. Every person I have interacted with at this location is friendly and efficient. I am addicted!

3 stars because their food is awesome but can never seem to get my order right whether they're busy or not. The one on Scottsdale Rd is SO much better. Every morning the one on Scottsdale Rd has a line out to the street and they still get my order right every time. They even repeat my order back to me when they hand me the food. The employees at this D'lish just really don't seem to care, which is super disappointing. I'll be making the trip to the Scottsdale location from now on.

You know, it's really a nice thing to have an option for a fast, but relatively healthy breakfast.  The restaurant itself is basically a drive thru type place with a slight coffee house vibe on the inside.  They weren't slammed but were pretty steady, and were able to move customers through quickly.  I had the veggie burrito, which was pretty good and cheesy, and was served with a very tasty, very mild salsa which gave it some flavor it otherwise would have been lacking.  Tanya had the veggie frittata, which was also quite good and was served on toast, which was a little more than lightly buttered, but that's okay.  Broccoli for breakfast ain't really my bag, but she seemed to be okay with it.  The place seems priced about right, and it's nice to finish breakfast out and not feel like a big fat whale.  For that alone, this place would get my recommendation, but they manage to make healthyish food taste pretty good, too.

Dlish always does it right. From the wraps to the salads you can not go wrong with anything on this menu!! Plus the drive through is clutch when you want a quick dinner but are not feeling Mcdonalds. We will be back soon!

I came here a few weeks ago and I really loved it. I thought it was great that most of the ingredients were vegan and vegetarian friendly. My husband and I came here for breakfast. I had a strawberry banana smoothie and my husband had a chocolate, coffee peanut butter protein shake to die for. And we had bagels that were very tasty. I would love to come back here for lunch, everything sounded excellent, especially the soup. I was also impressed with the staff....I thought that was the best feature of this whole place. They are super friendly, and this one guy, was SOOOOOOOO Funny the way he was greeting people and making jokes. It was very outgoing and it made the customers feel like they had been coming there forever even if it was their first time. It also makes patrons and business owners feel like they are an important part of the community with the camaraderie that takes place here. I am looking forward to returning.

This place is my go-to when I'm in a hurry for breakfast in Phoenix. They have delicious Nitro Toddy and I LOVE their breakfast burritos- the veggie and the AZ Burro. My husband tried the low carb breakfast and he was impressed too (see photo). Quick and efficient service, healthy and delicious food/coffee and a great price point.
Management took care of me and this time it was to perfection. Love this place and their food. Highly recommend the cali club and breakfast buzz!

First time, went signature on both food/drink (California club/Breakfast buzz). Service was exceptional, food is fresh & hot, very good place. Small place primarily drive thru or togo, about 6 tables & counter seating. Loud due to the blenders & good mellow tunes playing.

How many times have you wanted healthy food but had no time to sit down or run into a Sprouts or TJ's?! D'lite is the answer! Healthy drive-thru! You can park and sit down and enjoy the food there, but if you're in a time crunch, they offer drive by service. So convenient, and the food is delicious. The Breakfast Buzz is their most popular drink, and for good reason. It's my new go to morning drink. Chocolate, banana, espresso?! What else is there? I also love their chicken pesto sandwich, and their side beet salad with goat cheese. There are tons of vegetarian options, and vegan as well. The Breakfast Buzz comes in a vegan form as well! The service is always great, and everyone is kind and helpful. :) love it all.

This place is very unique and healthy! Their wraps are amazing and the blended "buzz" is very addicting. The only downside is the parking situation. I hate having to pull into this place because I feel like im either holding up traffic or about to get hit. A better idea - park at the Albertsons parking lot and WALK over. It'll be worth the few extra steps :)

In a weird location in Tempe and run by what seems to be college kids so service is very lax but staff is always very friendly. I've only ordered the California Club because I enjoy it so much but I have heard you can't really go wrong with anything. I work near by and my coworkers go at least twice a week for breakfast and lunch so they always rave about it. Next time I go I'm trying something new.  Funny Note: The back parking lot really reminds me of a Sonic but I have never been there when the speaker service is working.

Deliciousness - 3/5 Happiness - 3/5  Despite the utter temptation of fried chicken from nearby restaurants, I went to this small healthy eatery. The menu is huge, with rice/quinoa bowls, wraps, salads, soup, breakfast items and plenty of drinks (coffee and juices... not alcohol!).   I got an egg and chicken sausage sandwich (on a bialy) and then a couple of bagels for the kids. I also got the mushroom soup, which was really thick and flavorful. And it was portabella based, which is great if you are a mushroom fan. The sandwich was OK but honestly lacked taste (it sorely needed some heat). The bialy was bland as well, which I view as a capital sin. The sausage was a bit on the chewier side. The kids devoured their bagels (and stole a bit of my soup too).  This is a unique option that prioritizes drive thru. So when you have the willpower to go healthy while driving, this will meet your goal (even if it won't blow you away).
Amazing!!!! Fast service and excellent food. Love the fact they have a drive-thru and great selection. Go to items - Kitchen Sink salad and the Humanitarian Chix Supreme wrap ;)

The boyfriend and I like to stop here when we're in town, especially when we're in a hurry for a good (and healthy) bite to eat. Well, I suppose it's not exactly a "quick" fix if you go during peak lunch hours, but what place is during those times anyway.  Service is great. They're always super friendly and welcoming, whether in the drive-through or if you go inside.  Food is amazing, as most of the other reviews have stated. I'm a tuna sandwich sucker, and this place makes me feel so much better about eating one. It's a "healtified" version, and it's actually even better than the original that's drenched in mayo. Burgers are yum, and I always love the teas they have. Prickly Pear seems to be a favorite of mine.  Parking lot sucks though. It's highly inconvenient, so be patient and careful while driving through or parking.

All bfast burritos are great.  Wish the salsa was more flavorful/spicy.  Love that they have sundried tomato wraps.  Hummus plate for $5 is an absolute steal.  So big & good (homemade hummus, broccoli, tomatoes, carrots, etc.).  SUPER friendly & fast service, both inside and drive thru.  Love the decor/colors, vibe.  Espresso could be better, it was a little bitter.  I want to try everything on the menu.  It all sounds so great.
Favorite place for a fast, healthy & delicious breakfast! All the employees are super friendly, too. I get the breakfast buzz at least 4x a week!!

Great find on a hockey trip to Scottsdale. Yummy breakfast options and quick, friendly service. Tried the California club based on reviews--good choice (substantial but not too heavy).  veggie burrito was good and filling, as was the low carb breakfast which "hit the spot". Latte and iced coffee were good.

This is the perfect place to grab a quick, healthy breakfast before heading to work. Their breakfast buzz shake was DELICIOUS. Had the right consistency to a shake, tasted fresh, and wasn't too sweet. My only gripe was we did a phone order hoping it'll be ready when we got there but they ended up making it after we paid at the register, pretty much defeats the purpose of calling in.  I also tried their breakfast burrito, definitely on the healthier side than what I'm used. It needed more cheese and seasoning. And the ratio to egg, cheese, and potato was off. Had a ton more scrambled eggs then I wanted.  The place is super clean, really hip with modern furniture/seating. Definitely want to go back to try their lunch!

April 28, 2016 around 8 am. Love the food here everything is usually yummy. But today I came here and thought about ordering a smoothie, the Four Berry smoothie. I'm very health concious and wanted to know the ingredients that went into my smoothie because many smoothies are filled with sugar and artificial additives. When I first asked what was in the smoothie the girl replied in a very sarcastic voice and said "four berries." Then when I asked again she listed off the four berries finally. Then I asked what else was in it (because obviously a smoothie isn't made out of just four blended berries) So then finally she said a banana. THEN I ask what liquid is in the smoothie that makes it a smoothie and she says "the berries make it a smoothie" The entire time she was talking in an extremely rude voice and being completely unhelpful and vague. So dossapoiinted I just wanted a smoothie but I gave up. When we got to the window for the coffee we ordered someone that seemed to be the manager was up there and was rude and unfriendly to us as well.

This restaurant reminds me of being in Portland for some odd reason. The restaurant is pretty small, but the good thing is they have a drive-thru.  Breakfast selections were straight to the point. I had their Low-Carb breakfast that I ordered with a side of chicken sausage. I have no idea why this place calls this breakfast "low-carb" because it comes with a hash brown. I think a piece of wheat toast would have lower carbs than a baked hash brown. I would probably rename this  "Low-Carb" breakfast to "breakfast salad" because all it was just a salad with a hash brown and egg on top. It was served on a bed of greens with tomatoes on the side. The dish had balsamic vinaigrette on the bottom of the greens, and pesto sauce drizzled on the top.  I didn't like how my eggs were over hard.  In fairness, this dish had a nice presentation.   If I were to remake this dish, I would probably have the eggs poached, skip the hash brown, and add turkey bacon crumbles. The chicken sausage was nothing special. It was one sausage sliced up covered in cheese that became hard. They should probably grate the cheese over the sausage so it melts delicately on the sausage.   My brother-in-law had the breakfast "traditional burrito".  He was not to happy with it and thought it could use more cheese and flavor.  This is definitely a quasi healthy spot.

I really like this place.  The concept is great, its cheap(ish) and healthy.  But I've gotten a hair in my food two times.  I really liked the food here, so when I got a hair in my bagel one time I totally almost vomited, couldn't finish eating, but still I went back because the food was good.  The second time when I got it in my sandwich, I pretty much decided NEVER AGAIN.  Either they did not like me or their kitchen is really unclean or they all need to wear hairnets and beard nets since it is hipster mecca.

There is a place in Arizona where the convenience of fast food meets the benefits of a fresh, quasi vegetarian menu in a salubrious confluence of amazing food and drinks. This place is D'Lish. Didn't see that coming, did you?  While this place is great any day of the week, I usually like to include it in my weekend routine. What is that routine you ask, well I'll tell you. I wake up before sunrise and hike a mountain shaped like a camel. At the top, I fight a dragon who has swallowed a magical key that will unlock a room at the top of a tower that contains a riddling troll who will eat you if you cannot answer his three mind puzzles. After wrenching the key from the bowels of the flying beast, I realize I'm hungry, so I stop at D'Lish for an early morning meal, which delivers every time to satiate my heroic appetite.  The AZ Burro, the Protein Burgers (House style and early bird) are my personal favorites, but I have yet to eat something there I didn't thoroughly enjoy. I even like the frittatas, which I previously thought to be punishment disguised as food.  And then there're the drinks, which seem to have already been covered thoroughly by my fellow yelpers, so I'll just say this: I can see The "Dwayne Johnson" Rock drinking/eating a breakfast buzz. Or at least that's how I like to picture myself when I consume one.  Having devoured my breakfast burrito and protein peanut butter coffee drink, I continue my weekend quest to the tower with the troll, fueled by the life-giving offerings of D'Lish Kitchen and Coffee House.
Came here and did drive-though to pick up a turkey sandwich and the "man" salad.   The salad was really good!!!!  On a hot summer day, the salad is a perfect choice for lunch!!!

D'Lite is damn near perfect. There's not much I can add to the huge amount of glowing reviews, but the friendly staff, extremely clean dining space, and amazingly-tasty (and quick) food all definitely earns their 5 star average.  Their iced coffee is perfect and I've tried two separate breakfast dishes:   1) The AZ burro (sans feta) was the perfect breakfast burrito (turkey, potatoes, avocado, egg whites, tomato). It fills you up without killing you and rendering your morning workout useless.   2) The low carb breakfast (2 eggs, tomato, avocado, greens, hash brown patty (!) and pesto drizzle (!!)) was different and light and so, so tasty.   My husband has stuck with two of his new favorites: their riff on quinoa oatmeal--I love that they offer a variety of milk choices, and their California club.  That's all you need to know. Go and love!

My favorite healthy fast food place around.  It's not just the typical salad and wrap place.  It's kind of funny because I feel like a lot of places around try to copy D'Lite but they just aren't the same.
Fresh fast food, unique menu, and great employees.  What's not to love.  I go hear all the time so that's pretty much the best compliment I can give.
D'Lish was great!  I order the Cali breakfast sandwhich and it was awesome.  Reasonably priced, plenty of seating, and the food was made quickly.
Great breakfast sandwiches. Healthy to-go options. We came here every day on our visit.

Good place, but a little pricey.   I was looking for some brunch, and didn't want to get something unhealthy. Yelped around and found this place. Took a look at the menu and decided that yes, it seems to be worth my time and money.   That said, I ordered a veggie burrito and a four berry smoothie.  I added avocado to the burrito and it probably made it even more delicious. The burrito overall tasted really... fresh! Didn't taste processed at all. It was as if they had fresh ingredients laying around and threw it into a torrilla, which was a sun dried tomato one.  The four berry smoothie was really fresh tasting, not that artificial tasting powder stuff that other places have. I think it consisted of raspberry, blackberry, strawberry and blueberry... and banana.   Overall, this place is really good. I think it's not really worth the money, but still good. Portions sizes for both things I bought didn't really reflect the prices in my opinion. But if you are looking to get into the healthy fresh fast food world, I think this is a great place to start.

Had the turkey club... ehh I mean it was good don't get me wrong but it wasn't wow. the drive thru was crazy almost out on the street. I parked and got it to go and still got out faster than the drive thru lane.

This place is awesome. I was in town visiting from Las Vegas and found it based on all the Yelp Reviews. I got here just in time before the drive thru line went out into the street. I ordered the turkey sandwich with no bacon and it was delicious. Probably one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. The ice coffee was good too. I highly recommend this place! A+++

What to do before heading out to the ballgame?  D'lish is the answer.    Great place, great local crowd.  Ended up going every single morning of our Spring Training trip.    The first day, we parked and went inside - ordered breakfast sammy's: a California club and a breakfast burrito - with a cup of coffee.  Very good both - but as we watched what the Regulars were ordering and we continued to read and re-read the menu as we enjoyed our breakfast we realized we missed the BOAT (Best Of All Time) - that's right all you Regulars know what I'm talking about - The Breakfast Buzz shake!!! Vitamins, protein, espresso, nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, chocolate all blended with some ice! Oh yeah, great start and keeps you going all morning!   Oh and you don't even need to get out of the car. - 'cause you don't need to sit down at a table to enjoy it.  Utilize the drive-thru - and you are all fueled up - drink and enjoy as you drive to the ballpark.

Food is amazing and always taste fresh... When you can make it here.... Id be here 2 or 3 times a week if their hours didnt suck. You come most times of the day and its busy . but still they close early . just doesn't make sense. Stay open til 6 or 7 and get the crowd who is just getting off work.

I'd like to start off by saying there is no parking... the drive thru line takes up both sides of the parking lot. Besides the parking issue this place is awesome. The workers are friendly and so polite and seem to have great personalities. They're quick and efficient! The food was great and had cream cheese in it? I didn't even taste it though. Anyways this place is cool and I'd recommend. Just park somewhere else and walk

Nothing beats D'lish after a nice Camelback hike.  Some of the best iced coffee in town and the food choices are healthy, appropriately portioned, and diverse. I've enjoyed mostly their vegetarian options, but their carnivorous offerings are really, really tasty as well--I recommend the Low Carb Breakfast, which is mixed greens and fresh tomatoes topped with a hash brown, fried eggs, and some pesto.  I don't recommend the "drive thru", you'll be waiting for looooong time (although I've heard you can call ahead and reduce this wait). The seating inside is a bit cramped (the new Tempe location has a cozier patio) but I kind of like that charm in a place like this.

We've anxiously awaited for this location to open. It's closer to home, than the Scottsdale location.   The food has the same great flavor as the other location, however the serving size was significantly smaller. Basically half the size of the servings in Scottsdale, but the same prices which aren't the cheapest. It would be better to have a consistent experience across the locations.   I hate that we were disappointed, we've been regulars for years. Back to Old Town we go.

The beet salad is to die for...and I hate beets! The food is always good and the people are cool.  Nice healthy choices. I have heard their breakfasts are good too, but haven't had the chance yet. YUM!

Awesome, tasty breakfast/brunch options. Everything was hot and fresh. Everyone was super friendly. The orange glorious smoothie was to die for. The kitchen had a mixup with our order and they completely went above and beyond to make up for it. The people that work here are truly good people. We will definitely be back.

I have been to this place a couple of times now for lunch and really enjoy it.  It has a small menu with just a few sandwich and salad options; you can also get breakfast all day (I believe).  They are known (apparently) for coffee, which I have not yet had the pleasure of enjoying.  I had the veggie wrap the first time and tuna salad sandwich today - LOVED the dill spice in the tuna.  Very fresh and well...D'lish.

My friends were boasting about this place and so I threw it on my bookmark list. Today I had the pleasure to stop in for some breakfast and I was very delighted!   I got the California Club sammich which was divine  I also had a caramel latte and it too was cute  What totally made my visit was when the ASU mens rugby team walked in...  I melted!

I wanted something quick and tasty and the yelp reviews were great so I decided to give it a shot.  I was pleased with my salad, I got the Kitchen Sink! I do recommend it!  The only reason I gave it a 3 star review, is because I feel like the portion size wasn't very satisfying (or maybe I was really hungry that day) and the parking situation there is horrible.  They have a drive thru, but I opted to go in and eat lunch inside.  When I came out, the drive thru line was long and I couldn't back out my car because of the way the parking lot and drive thru is set up.  Not ideal, especially when you're trying to get back to work from your lunch break.  So in short food is tasty, but for me personally, the parking sitch alone makes me want to not go back.

What a little gem. I had this place bookmarked and it was highly recommended I try the California Club - I listened and am so glad I did! It was the best breakfast sandwich I've had in a long time! My iced latte complimented it perfectly. I only regret I was too stuffed to go crazy with the Breakfast Buzz...saw so many people coming in to order it.  My only reason for not giving this place the 4 stars it earned with its great food is due to the service. Nice people, just not the most alert. I was sitting at the counter for a good 10 mins and gave him time to attend to me when 3 different people walked in and got taken care of first. Not cool. But I'm sure they're workin' on it and anytime I'm in Scottsdale, I'll definitely be returning.

Really enjoyed this place. I'm always trying to find new things to love and this place satisfied me even with my particular tastes. My husband loved his panini and I loved my turkey sandwhich. It's very small, but very nice to sit on the patio and enjoy good, healthly food with a lemonade! Would love to come here again.

Just walked out of there. Ordered coffee and was treated very rudely.  The workers were more interested in talking to each other then helping their one and only customer.    I had ordered my coffee. Asked for whipped cream. A guy who was behind the cashier said,  this isn't Starbucks.  I personally hate Starbucks. I didn't say anything.  But then the girl cashier says,  sheesh he is only joking.  I walked out of there immediately.  Off to Dutch brothers. Always get great coffee and great attitudes

Groovy little joint located in Scottsdale. Not bad for a quick, healthy bite if in the area. Keep your eyes peeled, easy to miss while on the road. But when you find it, go ahead and enter the quaint,  small coffee shop and take a peak around- witness the gleam of natural light shine through the windows,  and walk up to the counter to glance at the menu and decide on your order. I got the California club & egg sandwich, which both were delicious. Hot and fresh, quick and easy- boom! Only downside is no public restroom - go 2 buildings down to the bar and use theirs.

Holy cow. I'm a first timer here and I'm converted for LIFE!!  I got the "oatmeal our way" (organic quinoa, vanilla macaroon granola, seasonal fruit and choice of steamed milk). It was an enormous bowl of delicious and only $4.50!!!!!  The owner was the cashier and was so nice and friendly!!!!  LONG LIVE D'LISH!!!!!
Two words: Breakfast. Buzz. That's all you need to know. Super friendly staff. Line may look long at times but it goes quickly.

After a long and hot hike at camelback, you MUST stop by and get a smoothie with protein for an awesome recovery. Great service, super friendly staff and delicious food, don't forget to try the humanitarian wrap and add chicken supreme, that's another amazing concoction ... chicken feta and pesto sauce added to it ....Thanks Nathan and Leonard... you guys got a great team at D'Lite !!!!

This place is awesome - one of my favorite spots to stop for lunch if I'm in the area. It's a really cute, casual lunch spot. The California Club is my favorite (I'm an avocado nut), they also have a fantastic breakfast burrito. Everything I've had here is healthy, clean, and well prepared. It's nice that they have almond milk for lattes and they can definitely cater to people with food allergies or restrictions.   The only downside is parking can be a total nightmare - there is a very small parking lot and if you go during peak lunch hours - really anytime between 11:30 and 1:30 - it can be impossible to get a spot, or even pull into the lot. They also have a drive through, but it can take quite a while.   As long as you're not in a rush, it's worth the wait!
I can't stop craving the breakfast buzz- A yummy smoothie like espresso drink with banana and chocolate.

Been waiting to go here as we have gone to their sister stores in lower Scottsdale and Temp.  This is the first Franchised store and another will be opening at Camelback & Miller in the Sprout's Center there. The store was very clean and of course new.  We are picky and my wife has major food restrictions.  The Staff was very accommodating.  Afterward we debriefed with Autumn who helped open the store.  She is a wonderful Ambassador for the Brand to be sure.  My wife loves beets and they roast their beets every day.  Seriously!   Big score and hopefully they can sustain all the positive karma and buzz they have created.  Just look at the other reviews here.  Again, Autumn really knows her stuff. And my wife wants to go back several times during this upcoming week.
Stopped in on a whim. The Man Salad was sooo good. Reasonable prices and super fresh. They didn't skimp on any of the ingredients. Tasty!!!

Oh D'Lite (previously D'Lish)! We've been coming here since college and really enjoy this place. They have a wide variety of healthy options, an awesome "breakfast buzz" smoothie, and many other delicious options.   On this trip we stopped by the Scottsdale location where (we knew from prior visits) the parking can be a bit rough. The parking lot is very small and with the drive through it can be a pain to get into the lot and find a spot. Once you do you can walk inside where you will find a moderate amount of seating and a small outdoor patio.   After checking out d'Menu we got the California Club and Traditional Burrito for our breakfast. We also got two vegan breakfast buzz shakes. We already knew from prior visits we were going to enjoy the food as we've had it before and this visit was just as good!

Stopped by for a few vegan breakfast buzzes while in the area. They were bomb per normal!   I've never been to this location before but it is really nice! It definitely has the Scottsdale vibe to it. Unlike the south Scottsdale location, this one features plenty of parking and the inside is quite large. There is plenty of room here to spread out, meet up with friends, or do some group work.   All the staff was super friendly.

I had heard great things about this place, but when I pulled up I wasn't so sure about it.  It's really small and at 2 o'clock in the afternoon it was empty.  Pulled in and ordered the chicken panini and it's amazing!  The bread is so good and pesto is wonderful!  Will definitely come back to try more!

I have eaten here four times. That proved to be four times too many. I tried, oh I tried, to find something appealing about this place. Beyond the very friendly staff, nothing else is making me want to come back. On my first venture, I ordered a breakfast burrito. Folks, you have to cook the egg. A runny egg, so runny I think the whites were still runny, in a breakfast burrito, is a breeding ground for disease. I mean, cook the friggin' egg. The next time I went I ordered a breakfast sandwich. It was served on a bialy. They forgot to include flavor - any flavor. I started to chew on the wax paper to add some spice. I kept blaming myself, I mean I read these reviews and I wonder what is wrong with me. I only wonder that for a brief moment. Janice B says she is in NY and can't stop thinking about D'Lish. WHAT??? Are you iactually living in the city or are you trapped on the top floor of Bellevue? There is nothing, absolutely nothing in Phoenix or anywhere else that compares to anything in NYC. One moment in NYC makes you forget the rest of the world exists. I digress, anyway, my third visit was the veggie burrito. Nothing I like better than raw mushrooms stuffed in a burrito. Why did I go back for a fourth visit? I did, I ordered a mushroom soup. I thought they would have to cook the mushrooms in the soup? Who knows, it tasted like water. Dear D'Lish, the way you make mushroom soup is very simple. Start with some shallots, saute them in a stock pot, you can add onions and garlic if you wish. Next add a whole mess of mushrooms, you can just use white ones, or mix them up, cremini, portabella, oyster, just saute them until all the water is removed, then add stock and cook for about 20 minutes - blend soup to a creamy texture, finish with some milk or cream and you have soup. Salt and pepper to taste. So simple, and yet you just couldn't do it. I can't come back, sorry, four times is way too many attempts, but good luck, it appears many people do enjoy your flavorless, poorly cooked options.

I might have stretched a point and given D'Lite four stars except that everyone else seems to want to rate it 5* and D'Lite is definitely not that good.    This location is new and it is clean, bright, modern, and totally without soul.  You could move a McDonald's in here and it would feel right, except for no playground.  But who cares -- right?  The menu is modest but adequate, but the imagination is limited to the item names.  But who cares -- right?  The food is better than fast food but not as good as some sandwich shops I've patronized.  There are strong points, such as the chicken sausage, but ... To me the biggest flaw is the bread used in sandwiches and accompanying the frittatas. It's just plain dull bread.  The whole wheat, for example, is the kind that looks like white bread except a little browner, and is baked from finely ground wheat kernels.  This is barely healthier than the much-maligned white (check the glycemic index).  The panini isn't really a panini, just a baked sandwich, and some miscreant puts sweet relish in the tuna salad.  Who cares? -- I guess I do.  Note: the menu does not include calorie content - perhaps it is available elsewhere.  I think that would be interesting and possibly surprising.

This is a perfect little place to stop in, get a coffee, bite to eat and chill. Freshly made, healthy food, cool ambiance. Or if you don't have time to sit down, they also have a drive through. But it seems to be the busiest area, always a line of cars. But that's not a bad thing! Lines at restaurants always means good food! So far my favorite is the veggie frittata,  bursting with flavor!

My 2 stars is for the concept. Having a healthy option is awesome. I give 0 stars for customer service. Everyone there seems stressed and they come off rude. I came here for kombucha tea  thinking that they made it there at the restaurant, but they literally pulled a bottle from the fridge and poured it into a cup. When I asked why they don't just give you the entire bottle instead of just a portion of it the guy said they only give you as much as you need. If I'm going to spend $4 on a drink I might as well go to Sprouts and get the entire drink. Such a joke

I came here for late breakfast and got the AZ burro with chicken. It was delicious and good quality but kind of small. My dining companion got a veggie frittata which was delicious. The pricing wasn't too bad. Although, we didn't get much for the $25 we spent here compared to other sit down breakfast spots up the road in Old Town.   It's not a restaurant in which someone waits on you. There isn't much seating. It's a small shack of sorts.   Their drive thru had a line the entire time I was there which is a good sign. I'll definitely be back.

Best place ever. Healthy, delicious, relaxed, fresh, clean place to grab coffee and a bite. The people that work there are amazing-friendly and helpful.  Free ice tea refills.  Vegetarian options available.

Bless me Yelp for I have dined. It's been many months since my last review. It's actually been awhile since I've had much opportunity to check out new (to me) places. It has been a rough year.   Things are turning around though, and I'm D'lighted to get my review'n skills back in shape.   I'm surprised I hadn't eaten here before. I guess I didn't even really know it existed to be honest. I live within a few blocks of here and I love breakfast and I drive by here frequently. Perhaps it is because I'm not a member of the vegetarian/vegan community... though I've dated several vegetarians and vegans so I'm pretty up to date on the places to go for that.   I haven't had my food at this place yet - I've only eaten from the drive through. It seems like a cute little place though. One of these days.   The food is tasty. It's about as tasty as it can be for something that can be considered a healthy breakfast. I tend to prefer a good thick greasy unhealthy artery clogging pile of bacon and some sort of fruit covered waffle or french toast drowned in maple syrup - that doesn't seem to be what this place is about. Still... it's true to its name. It is definitely delicious.   Their prices aren't too bad for what you are getting. It's quality food. I mean, I was getting burned out on shitty fast food breakfast places. I can't stomach the Breakfast Club douchetastic crowd most of the time, and I haven't been really up for eating around any sort of crowd on my weekend mornings. I'd rather eat in the comfort of my own home these days.   I'll have to update this when I have more to say about it - so far, I've only really sampled the food. I have yet to really experience the atmosphere and the service. Sooner or later though...  I'd say this is yet another reason why I still stand behind my belief that Scottsdale is an awesome place to live.

This is SUCH an amazing idea!! Why there aren't more healthy drive-thrus is beyond me!! The worst is when you are in a rush but want to eat healthy but there aren't any options available. I only wish there were more menu options available.

Nice little hole in the wall place.   They are able to make most of their menu GF and some dairy free as well.   Had their one of their burgers 'naked' which just means on a bed of greens with a fresh squeezed lemonade.    All in all good meal for price and with it being .3 miles from the hotel I am at this week works great.

Loved what I ordered here!   The low-carb breakfast is a great idea, and I think it will inspire me to create a similar meal at home.  A hash brown, two over-easy egg, atop a bed of greens all drizzled in pesto.  A pairing I wouldn't have thought to make on my own, but works wonderfully together!  Their pesto is not too thick, and tasted really fresh (maybe house-made?)  It was the perfect lunch for me, and I probably could've been satisfied with just one egg.  The california club sandwich was also noteworthy and full of flavor.  I could eat this for lunch, and maybe even dinner!  Man salad was huge - served in a gigantic bowl and included toasted bread.  There were a few parking spots, and a drive-thru.  Coming at an odd hour had plenty of seating, but not sure if this is true to the rush hours.  If you don't know where you're going - be sure to look out for it as you're driving by... It's easy to miss.

Staff here is SUPER CHILL...The strawberry lemonade here was flame, highly suggest. Traditional burrito was pretty tasty, wasn't the greatest burrito I've ever had but the combination with the lemonade made it easy for me to want to come back.

It's so nice to have a place that caters to a healthy lifestyle. This place was beyond delicious and totally hit the stop. They have a variety of different choices, but we had the Cali club and a latte. Both were amazing. Definitely wish we had this spot in Cali.

My daughter was getting moving out of the dorms and she wanted a last breakfast with her roommate and parents. Never knew about this place. Loved it here.   Small parking lot with a drive-thru. Seemed like the drive-thru always had a line while I was there. So I thought this must be a good place. Just found a little gem.   The parking lot, outside the door, and inside they have these big menus. So I park and look at the menu. Yum yum. Looks very interesting. Typical small joint. Order at the front, get a number, they bring the food to your table, and they clean up your table.   Anyways, I ordered the AZ Burro for breakfast. Smoked turkey, avocado, egg, feta, and hash. Doesn't sound very good but it was really good. Very tasty. Thoroughly enjoyed it.   Nice little place to enjoy breakfast and just enjoy the morning. Very surprised about this place but then again. Good food. Relaxing atmosphere. All I can say is enjoy.

Wanted to give another place a try for a quick bk so jumped on Yelp. I have to say I am lukewarm about it. I had the egg and cheese bk sandwich but without the cheese +bacon on a bagel as they were out of the bread it normally  comes on and it was ok. Prob need to add some salsa or sauce to it. It was fresh tasting tho. Also decided on a decaf coffee which was on the menu board but then I was told they actually don't have a decaf that they make but could do a pour over ... i.e. an Americano. I was like ok well do I get the same price and was told no that I would be charged for an Americano. I say okkkkkk.. Prob should take the decaf house off the menu board then .. Just sayin. .. So I opted to pay the additional price for the Americano and didn't like it at all, so I dumped it.  My kiddo ordered the bk burrito and the Italian soda with vanilla which she enjoyed. I noticed that the Italian soda had one price on the board but I was charged .50 more so I brought that to the cashiers attention and she said it was tax. I said no taxes are on the bottom of the receipt and it is not .50 tax on a $2.50 item . She spoke to the mgr and he told her to refund me the .50, so that was taken care of quickly and professionally. All in all ok place for me but not one I would frequent tho.

I was looking for a healthy to go order. I enjoyed the burrito as it was light and tasty. I did not enjoy the drive-thru aspect and the spot is so small, wasn't sure where the parking lot was. Probably just a drive-thru spot, I'm not sure. The girl working there was nice but I just couldn't justify the price of their items. I'm not a cheap guest but I just didn't find the value in the meals. It was a good meal but nothing memorable and I would not return nor refer.

Finding legitimate healthy options for breakfast or a quick lunch on the go can be a  hassle in Tempe, but D'lish has D'livered every time !  Excellent breakfast smoothies and several tasty options to eat for lunch!
My morning go-to.  Love their vegan buzz kill, and the breakfast sandwiches.  Also, tge lemonade, juices, and green tea are bomb.

Sooooo I came here for a croissant 'wich and a dirty chai latte, my sandwich was delicious, but after taking a couple sips of my latte, something hard slipped into my mouth. I thought it was some curdled milk so I dug it out, only to find that it was definitely not curdled milk it was a roach. My chai was definitely dirty. Will not be coming back here.
Quaint little place with a nice young couple that aren't shy about recommendations running the show. Decent coffee and the drive-thru is a plus.

I've been here several times the food is always fast and flavorful. Good service. Nice portions. The only reason I'm giving them a 4 stars is because their siracha cap is always so dirty even in the morning so it clearly isn't being cleaned. Gross.
The bowls here are D'lish. Really healthy and quick! The employees are sweet college kids.

I guess I wasn't as blown away by D'Lish as everyone else.  Maybe I was expecting greatness from reading so many five star reviews on Yelp, but my experience was somewhat underwhelming.  I had the low carb breakfast, husband had the AZ burrito.  Low carb breakfast had a very good flavor, but way too many oils.  Oily salad dressing, drizzled with an oil-heavy pesto, two eggs cooked in oil, and then an avocado for even more fats.  The flavor was very good, but I just felt like it was a pretty heavy dish for what it should have been.  My husband liked his burrito though!  We also split the breakfast buzz shake.  Our bill was $19.50, slightly over priced in my opinion.   It is small inside, so seating might be an issue if you go during peak hours.  Also, their smoothies and shakes seem to be popular, so the blender is literally always raging... Makes conversation too difficult.  There is absolutely no denying that parking here is a nightmare.  The parking lot is too small to begin with, and then the drive thru line always blocks people in their spot.
Delicious!!!! I had the croissant sandwich and breakfast smoothie.  The service was great and the pricing is very economical.  It was busy but the line went fast.  I will definitely be back again!

Found this place on Yelp and everything here is amazing. I try to eat here as often as I can. The buzz is great to. I wish they would open a east valley location. Service is 5 stars, food 5 stars and drinks.   Parking sucks! so carpool here with friends to make things easier. I usually park two buildings down and walk over. IF I am willing to walk 5 minutes in 115 degree weather, You know its worth it!

I went to D'lish for the first time just an hour ago, and here I am reviewing it already!  To begin with, I rolled up to the drive thru with my dog in my lap, making a fuss, and the woman at the window could not have been any nicer! She gave Danny (my Pom/Schipperke mix) a treat, which he happily gobbled up.  Next, I ordered the Breakfast Buzz. Took 2 minutes for the drink, and the gentleman who gave me my drink was very friendly!  Finally, my drink- OMG it is SO GOOD! I'm hooked. Chocolate, peanut butter and bananas, what is not to like? I can't wait to try their food!   Friendly service and good food make this place a must!

Went here twice while in Phoenix last week.   Both times I was in a big rush and it was awesome to be able to get a healthy meal so fast!   REALLY exceeded my expectations in terms of taste and quality.

MAN BUZZ! The breakfast buzz is the ultimate meat head drink. I mean espresso protein and smoothie all in one? Can't beat it!   I have had many things on the menu here and all good. The bowls are awesome the breakfast club is out of this world and the veggie wrap add chicken(come on gotta do it!) is also awesome. Great drink selection, if you like Arnold Palmers ask for the Tiger Woods the next time you go in. E  Atmosphere is super laid back with a great stay. This is the only thing to warn you about it can take some time if you don't call ahead but its worth it!
Literally come here every week! Try sandwich and smoothie. Dog friendly and outside seating. They have drive through also free parking.
Looking for food? Try somewhere else! D'lish is the go to place for a breakfast buzz!! Best thing on the menu :)

Let me tell you a secret- AZ Burro. This is the epitome of the PERFECT hungover breakfast spot in restaurant history. When I lived in Scottsdale this was literally my favorite spot ever to go for breakfast. My only complaint about here is that they don't serve alcohol, but let's be real nobody is perfect. "AZ Burro" needs to be in the vocabulary of every person that likes to party in Scottsdale. Why? 1. It's pretty much the healthiest breakfast you can get without actually making it yourself 2. It's perfectly filling after a long night out at smashboxx/hefe/etc that ended with a late night at pattie's 3. It doesn't make you full to the point where you can't hit up RnR after to go day party and get started with some bottomless bloodys mimosas 4. (and most importantly) D'lish is drive thru! Making it ridiculously catered to the hungover person. Don't want to see everyone you blacked out in front of last night or run into last night's hookup? No problem. Just make sure that you are sober enough to drive (aka no alc for you Arizona peeps) and drive on through that drive thru people! I know, I know- it just sounds too good to be true but I promise I'm not making it up, this place really does exist. Also the Breakfast Buzz is really filling but I would honestly recommend it as a meal in itself or like a snack or something because I don't know if you would be able to handle it with a meal unless you're really trying to get down then in that case go big or go home. And at the end of the drive thru if you find that all this is just wayyy too healthy or you're over it, then Super Burrito is conveniently located next door. Don't worry, they have a drive thru too so you can still avoid seeing anyone :)

I used to go here a lot for lunch when I worked in Old Town, if the line wasn't super long. The sandwiches are healthy, all the while keeping it really tasty. Everything I have tried has not disappointed and the coffee is so good. Turkey club was my usual lunch order.
I had the croissant sandwich it was amazing I can't wait to go back ! I wish I knew the girl name who took my order she was very sweet .

Went here for the first time today after seeing the reviews and it was just as good as everyone says it is. I got the man salad and although it wasn't exactly what my stomach wanted, it was still really good. The service was very good and the staff was very polite. I will definitely be coming back to try more of the menu.
The best breakfast sandwiches. I had my first dirty chai here, awesome! Can sit outside with my little dog and enjoy the nice weather.

Love this place! They have a drive thru that moves pretty quick if you don't want to go in. Kinda smaller place but you can dine in. Don't blink or you'll miss this place driving by! I primarily stop by for the Vegan Buzz shake. So d'licious!

The food is always great, and it is nice to have a healthy and affordable option for fast food. Your iced green tea is one of the best I have had. The breakfast buzz is a great option for a breakfast "shake" as well, or just a liquid lunch too. A few of my favorites menu items are the tuna sandwich, the chicken panini, or the hummus plate with pesto and chicken. The staff are always accommodating and fast, however I do feel the people they used to have working the drive through line a couple years back were much more friendly and personable, as they always went out of their way to make conversation with you, which always helped break up the monotony of the work day. The staff their over the past year or so just feel like they are just there to work and don't seem to enjoy themselves as much. Also, the parking lot is horrible if you do plan to go inside around lunch time. I heard rumors that you guys would be moving down the road to a bigger building and parking lot? Highly recommended to do so to help your customers out with accessibility. Otherwise, food is always consistently great! Thanks!

I met Brian S at D'Lish for coffee and conversation.  D'oes that constitute a coffee klatch?  I D'on't know if it D'oes but we sat around for probably a couple hours enjoying the fresh outside air.  As fresh as it is on Scottsdale Rd. anyway.  I had a mocha when I arrived and later a brewed coffee.  Both were, well, D'lish.  So I can vouch for the mocha and the brewed coffee but not the D'caf.  I was wearing my "Corporate Crime-Capitalized Profits, Socialized Debt" t-shirt and the guy at the counter called out the other employees to make sure they saw it.    I will D'efinitely keep D'lish in mind and stop in when I'm in south Scottsdale.

This is an envirmentalist drive-through dream. Don't forget to bring your own coffee cup and save a tree.  Had a double espresso [in my mug] $2. and a egg and cheese breakfast sandwich.$4.5, add sausage, [Indeed, you are what you eat.] $1.5 served on a bialy and really I prefer a toasted bird seed bialy.  OK D'lish there is your feedback, See you on the track~

I was super excited to go this morning because it didn't have the big line it normally does, which im ok with. So I pull up to the window to order and was there for a good 5 minutes just waiting for someone to come take my order. I could see them in there just talking and they looked over at me a few times and never came to the window. So annoyed and hungry.
I love a healthy drive thru! I've tried the breakfast burrito & turkey wrap from here! I want to go back and try their protein shakes :)

BEST BUSINESS EVER!!!!!  A HEALTHY, vegetarian friendly, special diet accommodating DRIVE-THRU! Where have you been all my life, why aren't you in CA, & how come you are in Scottsdale?! No excuse not to eat right when D'lish-ious, healthy food can be had quick & easy from a window, just like fast food. I also love that they are open early so I could get coffee & a healthy breakfast to start the day first thing in the morning, AND it was friendly, helpful customer service! They also got my order right, with my customizations. (Whatever, I particular, not picky). I got the low carb breakfast with no cheese. I was happily surprised by the portion size! It came with a generous helping of scrambled egg whites, a huge bed of mixed greens, tomatoes, pesto drizzle, & hash. Unfortunately I couldn't eat it all (not even close!) & it was left to sit & die in my car under the hot AZ sun :(  I wish I could come back, & I know I will if I am ever in Scottsdale again! You go, D'Lish!

Always D'lish just like the name describes. I have only had a select few items on the menu but everyone of them is in my tops list, and I'm a huge fan of the breakfast buzz! Another great aspect of D'lish is their customer service, sure a little unusual and kinda give off that Cali surfer vibe but they're always working super hard. The last time I went the dude at the window saw the line backed up ran all the way outside a couple times making sure the line wasn't taking forever because this place gets packed during breakfast and lunch. The fact that they work that hard to keep the line moving is awesome.

This is one of my favorite places in AZ.  First of all, the "buzz" is one of the best inventions of the 21st century.  It's delicious.  Both breakfast burritos are phenomenal, but my two favorite items are the oatmeal and the turkey club.  They are superb.  I ashamed to have written this much without mentioning the guys that run the place.  They are hilarious and always in a good mood.

Not bad, had the "humanitarian" and it was pretty good, not to heavy. Ordered the hummus plate as a Starter, came at the same time as the food which kind of defeats the purpose, but they seemed a little busy so I don't hold that against them. I would suggest take out because this place is super small, and me and my girlfriend both had to pee really bad but there was no restroom. All in all I would go back again if I'm on that side of town, but I was not blown away like everyone in yelp seems to be.

A. Delicious + Affordable B. Fast + Amazeballs ©. All of the above  I've been looking for a place exactly like this. It's healthy, quick, affordable, tastes fantastic; perfect place to stop for lunch!
Get the breakfast buzz shake!! Great for any chocolate lover. They also cook a fried egg perfect every time!

I was craving a salad and decided to try this spot since it's closer to my house.  I ordered the kitchen sink salad via drive-thru. At $8.25, this salad is extremely disappointing. Small portions and just bland! This salad left me very unsatisfied and full of regret. I can think of plenty of other things to spend that $8 on.  Next time I will just go to my usual salad spot (salad and go) where portions are bigger l, tastier, and cheaper.

Great customer service! I've dined in for breakfast twice. Friendly and always willing to assist.   Az burro is amazing!   Almond buzz's are on point! Lactose intolerant so I request almond milk.   On a low carb day I "build my own" from the sides. 2 Eggs and chicken sausage both come off the side menu. Inexpensive and delicious!   Definitely recommend to anyone in the area -- friendly, great customer service, clean and nice, and great healthy options.
The staff members are the sweetest and the food was without a doubt 5 stars. If you haven't tried there traditional burrito or any of there breakfast items yet you're missing out!

Had the AZ burro and was great! Egg whites w turkey and avocado wrapped in a tomato tortilla. They have a breakfast menu that is also served during lunch. Everything looked affordable.   Will try the soup next time (my gal pal had it for lunch) or the burgers. Vegetarian options are numerous and service was quick.  You do have to bus your own dishes but that's not a problem.   Located right off light rail line in Tempe.

Finally dried out this healthy alternative to the former McDonald's restaurant. I have been very excited to see the change made at this property. Went in with a couple friends for lunch. The staff was very friendly and there is a broad selection of breakfast and lunch items.  My one friend had the California club sandwich which has egg bacon smoked turkey tomato avocado pepper jack and pesto on a toasted artisan bread. He has been here number of times and it is his favorite sandwich. I had the "man" salad which has in the center a avocado stuffed with homemade tuna salad which was excellent it is served on a spring mix of greens there was chicken breast bacon feta and tomato. I asked to try to different dressings on the side and they were very willing to accommodate. The seating in the restaurant is comfortable they have an area with sofas that Makes for a nice place to hang out. I will start them with a four star rating. And when I go back I will try a few other items and update the review at that time
Love the fact that i can get myself something while getting a little doggy bag for my fur baby! Also the people there are so sweet!! I just moved here and this is my new favorite spot!
Delicious coffee and awesome breakfast sandwiches, well worth the trip. The California Club is an excellent pair with a fresh cup of coffee, staff is very friendly

The customer service was phenomenal made it feel like it was a picnic kinda place felt just at home. The food and drinks were amazing especially the breakfast buzz . I would recommend this to anything who loves to eat healthy. Definitely a great breakfast and lunch place for family's and friends

This is my boyfriend and i's favorite breakfast spot in Scottsdale! Every time we are even remotely near Arizona we make the trip to this place! It's all about the breakfast buzz and the California club sandwich. We will continue to come to this place as long as we live!

I have two words for you... breakfast buzz. Stay warned its an alternate for a meal.. but it is amazing. Add some soy or almond milk and an extra shot of espresso and its golden.   Best part of the morning.

First of all, the Breakfast Buzz is a MUST TRY! It's so good & will wake your ass up!  The Top Notch (black bean quinoa) Burger is also really yummy. It's definitely my go to for when I'm really hungry.  I'm not particularly a huge fan of the egg they put on some of their items, it just tastes a little weird to me.  P.S. If your headed to check them out for the first time, keep an eye out for that that turn into the drive thru, it kinda comes up out of nowhere.  I always almost turn right into that "well bar" that sits next to it.
Totally chill is da werd. Extremely friendly and helpful behind the counter. Sociable friendly peeps.
This place is sooo good!  Had the California Club. Probably the tastiest I have ever had. My friend had the chicken breast panini which was also very good.

Being new to the neighborhood, I was seeking out unique places to get a good cup of coffee.  I like to give the locals some business once in a while.  I find their coffee is often better too because it has to be.  This place is great!  They have a drive through (majorly important) and their coffee doesn't have that burnt taste that you get at Starbucks.  The service was really efficient.  I want to go back to hang out for a while some lazy Saturday or Sunday morning.  It seems like a great place for doing that.

Don't believe the hype. If your looking for a d'lish breakfast or brunch, this place is a pass. The breakfast sandwiches are fine, but nothing special. The chai is lackluster. When I go out for breakfast I like to order something I cannot easily duplicate at home- nothing on the menu is special.   The line boggles my mind. I'd say if you're looking for a drive-through meal your fine here.

Wanted to like this place.... really really wanted to.   Horrible service, I mean absolutely horrible.   I arrived and was starting to say what a friend recommended to me but I couldn't remember the name of it and the guy behind the counter snapped and cut me off and said "I hear that ten times a day." Well buddy since you've heard it before, I can understand that working in the service industry, you'd not expect to hear it again (sarcasm.) Whatever, I made my order and was told to go relax at a table. Well, I relaxed for 18 minutes with no food (turkey BLT I ordered) and watched everyone else get their food. I got up and asked if I was forgotten and there was absolutely no apology offered, but said they would bring it to me.   When the guy brought over my sandwich, he kind of slammed it down on the table and walked away. No apology still, no offer to refund my meal, no come back later and try us again. They were just extremely rude about it. I understand, it happens... It's part of life, but they acted as if me not getting my food was a bother to them.  Horrible customer service. I'll tell everyone I know about this story. Nobody should be able to treat their customers like that. A simple "I'm sorry, come back and see us again for a free coffee" or something to that effect would have gone a loooooong way.   Too stupid to get it probably. Or maybe because I didn't have a rat-tail with a mohawk, a basketball jersey, converse shoes, and an obvious roid rage attitude, they just didn't care.

We were looking for something outside of your typical junk fast food. We saw this place and give it a whirl. I wasn't too thrilled about their coffee beverage much like a frappuchino, but not! But their food was good, the bread was soft. And I really like their version of oatmeal.

I could probably eat here everyday if it was closer to me! What I love is the portion size, it's sooo filling, you can order any sandwich at any time of day, the consistency of the meats, quality and every sandwich I've had tastes the same and how efficient the place runs. I wish that they would've told me they did punch cards and I also think it would be more fair to get a punch per sandwich, not per day. Even tho we spent $60+ on sandwich's for the girls at work we were only given one stamp because the girl said they were per day. I mean not a big deal but I just don't see how that's fair to get one stamp on spending that much on multiple sandwich's compared to a person ordering one sandwich?
California. Club. All day long. Strangely wasn't really that big of a fan of the breakfast buzz but it was still good.  Maybe too much peanut butter for my taste.

This little gem of a drive thru has fantastic food and coffee. They're veggie breakfast burrito is excellent with portobello mushrooms and a red pepper tortilla, i plan on returning for lunch some time soon.

Decent, affordable breakfast spot. I am not a vegetarian but I do like their humanitarian wrap. They have free refills on some drinks if you are dining in and they even have a punch card so that their regulars can get free drinks. The staff is very friendly. I know a lot of people love the drive-through (and it gets super busy), but I do like the patio on a cool morning. They have free wi-fi!

We just moved into the neighborhood and checked out D'lish after one of my co-worker's recommended it.  We can't get enough!  Great coffee, creative and tasty healthy food and coffee that is expertly made.  I recommend the carmel, the mocha and my husband likes the Buzz smoothie.  The quinoa oatmeal with rice milk and fresh fruit is d'lish as is the california breakfast sandwich which is the perfect balance of flavors on a ciabatta bun.  The employees are so much fun and are friendly and fast to get you your order. If you're in South Scottsdale stop in, you won't be disappointed!
Updated review, they took care of my concerns and I still come here often for a Cali breakfast club and a breakfast buzz. Good people, good food.

Shit, I am so bummed I didn't have the same experience as the others did here. Maybe I just showed up on an off day. My gf and I tried this place out and I was really shocked at the letdown. I ordered a bfast sandwich and it arrived cold and really didn't have much flavor. I didn't try anything other than that so maybe there are better choices that I missed. Hopefully we will be back in the area and can give it another try. Yelp has never let me down so it deserves a second chance. I will write another review after my next experience.
Super yummy breakfast sandwiches though I have mine made into wraps. Wicked awesome dirty chai!

Really disappointed in D'Lish! This used to be my fave Tempe spot but recently it's been awful! The past 2 times my order has been wrong. Today I waited 30+ in the drive thru... Most of the time I was sitting at the window after paying. After all that time and getting home, super stoked to eat my sandwich- it was wrong!!! I ordered no tomatoes, well I had lots of tomatoes and the spring greens were missing. I'm a little peeved after paying 7+ bucks and all of that time to have an incorrect order. Get it together!

Their food is great - i've had the veggie frittata and the house style veggie burger, both are pretty amazing. Especially the burger. I'm not vegetarian, but i love a good veggie burger as something healthy & different, and theirs is quite possibly one the best in town. Including the ones i've had from full blown sit-down restaurants. Too many places just slide a veggie puck out of a box and throw it on a bun. Not these guys.
