Also, their coffee and iced tea are pretty dang tasty.  Only problem I ever have here is the wait. Definitely a place you have to be patient at.  Maybe it's better if you actually go through the drive-thru - I always just walk inside. Also, for $8.50,  was a little surprised that the burgers don't come with any sort of side item. Not a deal breaker, just something to keep in mind. And I'd probably come here more often if they had hours that extended into the evening.

I've been here a few times, as well as the location in Scottsdale. Both are always tremendously busy, which I can typically deal with. I've tried a few things, and really the veggie & house frittatas are the only things on the menu which I feel aren't overpriced for what you get, but their food is good, so this is - was - an occasional stop for me.   Today though, after waiting at the counter for nearly 5 minutes, someone finally came to take my order... Only to refuse to make me the thing I wanted.   Yes, you read that correctly. He "offered" me something else from the menu because the frittatas apparently "take to long to make, and we're really slammed." I was beyond stunned, and left out of pure principle. I can think of 9 other better ways to handle that situation. Even worse, I think the guy helping me was the manager. (Here's an idea; advise me that there will be a long wait, offer me a complimentary drink, maybe even bump an order or two ahead of mine so it doesn't cause a backup. It wasn't like I was in a hurry - I even brought a book to hang out for a while!) If an item on the menu is that much of an issue, it shouldn't be on the menu.   I really hope owners peruse these reviews from time to time so they can address this sort of atrocious customer service... Not that I'll ever be back to find out, but they might like to know how their business is being handled.

Favorite place to stop after hiking Camelback!  I love this tiny little place on Scottsdale.  Its the best spot to grab a quick bit to eat or some coffee.  The breakfast sandwich is the best!  I love that several of the items on the menu are vegetarian or gluten free.  The staff are always the friendliest people around.  I'm hooked on this place!

Last day of class for my son in college, so I told him I would take him out for breakfast . . . we have been driving by this place all sememster and decided to try it . . . and was very glad that we did.  I ordered the House Fritatta and a Four Berry Smoothie . . . but was informed that the Four berry Smoothie was out of season.  Well, if that is the case . . . take it off the menu.  So I had a Strawberry Banana Smoothie . . . and that is why the lost a star.  The House Fritata was unbelievable . . . hot and full of flavor . . . The Strawberry Banana Smoothie was pretty good also . . . but I would bet . . . not as good as the Four Berry Smoothie.  Definately a place I will be stopping back at . . .

D'Lite is a delight for tasty breakfast burritos at a good price.  I live nearby and occasionally will buy myself breakfast on the weekends after a workout. They had been on my to-visit place for awhile.   The weekend drive thru lines can be a little long, but their food is totally worth it. I pretty much get just the Low Carb Breakfast sans tomato in a wrap. Yeah you're getting carbs with the wrap, but it's absolutely delish. And it's a fairly hefty wrap, totally worth the cost.  Every time I return, I mean to try something else but I keep going back to LCB wrap.

Ive only been there once, but I can't wait to go again. Im actually writing a review because I just looked to see if they were open on the holiday haha anywho, I went through the drive thru and I kept thinking the guy walking around the cars was creepy with his big smile on his face but then once we got up to the window to order, low and behold it was him! He is what every restaurant should have as a front house man and I can't wait to experience D'lish again!
Great spot for healthier breakfast. Sat outside and enjoyed the weather. We will be back.
Much bigger inside than appears from outside!  Very cozy, great menu, great options, super friendly.  Love it!
I've only had the breakfast buzz and it was tasty...lots of healthy menu choices and we are looking forward to returning soon ....  Thanks

I believe that this restaurant is very overrated.  If you try going on the weekends the line of cars is out into Scottsdale Road, but I'm not sure exactly why.    The food is alright, nothing too special.  The prices are decent.  They do offer a lot of vegetarian options, which may be pulling in a lot of customers.  My biggest complaint is the service, which is truly horrible every time I go.  All the employees seem to be high school or college kids who absolutely HATE their jobs.  I am not exaggerating when I say that you will get significantly better customer service at the McDonald's across the street.  They have screwed up my order the last 2 times I went through the drive through.  I had to park two stores down and walk back, when I explained the mistake they tried blaming me for it-  I don't know how I could be more clear than saying "A Traditional Burrito with sausage, please"?!    I don't mean to rant, I apologize.  It's just exceptionally poor customer service and the food is average at best.

Can they fix the pothole in the drive-thru already?   Also, waiting 20 minutes before my order is even taken has me considering other places to go to for my "breakfast buzz."  The breakfast buzz is usually spot on and d'lish, but the last 2 times I've gone, it tastes like I swallowed vitamins-without any water. Gross. I know vitamins are an ingredient, but it shouldn't be the only ingredient I taste.

You might think that healthy fast food might be unappealing but do not let that hesitation keep you away from trying this place.  Knowing that it's healthy and tastes wonderful will now make me a regular customer.
I had the burrito and a sugar free vanilla latte, coffee is bold, bitter bold at first but you get use to it. The burrito had a sauce that was more of a marinara, still good! We will be back!
Amazing!  Great food, great concept!  We kept going back!

This little cafe is just great. The staff is friendly, serive is quick and if you just want to hang out and use the wifi that's cool too. They offer good coffee, good sandwiches, and good conversation. I have nothing bad to say about this awesome little coffee shop.

Wanted to try something new so gave this place a shot. I ordered a the California Club and for myself it did not seem worth what I paid (over $7). It was very bland in my opinion that I should have just made my own breakfast sandwich at home or went to McDonald's instead. My friend ordered some type of protein drink and he really seemed to enjoy it. The girl who took our order seemed bored, but I was bored eating the sandwich so I get it.   I do like the concept of this place but I would prefer a Salad and Go to open near me. The drive through was also a pain in the but because there is small, limited space for a drive through. We ended up parking and going inside because the drive thru line was so small we would have been pushed out onto the street if we waited in line.

I am so grateful that Yelp on my phone steered us to D'LIsh. We had planned to follow up a great dinner at Green, just down the street, with breakfast at the same spot, but Green was closed. No problem! We drove up to D'Lish and had a great breakie of the California Club breakfast sand and a veggie sandwich. The coffee with first-rate, and the staff was super cool to a couple of out-of-towners who were gawking at all of the outstanding options on the menu board. Too bad we had a plane to catch. We would have stayed for lunch. PS Get the Breakfast Buzz.

Healthy breakfast food spot with a super tasty 'breakfast buzz'. A must try for the coffee drinkers out there. Especially in the AZ heat. This will get you cooled off and energized. I recommend the Cali club to go with it.

Hit this place up while on vacation for spring training was looking for something fast and healthy man this place was sooo goooood!! Love the breakfast burritos and that fresh squeezed orange juice!! Definitely will be hitting this place up again next year when we come back for baseball!

I was a bit skeptical when I asked Siri for a good place to get breakfast being an out of towner.  I was not disappointed at all with D'lish as the selection.    I was looking for a light easy breakfast, and went with the quinoa oatmeal.  I was a bit nervous having oatmeal without the oats, but they nailed it.  The fresh medley of fruit , the vanilla macaroon granola, and everything else just mixed perfectly.  Will return without question.  Can't wait to try some more of the menu.
The breakfast buzz is very addicting. I love how they use pesto on their breakfast sandwiches. I have not tried anything that I have not liked from their menu.
So amazing! Love this place! They have fast healthy food which makes eating great so easy!
Loved everything about this place...food, vibe, price, service.

Breakfast Buzz is literally the best thing that could ever happen to your tastebuds. Staff is always so sweet- even gives my puppy a treat when I take her to the drive thru with me. My favorite breakfast place BY FAR!

The food here is great. Love the burritos and lo-carb breakfast! The burritos have these awesome egg whites that are just perfectly cooked.   The breakfast buzz is probably the best shake I've ever tasted. It's also huge, so it's a better value than most. I love the mix of chocolate, peanut butter, banana, and coffee.  Any time I'm in Phoenix I make it a point to go here.

Introduced to D'lish today by a friend. I'd already had breakfast (although the menu looks great, lots of delicious sounding, healthy options) but he suggested a Chai coffee. I don't usually like Chai Tea, but I thought I'd give the Chai coffee a chance based on his recommendation.  When I ordered, the server suggested a "Sexy Dirty Chai", which as lurid as it sounds means adding vanilla. The Sexy Dirty Chai Coffee over ice is hands down now my favorite coffee drink. The place is tiny, has a really cool, funky interior and also has a drive thru- a true local gem. The service is friendly and energetic and I plan to start my day here again soon :)

The staff is very young and friendly, and I enjoyed chatting with them while I ordered. I ended up trying out two customer favorites, The California Club and the Breakfast Buzz.  The California Club has cream cheese, avo, egg, bacon, cheese, and pesto on a bun. It was good, but I kind of thought that I could whip this up in my own kitchen easily, and I think I even used to eat a similar sandwich in college so maybe that's why it's so popular at this location. Either way, didn't do much for me. But luckily I had the Breakfast Buzz, too. And whoa- the Breakfast Buzz was redemption! It's simply a must-order and you have to make room for it: vitamins, peanut butter, coffee, and protein all in one. I thought it was going to be too peanut-y or too protein-y but it was a perfect blend. I drank the whole thing and felt like a superhero without the bad effects of an energy drink (racing heart, etc.). Stop by here if you need a quick pick me up and are looking for healthier, fast-food options.

I've had lunch here a few times and haven't been disappointed yet aside from VERY limited seating. Their protein bowls and veggie bowls are amazing and it's always a struggle for me to finish. Thanks for giving me the energy I needed to knock out the rest of my crazy work day! You guys rock!
Loooooove their veggie bowl! Protein bowls are amazing too. Heck just about everything is great! Small seating area but definitely a place I like to order ahead and then grab to go!

D'Lish was a random find for me and a friend, as we were looking for a more palatable option than our standard Dunkin Donuts hangover breakfast. I was surprised to have not heard of it sooner, as it was nearly within walking distance.  I perused their menu on their website, had a game plan then headed in. The seating area is small but not cramped, and is tastefully modern and cozy. The two other girls seated inside with me were both wearing Tori Burch flats, so I knew it was a little more highbrow than your standard hipster hangout. I ordered a vegetarian breakfast burrito, and brought back a classic breakfast burrito for my friend. They were quite tasty- very fresh and not greasy. I also had the "sexy dirty chai" I read so much about (a chai tea with coffee and vanilla) and it lived up to all expectations. I'm craving one right now, as a matter of fact.  Since then, I've also tried their yogurt parfait with fresh seasonal fruit and it was amazing as well. Their bagels are soft and delicious, and I'm looking forward to trying a Bialy sandwich next. Everything I've tried has been of good quality and freshness. I have yet to be disappointed with the food or the friendly service.  My only issue is that I don't think they quite have their "flow" down yet. Both visits took considerably longer than they should have for a small to-go order. It was much faster to phone in my order and pick up at the drive through window, rather than order and wait inside. Plus, when I used the drive through, I didn't even have to put on pants to go get breakfast. Does it get much better than that?
LOVE this place! Do yourself a favor and try the Breakfast Buzz! The food is healthy and delicious as well. This is my weekly go to spot.

They're on to something. Ton of healthy options, including gluten free wraps and burritos (and they ask if it's for severe allergies - thankfully mine is not, good coffee and lattes (almond milk) plus a breakfast buzz protein and vitamin shake with espresso. Yum! Clean, good place to eat. Friendly staff that seems engaged.

Great cafe with plenty of healthy vegan and GF options. The wifi was strong and it's a good place to get some work done. Plenty of seating but the music is a bit too loud. Love the specialty smoothies!

It is D'lish.  The AZ Burro is real tasty as is the salsa on the side it comes with (at just under $8). Healthy menu options for Breakfast/Lunch.  Small location with seating for about 15+ inside, Parking is very limited.  You must have patience during busy time with parking and leaving - it has a pretty solid drive through line.  There is a small patio that seats 6 i think.  In the 20 or so minutes I spent inside - I have NEVER seen a more physically fit clientele come and go.  Enjoy.
This place rocks. I wish they opened earlier since I wake up really early. Good coffee and  good food. I think it's a requirement that you are good looking to work here.

I made the wise decision to bail on my hotel continental breakfast this morning and discovered this amazing joint. The California Club may well be one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have ever had! I highly recommend you give this particular menu item a shot. I have a few more days left in Tempe and will, no doubt, be spending my mornings here. I also tried one of their daily special teas (cactus blossom) and found it quite refreshing and palatable.

First time here for lunch after driving by frequently and hearing good things fro coworkers. It's a solid spot! When you walk in you get a definite modern coffee shop vibe, there are comfy looking chairs to the left, tables to the right and a larger community table hi-top right near the counter. They had a good playlist on too if I do say so myself, lots of older pop songs.  You order at the counter and get a number, then they bring your food out to you. They also have a drive thru! I only got the tuna salad sandwich cold (you have a choice of cold or hot) and water but I was really into the sandwich! The tuna itself was delicious, and had feta, white cheddar along with tomato, cucumber, lettuce and onions on wheat bread. It hit the spot and was better than I've had at other places with similar lunch fare.   I saw several other menu items I'd like to return and try, not to mention what looked like a great tea/coffee selection. My coworkers got the rice bowl and the chicken panini and liked their choices as well. I would recommend if you are looking for a healthier lunch and will definitely be back.

It's been 7 months since I made the move from PHX to NYC and I still think about D'lish.  It's a small joint and sometimes takes awhile if the line is long, but the awesome service & delicious food are well worth the wait.  Get addicted like me and order these:  - The California Club - The Man Salad (sub blue cheese dressing w/ balsamic vinaigrette) - The Breakfast Buzz (w/ almond milk) -- this is the only coffee/espresso related drink I've ever been able to enjoy.  I've never been a fan of coffee or anything that tastes like the stuff, but this drink defies all odds.  It's like drinking a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup.  Whenever I make it back to the desert... D'lish, you're my first stop.

Friendly staff, awesome breakfast.  If you like to eat healthy organic food, you would like this place.  I tried their "oatmeal our way" which was made with quinoa and fresh fruit and I loved it.  Also their breakfast buritto was really good.  We were in Scottsdale for a few days and we ate there every day.

I cannot explain how much I love D'Lish! I tell everyone about this place.  One day I just so happened to get my oil changed at a shop down the street. Starving for some breakfast goodies, I walked down the street and coincidentally ran into D'Lish. I ordered the California Club with a iced French Vanilla Latte. At first I was a little reluctant to try the California Club because anytime I have ever had anything "healthy" it turned out to be a let down. Thankfully when I ate the California Club I was  delightfully surprised. Ever since then I have continually come back to D'Lish. They have a drive thru as well which is extremely convenient for someone always on the run, like me!
Speedy efficient and friendly service, average food. Had the California club and thought it was nothing special. Lemonade was great and tasted freshly squeezed...Overall average
The food is excellent, very fresh and always high quality.  Service is great and the stuff is very friendly.  Check it out!

Really great food. This used to be where McDonalds is at. My coworkers love the food here so I gave it a shot with some company. We got the house, four-berry, and orange glorious smoothie. The best one was the house smoothie. Orange glorious tastes like perfume. Would not recommend that one. The southwest rice bowl is really great. So is the turkey club sandwich. The best sandwich was the chicken breast panini. Will be back another time. It was filling.

Absolutely love this place! I've lost count of how many dozens of times I've eaten here in the last few years.   My go-tos are the nuts & berries salad, the humanitarian wrap, and the mushroom bisque. Love their egg sandwich on a bialy, too. And I really love that I can get breakfast anytime.   Healthy and d'lish.
Literally d'lish. I think I've had and loved everything on the menu. Nuts&berries salad, california club, turkey club, southwest burrito bowl, protein burger, ...everything. healthy and amazing.

The ultimate java drive through joint! Coffee is aromatic and sturdy. Much like my Aunt Miriam in Berkley. Staff is SO friendly and accommodating. I've never been inside, so as far as I know they are only torsos serving me. I've had the breakfast burrito and it was perfect for eating in the car. Yes, I was driving and eating. Bad driver! Bad! At least I wasn't texting! A couple of times I've had our dog with me and they always throw in a Scooby snack for Emilie. This is the obvious alternative to Starsucks. And if the line gets too long, they come out in person to take orders and get your morning liquid bean fix started!

I used to visit the Scottsdale location every payday Friday for work. I went with my sister on a date. I had the D'veggie bowl and she had the southwest bowl. We both loved our dishes. It was a nice healthy break from a long day shopping. The prickly pear tea is my favorite! The Arnold Palmer my sis had was good but the plain black tea from her refill was not so good. Overall the experience the food and the cleanliness was delicious. I just wish they didn't close at 4pm :( it would be a great dinner spot.

I think this place's overall 4 star rating might be boosted by the fact that it's kind of a hip, non corporate chain.   I've visited D'Lish 3 different times and each was a different experience taste wise but every time I never felt like I got my money's worth.  Traditional burrito with bacon was good, but was kind of small and it lacked a little in the flavor category.  Croissant sandwich was OK, kinda small though.  California club was gross, didn't even finish the sandwich; it was very sloppy and would be better if you substituted the egg for more turkey in my opinion.   Everything is fresh and you can taste the quality but I just can't really justify the price.  D'Lish has a drive thru, that is a huge plus, and it's probably the only reason I'll come back.  Just won't be very often.

I'm glad to have been introduced to this place by my coworker. My go to is the DBuzz breakfast shake. The benefits of going often do pay off because they have a rewards program! The food is good as well. Hopefully they make more locations.

Such a great deli! I love this place and can't wait til I visit again to have their shake for breakfast! All my favorite things...chocolate, banana and peanut butter...YUM! And their breakfast sandwiches are DELISH! Such a fitting name. They even have a drive thru! Man, I wish they had one in CO
Top 3 Turkey Sandwich in town, breakfast burritos are great.  Been to four of the locations and there is consistency amongst all four.  Impressive

I had no idea this place was here until I read about it on Yelp. I think it's usually dark when I'm down there and I'm focused on getting into Los.  I knew I was getting a Dirty Chai Latte. Pulled up to one window...should I stay? Go? pull forward? The pressure!  Pulled forward and was greeted by a rather homely looking young guy..ha! Right? Homely!  His shirt said "wanted" and he wasn't kidding.  How could he know what was in my head?  Seriously beautiful. I even called my husband to tell him how beautiful this boy was. He's young. I don't know that he's a boy..I'm just sayin'.   I almost didn't want to order my Dirty Chai Latte because I had to say "dirty" and I was afraid it would purrrrrr out of me like a cougar.  I managed to order without purring. It was delicious and I was on my way. Life is good.

It's so nice to have a healthy, yet quick alternative to fast food. I love to get a full salad and sandwich to have food for the whole day. I haven't really had anything that I didn't like here. I think that when you start looking at all of the ingredients one might start to think what is that or do I like that? I try to just go with whatever toppings are included (barring any allergies) because I have faith that they know what they are doing! I like to introduce myself to new foods that I'm not familiar with because I'm not a vegan or even a vegetarian, but am trying to be more conscious of eating healthy. I'm so happy to have discovered the wonderful treat to your body that is D'lish!

Great little hidden gem I discovered. Many healthy options that wont break your wallet. Also love that you can get your food fast without having to be waited on. Excellent spot to stop by for lunch. Love the Man Salad and any of the breakfast egg creations are awesome. Nice atmosphere, free Wifi so i can get my work done. Go check them out asap!

This is my first time here. This place is really popular and busy. It's a tiny place. Most of its business seems to happen through its drive through. But inside its nonstop as well. Not a huge menu, but big enough and with enough variety to make my selection take a little time. The girl was very patient with me. A guy at the breakfast bar suggested the California Club. It's their signature breakfast sandwich. I went with that and a iced coffee. This is a really good sandwich. Artisan bread and all the ingredients are really fresh. Oh and the iced coffee was really good and strong. I really like this place and will come back. If you are looking for a new place that isn't a chain and has a lot of healthy choices and healthy also means yummmy, here is your place.

New concept, great concept, NEEDED concept!  It's new and I think they are going through some growing pain but if they have experienced people running the place verses someone simply interested in owning a restaurant (and there are many like that hence here one day and in 2-3 years, gone), they'll be fine!  They use local fresh meats and veggies and organic -  however no signage letting driver bys know - large window signage will draw them in!  We all want to grab a quick fresh organic lunch or snack to go so God willing they'll be a long term success!

My fiance and I went here while we were on vacation. We walked away so impressed with this place and it made me wish there was one of these back home. The food was phenomenal and felt healthy. I felt great and not overly full after eating despite eating a lot. It is a little on the pricey side but I thought it was still pretty reasonable and you definitely get what you pay for. I'd go back here in a heartbeat if I ever find my way to Scottsdale ever again.

Hot off the plane in Arizona... we were on a mission to find me some good Vegan food!  We decided to hit up D'lish in Scottsdale!  This tiny little hot spot, was right off a busy road so naturally we missed our turn the first time, but found that they had a little parking lot located just to the back of it.. This parking lot also served as their drive thru, which a member of the staff actually came out to your car to take your order?  This would become a nightmare later as we were trying to leave the parking lot, since there was a NYC STYLE TRAFFIC JAM behind the restaurant!  We couldn't get out! Oh well that's the only thing keeping this place from being a 5 star!   The food was fantastic! I had the home maid black bean Veggie burger with a side salad!  It would be the first of many veggie burgers I would eat this week, and might have been the best! Really wonderful flavor, topped off with a little hot sauce, (when in Rome)!    We loved the out door seating, and the staff was super nice, as one of them was clearing our table told us of a few spots we could hit up while we were in town!  And gave us directions to Old Town!  I really wanted to try to Peanut Butter Smoothie, it looked and smelled gonza good, but I had to leave some room in my tummy for Beer by the pool!  Next Time!    Great staff, cool little space, only problem was that disastrous parking situation!  Walk here if you can! Or park on a side street!

Only giving this 1 star because the customer service at this place is abysmal at best. On a taste level, I'd give it a 3.5.  I recently moved to Phoenix and drive past D'lite on my daily commute. I finally decided to try it today. I walked in and told the cashier I needed a moment to take a look at the menu. The first thing he said to me was "Wow! Why would you steal from McDonalds?!" Confused I looked around and realized he was making fun of my black-and-white striped dress. "Ha ha, the Hamburgler wants his outfit back!" he exclaimed. I wouldn't classify myself as a stick in the mud, but the condescending tone and laugh didn't sit well with me. I disregarded the comment and told him I needed a few minutes to make a decision.  As I  was reading over the menu he was sighing and staring at me (i could tell he was annoyed I was taking so long) I told him I still needed a few more minutes because I have difficulty seeing. He muttered to himself, "I'm going blind too because of that dress." This made me extremely uncomfortable but I disregarded the comment because I really wanted to try this place, and I was too hungry to go somewhere else.  When I asked him where the kids menu was he scoffed at me and muttered with an eye roll, "under D'kids" and pointed to the screen as though I was inconveniencing him and should have known where that part of the menu was, even though there are 5 screens with 3 in awkward places.   I ordered my food (to-go, even though I had originally intended on eating in the restaurant) and left as fast as I could because I was so embarrassed from the comments made.   There was another woman leaving at the same time as I was. She walked towards a wall thinking it was the exit door. When she turned around and left, the same cashier who had made fun of me started laughing and said, "That's the only reason I work here! To watch people do that!"  I'm not sure if that guy was having a bad day or if that's his general attitude but it definitely left a poor impression on me. The ambiance of the store is cute, the menu has a lot of tasty-looking offerings, but today's experience has left me wondering if I will give D'lite another try.   I ordered the humanitarian wrap with a cactus green tea, turkey wrap and kid's grilled cheese. The food was excellent and the restaurant's location is so close to my work and home that I could see myself coming here multiple times a week. After dealing with that cashier I can't say I'll come back. If I do order, it will most likely be through the drive-thru, so one can only hope that I'll have a better experience with that.

This place is terrible at customer service! I went through the drive thru and was greeted at first but said i needed a min to decide. Then i had to yell  several times to get someone to answer when I was ready. I think they were going I was going to drive away. The food took a very long time and the girl with the short blond hair was rude, slow and all around unpleasant to deal with. I went there because t seemed like a healthy option food was just okay but definitely did not make up for the terrible service!!

I was on my way to a meeting yesterday and I thought I would give this place a try (I just cannot abide Starbucks burnt coffee). I didn't do the drive through ( I wanted to take a look at the muffins, doctor up my coffee the way I wanted it, etc.). You know, I though it was a nice little coffee place. The muffin was pretty good (although certainly not fresh from the oven...but then what is these days?). The coffee was also pretty good (they didn't have a dark roast option, so "house" was it for me...I would prefer a little better selection from a place where the primary business is "coffee"). They had to scramble around to get me some milk for my coffee, but scramble they did, and they came up with a carton after a couple minutes of digging in the refrigerator. The prices are reasonable, and that's always a plus. I will try them again.

I must have had an off day.  I ordered one of the breakfast burritos, and I found it to be very plain and without a lot of flavor.  It just did not do it for me.  Perhaps I would go back and try something else.  The customer service was fine.  They can get you through the drive-thru pretty quickly.  My coffee was just ok.  I really do not get the fuss about this place.

If someone asked me my deepest desire while I was sleeping, there's a 94% chance that I'd mumble "The House-Style Veggie Burger with grilled onions instead of feta, please".  It's been about a month since I had the pleasure of ravaging this for lunch, but it hasn't left my mind. Even though D'lish was out of buns, the toasted sourdough bread they put it on was good enough for me to consider asking for that instead from now on.  First off, it's only $8.50 for a meal that will keep me full for at least 6 hours after. The burger itself (a mix of quinoa, black beans, and some other nommy things) is massive. It's the kind of burger that squishes out of the side of the bread when you bite into it. Awesome. It's topped with all kinds of fresh veggies, and then the bread is slathered with cucumber sauce on one side and pesto on the other. It's unreasonably good. Sound like a lot? It is. It might be 1,000 calories... but you know what? It's 1,000 calories of really freakin' delicious stuff.
Healthy and consistent.  On the expensive side for a breakfast spot but it should be expensive based on the quality of the ingredients and emphasis on keeping it clean and good for that body.

The other location in Tempe has waaaay better service. If you go to this one, try to stay away from the brunette with the nosering, especially.  The food is good and some would say the food is great, but inside is simple and loud due to coffee machines. Driving through is better.  It's easier to take the food to go but don't go here during lunch. The traffic is so backed up, it's not even safe sometimes. I once sat in the median on Scottsdale Rd for 10 min just waiting to turn into their lot. If you come from the South, cars get backed up in the right lane and actually stop in the road. In a larger town, the cops would be here demanding these guys stop blocking traffic and get out of the median.  I highly encourage you to try the food, however. The other location in Tempe is certainly worth the drive to get there.

Humanitarian with avocado is what I order here.  But I have to drop you down for not having a bathroom. At least give me an outhouse or something.  It's a bit sad when your fav place also has no where "to go". I mean, it's kind of embarrassing when I bring a date here and then on the way, I need stop by the local Lowe's/Best Buy in case she needs to use the toilet. I figure that is a step up from dropping her at the gas station, but it still doesn't do much to set the mood, you know?  HEY? I just figured it out! You know how they have BYOB? How about BYOO? Bring your own outhouse. I could carry one of those little plastic things in my trunk...but wait, then there is still no tp, sink, mirror, etc.  OK, just kidding about byoo, but seriously guys, thanks for anything you can do.

Came here today for the first time - FINALLY. I've only put that off for a few years. I generally stayed away because I had the notion built up in my head that it was expensive, not-that-great food.  I am happy to say though, that prices are fairly reasonable, and the Top Notch burger I got was so good. Their burgers are all quinoa and bean burgers, so that might've been a first for me. Very interesting (in a good way!)  Overall, I loved it, and I will definitely be back to try.....well, everything.

What a "D'lite" this place is! If you're always on the go like I am, sometimes it's a necessity to grab a quick bite to eat. There aren't a lot of quick, healthy, options when you need your food fast (aka drive thru!). So when I discovered D'lite Healthy On The Go from my friend I knew I had to check this place out!   My two favorite menu items are first the Breakfast Buzz!! This is one of the BEST shakes I have ever had in my life. Chocolate, espresso, peanut butter...need I say more?! My other favorite is the California Club. I've tried this as a sandwich and as a wrap and both are equally delicious! The customer service is excellent as well!!

So far, nothing but good experiences from this place. I haven't been able to delve into their whole menu quite yet but I will tell you that their shake like drink called the Breakfast Buzz is probably one of the best shake combo drinks I've ever had.   The Breakfast Buzz has vitamins, protein, espresso, nonfat milk, peanut butter, banana, chocolate, and it's blended with ice.  My roommate goes there about five times a week, so if that doesn't say something, I'm not sure what does. I've heard nothing but great things about the staff and food from this place.   Just a warning, the drive-thru line can become incredibly long which shows how yummy and popular it is, however, it can be a bummer when you only want a Buzz. SOOOOO my roommate and I usually call and order it ahead of time so by the time we get there all we have to do is run in and pay, no waiting.   It's about a five minute drive from my house which is wonderful, but the Breakfast Buzz is so good, I usually finished a large by the time I get home. It's a problem, I wish I could make it last longer but it's just so freakin' good.   This place is a great option if you're looking for something healthy and delicious whilst out and about.

This place is pretty incredible.  The california club and the breakfast buzz are probably the best items on the menu IMO... but seriously, you can't go wrong.  The only thing I've had that I didn't really care for is the Breakfast Burrito, but that was because it was just a little boring compared to the other choices on their menu.  It's a long wait in the drive thru 99% of the time, but it is absolutley MORE than worth it.

Awesome food and everyone is great! Duh it's going to be busy and lines are going to be long because it's SO good. Duh it's going to be loud sometimes because it's a small place and blenders are loud. Duh it's not going to be sunshine and rainbows every time but this place has great food, easy selections, and the guys and gals get you in and out of there as fast as they can, NOT to be rude but so you can be on your way. :)

AMAZING spot for breakfast/brunch. Have not been here for other meals but wouldn't hesitate to come back and try.   My Order:  Croissant Sandwich w/ Portabello soup.  FOOD: 5/5 To begin to explain how amazing this was, I have to mention that I savored every bite and even tried to eat slower with smaller bites because I didn't want the flavors to end. The croissant is rich in flavor and balanced very well. The pesto was my favorite part and would recommend maybe asking for extra.   AMBIENCE/DECOR: 5/5 Small but cozy. It wasn't very busy when I came but can see this place getting quite packed. Drive thru line went out to the street. Parking is a bit of a hassle but there are plenty of nearby establishments you can park at.  It can get a little noisy as well when the blenders are running but it's expected for a small little place.   COST: 5/5 Cost is a bit high but it is obvious they don't skimp out on the ingredients and preparation. The food and the experinece is well worth it. Everything is fresh and healthy.   I can't wait to come back!
This place is really popular. There was constant traffic the entire time. It's worth checking out for sure.

Met a couple buds from the AOB and S (Female). I picked D'lish so really this was all on me. There are just so many negatives to talk about first, BEFORE I even get to the food. First: Parking is a joke. There is such limited parking in the back of the restaurant that you might as well park down/up the street and walk. Second: There is NO BATHROOM. Now, regardless of whether or not this has been grandfathered into the creation of this place, why would the owners choose to have a "sit down" restaurant and then not provide a bathroom. NO BUENO. Leave this place as a drive-thru only and you're fine. As soon as they added the 7 2-tops to the inside and the 3 2-tops to the front porch, they should have added a bathroom. Three: The noise. OMFG. If you're sitting inside, which why wouldn't you, and someone orders a smoothie, fagetaboutit. You cannot hear. It is deafeningly loud. Have you ever been to a Jamba Juice and stood close to the machines when they run them? Well, imagine they picked up the machine and STUCK IT next to your ear. Seriously annoying. And, I will add that I'm obviously not the only one who thinks so because while we were sitting there a few customers sat inside only to move outside after being subjected to the noise and deciding there's no way to have a conversation. Now there was going to be 4 of us and there's no way to seat 4 outside so we tuffed it out inside. Four: Employee. You're NOT right. When a customer complains, brings up something that is making them unhappy or is otherwise not pleased with their experience. Your SOLE job is to fix it. NOT ask questions. NOT make them feel as if they're stupid or wrong. You (employee) simply smile and fix it. I realize it sucks sometimes and you probably want to kill half of the people you deal with on a daily basis. BUT, that's the job you've taken. I'll explain more on this momentarily.  So, T, S (M) and I were waiting for S (F) to show up so we ordered 3 Black Tea's. (32oz $3 ea). We took the 2 2-tops right in front of the counter because the rest of the tables were full. This was when we first realized how loud it was. It was funny but then NOT funny. The smoothie machine was just ridiculous. While we were waiting for S (F) to show up the two tables closer to the window opened up so we moved. Even being 3 feet further away from the noise had to help, even if it was just the tiniest bit.  So now we come to our problem with our server / employee. 2 of our Black Tea's tasted like crap. Actually, they tasted like there was Fish sauce with the tea. T said he thought it was because they were using Scottsdale Tap water. Seriously? Does Scottsdale Tap water really taste that bad? I live in Chandler and if my tap water tasted this bad, I would have moved long ago. The thing is, only 2 of the 3 had the taste and they were all the same drinks. Hmmmm. Regardless, we got the 3rd degree about it when we wanted to change them to green tea to see if there was a difference. There was. Then we were informed that they had gotten a new brewer the day before and maybe this batch, which they brew and then put in gallon water jugs to store, might be the culprit. EXCUSE ME. I assume they've run a few batches through the machine so we all agreed we thought this wasn't it. What I did think was the culprit was the gallon jug of Black Tea that had 1/23 date written on it. I doubt the tea was brewed a week ago, but, the plastic jug could have old dried tea rotting away on the inside. GROSS. Use a jug and then recycle it. Not a place to cut corners.  Onto the food. Only S (M) and I ordered food. I ordered the Southwest Rice Bowl ($8.25).  Steamed basmati rice, chicken breast, broccoli, shaved corn, black beans, enchilada & creamy cucumber sauces, topped with fresh cilantro & a side of toasted bagel chips. This was yummy. I think the portion size was a little wimpy, but the taste was great. Winner winner Rice Bowl dinner.  S (M) ordered The Man Salad ($8.50). House made tuna salad & sliced avocado served on bed of spring mix greens, chicken, bacon, feta, & tomato with a side of black bean azuki chips & creamy cucumber blue cheese dressing. S (M) said this was a great salad. All the flavors mixed very well together. Another winner.  So the problem is, there were just so many negatives BUT the food was great. So, use the drive-thru and get a 5 star experience. Stop and eat there, not so much. Since we ate there, this review is based on our experience dining in.  No Bathroom. Crappy Parking. Loud Machine. Not the best customer service. Great Food. 2 Stars.

I went through the drive through this morning, so my review is based solely on my experience there and the food. The staff was friendly, efficient and everything I ordered was correct so that was good. However, I found the food and drinks pricey for what they were. I ordered a large chai latte, a large strawberry banana smoothie, a California club breakfast sandwich and a house black bean quinoa burger. The chai latte was fine. The smoothie was very large but it was a bit sweet, could've done with a bit of acidity like orange juice. The sandwiches were pretty small for $9 each. The Cali club was good. The bread is soft and fresh. The black bean quinoa burger was good but out of proportion. Too much black bean quinoa patty to bread and toppings. I asked for extra cucumber sauce, which was wise, because it would've been very dry otherwise. The outside of the burger was crispy and dry while the inside was total mush and falling apart. It had good flavor but the structure was really lacking. A $30 mediocre breakfast, probably won't come back.

Absolutely delicious sandwich. I had this place bookmarked for when I was in the Phoenix area and decided to stop here before heading back to Tucson. I had the turkey club and a dirty chai latte and enjoyed every minute of it. Everything tasted fresh, bacon was crisp, bread was delicious. Love that their food is healthy but delicious. Can't wait to go back for some more!

I really wanted to love it after reading all the wonderful reviews, but unfortunately, it didn't hit my wow factor!  I ordered the California club for my hubby and I got the oatmeal with all the yummy fruit. All in all, after having to wait twenty minutes in that long line of cars I wouldn't go back. Sorry D'lish. You didn't make my breakfast roster.

It was my first time here to grab a quick breakfast before my 6:30am meeting.  I ordered the protein shake and I really liked it. I have to get less chocolate in it since it was a bit too sweet for my taste.  I also ordered their quinoa oatmeal and was not impressed. I guess I had no idea on what I was ordering or what it would have tasted like but my taste buds did not like it. I have read that the California Club is the way to go for your morning fix. I will definitely have to give this place another try for a healthy breakfast.
Hidden a bit, but worth the search.  Breakfast was very good, fast, and fresh.  We had the California Club and Breakfast Burrito (w/ chicken sausage) - 2 thumbs up for both.  We'll be back.
One of my favorite spots!  Staff is always friendly. Angelica and Aleck are always super helpful and friendly.  Thank you guys!
So yummy! I've been to D'Lish in South Scottsdale and love it and this place is no different! Quality food, great service but shorter lines and more space!

Great food, not great coffee. Chad the owner has crafter an excellent menu that is healthy and tasty. All of the salads are killer, but I can't get away from the breakfast sandwiches. I love the California Club. It's perfect. The drive through is fast and awesome. But if you are looking to have a lunch business meeting, don't do it there. The seating is very limited and the blenders are super loud. So it's hard to hear and pretty distracting. Other than that, D'lish is awesome, and I'd definitely recommend it.

I've been to both the Apache location and this one several times. Both locations are top notch.   I love coming here for a quick and healthy breakfast. The atmosphere is really laid back and the service is always great. I am a creature of habit but may I recommend the veggie breakfast burrito? Oh. My. God. It's divine. It's balanced and filling-and I feel like I'm starting my day off right. The iced coffees are so yummy, but beware of knowing what size to order... I went for the large Americano once and got a thirstbuster of espresso!   The only drawback of both locations is the parking lot, especially this one. It's quite small and hard to navigate.   Overall, I highly recommend checking this place out if you're looking for a place with healthy breakfast and lunch options & great coffee. There's something to satisfy both vegetarians and meat eaters alike!

I love this drive-thru!!! Sometimes there is a bit of a line but it moves by fast. I usually get the Az burro or the croissant sandwich. Both very good! The breakfast buzz is also amazing. I am excited to try more of the menu!
Obsessed with this place. Breakfast buzz is a perfect post workout meal and any of their wraps are guaranteed to cure a hang over.

At first, I was really skeptical about the reviews regarding the California club sandwich:  it's just a club sandwich and what do you expect to be different from others? But immediately after my first bite of the California club, I know that it is the best club sandwich that I've ever had! It's a perfect combination of avocado, bacon, tomato, and most importantly, the sour cream: it made my day great! With respect to the decor and space, I would say that it is pretty cozy and relaxed, but the space is limited. I would definitely go and try other stuff.
I do not eat from fast food restaurants, but this place lived up to their claim. Delicious qualuty food. Long line, almost no parking, but well worth the wait!
Was a little nervous from the partial hippy vibe but was great food and coffee. Price/portion was good as well. Will def do another breakfast/brunch here if I'm in the area.

This place is awesome. I usually get the burritos with turkey meat but I had the SW bowl the other day and it was huge!!! I had to take 1/2 home. I crave the blended-chai and have recently hopped off the unemployed student band wagon to pay for my addiction. Jk. But seriously.
place was swamped and they handled it very well. Food was fresh, delicious, and fast. the morning buzz was delicious too.

They don't call this place D'lish for nothing. They have some really tasty and healthy sandwiches. The place may be very small but the place does have its unique character. They also do serve some pretty good coffee.

Very, very good food.  My only complaint is that it should have two dollar signs on Yelp ($$) because it costs more than $10 to eat there.  I was a bit disappointed by that, but the food was really top notch.  Great service and staff too.  If I'm feeling a bit pricier than I normally am for lunch, I'll be back.
Hands down one of the best local spots around.  The California club is one of my favorite sandwiches from anywhere, period.  Smiling faces and healthy eats.  Love this place.

As an out of towner LA vegan, I was skeptical after reading all the rave reviews.  This place is vegan friendly with their Quinoa Oatmeal and delicious coffee!  The guys on duty the Sunday morning we frequented D'lish were super patient and cool.  We'll be back next year during Spring Training!!

I was excited when I saw D'lish was opening in Tempe as it has been on my Phoenix Coffee Tour (ftw) for over a year, but I never found myself in Scottsdale to try it. So I went there a couple weeks ago and can honestly say it was just okay. Now, I preface this by saying that I have only been there once, they are new, and I didn't order anything terribly complex, but for now...just ok. The BF and I decided to go in instead of driving through. We each got a latte (which are VERY fairly priced at 3$) and I had the bagel and egg sandwich. The lattes were good at the very beginning, but as they lost some of their heat, they became more acidic tasting. I think this may be indicative of good milk steaming abilities and mediocre espresso. Our lattes came out quickly, but we waited about 15 minutes for my egg sandwich (meanwhile a huge table of obnoxious patrons were laughing as loudly as they could next to us in the early AM.....not D'lish's fault, but annoying). I think what may have happened is the people inside get put at the end of the list as far as making food because there are people waiting in the drive thru, so it took much longer to receive food. Anyway, the sandwich was pretty bland BUT I did like that they don't scramble their eggs in the sandwich, they are over hard (like it better over medium, but whatev). I wish they had more variety of bagels and allowed a choice for the sandwich because it would be really good on an everything bagel. Also, their menu states they have assorted pastries and when the BF asked what pastries they had they said bagels and croissants.... not really assorted.... they could probably take that off the menu or add some more pastries. Anyway, I hear their sandwiches at lunch time are really good, so I may try them again for lunch, but for coffee....eh, just ok.
This place has good and healthy food for a reasonable price! The staff isn't always the most friendly, but I am still a regular anyway. I love the breakfast buzz and the low carb breakfast.

D'lish breakfast Sammie with all the fixings. The bread was the perfect compliment- soft and yeasty. The Sammie had egg, cheese, bacon, avocado and turkey. Just the protein loading I needed on a cold Saturday morning. It was their Grand Opening and everything was half off !!! Say what????

Trying out a new location and so far it's turning out to be better than the Tempe location. Alec was the cashier and was very friendly and gave me suggestions for my burrito. They made my food very fast and it tastes delicious. This is definitely a regular place for me to visit and study. Thy provide free WiFi and the food is decently priced.

First time trying this place. We're big on breakfast dates. Went through the drive through the first time and ordered 2 traditional burritos. (Added avocado to mine) There was an overabundance of eggs and hardly any cheese or potato (or avocado)   =(   We decided to give it a second shot, so we drove back, parked, and came inside. This time, we ordered a California Club as well as a Cinnamon Raisin Bagel with cream cheese and sat to wait. As my fiance had his Club delivered, I received news that they had run out of Cinnamon Raisin bagels. Not only was I bummed that they didn't tell me that at the register, now I'm no longer hungry for anything else here. I let the manager know about my first time experience here and instead of having empathy, he couldn't believe that I didn't enjoy the burritos because "it's his favorite thing ever here." Well it wasn't mine. & they offered no incentive for us to come back and try anything else. Sad morning. Unhappy pregnant belly.

Tried this place strictly because of convenience at the time, so glad I did! Great, healthy, fresh options in a cool relaxing environment. Everyone was friendly and the food was delicious! Had the California breakfast sandwich with a caramel latte, both were fantastic. Can't wait to go back and try a salad or sandwich for lunch.

So I wanted to write a super good serious review and become like yelp famous and respected but I'm really stoned. The food was really good. Got the southwest rice bowl (I thought it was more of less sauce kinda thing, but there's a lot of sauce, kinda drowned the bowl, still really good tho) and the hummus plate, grade A man,also the breakfast buzz which honestly was awesome :)

I generally don't believe five star reviews myself, but this place is the real deal. Great coffee, fantastic food, the best service around. The people who work here are genuinely happy that you walk in. They will chat with you if you want, or let you do your work on their free WiFi.  The Breakfast Buzz has been deservingly and glowingly reviewed here at length, and is well worth the hype.  One of the best surprises on their menu is their tuna sandwich. I am extremely fussy about tuna salad, and this one is my absolute favorite. I could go on, but your best bet is to just come on by and see (and taste) for yourself!

I absolutely love how consistent all the D'Lites are, the South Scottsdale location being my favorite.  Both Nathan and Leonard (managers) are always there with a smile and greeting customers.  Friendly Staff and THE BEST food!
Best Coffee  Love the chill vibes. Healthy menu options for Breakfast or Lunch.

Love you. Really do. Love you even more because I can't have you.  Because I live in Chi-town and you live in Scottsdale.  Darn you.  I ate here three times. In two days. Yep.  That amazingly good.  Iced tea is the bomb. I loved it. They have great flavors. Protein shakes are delish.  Hence the name of the place.  Rockin' to say the least. Breakfast salad was so good, I now crave it.  Sucks to crave something so far away. Quinoa oatmeal was also wonderful and healthy and tasty.  Basically, I think you are nuts if you don't like this place. I'm super jeals of all of the peeps that live out there that can eat at D'lish whenever they want.  As for people crabbin' about the price?  It's independent.  It's different. It's got a great vibe.  And the food is tasty.  Eat and hush up and enjoy.

I have been coming to D'Lish fairly regularly for about 3 years or so. I enjoy the fact it's not a huge chain and offers healthier food options. I've eaten just about everything vegetarian or fish on the menu as well as trIed the smoothies and tea options. Recently after having been frustrated many times over the past few months I finally had to give up on this place. The parking is situation is horrible or the ability to turn into the drive-thru line. The business basically needs someone conducting traffic duties to control the situation. It really is a huge traffic situation that oftentimes blocks the curb lane and either forces you to be a jerk who also blocks the lane or just give up. The staff typically ranges from barely polite to outright rude and they have no public restroom on the premises so I would recommend against eating in because even washing your hands after or before eating is completely out of the question. While the food is good it's not so amazing as to make up for these problems. Save yourself the aggravation and go to one of the many other options in the area

Concept is amazing.  Drive thru with  healthy food? Is it even possible? Yessireee! Welcome to D'lish.  The parking lot is EXTREMELY tiny but you can go through the drive thru to get fresh salads or delicious food that's not deep fried with oil and fats.  On top of that, the restaurant isn't very big either - small as well.  My friend ordered a salad - it was large, filling and had lots of goodies in there.   I ordered the hummus dish with feta on the side. I don't particularly like feta...ehhh.... Hummus was delicious and garlicky. The vegetables and pita were fresh and had a snap sound to it as I crunched into the broccoli! *Munch* Yum-O!  Great place to come if you're on the go and want something healthy and quick.   .....Free wi-fi for the win! :)

The veggie wrap with added turkey was really good. Lite enough not to weigh me down, but a perfect size to not leave me hungry. The only gripe is that their parking situation seemed a bit sketch. There were spaces but it looked like a tight fit. Also their water tasted bad, like tap water from some old pipes.
VERY good, VERY healthy, VERY small! The breakfast fare is delicious, the Breakfast Buzz is addicting and the quality of the ingredients is top notch. Check it out.

Good little find thanks to fellow Yelpers! Nice little hole in the wall / diner, drive-in, and dive joint. Service is great, guys have a friendly and terrific attitude!  Menu is very diverse. My spouse is an RD. LD, and gave it two thumbs up for healthy variety.  Give it a try!

Healthy food (and I mean true, healthy food) on the go, this is your place.  I have been to D'lish numerous times and have tried many things and I haven't been let down.  The club sandwich is PACKED and so so good. My usual go to is the chicken breast panini. Also packed with ingredients, my only gripe with this is it usually has a little bit too much pesto but it is still very good. The latest thing I tried was the Humanitarian with chicken. This was so good, it is now my go to meal. The hummus was full of flavor and the sun dried tomato tortilla was excellent.  I've also had their toddy and iced dirty chai and both were good, also.   The wait for food can sometimes take a little while but hey, this place is packed and you can't blame them if it's busy!

I love the breakfast buzz, no clue how something so good can be somewhat healthy for you. Their seasonal smoothie has been the same pear, apricot flavor for almost a year but it's delicious so we definitely don't mind. The California club and breakfast burrito are our go to's. They are bursting with flavor and Very balances. The only critique is the bacon could be crispier, it can sometimes be chewy which some people may like (I like crispy bacon). We ordered burgers one time but should have read the menu more carefully, they are all veggie burgers.

Like the Place! has some covered parking with a menu on it so you can decide what you want before you go in, pretty cool. has a drive thru as well. you can place big orders ahead of time and go through the drive thru and pick it up! how convenient. place has 1 register, so when the place is packed and the drive though is packed, they switch back and forth using the same register. A little annoying for customers and prob the register guy too! get another register! Peeps are friendly, service is great, they get people in and out quickly, so it seems ok. ordered the California Club, place was packed! food amazing, the Tea was amazing too! I'll go back for sure!

I work a physically intensive job, and I was in a rush before work so I was hoping for a hearty meal before my shift, especially as I had not eaten for 16 hours. However, I was extremely disappointed to learn that they did not take my credit card, so I had to walk out the store without any food that I needed for work. It's no wonder that this place is closing. Good thing Jimmy John's was able to take a delivery to me in a quick and easy manner where I wouldn't pass out from exhaustion

More of a coffee shop, than a restaurant. (It has a drive thru.). Good coffee/espresso bar and healthful alternative to fast food. It's an order-at-the-counter place with cheerful staff that takes orders and delivers food to your table. Breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito were fresh and tasty -- but more of a "take-away" "to-go" feel. Small parking lot can get a little jammed up with drive thru traffic.  Good place to grab a quick bite.

We come every weekend for breakfast and our dogs love to come because they typically get a dog treat at the take out window. The last three times the same woman didn't give a treat. The food is always good but we are driving home with with disappointed pups.
Really neat place, only thing stopping me from a 5-Star review was the amount of 311 I had to listen to while I ate

I don't know how someone could say the service was subpar!!! Every time we come in I'm impressed with how quick and friendly the people working are! I think they go above and beyond actually. Even though it's standard, they always promptly bring out a water bowl for my pup and are sweet to her. They also run in and out to the patio to bring you what you need even though you could easily get it yourself. The food is good and the vegan buzz is my favorite!! They are pretty accommodating about changing things to your need but I'd always love more vegan options

Although it was a little out of our way, D'lish was worth the drive, times ten.  The guys behind the counter rock the casbah. They inject friendliness like they have a PhD in positivity. I loved every minute of sitting at the counter, I would have gladly swapped my 6-hour passenger seat spot home to LA to sit there and chat and slurp up their complimentary samples of the "breakfast buzz." Apparently it goes by many different names but just ask for the peanut butter thing and your am will forever be changed. The breakfast bagel I had on bialy bread was also top notch, filling, and inexpensive.  D'lish, want to take a road trip to LA?

My wife and I were looking for a place to get breakfast on the way to Phoenix Airport. We consulted our trusty Yelp app and found D'lish. It got great reviews so we thought we'd give it a try. When we pulled up, there was a long line at the drive through. I figured this was a good sign. The parking lot is very small and cramped and took some maneuvering to get into a spot, especially with all the cars at the drive through. We wanted to sit and eat so we went inside. The inside is very small and maybe would fit a dozen people comfortably. Luckily, there were only a few others besides us. We were a little confused when we walked in as we received no greeting. Do we just sit? Is there table service? Or do we just walk up and order? After realizing there is no table service we looked at the menu, which was located above the counter. The menu was written very small and was difficult to read. The inside is very loud mostly because of the blenders and the loud music that was playing. It was very difficult to have a conversation there and I could barely hear the woman taking my order. The noise level was so high I can't imagine it's good for the people that work there. I placed my order at the counter and I received a number to place on our table. I ordered the traditional burrito and my wife ordered the frittata. While we were waiting we noticed some not-so-customer-friendly signs. There was a sign that stated no public restrooms. We looked for the restrooms and discovered that there aren't restrooms to use even if your a paying customer. Then there was the old, "We reserve the right to refuse service to anyone." Really? Come on. As a paying customer that really doesn't make me feel welcome. Anyway, back to the food. The food came out promptly and hot. My burrito was in a wheat wrap with eggs, potatoes, bacon and cheese with a side if salsa. The burrito was good, but not seasoned. The salsa was from a jar. I know this because I can tell and it was confirmed when I saw the container of salsa in the kitchen. I would of liked some D'lish home made fresh salsa. My wife's frattata was a baked egg omelette with cheese, and vegetables, hashbrowns on a thick piece of white toast. Drizzled on top was a spicy sauce. They also offer smoothies and vita shakes. The food was good, but the atmosphere and service were poor. I think I know why a lot of people were in the drive through line getting food to go.
Great, fast, high quality, and consistent. Always a great option. My favorite is the club and pomegranate green tea.

Swung by though drive thru for a California club sandwich. The drive thru moved quickly because they had workers walking to our cars to take our order and payment.  The sandwich (around $8) was well made... the eggs were cooked differently, really thin somehow?  The pesto and mayo.. everything was great.  They cut it in half and wrap it up nicely for on the go eating.  Great service.  Great sandwiches.

Food here is really clean and delicious. The inside is well kept and cared for. Breakfast buzz and burritos are great. My only complaint about this place is the price. We got two breakfast burritos, two waters, and paid around $30 after tip, only to leave still hungry.

Very refreshing to have a place like this around. Food is phenomenal to say the least. I will be trying the breakfast buzz next time after seeing all the reviews. Finally healthy fast food. I would say great food vs fast food. Will be a loyal customer!

Love the relaxed atmosphere, the friendly staff, and of course the food!    My favorite thing to get is the low carb breakfast (especially good when you had gestational diabetes),and it hits the spot any time of the day. I love how fresh every ingredient tastes, and the way that they take the care to dress it just right in pesto and vinaigrette yum!  It's basically a salad with eggs and a hash brown on top with avocado.  I also like to get their walnut and berry salad. Can you say heaven in every bite? It's a bit on the sweet side because of the dressing, but it has so much flavor!  I would give 5 stars, but there has been several occasions where I've waited in the drive through for over 20 minutes. Pretty much my whole lunch break. &that was 20 minutes for the line to move, then another 5 to 10 minutes at the window waiting for my food. I get it though, it takes time to make such delicious food and serve it through the drive through.
Trying to eat healthier, yet not starve, and "the Man Salad" was pretty good!
This place changed it's name to d'lish kitchen-- perhaps new owners and worse food? I had wheat bagel sandwhich- bagel was stale sent it back. Tried sesame and that was just as stale. Bad.

Came back here 4 years later when I was in town a couple weeks ago.  The day after partying all night,, we were looking for food that was quick and not too pricey in Scottsdale.  I thought of D'lish because I remember the fresh and healthy menu that I loved when I first discovered it.  Fried, greasy, or heavy food was just not acceptable to me that day.  Sad that I was not able to share that same fresh experience with my friends this time with the food here.  My boyfriend ordered a breakfast burrito and it looked horrible inside once he bit into it. The eggs were green, way overcooked, and didn't really look like eggs.  Just looked like a light green meat patty.  Not sure what happened.  I won't say that I won't come back here ever again, but I hope they'll get back to serving more fresh and high quality food.
This place is overpriced but definitely a hangover cure. Go here and get the California club and a breakfast buzz!!! Highly recommend to anyone!

I can't believe I paid over ten dollars for this salad. I ordered the Man salad. It was not made according to the description given- it was completely absent on any tuna salad and has two small slices of avocado. Additionally, the lettuce was wilted and slimy. I could've made a better salad at home. I will stick with Salad and Go for now for consistent results and much better prices. I realize this location just opened and they may still be figuring things out, but this was a disaster.

Clean, healthy and tastes amazing! Their breakfast buzzes are so good that I pretty much crave one every day. I've also had almost all of their breakfast sandwiches and you really can't go wrong with any of them. The AZ Burro stands as my favorite though.  The inside of this location is roomy and clean and the staff is always helpful and courteous.

I stop by for a quick lunch near work. I've enjoyed several of the dishes they serve here: -The chicken panini ($7.25 with chips); the chicken, mushrooms and pesto were very good. -The Breakfast Buzz (peanut butter-banana-espresso smoothie) -The baja chicken soup and the bagel chips that go with it -Pomegranate green tea (not artificially/overly sweet) -Man Salad (Nice assortment of protein to fill you up) -Lo Carb Breakfast (2 eggs, avocado, & hashbrown on top of a salad) -The AZ burro (I only had a bite but seemed tasty and more filling than the regular sandwiches); saw someone eating this "enchilada style" (baja chicken soup on top) and it looked glorious.  Wouldn't try again: The hummus plate. The hummus itself wasn't that great and even though I usually like crudites, the veggies that came with it weren't standout either. Oh well, can't win them all. Won't deduct a star for this because of how good everything else has been.  The guy at the counter was really nice and friendly and didn't rush us to order even though it was getting busy.  Parking sucks (something like 9 spots?) and the drive thru line looks like it can get crowded fast, but I've had decent luck with it after 12:30 and when I call my order in ahead of time.  Also, God help you if you sit inside and someone orders something that needs to be blended (like a Breakfast Buzz). It gets really loud with that machine on. That being said, it's nice to sit at one of the outside tables when the weather is good.  I'll definitely keep swinging by as almost everything I try turns out to be quite tasty. As far as food goes in that area, it seems like one of the better options. Only wish they were open later in the day so I could grab something on my way out of work.

Great spot, great atmosphere !   My husband had the tuna sandwich which he said was the best he ever had- coming from him that is huge. I had the d'veggie bowl- comes hot- not a salad but delicious,  only negative is no bathrooms - so go before you come.
Ordered the chicken panini. Supposed to be served on sourdough they gave me plain white bread instead. Wasn't impressed definitely not worth 9 dollars.
We love this fast food alternative! Our favorite is the California club or the naked chicken panini- yum!

Same awesome menu, great location, convenient drive thru, welcoming and nicely designed interior space, yet poor customer service. Like, really poor. Customer service is the magic that ties everything else together & this location really misses the mark. I've frequented the south Scottsdale location and every interaction with the employees is bright, happy, positive, and really genuine. So I'm completely surprised that this culture and standard isn't upheld at this location. I've been coming here since they opened and haven't had one experience where I didn't feel like my order was an inconvenience. All the girls are short, curt, blatantly unapologetic if an order takes a little longer than normal, they all seem miserable working here, they pass the order out the window and gone in a flash, no "thank you", no "have a great day", no smile, nada. Completely cheapens the experience. I keep thinking "it'll be different today" each time I go, nope. I can an easily make this breakfast buzz at home. Such a shame.

$10.50 got me a 16oz hot, dirty chai and chef salad.   I loved me the hot, dirty chai. Plus, it's just fun to say.   The salad was tasty. Great portion size. Often we think we can stuff our faces with lettuce, turkey slices and eggs...but we can't. Let's face it. D'lish does a great job of making a well-balanced salad.   The guys who run this place are also very easy on the eyes.   The menu is expansive, offering up breakfast choices with lighter fare, including smoothies. Ingredients are said to be mostly organic. Yep, I like this place alot, actually.   And it's very cool they have a drive-thru.   I also dug the music while I was there. It was from one guy's laptop; so you know he's got a great library of tunes. Thumbs up for me.   If you haven't gone here, go. Even if it's for a coffee. You may find, though, that when you arrive, you can't resist their menu options.

I absolutely love how this restaurant makes eating healthy, fast with their drive thru. The Vegan breakfast buzz is my all time favorite! Along with the AZ Burro! The only thing I really don't like about D'lish is that they close at 4pm so I can't stop by after work to get food. Wish they would stay open until at least 7 or 8!

I have literally been here over 1,000 during and after college. I get the same thing every single time. Cali club, seasonal smoothie, side of fruit. Amazing, healthy, slightly overpriced (but not enough to keep me away). Get this up on Uber Eats and I won't eat anywhere else ever.

okay, i finally know the name of this place. i think it used to have different owners when it originally opened.   i live 5 minutes from here (you know, on the other side of the tracks) and have been going here since it opened a few years ago. the quality of coffee drinks has gone up and up and up since the first time we tried it.   i love their lattes as well as their plain old cup of joe. the service has always been great; typically my dog gets a treat if she's riding along with me through the drive-thru.   great coffee, nice, local spot to support.

Get the breakfast buzz shake! It's the reason I put up with the line 95% of the time. The food is good too, personal favs being the low carb breakfast and the chicken panini. I wish they had a better way of dealing with the wait time in the drive through but I feel like it's worth it when everything is fresh and made to order. Love this gem!

Super fresh fast fun and friendly !!  Sometimes the line gets super long so I guess not that fast at times . Friendly staff and just love the vibe .  Wish they could tone down the industrial loud blenders they use to make the Breakfast Buzz!  Good concept i would buy into a franchise ...

Disappointed to say that the quality of D'lite has gone down as the number of locations have gone up. I have always loved D'lite since it was still called D'lish, and only had two locations (One in Tempe and one in South Scottsdale). It helped me survive college when I was too lazy or rushed to cook! Now that I live closer to Arcadia, I have began going to the one on Indian School, however its become a gamble to see if they will get my order correct or if it even turns out decent.   Today I asked for an everything bagel with egg, avocado and tomato. I received a ridiculously small plain bagel with only egg and avocado. I've literally never seen a bagel that small. I didn't notice until I got to my car and didn't have time to go back, as I was on my way to work. Most of the times I get D'lite are on my way to work, so it is frustrating to constantly receive wrong orders that I have already paid for and don't have time be remade.The last few times the breakfast burritos I have gotten were way smaller than usual, soggy, and just gross to be honest. This is the first Yelp review I've ever written in my life. I hate to be that person to complain over something minor, but I'm sad to see one of my favorite places go so downhill.
Really tasty food fast at a good price. We had the California club and the low carb breakfast as a wrap. California club stole the show.

While I love the food here and don't mind paying $10 for a salad, I have to give them a low rating because they nickel & dime customers for everything! Non-dairy dressing for your salad = $1.50 because it normally comes with ranch. Splash of lemonade with that $4 tea = $.50 because they can. Come on. Employees had attitude about it too. Well you know that $2 tip I threw in the tip jar? Why don't I take it back to pay for my splash of lemonade? Even though good food, still leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
The service was fast, the food was healthy and delicious, and the workers were friendly. What more could I want??

Cute little shop on the east side of Scottsdale road.  Minimal seating and parking, but of course they do much of their business through the drive thru.  Employees were very friendly and conversational, and the espresso was surprisingly good.  Prices were reasonable.  Will definitely return any time I'm in the area.

It doesn't get five stars because the parking and drive thru situation is atrocious. The food however is d'lish (see what I did there). I usually get the breakfast sandwich and a nice tea. For lunch the southwest chicken bowl is SO good. The employees are always  smiling and on point despite how busy it gets!

I love the breakfast buzz here so I drove 15 miles from my house to get it. Shake was great but the girl taking my order in the drive thru was short and not very friendly. After she gave me my change I said "thank you" and she just shut the window that was it. No response no have a nice day definitely not the friendliest.

Awesome food, staff, and coffee! If you're looking for a quick breakfast or lunch stop that's healthy and delicious I fully endorse D'Lite. Stopped in the other day and had the breakfast burrito and coffee. In a rush? They have a drive thru!

Great concept!  In fact, had thought about this for so long:  Why isn't there a place WITH a drive-through that actually makes delicious, HEALTHY food?  D'Lish is it. They pride themselves on not serving coke/pepsi products, which I do quite like.   Best dirty chai of my life here. Legit. So rich, flavorful and the espresso was made perfectly. Not over steeped, not burned...not weak, just right! Well, of course their food is incredible too : ) Anything you pick will rock your socks off.  Lemme say, while my dog didn't take the treat they offered (he's a brat lol) - the fact that they offered it was so nice. These folks care about what they're doing, and do it well.  I can't wait to go back and have a meal on the delightful little patio.

The Man Salad! What a great place for tasty healthy fast food. And the people are really friendly. They love what they do and what they do is great. Don't be fooled by the street view. Clean, charming, modern, young, and delightfully d'lish.
