Had the veggie burger.  Really good ... though needed a wee bit more spice.   Perhaps in the Aioli?   I really liked the bun ...  For the $ expected a teeny side dish ...but nothing?   Ok experience.

D'lish has very delicious food.  This place has very healthy and tasty fresh food.  In addition, they have a major plus with a drive-thru window.  It is a good thing they have that because it gets quite packed with such a small location.  I have had their salads and sandwiches, and so far everything has been exceptional.  During my last visit, I tried the Breakfast Buzz.  The Breakfast Buzz has peanut butter, protein powder, bananas, espresso coffee, and skim milk.  It was a delicious blend of yummy.

Great sandwiches, lots of healthier options.  I love that they mark everything for those of us with special dietary needs, like dairy free options.  I have never been disappointed.  You can call ahead and pick up your take out order through the drive thru.

The food was very good and staff was nice. The veggie burrito just seems to be missing something as it doesn't have much flavor to it. The salsa that comes with would be helpful to add flavor but it didn't have any. Ingredients were fresh and everyone else's food was extremely good! I will definitely be going back, just skipping the burrito.
Two words, Almond Buzz! Try it, you will get hooked!

Two words, Almond Buzz! I could live off these things. I discovered them a few months back and am there almost every morning feeding the monkey. They look out for their customers with a punch card so every 10 you get a free one. Good looks on that! Parking lot can be nightmare but you gotta pay to play. All in all give it a go, you'll be hooked.
Good fast healthy food. Their protein shakes are great I recommend the breakfast buzz. Some of their menu items are strange which is why they don't get four stars from me.

I can here often for the California club which is my fav!! Today I tried the Burro and subbed the eggs for avocados and it was delicious. The cashier didn't provide the correct change so I will be back to get my funds but that doesn't take away from the quality of their service and food!

AZ burro, California Club, and of course, the Breakfast Buzz are my go to's. Everything bagel toasted with cream cheese is also a good simple option. The prices increased recently which is understandable since they said they haven't in a number of years. I would definitely recommend.

I ordered the California turkey and OMG. My taste buds exploded with happiness. The pesto and cream cheese blended together perfectly. The turkey was good quality, and the eggs were cooked well. The bread really gave it a wonderful texture and flavor. I wish there was a D'Lish closer, but I have no problem making the drive. D'Lish is right!

I'm ecstatic to find this establishment recently on my foodie run in Scottsdale. I love their mission to offer healthy fast food options to all the busy bees in Arizona. Staying true to the fast food concept, this location is equipped with a drive-thru so their customers can grab healthy food and be on their way to or from work. My two to picks are the Breakfast Buzz shake for my morning routine. This shake has all the protein and caffeine to get me through to lunch. The Breakfast Club is my second choice for when I want to munch my breakfast. Overall, I love the friendly staff, the cleanliness, and the gorgeous decor at this establishment. Give these peeps a visit, you won't be disappointed. Until next time, stay hungry :).

DELICIOUS FOOD - ALWAYS BUSY  That's the sum up. The Breakfast Buzz (banana chocolate smoothie with espresso) is AMAZING!!! The California Club is out of this world. The Oatmeal Our Way is a little odd because it's not oats, it's quinoa. Very filling but takes some getting used to if your mouth is expecting the mushiness of hot oats. The hummus comes with seasoned pita/naan and the smell is a little odd, but it all tastes good.  This place is the BEST fast-ish food place. I can't say 'fast' in all truth because I've often sat in the line for several minutes with other cars behind me. Good news is, that SHOULD mean they're taking time making your food even more awesome and not just slapping it together in uniform fashion like McD's or the like.  If you're coming here, plan ahead and either come early when you know you gotta be somewhere. The food is TOTALLY worth it.

As the name implies... EVERYTHING here is D'lish!!! From the breakfast sammies to the Man Salad to the Breakfast Buzz, I have never been disappointed with the food!!! I do suggest going to the drive-thru, as it can get very loud inside. Plus, the restroom facilities aren't the most accommodating. But the staff is always laid back, friendly and efficient. I do love the Tempe location but it is a little to far from my 'hood but if you are in that area, I definitely suggest making breakfast or lunch there a regular thing... as I do at the Scottsdale location!
Awesome sandwiches for lunch or breakfast, and apparently pretty good coffee as well!! Definitely recommend giving it a try sometime, fairly quick too if there's no line at the drive thru

Hipster Mecca. I don't get it. I worked next to D'Lish for a while. Went a couple times. Very expensive for a sandwich that is really nothing special with no side or drink. I'd rather spend my money down the street at DeFalco's any day.

Nice breakfast spot and convenient that they offer a drive-thru. It does get busy so be prepared to wait in line for a while in the drive-thru, especially on the weekends. Big fan of the California breakfast sandwich. Some of their frozen coffee drinks are a little milky and watered down -- I like my coffee drinks STRONG! Still, overall, a very nice breakfast option.

Jump on the Triple B if you haven't already (Breakfast Buzz Bandwaggon). You have literally no excuse not to (they have a Vegan Buzz as well) unless you're allergic to delicious.   You can't go wrong with a California Club either. It's yummy and filling.   Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is their website is outdated in my opinion. I wish it provided more nutritional information beyond the ingredients.

Holy cow, the food here is amazing!  Just a small quick eat place with super fresh and healthy food. They have very a very creative menu with options for just about everyone's diet, including vegi, vegan, and gluten free.  Very friendly service, from people that seem to love working there.  I recommend the cali club the ingredients sound strange, but trust me, it works. Check out the photo that someone has posted of it.  Highly recommended, its a must do in Scottsdale.

I wish there was a place like this in Sacramento.  So many healthy options and variety, quick, and good portions.  The cup sizes are huge so just be careful with that.  We had the California breakfast sandwich and put Sriracha on top, wow it was so good! The next time I'm in town I'll definitely be going back to try something else on the menu.  The parking lot is a little odd and small because of the drive thru but we ended up parking a could stores down and walked right in.  No line and not too long of a wait so all worked out!

I got the turkey sandwich for lunch and I already thought the ordering was ridiculous.  The line is atrociously long so someone comes to your window, takes your order and takes your card so they can go inside and run it.  Then I get my food and they just handed me my sandwich--no bag! Just the sandwich and napkins.  That's just weird to me.  The sandwich was good but not worth all the hype I've heard about this place.

Great breakfast.  I had the California Club based upon the reviews and my friend had the AZ Burro and we were both very happy with our choices.  Parking is horrible - so just be prepared.  Worth the trip for sure!

My favorite sandwich is the California club, if you are not a health nut this is a great option. The mushroom soup is always amazing and you can't beat a drive thru! The salads are great and actually filling, I just wish they were open later, when I want to go after work they are closed. Also the wait is a mixed bag, sometimes there is no line and some times the line of cars spills into Scottsdale road.
Love love D'Lite. Much closer for us than other locations and happily, the food is exactly the same. "Must-trys" include Cali Club, AZ Burro, and the breakfast Buzz icy drink.

Holy cow this place is good! We came in to eat as it was our first time, but it has a drive-thru.  The servers were great and it seemed like such a fun atmosphere and they were enjoying their time, which made us feel really comfortable.  The food was really healthy and I enjoyed my wrap.

I've gone here a few times because it's right across the street from my school. Their tuna sandwich is good, bialys are yummy, coffee is decent, breakfast sandwich yummy but their "oatmeal our way" is not my fave. I couldn't finish it, it was so bland because it's made with quinoa and steamed milk and pears/apples and not much else excitement goes into it. If they put berries in it that would help sweeten it up but they didn't quite nail this creation on the head. Other than that it's a reasonably priced yummy eatery with a drive thru!

Best breakfast in the phoenix area. I wish they had more locations. The low-carb breakfast is like a miracle. You can see for yourself in the pictures that the food is amazing. I wish I lived closer to it

The d'veggie bowl is one of the most delicious meals I've had in awhile. The staff is really nice, and the drive through moves very quickly. I can really go all day about how great this place was. Go check it out!!

I have a hard time finding anything wrong with this place.   Dog Friendly? Yes.  Customer Friendly? Absolutely.  Delicious food? You bet your ass.   A little on the pricey side for a drive through(nothing too terrible, but probably around $8 without a drink is a good marker), and the hours could be better.  Chicken Pesto Panini is delicious. Comes on white( or wheat if you ask) with mushrooms and tomatoes. This is my go to dish at d'lish. It's like sex. Sometimes they screw something up, but no worries, it's all good. You are still eating a delicious sandwich.(having sex.)  Also try the humanitarian wrap. Its good. Not a fan of the "burgers", but the cali club is a delicious breakfast treat, and so is the recently stumbled upon frittata( chicken sausage n stuff frittata on a hashbrown, on  a piece of wheat toast with chipotle sauce drizzled on top.)

This place makes me so happy. I went through today and got a vegan apricot smoothie and the veggie wrap with raspberry dressing instead of the cucumber. It was so amazing!!!! This is my new favorite place! The food was so fresh and you can just feel how healthy it is!
